<div id="page-1134441">
<h3><a name="page-1134441">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 049)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>49</p>
<p>Trustees' Records _ 1859-1860.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Feb. 14. 1859.'>Trustees _ <date when='1859-02-14'>Feb. 14. 1859</date>.</span></p>
<p>The first meeting of the Trustees of Mount Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>for organization and business, was held at the usual <span class='line-break'> </span>place (the office of the Secretary, No. 39 Court Street)<span class='line-break'> </span>after due notice, on <date when='1859-02-14T10:00:00'>Monday, February 14, 1859, at <span class='line-break'> </span>10 O'clock, a. m.</date></p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> took the Chair.</p>
<p>The records of the meetings of <date when='1859-01-01'>January 1<sup>st</sup></date> and <date when='1859-02-07'>Febru<span class='line-break'></span>ary 7<sup>th</sup></date>, and of the Annual meeting of the Corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>were read.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Choice of officers and Committees'>Choice of officers and Committees</span></p>
<p>Voted to proceed to the choice of Officers and <span class='line-break'> </span>Committees for the year ensuing: and Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> and <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a> were appointed to receive and count the votes.</p>
<p>The following were chosen by ballot: _</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>President,</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>Secretary,</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>Treasurer,</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>George W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Committee</th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>on</td> <td>Messrs</td> <td>{<a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>Finance</td> <td>___</td> <td>{<a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Committee</th> <th>___</th> <th>{<a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>on</td> <td>Messrs</td> <td>{<a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>Lots</td> <td>___</td> <td>{<a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Mr Tobey</a> having declined reelection on this Committee.</p>
<p>[writtin lengthwise in side margin:}</p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts, Suffolk Ss.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1859-02-14'>February 14<sup>th</sup> 1859</date>. There personally <span class='line-break'> </span>appeared  <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, and made oath<span class='line-break'> </span>that he would faithfully perform the duties of <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary of the Proprietors of ^<sup>the Cemetery of </sup> Mount Auburn for<span class='line-break'> </span>the ensuing year _<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C P Curtis</a>  Justice of the Peace:</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1134442">
<h3><a name="page-1134442">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 050)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>50</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Choice of Officers and Committees'>Choice of Officers and Committees</span></p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Committee</th> <th>___</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> and<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>on</td> <td>___</td> <td>{<a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Bangs</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>Grounds</td> <td>Messrs</td> <td>{<a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___</td> <td>{<a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___</td> <td>{<a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Committee on</th> <th>___</th> <th>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>Regulations and</td> <td>Messrs</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>Records of Interments</td> <td>___ </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Jonathan Mann</a> was chosen Superintendent.</p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Mr Cheever</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52579' title='Safford, Truman H.'>T. H. Safford</a> was chosen Gate Keeper and Sup<sup>t</sup> Clerk:</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/66870' title='Apple, Anthony'>Antoni Apple</a> was chosen Gardener.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salaries and Compensation'>Salaries and Compensation</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the salary of the Secretary be the same as <span class='line-break'> </span>for the last  year:</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the compensation of the Treasurer be the <span class='line-break'> </span>same as for the last year:</p>
<p>Also, upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the salary and compensation of the Super<span class='line-break'></span>intendent be the same as for the last year;</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134443">
<h3><a name="page-1134443">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 051)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>51</p>
<p>Also upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the salary of the Gate Keeper and Superintendent's <span class='line-break'> </span>Clerk be the same as for the last year.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ament to By-law _ Art. 23 _ Receiving. Tomb fees.'>Amen<sup>t</sup> to By-law _ Art. 23 _ <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Receiving. Tomb</a> fees.</span></p>
<p>The Amendment to Art. 23<sup>d</sup> of the By-Laws, _<span class='line-break'> </span>which was proposed at the last precding meeting, <span class='line-break'> </span>to wit: _ requiring <u>twenty</u> dollars to be advanced for a <span class='line-break'> </span>deposit in the <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Receiving Tomb</a> instead of <u>fifteen</u> dollars <span class='line-break'> </span>as heretofore provided, <u>fifteen</u> of which is to be refunded <span class='line-break'> </span>upon compliance with the by law, instead of <u>ten</u>, as <span class='line-break'> </span>heretofore, _ was taken from the table, read and <span class='line-break'> </span>unanimously adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Purchase of land _ Comee report inexpedt'>Purchase of land _ Com<sup>ee</sup> report inexped<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> for the Committee chosen at the last meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>to inquire into the practicability of purchasing the lot of <span class='line-break'> </span>land, west of and adjoining the Cemetery, submitted <span class='line-break'> </span>a report in writing, concluding as follows: _</p>
<p>"While therefore, for some reasons, this land <span class='line-break'> </span>would be a desirable acquisition, the Committee do <span class='line-break'> </span>not feel justified in recommending its purchase at <span class='line-break'> </span>the price at which it is held, but leave the question <span class='line-break'> </span>for the consideration of the Trustees.</p>
<p>Voted that the report be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Committee on Supply of  Water chosen –'>Committee on Supply of  Water chosen –</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the Committee to inquire on what terms<span class='line-break'> </span>a supply of water can be obtained for the Cemetery from <span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/64852' title='Cambridge Water Works'>Cambridge Water Works</a>, (cosisting [sic] of</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>Messrs</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> and </td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a></td> <td>be reappointed.</td> </tr> </tbody> </table></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134444">
<h3><a name="page-1134444">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 052)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>52</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. on Statuary_'>Com. on Statuary_</span></p>
<p>------------</p>
<p><small>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Mr Gould</a> be a Committee on Statuary </small></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee to obtain Amendt of Charter.'>Com<sup>ee</sup> to obtain Amend<sup>t</sup> of Charter.</span></p>
<p>------------</p>
<p><small>Voted that the Committee appointed at the last meeting (Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a>,)<span class='line-break'> </span>to apply to the Legislature for such Amendment of the Charter as will allow of the conveyance of <span class='line-break'> </span>lots to heirs at law, &amp;c be hereby reappointed.</small></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee to consider expedy of building Tombs'>Com<sup>ee</sup> to consider exped<sup>y</sup> of building Tombs</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Mr Cheever</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the Committee on Grounds be instructed<span class='line-break'> </span>to examine and report as to the expediency of building <span class='line-break'> </span>one or more tombs for sale by the Corporation</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned to the next <span class='line-break'> </span>regular meeting.  Attest  <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>,, Secretary</p>
<p>-----------------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees March 7. 1859.'>Trustees <date when='1859-03-07'>March 7. 1859</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees was held <span class='line-break'> </span>at the usual place, on <date when='1859-03-07'>Monday, March 7, 1859, at <span class='line-break'> </span>10 O'clock a. m. </date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>. = 6.</p>
<p>The Record of the last meeting was read.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stable at Superintendts House _'><a href='/pages/subjects/62651' title='Stable'>Stable</a> at <a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>Superintend<sup>ts</sup> House</a> _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion  by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the question of the expediency of building a <span class='line-break'> </span>suitable <a href='/pages/subjects/62651' title='Stable'>stable</a> in connection with the <a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>Superintendent's house</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>be referred to the Committee on Grounds, to report upon <span class='line-break'> </span>at the next meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tombs to be built by Corpn for sale.'>Tombs to be built by Corp<sup>n</sup> for sale.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> made the following report for the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>upon Grounds in favor of building tombs: _</p>
<p>"That <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->the Superintendent</a> be authorized to construct <span class='line-break'> </span>for sale two tombs in the manner proposed by him in <span class='line-break'> </span>his late communication to the Trustees, the cost not <span class='line-break'> </span>to exceed twelve hundred and fifty ($1250) dollars."</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>, the same was <span class='line-break'> </span>adopted.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134445">
<h3><a name="page-1134445">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 053)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>53</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tomb under Park St. Church _'><a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Tomb under Park St. Church</a> _</span></p>
<p>A communication was received from <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent, making inquiries about the custody <span class='line-break'> </span>&amp;c of the <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>tomb under Park Street Church</a> belonging<span class='line-break'> </span>to this Corporation.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, the same was re<span class='line-break'></span>ferred to the Committee on Regulations and Records<span class='line-break'> </span>of Interment.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Forest Pond, improvement of, refd to Comee on Grounds.'><a href='/pages/subjects/57671' title='Forest Pond'>Forest Pond</a>, improvement of, ref<sup>d</sup> to Com<sup>ee</sup> on Grounds.</span></p>
<p>It was also Voted, that the subject of improving Forest <span class='line-break'> </span>Pond with edge stones and otherwise be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Grounds, to report thereon.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary.</p>
<p>-----------------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ April 4, 1859.'>Trustees _ <date when='1859-04-04'>April 4, 1859</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held at the usual place on <date when='1859-04-04T10:00:00'>Monday April 4, 1859,<span class='line-break'> </span>at 10 O'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a></p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stable at Sup.ts house _ negatived _'><a href='/pages/subjects/62651' title='Stable'>Stable</a> at <a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>Sup.ts house</a> _ negatived _</span></p>
<p>The Committee on Grounds reported through the Chairman <span class='line-break'> </span>upon the subject referred to them at the last meeting,<span class='line-break'> </span>in reference to erecting a <a href='/pages/subjects/62651' title='Stable'>stable</a> in connection with <span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>Superintendent's house</a>, recommending the erection <span class='line-break'> </span>of the same at a cost not exceding five hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>and fifty ($550) dollars.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134446">
<h3><a name="page-1134446">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 054)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>54</p>
<p>The acceptance of the report was moved,<span class='line-break'> </span>but the motion was lost.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Forest Pond. Resolve to stone around and improve same, conditional upon sales of spaces, &amp;c.'><a href='/pages/subjects/57671' title='Forest Pond'>Forest Pond</a>. Resolve to stone around and improve same, conditional upon sales of spaces, &amp;c.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> asked the opinion of the Trustees in <span class='line-break'> </span>reference to stoning around <a href='/pages/subjects/57671' title='Forest Pond'>Forest Pond</a>, stating<span class='line-break'> </span>that it had also been questioned whether it might not <span class='line-break'> </span>be expedient to fill up the same.</p>
<p>After remarks by several gentlemen, it was <span class='line-break'> </span>Moved by <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>, that the Corporation will<span class='line-break'> </span>proceed to stone around <a href='/pages/subjects/57671' title='Forest Pond'>Forest Pond</a> provided that <span class='line-break'> </span>one half the expense thereof shall be paid by the abutters<span class='line-break'> </span>in conformity with the vote passed thereon, <date when='1857-08-03'>August 3, 1857</date>,<span class='line-break'> </span>respecting the sale of intervening space, or in such other<span class='line-break'> </span>manner as may be satisfactory to the Committee upon <span class='line-break'> </span>Grounds.. The motion was adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trees _'>Trees _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Mr Gould</a>, it was <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the Committee upon Grounds be <span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to procure trees and shrubs to an <span class='line-break'> </span>amount not exceeding five hundred ($500) dollars,<span class='line-break'> </span>during the present year.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots 1335, 1336, 1337, Petitn to change numbers _ Refd to Comm on Lots _'><a href='/pages/subjects/70001' title='Lot 1335'>Lots 1335</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/70002' title='Lot 1336'><!--Lot-->1336</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/70003' title='Lot 1337'><!--Lot-->1337</a>, Petit<sup>n</sup> to change numbers _ Ref<sup>d</sup> to Comm on Lots _</span></p>
<p>A communication from <a href='/pages/subjects/70004' title='Darracott, Franklin'>Franklin Darracott</a> re<span class='line-break'></span>questing that the numbers upon his and the two adjoining <span class='line-break'> </span>lots might be changed upon the plan so that the same may <span class='line-break'> </span>conform to the actual ownership, was presented by <span class='line-break'> </span>the Treasurer  –  and the same</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>, was referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Committee upon Lots, with full power.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134447">
<h3><a name="page-1134447">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 055)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>55</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Communication _ from John Wyeth respecting opening of drain.'>Communication _ from <a href='/pages/subjects/70005' title='Wyeth, John'>John Wyeth</a> respecting opening of drain.</span></p>
<p>A communication was received from <a href='/pages/subjects/70005' title='Wyeth, John'>John Wyeth</a><span class='line-break'> </span>requesting that the drain leading from his land <span class='line-break'> </span>through Mount Auburn might be lowered or <span class='line-break'> </span>kept open so as to let the water pass off.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Mr Tobey</a> it was</p>
<p>Voted that the same be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee upon Grounds and ^<sup>that</sup> this Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>request <a href='/pages/subjects/70005' title='Wyeth, John'>Mr Wyeth</a> to meet them upon the Ground<span class='line-break'> </span>and make his statement in that they have <span class='line-break'> </span>power to take such action as may be necessary,<span class='line-break'> </span>and report their doings at the next meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sale of land on Snowberry Path for erection of statue, &amp;c-'>Sale of land on <a href='/pages/subjects/64063' title='Snowberry Path'>Snowberry Path</a> for erection of statue, &amp;c-</span></p>
<p>A communication was received from <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>stating that he had sold, subject to the approval <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees, three lots of land upon <a href='/pages/subjects/64063' title='Snowberry Path'>Snowberry<span class='line-break'> </span>Path</a>, measuring twelve hundred feet for the sum of <span class='line-break'> </span>twelve hundred ($1200) dollars_ to <a href='/pages/subjects/60202' title='Tufts, Charles'>Charles Tufts</a> of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/55343' title='Somerville, MA'>Somerville</a>, 400 feet _ <a href='/pages/subjects/60201' title='Packard, Sylvanus'>Silvanus Packard</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a><span class='line-break'> </span>400 ft, and to <a href='/pages/subjects/64881' title='Ballou, Maturin M.'>M.M. Ballou</a> 400 feet_ to be in <span class='line-break'> </span>one enclosure without passageways intervening,<span class='line-break'> </span>the last named lot to be used for the erection of <span class='line-break'> </span>a marble statue to the memory of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/70006' title='Ballou, Hosea'>Rev. <span class='line-break'> </span>Hosea Ballou</a>.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>, the matter <span class='line-break'> </span>was referred to the Committee upon Lots with <span class='line-break'> </span>full power.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134448">
<h3><a name="page-1134448">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 056)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>56</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ May 4. 1859.'>Trustees _ <date when='1859-05-04'>May 4. 1859</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn Cemetery was held at the <span class='line-break'> </span>usual place, on <date when='1859-05-04T10:00:00'>Monday, May 4. 1859. at 10<span class='line-break'> </span>O'clock a. m. </date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, Messrs <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report upon petitn  of J. Wyeth _ No action necessary.'>Report upon petit<sup>n</sup>  of <a href='/pages/subjects/70005' title='Wyeth, John'>J. Wyeth</a> _ No action necessary.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a>, for the Committee upon Grounds, re<span class='line-break'></span>ported that the Committee had had an interview <span class='line-break'> </span>with <a href='/pages/subjects/70005' title='Wyeth, John'>Mr Wyeth</a> in reference to the alleged obstructon <span class='line-break'> </span>in the drain, and that no further action is <span class='line-break'> </span>necessary.</p>
<p>The Report was accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Rhododendrons purchased, and to be set_'>Rhododendrons purchased, and to be set_</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> also for the Committee authorized to<span class='line-break'> </span>procure trees and shrubs for the Cemetery, reported<span class='line-break'> </span>that the Committee had sent to <a href='/pages/subjects/52562' title='Liverpool, UK'>Liverpool</a> for flowering <span class='line-break'> </span>shrubs _ the Rhododendron _ to the amount of about 20£, or<span class='line-break'> </span>$100. _ that they had arrived &amp; would be set out immediately.</p>
<p>The report was accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stable in connection with Supt&apos;s house to be erected _'><a href='/pages/subjects/62651' title='Stable'>Stable</a> in connection with <a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>Supt's house</a> to be erected _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> for the Committee upon Grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>recommended the erection of a <a href='/pages/subjects/62651' title='Stable'>stable</a> on the lot which <span class='line-break'> </span>contains the <a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>Superintendent's house</a> at an expense<span class='line-break'> </span>not exceeding five hundred and fifty dollars ($550),<span class='line-break'> </span>and the order was adopted.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134449">
<h3><a name="page-1134449">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 057)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>57</p>
<p>The Committee upon Grounds having reported that <span class='line-break'> </span>they have provisionally engaged the stones for <a href='/pages/subjects/57671' title='Forest Pond'>Forest<span class='line-break'> </span>Pond</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stoning around Forest Pond ordered _'>Stoning around <a href='/pages/subjects/57671' title='Forest Pond'>Forest Pond</a> ordered _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>It was ordered that the Committee have<span class='line-break'> </span>authority and that they proceed to surround the <span class='line-break'> </span>margin of that pond with a stone curb in <span class='line-break'> </span>a manner similar to that around <a href='/pages/subjects/57593' title='Auburn Lake'>Auburn Lake</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Carriages at Gate for accommodation of visitors _'>Carriages at <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->Gate</a> for accommodation of visitors _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>It was voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Mr Cheever</a> be a Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee to inquire as to the expediency of making <span class='line-break'> </span>arrangement with some stable keeper to have<span class='line-break'> </span>a suitable number of carriages stationed at <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->the <span class='line-break'> </span>gate</a> for the accommodation of such strangers as <span class='line-break'> </span>may require the use of them in the Cemetery.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Amendt to Art. 23 of By-laws proposed-'>Amend<sup>t</sup> to Art. 23 of By-laws proposed-</span></p>
<p>The following Amendment of Art. 23<sup>d</sup> of the By-Laws<span class='line-break'> </span>was proposed by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> _ to wit _</p>
<p>the insertion of the words- "or Treasurer" after <span class='line-break'> </span>the words- "on payment of twenty dollars to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent<u>"</u> which under the rule was re<span class='line-break'></span>ferred to the next meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report upon Tomb under Park St. Ch.'>Report upon <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Tomb under Park St. Ch.</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Mr Gould</a> submitted a written report, containing <span class='line-break'> </span>a history of the tomb owned by this Corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>under Park Street Church, and stating its pres<span class='line-break'></span>ent condition, accompanied with a recommendation <span class='line-break'> </span>for the purchase of the half owned by the heirs of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/70008' title='Beale, Mr.'>Mr Beale</a>, if deemed practicable by this board.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134450">
<h3><a name="page-1134450">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 058)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>58</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>, the report<span class='line-break'> </span>was laid upon the table until the next meeting.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> stated that applications for tickets<span class='line-break'> </span>are sometimes made by the families  of deceased <span class='line-break'> </span>proprietors of small lots, and that the by-law respecting <span class='line-break'> </span>issuing tickets to representatives of deceased proprietors has <span class='line-break'> </span>heretofore been construed to apply only to such repre<span class='line-break'></span>sentation as is contemplated by the Charter _ viz. to lots <span class='line-break'> </span>of three hundred square feet.</p>
<p>It was accordingly voted , upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Declaratory Vote that the By Laws authorize the representation of small lots.'>Declaratory Vote that the By Laws authorize the representation of small lots.</span></p>
<p>That the clause in Section 8 of the  Charter providing <span class='line-break'> </span>for the representaton of lots of deceased proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>which contain not less than three hundred square <span class='line-break'> </span>feet ^<sup>each</sup> is hereby understood to apply only to the right<span class='line-break'> </span>of voting as members of the Corporation, and that <span class='line-break'> </span>it was not intended to prevent such representation <span class='line-break'> </span>of small lots as may be necessary to vest their or<span class='line-break'></span>dinary care in one person: and therefore that the <span class='line-break'> </span>by-laws respecting the representation of lots of deceased<span class='line-break'> </span>proprietors, and the issuing of tickets to representatives<span class='line-break'> </span>be understood to include any and all lots <span class='line-break'> </span>within the Cemetery.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots _ respecting extinguishment of numbers and lines _'>Lots _ respecting extinguishment of numbers and lines _</span></p>
<p>A communication from <a href='/pages/subjects/56692' title='Wadsworth, Alexander'>Mr Wadsworth</a> respecting <span class='line-break'> </span>the obliteration of old numbers as well as the limits <span class='line-break'> </span>of old lots in the Cemetery, and the location thereupon <span class='line-break'> </span>of other lots with new numbers, was</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>, referred to the Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee upon Lots. <span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134451">
<h3><a name="page-1134451">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 059)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>59</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resolutions upon death of  Mr Bangs _'>Resolutions upon death of  <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Mr Bangs</a> _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> presented the following <span class='line-break'> </span>resolutions, which were unanimously <span class='line-break'> </span>adopted.</p>
<p>"Whereas, by the decease of the <span class='line-break'> </span>late <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Isaiah Bangs Esq.</a>, the Proprietors of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn have been deprived <span class='line-break'> </span>of the services of a faithful officer, who <span class='line-break'> </span>during five years devoted himself to their in<span class='line-break'></span>terests with a zeal and fidelity rarely equalled,</p>
<p>And whereas the Board of Trustees have <span class='line-break'> </span>lost a companion whose good temper, amen<span class='line-break'></span>ity and candor were conspicuous in all his <span class='line-break'> </span>relations with them. _</p>
<p><u>It is voted _</u> that the Board of Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>hereby desire to express the sense they entertain <span class='line-break'> </span>of the loss which they and the Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn have sustained by the death <span class='line-break'> </span>of their late friend and fellow trustee.</p>
<p><u>Voted _</u> that a copy of the foregoing pre<span class='line-break'></span>amble and vote be sent by the Secretary <span class='line-break'> </span>to the family of <a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Mr Bangs</a>."</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134452">
<h3><a name="page-1134452">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 060)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>60</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees June 6. 1859.'>Trustees <date when='1859-06-06'>June 6. 1859</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthlly meeting of the Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held at the usual place on <date when='1859-06-06T10:00:00'>Monday, June <span class='line-break'> </span>6<sup>th</sup> 1859. at 10 o'clock a. m.</date></p>
<p>There were present, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, Messrs<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a> and <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> asking leave of absence <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> was called to the Chair.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Carriages at Gate _'>Carriages at <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->Gate</a> _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Mr Cheever</a> made an informal report on <span class='line-break'> </span>the matter of inquiry referred to him at the last <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting _ viz. the expediency of having carriages sta<span class='line-break'></span>tioned at <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->the gate</a> for the accommodations of <span class='line-break'> </span>such visitors as may desire the use of them.</p>
<p>No action was had thereon.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Amendt to Art. 23d of By-Laws.'>Amend<sup>t</sup> to Art. 23<sup>d</sup> of By-Laws.</span></p>
<p>The Amendment to Art. 23<sup>d</sup> of the by-laws, which <span class='line-break'> </span>was proposed at the last meeting _ viz. the insertion of <span class='line-break'> </span>the words "or Treasurer," after the words, "on payment <span class='line-break'> </span>of twenty Dollars to the Superintendent," _ was taken <span class='line-break'> </span>from the table, read, and unanimously adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report on Tomb under Park St. Church _'>Report on <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Tomb under Park St. Church</a> _</span></p>
<p>The report of <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Mr Gould</a> upon the Receiving <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>tomb under Park St. Church</a> was taken from the table, <span class='line-break'> </span>accepted, and ordered to be recorded – and <span class='line-break'> </span>is as follows: _</p>
<p>"The Committee to whom was re<span class='line-break'></span>ferred the subject of the <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Receiving Tomb under Park Street<span class='line-break'> </span>Church</a> visited the tomb with Mr Baker, the Sexton <span class='line-break'> </span>of that Church, who informed them that for the</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134453">
<h3><a name="page-1134453">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 061)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>61</p>
<p>eight year he had been in charge, fifteen bodies <span class='line-break'> </span>had been received into the tomb, and sixteen had <span class='line-break'> </span>been removed from it, leaving one less than the <span class='line-break'> </span>number in it, when he took charge of the tomb.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report on Tomb under Park St Church _ continued _'>Report on <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Tomb under Park St Church</a> _ continued _</span></p>
<p>He has charged for his own services in <span class='line-break'> </span>opening and lighting the premises for the reception <span class='line-break'> </span>of a body, one dollar and a half: and for deliv<span class='line-break'></span>ering, one dollar each.  He does not know of <span class='line-break'> </span>any other charge nor to whom it was paid, if any<span class='line-break'> </span>fee has been demanded.  He did not know who <span class='line-break'> </span>owned the tomb, but supposed the Mount Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery owned one half, and <a href='/pages/subjects/70096' title='Smith, Mr.'>Mr Smith</a>, the sexton <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Stone Chapel, the other half, as he occasionally <span class='line-break'> </span>made use of it.  The Committee subsequently saw <a href='/pages/subjects/70096' title='Smith, Mr.'>Mr <span class='line-break'> </span>Smith</a>, who stated that a <u><a href='/pages/subjects/70008' title='Beale, Mr.'>Mr Beale</a></u> was the owner<span class='line-break'> </span>of the other half; and that his body had been <span class='line-break'> </span>deposited there, and recently removed thence to <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn.  It does not appear that any <span class='line-break'> </span>specified time that a body may remain has been <span class='line-break'> </span>fixed; nor that any individual has charge of the <span class='line-break'> </span>tomb.  But an order from any trustee, or from <span class='line-break'> </span>the City's Superintendent of burying grounds has <span class='line-break'> </span>always been respected and obeyed.</p>
<p>The Committee did not learn that any body, de<span class='line-break'></span>posited by the authority of Mount Auburn Cemetery, <span class='line-break'> </span>remained in the tomb, except that of <a href='/pages/subjects/70097' title='Lilly, Mr.'>Mr Lilly</a>, the <span class='line-break'> </span>former partner of <a href='/pages/subjects/70098' title='Wells, William'>Mr W<sup>m</sup> Wells</a>.  But a full ex<span class='line-break'></span>amination would shortly be made, and a report of <span class='line-break'> </span>all that remained in the tomb would be furnished <span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134454">
<h3><a name="page-1134454">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 062)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>62</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report on Tomb under Park St. Ch. continud _'>Report on <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Tomb under Park St. Ch.</a> continu<sup>d</sup> _</span></p>
<p>The Committee inquired of <a href='/pages/subjects/70096' title='Smith, Mr.'>Mr Smith</a> what was <span class='line-break'> </span>the value of the tomb – and he replied "Nothing."</p>
<p>Therefore, as there is no inducement to attempt<span class='line-break'> </span>a sale of the tomb and as the possession is attended <span class='line-break'> </span>with no expense, and may be useful in cases of very <span class='line-break'> </span>deep or drifted snow, rendering access to Mount Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>difficult, the Committee would suggest the propriety <span class='line-break'> </span>of placing the name of Mount Auburn Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>over the door – of fixing a time for which a body <span class='line-break'> </span>may remain in the <s>Receiving</s> Tomb, and of appointing <span class='line-break'> </span>the Sexton of the Church, who has the keys, or some other <span class='line-break'> </span>suitable person to take charge of the tomb.  It would <span class='line-break'> </span>seem advisable also that the remains of <a href='/pages/subjects/70097' title='Lilly, Mr.'>Mr Lilly</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>be removed to a permanent resting place.</p>
<p>Respectfully submitted by <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B. A. Gould</a> for the Committee.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1859-04-30'>April 30. 1859</date>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Regulations of Interment in Tomb under Park St Church.'>Regulations of Interment in <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Tomb under Park St Church</a>.</span></p>
<p>The following votes recommend by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee in furtherance of the views contained <span class='line-break'> </span>in the report were read, and adopted =</p>
<p>"That the same terms and conditions be required <span class='line-break'> </span>for depositing bodies in the Park Street Tomb belonging  to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery as those required for depositing in the <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Receiving <span class='line-break'> </span>Tombs</a> at Mount Auburn.</p>
<p>That application may be made to the Treasurer for <span class='line-break'> </span>permission to deposite bodies in the Park Street tomb,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that the fees for deposite may be paid to him:</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134455">
<h3><a name="page-1134455">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 063)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>63</p>
<p>and, in such cases, that the charges for receiving <span class='line-break'> </span>and for removing bodies may be paid by the Treas<span class='line-break'> </span>urer to the Sexton of Park Street Church, who <span class='line-break'> </span>shall have charge of the Tomb, till further<span class='line-break'> </span>ordered.</p>
<p>That <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Mr Gould</a> cause a slab to be <span class='line-break'> </span>placed over the door with the following inscription _</p>
<p>"<u>Mount</u> <u>Auburn</u> <u>Cemetery</u>."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Concurrence of Trustees voted upon Contracts for Perpetl Care of Lots _'>Concurrence of Trustees voted upon Contracts for Perpet<sup>l</sup> Care of Lots _</span></p>
<p>It appearing that the by- law requiring the <span class='line-break'> </span>concurrence of the Trustees in contracts made by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee upon Lots for the repair of lots, had <span class='line-break'> </span>been accidentally overlooked by the Committee,</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the Trustees hereby signify their <span class='line-break'> </span>concurrence with the action of the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>upon Lots in the contracts made by them for <span class='line-break'> </span>the ^<sup>perpetual</sup> repair and preservation of the following – named<span class='line-break'> </span>lots _</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th>[ <a href='/pages/subjects/70103' title='Lot 1080'><!--Lot-->1080</a> –</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mace Tisdale</a></th> <th>} $500</th> <th>in addition to the <span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>Lots</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/70104' title='Lot 1081'><!--Lot-->1081</a> –</td> <td>___</td> <td>}</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/68568' title='Lot 661'><!--Lot-->661</a> –</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/62033' title='Hewins, Simmon K.'>S. K. Hewins</a></td> <td>} 1500</td> <td>previously given </td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/65824' title='Lot 1181'><!--Lot-->1181</a> –</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/70105' title='Dewhurst, William'>William Dewhurst</a></td> <td>$300 _</td> <td>" [previously given]</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/70106' title='Lot 2300'><!--Lot-->2300</a> –</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/70107' title='Brown, Francis'>Francis Brown</a></td> <td>$100.</td> <td>" [previously given]</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Admission of Visitors _'>Admission of Visitors _</span></p>
<p>The Secretary stated that there is apparently very <span class='line-break'> </span>little restraint exercised in respect to the admission <span class='line-break'> </span>of non-proprietors, as a large portion of the tickets <span class='line-break'> </span>issued, are not returned.  It was thereupon</p>
<p>Voted – that the question of whether any change <span class='line-break'> </span>is necessary in the mode of admission at</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134456">
<h3><a name="page-1134456">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 064)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>64</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Admission of Visitors refd to Comee'>Admission of Visitors ref<sup>d</sup> to Com<sup>ee</sup></span></p>
<p>the gate, either on week-days or Sundays be <span class='line-break'> </span>referred to a Committee of three,<span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>consisting of Messrs</th> <th>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a> &amp;</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> to report thereon.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Shelter at Gate _'>Shelter at Gate _</span></p>
<p>Voted that the question of the expediency of <span class='line-break'> </span>erecting some shelter at <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->the Gate</a> from sun and <span class='line-break'> </span>rain, be referred to the Committee on Grounds &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>report thereupon at the next meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Place for Tools &amp;c.'>Place for Tools &amp;c.</span></p>
<p>Voted that the question of the expediency of having some <span class='line-break'> </span>suitable place within the grounds, as a repository for tools <span class='line-break'> </span>and the personal effects of the workmen, while in the <span class='line-break'> </span>grounds, be referred to the same committee to report<span class='line-break'> </span>thereon at the next meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 207'><a href='/pages/subjects/70108' title='Lot 207'>Lot 207</a></span></p>
<p>Upon the petition of the Heirs at law of <a href='/pages/subjects/58499' title='Kinsley, Henry'>Henry <span class='line-break'> </span>Kinsley</a>, deceased, late  proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/70108' title='Lot 207'>lot numbered <span class='line-break'> </span>207</a>, in the Cemetery of Mount Auburn,  <a href='/pages/subjects/70109' title='Kinsley, Mary'>Mary<span class='line-break'> </span>Kinsley</a>, widow of said Henry, of <a href='/pages/subjects/72695' title='East Cambridge, MA'>East Cambridge</a>: –<span class='line-break'> </span>was designated to represent the said lot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 690.'><a href='/pages/subjects/70110' title='Lot 690'>Lot 690</a>.</span></p>
<p>Upon the petition of the widow and heirs at law of <a href='/pages/subjects/70111' title='Foster, William'>William <span class='line-break'> </span>Foster</a>, late proprietor of a small lot, <a href='/pages/subjects/70110' title='Lot 690'>numbered 690</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/70112' title='Foster, Emily R.'>Emily R. Foster</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, daughter of said William, <span class='line-break'> </span>was designated to represent the said lot.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134457">
<h3><a name="page-1134457">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 065)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>65</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees July 11. 1859.'>Trustees <date when='1859-07-11'>July 11. 1859</date>.</span></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Trustees was held <span class='line-break'> </span>at the usual place on <date when='1859-07-11T10:00:00'>Monday, July 11<sup>th</sup> (the <span class='line-break'> </span>first Monday in the month having occurred upon the<span class='line-break'> </span>4<sup>th</sup> of July) A.D. 1859, at 10 O'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> and Messrs. <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Rept of Comee on Grounds _'>Rep<sup>t</sup> of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Grounds _</span></p>
<p>The Committee upon Grounds submitted a report <span class='line-break'> </span>upon sundry matters, of which the following is<span class='line-break'> </span>a copy.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Awning at Gate _'>Awning at Gate _</span></p>
<p>1. That the Committee on Grounds be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to place an awning over the two recesses on the <span class='line-break'> </span>inside of the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>stone gateway</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tool _ House _'>Tool _ House _</span></p>
<p>2. That the same Committee be authorized to erect <span class='line-break'> </span>a small moveable tool house for the use of the workmen,<span class='line-break'> </span>in some convenient part of the grounds.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Repair of Iron-fence'>Repair of Iron-fence</span></p>
<p>3. That the same Committee be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>repair, in such manner as they may find best, <span class='line-break'> </span>the defective joinings in the <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'>iron and stone fence<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery</a>, especially where the iron is corroded<span class='line-break'> </span>by the action of the sulphurous cement.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Painting Fence-'>Painting Fence-</span></p>
<p>4. That the same Committee be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>paint the whole <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->iron fence</a> on the northerly and <span class='line-break'> </span>easterly sides of the Cemetery, when, in their Judg<span class='line-break'></span>ment it shall require it.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134458">
<h3><a name="page-1134458">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 066)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>66</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Removal of part of fence outside of Gate _'>Removal of part of fence outside of Gate _</span></p>
<p>5. That the same Committee be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to remove the two lower lengths, or as much <span class='line-break'> </span>as may in their judgment be necessary, of the <span class='line-break'> </span>low outside iron fence near the gate, and to <span class='line-break'> </span>place the same on the steep and dangerous places <span class='line-break'> </span>on <a href='/pages/subjects/61236' title='Mountain Avenue'>Mountain Avenue</a> near the <a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>tower</a>; provi<span class='line-break'></span>ded that one hundred and fifty feet of said <span class='line-break'> </span>fence shall be left on the easterly side of the gate.</p>
<p>The foregoing recommendations were taken up<span class='line-break'> </span>and severally adopted, and the report was <span class='line-break'> </span>then adopted as a whole, and ordered to be<span class='line-break'> </span>recorded.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 1979 _ Perpetual Care _'><a href='/pages/subjects/70116' title='Lot 1979'>Lot 1979</a> _ Perpetual Care _</span></p>
<p>The Committee upon Lots reported that they <span class='line-break'> </span>had provisionally agreed to a contract with <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/70117' title='Knight, William H.'>William H. Knight</a> for the perpetual care of <span class='line-break'> </span>his <a href='/pages/subjects/70116' title='Lot 1979'>lot No. 1979</a>, on <a href='/pages/subjects/61175' title='Elm Avenue'>Elm Avenue</a>, for the sum <span class='line-break'> </span>of Five Hundred dollars.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Mr Gould</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that this Board hereby concur in <span class='line-break'> </span>said agreement.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 2873 Represented.'><a href='/pages/subjects/70118' title='Lot 2873'>Lot 2873</a> Represented.</span></p>
<p>Upon the petition of the children and heirs <span class='line-break'> </span>at law of <a href='/pages/subjects/70119' title='Woodbury, Thomas'>Thomas Woodbury</a>, late of <a href='/pages/subjects/55343' title='Somerville, MA'>Somerville</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>deceased, as they are, under the recent amend<span class='line-break'></span>ment of the Charter, the grantees of <a href='/pages/subjects/70118' title='Lot 2873'>lot numbered<span class='line-break'> </span>2873</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/70120' title='Woodbury, William C.'>William C. Woodbury</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/54284' title='Charlestown, MA'>Charlestown</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>a son of said deceased, was appointed to <span class='line-break'> </span>represent said lot.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134459">
<h3><a name="page-1134459">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 067)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>67</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Comee on Admission to Grounds _'>Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Admission to Grounds _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>, for the Committee to whom <span class='line-break'> </span>was referred the question whether any change is nec<span class='line-break'></span>essary in the mode of admission at <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->the gate</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>either on week-days or Sundays, submitted their <span class='line-break'> </span>report, of which the following is a copy.</p>
<p>"On the <date when='1853-07-05'>5<sup>th</sup> of July, 1853</date>, a vote was <span class='line-break'> </span>passed 'that the Gate-Keeper be permitted to <span class='line-break'> </span>admit persons of respectable appearance and <span class='line-break'> </span>demeanor to ride into the Cemetery without tickets<span class='line-break'> </span>or permits until further orders'.</p>
<p>The 27<sup>th</sup> article of the By- Laws provides that <span class='line-break'> </span>'strangers from a distance, also persons having <span class='line-break'> </span>business in the Cemetery, may be admitted with <span class='line-break'> </span>carriages on presenting a note or ticket of admis<span class='line-break'></span>sion signed by a Trustee or by the Secretary <span class='line-break'> </span>or Treasurer,'</p>
<p>The same article also provides that 'Persons <span class='line-break'> </span>having a relative or near friend interred there, <span class='line-break'> </span>may enter the Cemetery on Sundays and Holidays,<span class='line-break'> </span>on presenting a card of admission from a Trustee,<span class='line-break'> </span>the Secretary or Treasurer.'</p>
<p>The By- Laws also contain a clause in <span class='line-break'> </span>these words - 'The Trustees, however, may, from time <span class='line-break'> </span>to time, pass such votes for the admission of <span class='line-break'> </span>strangers and other non- proprietors, and under<span class='line-break'> </span>such regulations as they may deem expedient';<span class='line-break'> </span>and another whereby all votes and regulations <span class='line-break'> </span>which had been previously passed and which were <span class='line-break'> </span>incompatible with the present code of By Laws, should<span class='line-break'> </span>be repealed.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134460">
<h3><a name="page-1134460">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 068)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>68</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Admission to Grounds _ continued _'>Admission to Grounds _ continued _</span></p>
<p>From the preceding citations it appears clearly <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Committee, <u>first</u>, that the By-Laws con<span class='line-break'></span>tain regulations and restrictions in regard to <span class='line-break'> </span>admission to the grounds.  <u>Second</u>, That <span class='line-break'> </span>notwithstanding these general limitations, the whole<span class='line-break'> </span>power of regulating the admission of non-pro<span class='line-break'></span>prietors is vested in the Trustees without reference<span class='line-break'> </span>to the By-Laws.  <u>Third</u>, That any vote not <span class='line-break'> </span>incompatible with the By-Laws, which had <span class='line-break'> </span>been passed prior to their adoption, and which <span class='line-break'> </span>has not been repealed, is now extant, and</p>
<p><u>Fourth</u>, that the vote of <date when='1853-07-05'>5<sup>th</sup> July, 1853</date>, is not <span class='line-break'> </span>incompatible with the By-Laws _ has not been repealed _<span class='line-break'> </span>and therefore is in full force now.</p>
<p>The question of admission to the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>is a delicate one.  Mount Auburn, although <span class='line-break'> </span>strictly a private institution, may in some senses, <span class='line-break'> </span>be considered a public one.  It is the pioneer<span class='line-break'> </span>of ornamental cemeteries _ the delight and pride<span class='line-break'> </span>of our own citizens, and the admiration of <span class='line-break'> </span>strangers.  It has caused many other institutions <span class='line-break'> </span>of like character to spring up all over the country,<span class='line-break'> </span>and its fame extends wherever <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> is known.<span class='line-break'> </span>It is natural therefore, that all strangers visiting <span class='line-break'> </span>this part of the country, should be desirous of seeing <span class='line-break'> </span>it, and it is the wish of the Trustes to grant every <span class='line-break'> </span>facility for the gratification of this desire, and also <span class='line-break'> </span>for the accommodation of resident non-proprietors,<span class='line-break'> </span>so far as they can do in justice to the <span class='line-break'> </span>interests committed to them</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134461">
<h3><a name="page-1134461">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 069)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>69</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Admission to the Grounds _ Contind'>Admission to the Grounds _ Contin<sup>d</sup></span></p>
<p>But while the Trustees desire to grant every <span class='line-break'> </span>privilege to our own citizens, and to others <span class='line-break'> </span>who may wish to ride or walk over the grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>for legitimate purposes, they do not wish <span class='line-break'> </span>to open them as a pleasant drive for all <span class='line-break'> </span>pleasure seekers who may chance to pass<span class='line-break'> </span>that way; and the Committee cannot but <span class='line-break'> </span>think, that a mild and reasonable enforce<span class='line-break'></span>ment of the rules, while it will allow all <span class='line-break'> </span>who ought to have the privilge of entering, every <span class='line-break'> </span>facility, will prevent abuses which must<span class='line-break'> </span>otherwise necessarily creep in.</p>
<p>It will be borne in mind that the num<span class='line-break'></span>ber of proprietors now approaches three thousand,<span class='line-break'> </span>all of whom have the right of admission in <span class='line-break'> </span>carriages; add to this the surreptitious use <span class='line-break'> </span>of the tickets of proprietors, which cannot be <span class='line-break'> </span>prevented, and the tickets issued for single <span class='line-break'> </span>admissions, and an aggregate will be shown <span class='line-break'> </span>quite sufficient to make the grounds as public<span class='line-break'> </span>as can reasonably be required.</p>
<p>The facility of obtaining tickets appears to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee quite sufficient for strangers and others <span class='line-break'> </span>who may wish to visit the grounds for proper objects, <span class='line-break'> </span>and if each one be obliged to deliver his ticket <span class='line-break'> </span>at the gate, it will render it much easier to <span class='line-break'> </span>detect those who abuse their privileges.</p>
<p>So far as the Committee can learn, the chief<span class='line-break'> </span>abuse is by the drivers of  public hackney coaches.<span class='line-break'> </span>They drive fast through the grounds with heavy</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134462">
<h3><a name="page-1134462">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 070)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>70</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Admission to Grounds continued _'>Admission to Grounds continued _</span></p>
<p>loads, and when spoken to, reply in improper <span class='line-break'> </span>language.</p>
<p>Looking at the subject in all its aspects, the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee are of opinion, that although the pro<span class='line-break'></span>hibition of some of the privileges which the public <span class='line-break'> </span>have enjoyed may cause some inconvenience<span class='line-break'> </span>and dissatisfaction, yet that a much greater <span class='line-break'> </span>evil would arise if the Cemetery were injured,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the proprietors annoyed by persons merely <span class='line-break'> </span>seeking amusement regardless of injury to others;<span class='line-break'> </span>and, as all have the  privilege of walking in <span class='line-break'> </span>the grounds, they think, of two evils it is better <span class='line-break'> </span>to choose the less: they therefore recommend<span class='line-break'> </span>the repeal of the vote of the <date when='1853-07-05'>5<sup>th</sup> of July 1853</date>,<span class='line-break'> </span>granting permission to enter without a ticket.<span class='line-break'> </span>They would also recommend that the Secretary <span class='line-break'> </span>be directed to furnish tickets to the Proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>of the prinipal hotels, for the use of strangers, <span class='line-break'> </span>in which the name of the visitor shall be inserted<span class='line-break'> </span>with the admonition that any abuse of this priv<span class='line-break'></span>ilege on the part of the drivers, will cause such <span class='line-break'> </span>driver to be afterwards excluded, and, if after<span class='line-break'> </span>proper representation to the proprietor of the hotel,<span class='line-break'> </span>the same driver shall be furnished with <span class='line-break'> </span>tickets - then that the privileges be withdrawn <span class='line-break'> </span>from the Hotel.</p>
<p>They would also recommend that the <span class='line-break'> </span>Gate Keeper be instructed to require the delivery <span class='line-break'> </span>of all tickets except those of proprietors, at <span class='line-break'> </span>the Gate, and that the same be returned to the Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134463">
<h3><a name="page-1134463">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 071)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>71</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Admission to Grounds Continued.'>Admission to Grounds Continued.</span></p>
<p>The question has been raised in regard to the <span class='line-break'> </span>clause in the By-Laws allowing persons having <span class='line-break'> </span>a relative or near friend interred in the Cem<span class='line-break'></span>etery to enter on Sundays and Holidays –<span class='line-break'> </span>whether they are allowed to enter in carriages?<span class='line-break'> </span>The Committee understand that the object <span class='line-break'> </span>of that privilege was, that any person who wished<span class='line-break'> </span>to visit the grave of a relative or near friend on <span class='line-break'> </span>the Sabbath, could be allowed to do so - but it <span class='line-break'> </span>is not necessary for this purpose that they <span class='line-break'> </span>should ride over the grounds, as they might do <span class='line-break'> </span>on a week-day, for curiosity or amusement _<span class='line-break'> </span>and the object sought for can be obtained without <span class='line-break'> </span>that.  The Committee therefore think that the <span class='line-break'> </span>design of that clause was merely to allow them <span class='line-break'> </span>to walk into the Cemetery, and they advise <span class='line-break'> </span>that that construction be put upon it: _<span class='line-break'> </span>Excepting, however, that individual Trustees, <span class='line-break'> </span>the Secretary and Treasurer, for good cause <span class='line-break'> </span>shown, shall have discretionary power to <span class='line-break'> </span>admit visitors, in carriages, on Sabbaths<span class='line-break'> </span>and Holidays.</p>
<p>All of which is respectfully submitted.</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Charles G. Nazro</a></th> <th>}<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>(signed)</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Uriel Crocker</a></td> <td>} Committee</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>James Cheever</a></td> <td>} " [Committee]</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report Adopted _'>Report Adopted _</span></p>
<p>The report was read, and with one or two slight <span class='line-break'> </span>amendments accepted by the Committee and incorporated, was<span class='line-break'> </span>unanimously adopted, and <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> was directed to <span class='line-break'> </span>notify the <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->Sup<sup>t</sup></a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/52579' title='Safford, Truman H.'><!--Safford-->Gate Keeper</a>, and cause the rules to be enforced.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned _ Att. <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary  </p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134464">
<h3><a name="page-1134464">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 072)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>72</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Aug. 1. 1859'>Trustees <date when='1859-08-01'>Aug. 1. 1859</date></span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>was held at the usual place, <date when='1859-08-01T10:00:00'>on Monday,<span class='line-break'> </span>August 1. 1859. at 10 O'clock, a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, and messrs <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was <span class='line-break'> </span>read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on Grounds authorized to purchase Lots on Laurel Hill _'>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Grounds authorized to purchase Lots on <a href='/pages/subjects/55347' title='Laurel Hill'>Laurel Hill</a> _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the Committee on Grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>be authorized to purchase of proprietors of lots <span class='line-break'> </span>upon <a href='/pages/subjects/55347' title='Laurel Hill'>Laurel Hill</a> in Mount Auburn all <span class='line-break'> </span>such lots, and at such price, as they shall<span class='line-break'> </span>deem expedient,  provided they can obtain <span class='line-break'> </span>clear title to the same.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Public Notice respecting Admission _'>Public Notice respecting Admission _</span></p>
<p>Also, upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> be directed to give<span class='line-break'> </span>public notice in the Newspapers that no <span class='line-break'> </span>carriages are admitted to Mount Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>without cards of admission, agreeably to <span class='line-break'> </span>the rules adopted at the last meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 2652 Perpetual Care of _'><a href='/pages/subjects/70184' title='Lot 2652'>Lot 2652</a> Perpetual Care of _</span></p>
<p>The Committee on Lots reported that <a href='/pages/subjects/70185' title='Jacobs, Benjamin'>Benjamin <span class='line-break'> </span>Jacobs</a>, Trustee under the will of <a href='/pages/subjects/70186' title='Church, Mary'>Mary Church</a><span class='line-break'> </span>late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/70184' title='Lot 2652'>lot numbered 2652</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>situated on <a href='/pages/subjects/61271' title='Rosemary Path'>Rosemary Path</a>, had offered</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134465">
<h3><a name="page-1134465">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 073)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>73</p>
<p>to pay to this Corporation a bequest of three hun<span class='line-break'></span>dred dollars contained in said will for the <span class='line-break'> </span>purpose of keeping said lot in perpetual <span class='line-break'> </span>repair and preservation, and that they had <span class='line-break'> </span>accepted the same subject to the concurrence <span class='line-break'> </span>of this Board.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that this Board approve<span class='line-break'> </span>the acceptance of said sum for the above named<span class='line-break'> </span>purpose.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 1331 _ Represente'><a href='/pages/subjects/70187' title='Lot 1331'>Lot 1331</a> _ Represent<sup>e</sup></span></p>
<p>Upon the petition of the heirs at law of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/70188' title='Daniels, Nathaniel'>Nathaniel Daniels</a>, deceased, late proprietor <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/70187' title='Lot 1331'>lot no. 1331</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/70189' title='Daniels, Edwin T.'>Edwin T. Daniels</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/55343' title='Somerville, MA'>Som<span class='line-break'></span>erville</a>, eldest son of said Nathaniel, was <span class='line-break'> </span>designated to represent said lot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 1370 Represente'><a href='/pages/subjects/70190' title='Lot 1370'>Lot 1370</a> Represent<sup>e</sup></span></p>
<p>Upon the petition of the children and <span class='line-break'> </span>heirs at law of <a href='/pages/subjects/70191' title='Nichols, Eleazer'>Eleazer Nichols</a>, deceased, late <span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/70190' title='Lot 1370'>lot No. 1370</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/70192' title='Nichols, Abigail'>Abigail Nichols</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>widow of said Eleazer, of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> was desig<span class='line-break'></span>nated to represent said lot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resignation of Mr Curtis as member of Com. on Lots-'>Resignation of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> as member of Com. on Lots-</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> tendered his resignation as <span class='line-break'> </span>a member of the Committee on Lots, and <span class='line-break'> </span>said resignation was laid upon the table <span class='line-break'> </span>until the next meeting.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned,<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Sec<sup>y</sup></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134466">
