<h3><a name="page-1134466">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 074)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>74</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Sept. 6. 1859.'>Trustees <date when='1859-09-06'>Sept. 6. 1859</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held at the usual place, on <date when='1859-09-06T10:00:00'>Monday, Septem<span class='line-break'></span>ber 5<sup>th</sup> at 10 O'clock, a.m.</date> _</p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resignation of Mr Curtis as member of Comee on Lots not accepted _'>Resignation of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> as member of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots not accepted _</span></p>
<p>The resignation of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> as a member of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee upon lots came up.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Mr Cheever</a>,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='5 votes - for it Bigelow, Andrews, Cheever, Sleeper &amp; Tobey _ no neg.'>5 votes - for it <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a> _ no neg.</span></p>
<p>Voted that this Board do not accept the <span class='line-break'> </span>resignation of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> as a member of said Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Amendments to By-Laws _'>Amendments to By-Laws _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Mr Sleeper</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> and Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> and <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a> be a Committee to consider and report what <span class='line-break'> </span>amendments, if any, are necessary to be incorporated <span class='line-break'> </span>into the By-laws.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Foundations for Monuments, &amp;c.'>Foundations for Monuments, &amp;c.</span></p>
<p>A communication was received from <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent, respecting the foundation of monuments <span class='line-break'> </span>and other structures.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>,</p>
<p>Voted to refer the communication to the same Com<sup>ee</sup>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fast-driving in the Cemetery _'>Fast-driving in the Cemetery _</span></p>
<p>It was also, upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the subject of fast driving in returning <span class='line-break'> </span>from funerals in the Cemetery, be referred to the same <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134467">
<h3><a name="page-1134467">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 075)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>75</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representative of Lot 515'>Representative of <a href='/pages/subjects/65303' title='Lot 515'>Lot 515</a></span></p>
<p>Upon petition of the Trustees under the will of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/70499' title='Tirrell, Edward C.'>Edward C. Tirrell</a> late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/65303' title='Lot 515'>lot no. 515</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/70500' title='Tirrell, Edward Q.'>Edward Q. Tirrell</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, son of said deceased,<span class='line-break'> </span>was designated to represent said lot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 694'><a href='/pages/subjects/70501' title='Lot 694'>Lot 694</a></span></p>
<p>Upon the petition of the children and heirs<span class='line-break'> </span>at law of <a href='/pages/subjects/70502' title='Wells, John B.'>John B. Wells</a>, deceased, late <span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/70501' title='Lot 694'>lot No. 694</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/70503' title='Cumings, Bradley N.'>Bradley N. Cumings</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, son in law of said deceased was <span class='line-break'> </span>designated to represent said lot. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 1661'><a href='/pages/subjects/70504' title='Lot 1661'>Lot 1661</a></span></p>
<p>Upon the petition of the widow and heirs at <span class='line-break'> </span>law of <a href='/pages/subjects/70505' title='Lynch, Stephen'>Stephen Lynch</a>, deceased, late propri<span class='line-break'></span>etor of <a href='/pages/subjects/70504' title='Lot 1661'>lot no. 1661</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/70506' title='Lynch, Charles S.'>Charles S. Lynch</a><span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, eldest son of said deceased was <span class='line-break'> </span>designated to represent said lot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 175'><a href='/pages/subjects/70507' title='Lot 175'>Lot 175</a></span></p>
<p>Upon the petition of the widow and children <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/25003956' title='Mears, Elijah'>Elijah Means</a>, deceased, late proprietor <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/70507' title='Lot 175'>lot No. 175</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/25003957' title='Mears, Granville'>Granville  Means</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>eldest son of said deceased, was designated <span class='line-break'> </span>to represent said lot.</p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>, and at the <span class='line-break'> </span>suggestion of the Committee upon Lots,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Wade Lot _'>Wade Lot _</span></p>
<p>Voted that the whole subject in controversy<span class='line-break'> </span>respecting the lot of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/70510' title='Wade, John'>Col. John Wade</a>, be taken <span class='line-break'> </span>from said Committee and referred to this Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Adjournd'>Adjourn<sup>d</sup></span></p>
<p>Voted that when this meeting adjourn, it be to such day as the  <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots may designate.</p>
<p>Adjourned, Att. <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134468">
<h3><a name="page-1134468">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 076)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>76</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees - Septr 17. 1859. Adjourned Meeting _'>Trustees - <date when='1859-09-17'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 17. 1859</date>. Adjourned Meeting _</span></p>
<p>An adjourned meeting of the Trustees called in <span class='line-break'> </span>conformity with the order of the Board at the <span class='line-break'> </span>last meeting, by the Committeee upon Lots, was <span class='line-break'> </span>held at the usual place, on <date when='1859-09-17T10:30:00'>Saturday, Sep<span class='line-break'></span>tember 17<sup>th</sup> at 10 1/2 O'clock a.m. </date></p>
<p>There were present, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, Messrs <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> and <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and <span class='line-break'> </span>approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Protection of the Public Grounds of the Cemetery against Sale _'>Protection of the Public Grounds of the Cemetery against Sale _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a> proposed the adoption of an order, <span class='line-break'> </span>which he read, the object of which was forever <span class='line-break'> </span>to protect from sale certain portions of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>which are now held as public ornamental <span class='line-break'> </span>grounds.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, Voted that <span class='line-break'> </span>the subject be referred to the Committee on Amend<span class='line-break'></span>ments of the By-laws - viz. <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> and Messrs <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Location of lot of the late John Wade.'>Location of lot of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/70510' title='Wade, John'>John Wade</a>.</span></p>
<p>The question for which this meeting was ad<span class='line-break'></span>journed, viz. the location of the lot of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/70510' title='Wade, John'>John<span class='line-break'> </span>Wade</a> - came up.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, Chairman of the Committee upon <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots made a statement of the doings of that Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>in reference to the matter, and read the Superintendent's<span class='line-break'> </span>statement of the same.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>, another member of that Committee,</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134469">
<h3><a name="page-1134469">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 077)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>77</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Wade Lot _ subject of Location _ continued _'>Wade Lot _ subject of Location _ continued _</span></p>
<p>and who was also present with <a href='/pages/subjects/70510' title='Wade, John'>Col. Wade</a> at the <span class='line-break'> </span>time the lot was selected, made his statement,</p>
<p>It was then moved by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,</p>
<p>That this Board direct that said lot shall <span class='line-break'> </span>be laid out twenty six feet by twenty six feet, <span class='line-break'> </span>and to have two fronts _ upon <a href='/pages/subjects/59993' title='Laburnum Path'>Laburnum Path</a> and <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61148' title='Chapel Avenue'>Chapel Avenue</a> _ as originally understood by <a href='/pages/subjects/70510' title='Wade, John'>Col.<span class='line-break'> </span>Wade</a> and his friends; the vote to be taken by yea &amp; nay.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> the Superintendent, was introduced <span class='line-break'> </span>to explain the lines upon a plan of said lot as made<span class='line-break'> </span>by <a href='/pages/subjects/56692' title='Wadsworth, Alexander'>Mr Wadsworth</a>; and <a href='/pages/subjects/71286' title='Converse, James C.'>Mr Converse</a>, Executor <span class='line-break'> </span>and Residuary Legatee of <a href='/pages/subjects/70510' title='Wade, John'>Col. Wade</a> was introduced<span class='line-break'> </span>to show the plan of a costly monument which it is <span class='line-break'> </span>proposed to erect if the location claimed by him is <span class='line-break'> </span>adopted by the Trustees.  He also read a letter from <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/70518' title='Page, John C.'>John C. Page</a>, who was present when <span class='line-break'> </span>the lot was selected; and introduced <a href='/pages/subjects/54376' title='Holden, George H.'>Mr George Holden</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>who was also present, both stating what they then <span class='line-break'> </span>understood to be the agreement as to the location of <span class='line-break'> </span>the lot.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> was called away from the meeting.<span class='line-break'> </span>There being but five members of the Board present,<span class='line-break'> </span>and one of them stating that he could not vote upon the <span class='line-break'> </span>question, as his present knowledge of the matter would not <span class='line-break'> </span>enable him to form an opinion,</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>, it was <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the motion pending be laid upon <span class='line-break'> </span>the table until the next meeting.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134470">
<h3><a name="page-1134470">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 078)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>78</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ October 3. 1859.'>Trustees _ <date when='1859-10-03'>October 3. 1859</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>was held at the usual place on <date when='1859-10-03T10:00:00'>Monday, <span class='line-break'> </span>October 3<sup>rd</sup> at 10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, and <span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Gould</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a>. = 9</p>
<p>The record was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Location of Wade Lot.'>Location of Wade Lot.</span></p>
<p>The questions of locating the lot of the <span class='line-break'> </span>late <a href='/pages/subjects/70510' title='Wade, John'>John Wade</a> which was laid upon the <span class='line-break'> </span>table at the last meeting, was called up.</p>
<p>The motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>  pending, was,<span class='line-break'> </span>by consent, amended, so as to read as follows</p>
<p>That this lot be laid out upon <a href='/pages/subjects/59993' title='Laburnum Path'>Laburnum <span class='line-break'> </span>Path</a>, having an area of twenty six feet by <span class='line-break'> </span>twenty six feet, with the usual frontage of <span class='line-break'> </span>six feet:  the vote to be taken by yea and nay.</p>
<p>After the several statements of Messrs <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, and the reading of <span class='line-break'> </span>a letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->the Superintendent</a>, and <span class='line-break'> </span>further discussion of the subject,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> withdrew his motion to <span class='line-break'> </span>allow of the following by <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a></p>
<p>To refer to the location of the Wade lot <span class='line-break'> </span>to the committee on lots with instructions <span class='line-break'> </span>to approve a conveyance of this lot, to be <span class='line-break'> </span>located upon <a href='/pages/subjects/59993' title='Laburnum Path'>Laburnum Path</a>, with an area<span class='line-break'> </span>of twenty six feet by twenty six feet, and <span class='line-break'> </span>the usual six feet frontage, with the <span class='line-break'> </span>addition of the strip of land lying on</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134471">
<h3><a name="page-1134471">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 079)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>79</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/61148' title='Chapel Avenue'>Chapel Avenue</a>, for ornamental  purposes, _<span class='line-break'> </span>provided the executors of <a href='/pages/subjects/70510' title='Wade, John'>Col. Wade</a> will <span class='line-break'> </span>consent to allow the same to be laid out<span class='line-break'> </span>at the distance of ten feet from the present<span class='line-break'> </span>line of the Fisher lot _ for the sum of <span class='line-break'> </span>nine hundred dollars.</p>
<p>The motion being put, was unanimously adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of the Comee on Amendts to By-laws _ Art. 3d'>Report of the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Amend<sup>ts</sup> to By-laws _ Art. 3<sup>d</sup></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> in behalf of the committee <span class='line-break'> </span>appointed at the meeting in September to <span class='line-break'> </span>consider and report what amendments, <span class='line-break'> </span>if any, are necessary to be incorporated<span class='line-break'> </span>into the By-laws, submitted their report _</p>
<p>That the following alterations and <span class='line-break'> </span>additions be made in the By-laws</p>
<p>Article 3.  after the words "a Gatekeeper<span class='line-break'> </span>___ " insert the words "and a gardener"<span class='line-break'> </span>and after the last paragraph in Art <span class='line-break'> </span>3. insert the following. "and neither the <span class='line-break'> </span>superintendent, gate keeper nor any <span class='line-break'> </span>other paid servant of the corporation, <span class='line-break'> </span>shall have any interest whatever in<span class='line-break'> </span>any work or materials furnished for <span class='line-break'> </span>the cemetery"</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='New Art. on Gardener.'>New Art. on Gardener.</span></p>
<p>After article 9. _ Insert new article <span class='line-break'> </span>styled "<u>gardener</u>" _ and renumber all <span class='line-break'> </span>following articles.</p>
<p>The gardener under the direction <span class='line-break'> </span>of the superintendent shall take charge</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134472">
<h3><a name="page-1134472">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 080)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>80</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gardener'>Gardener</span></p>
<p>of and keep in repair the lots of such <span class='line-break'> </span>proprietors as may apply to him for that <span class='line-break'> </span>service, and on such terms as may be <span class='line-break'> </span>agreed on between the parties; he shall <span class='line-break'> </span>also keep for sale at some convenient<span class='line-break'> </span>place designated by the Trustees, shrubs, trees,<span class='line-break'> </span>and flowers, and be ready to furnish, plant <span class='line-break'> </span>or cultivate the same at his own expense,<span class='line-break'> </span>and for such price and remuneration <span class='line-break'> </span>as may be agreed on with the purchaser.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Art. 17 _ Public Lots.'>Art. 17 _ <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>Public Lots</a>.</span></p>
<p>Art. 17 _ add at the end "and in case <span class='line-break'> </span>the body thus interred is removed from the <span class='line-break'> </span>cemetery, the right is thereby vacated, and <span class='line-break'> </span>no allowance is made by the corporation"</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Art. 18. Refusal Certificate'>Art. 18. Refusal Certificate</span></p>
<p>Art 18. _ After the first clause, insert<span class='line-break'> </span>"upon the selection of a lot, the superintendent <span class='line-break'> </span>shall issue to the party intending to purchase, <span class='line-break'> </span>a certificate giving him a right to pay for <span class='line-break'> </span>the lot at any time within five days if <span class='line-break'> </span>the sale shall be approved by the committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on lots;  otherwise the bargain for sale shall <span class='line-break'> </span>be void". _  and after the words "Lots" at <span class='line-break'> </span>the top of page 22 of the catalogue and <span class='line-break'> </span>By-Laws insert "This rule is not to apply<span class='line-break'> </span>to heirs at law, devisees or trustees of a de<span class='line-break'></span>-ceased person, or to a corporate body, in <span class='line-break'> </span>accordance with a provision of the Legislature <span class='line-break'> </span>of Massachusetts passed <date when='1859-04-06'>April 6<sup>th</sup>, 1859</date></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134473">
<h3><a name="page-1134473">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 081)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>81</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Art. 19 _ Representation'>Art. 19 _ Representation</span></p>
<p>Art. 19 _ add at the end _ "</p>
<p>"any person who shall be designated by <span class='line-break'> </span>any company, society or association whether <span class='line-break'> </span>corporate or incorporate, which may own a <span class='line-break'> </span>lot of three hundred feet or more in the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery, is authorized to represent such <span class='line-break'> </span>lot and vote at the meetings of the corporation."</p>
<p>"Lots of less than three hundred square <span class='line-break'> </span>feet may be represented in the same <span class='line-break'> </span>manner as other lots for all purposes not <span class='line-break'> </span>conflicting with the charter."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Art. 22 _ Tombs _'>Art. 22 _ Tombs _</span></p>
<p>Art 22. _ at top of page 24 of the <span class='line-break'> </span>catalogue and  By-laws after the words "manner <span class='line-break'> </span>and" insert the words 'except in catacombs<span class='line-break'> </span>made as here ^<sup>in</sup> after described.'</p>
<p>Page 24 of catalogue and By-laws, Insert <span class='line-break'> </span>a new By-law after art, now numbered 22<span class='line-break'> </span>and after the subsequent numbers to correspond<span class='line-break'> </span>thus</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='New Art. Catacombs.'>New Art. Catacombs.</span></p>
<p>"<u>Catacombs</u>"</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/66005' title='Catacomb Tombs'>Catacomb tombs</a> may be constructed <span class='line-break'> </span>in such places and manner as shall be <span class='line-break'> </span>approved by the committee on lots, with <span class='line-break'> </span>the entrance doors above ground; but no <span class='line-break'> </span>bodies shall be placed in them except <span class='line-break'> </span>in single compartments made satisfactory <span class='line-break'> </span>to the superintendent and closed so as to <span class='line-break'> </span>be hermetically tight with brick or stone</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134474">
<h3><a name="page-1134474">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 082)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>82</p>
<p>and cement."  add also at the end of <span class='line-break'> </span>Art now numbered 24, "all foundations of <span class='line-break'> </span>monuments and other structures shall be <span class='line-break'> </span>made satisfactory to the superintendent,<span class='line-break'> </span>under the direction of the committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>lots"</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='New Art. on Collection and Payment of Money _'>New Art. on Collection and Payment of Money _</span></p>
<p>After present art 25. insert new article<span class='line-break'> </span>styled "<u>Collection</u> <u>and</u> <u>payment</u> <u>of</u> <u>money</u>" <span class='line-break'> </span>All sums due the corporation of one <span class='line-break'> </span>hundred dollars and upwards shall <span class='line-break'> </span>be paid to the Treasurer;  and all bills <span class='line-break'> </span>of like amount shall be paid by him;<span class='line-break'> </span>and all bills except those for labor shall <span class='line-break'> </span>be approved either by the proprietor for whom <span class='line-break'> </span>the works is done, or by the committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>lots;  provided that nothing herein contained <span class='line-break'> </span>shall be understood as conflicting with <span class='line-break'> </span>the provisions of any existing by-laws"</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Art. 26 _ Perptl Repair of Lots _'>Art. 26 _ Perpt<sup>l</sup> Repair of Lots _</span></p>
<p>Page 25 of catalogue and By-laws. _ at <span class='line-break'> </span>the end of third line insert "containng <span class='line-break'> </span>three hundred feet and upwards" and in <span class='line-break'> </span>the fifth line after the word "dollars" insert<span class='line-break'> </span>"and of lots containing less than three hundred <span class='line-break'> </span>feet, on the payment of a sum not less than <span class='line-break'> </span>one hundred dollars."</p>
<p>he foregoing proposed amendments and <span class='line-break'> </span>alterations were severally read and referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to the next meeting for adoption.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134475">
<h3><a name="page-1134475">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 083)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>83</p>
<p>Some discussion arose in reference to <span class='line-break'> </span>amending articles 27 &amp; 28 upon "admittance <span class='line-break'> </span>and Funerals: and instead of proposing an <span class='line-break'> </span>alteration thereof, the following vote ws adopted _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Copy of Rule respecting Fast-Driving [to] be handed to Every carriage entering [the] cemetery _'>Copy of Rule respecting Fast-Driving [to] be handed to Every carriage entering [the] cemetery _</span></p>
<p>That a copy of the rule respecting Fast <span class='line-break'> </span>driving shall be handed to every person <span class='line-break'> </span>driving into the cemetery _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Repeal of vote giving Comee on Lots control of erection of monuments &amp;c _'>Repeal of vote giving Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots control of erection of monuments &amp;c _</span></p>
<p>It was further voted that the order <span class='line-break'> </span>of <date when='1857-11-02'>Nov 2<sup>d</sup> 1857</date>. providing "that the committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots shall have control of the mode<span class='line-break'> </span>and manner of erecting monuments,<span class='line-break'> </span>and head stones in the <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>public lots</a>" _<span class='line-break'> </span>be hereby repealed _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Plan and Survey of Cemetery _'>Plan and Survey of Cemetery _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> stated that a large <span class='line-break'> </span>plan of the cemetery was greatly needed <span class='line-break'> </span>in his office: that additions had been <span class='line-break'> </span>made to the old plan from year to year <span class='line-break'> </span>since 1831, and frequent erasures and <span class='line-break'> </span>changes upon it had, nearly worn it <span class='line-break'> </span>out, and thus in a measure impaired<span class='line-break'> </span>its accuracy, that a new and careful <span class='line-break'> </span>survey of the whole cemetery and its<span class='line-break'> </span>adjacent lands could probably be made<span class='line-break'> </span>at a moderate cost; and upon his <span class='line-break'> </span>recommendation, and on motion of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>,</p>
<p>It was voted that the subject of</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134476">
<h3><a name="page-1134476">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 084)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>84</p>
<p>a topographical, contour survey of the <span class='line-break'> </span>cemetery be referred to the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Grounds to report thereon.</p>
<p>The meeting was then ad<span class='line-break'></span>journed</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>,,Secretary</p>
<p>---------------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Nov. 7. 1859'>Trustees <date when='1859-11-07'>Nov. 7. 1859</date></span></p>
<p>The regular meeting of the Trustees was held<span class='line-break'> </span>at the usual place, on <date when='1859-11-07T10:00:00'>Monday, November 7<sup>th</sup>,<span class='line-break'> </span>1859, at 10 o'clock a. m.</date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>and Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Correction of Record _'>Correction of Record _</span></p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read, <span class='line-break'> </span>and approved, with the exception of the vote <span class='line-break'> </span>repealing the vote of <date when='1857-11-02'>Nov. 2<sup>d</sup>. 1857</date> which was <span class='line-break'> </span>passed under the erroneous supposition that said<span class='line-break'> </span>vote of Nov 2<sup>ond</sup> gave the committee upon lots the <span class='line-break'> </span>control of erecting monuments &amp;c, in <u>all</u> lots <span class='line-break'> </span>in the Cemetery, as well as the <u>public</u> lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Expunging of vote _'>Expunging of vote _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that said repealing vote be stricken <span class='line-break'> </span>from the record.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Amendments to By-laws proposed at last meeting adopted _'>Amendments to By-laws proposed at last meeting adopted _</span></p>
<p>The amendments to the by-laws proposed <span class='line-break'> </span>at the last meeting were taken from the table, <span class='line-break'> </span>and were unanimously adopted.</p>
<p>The Committee on Lots presented a report</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134477">
<h3><a name="page-1134477">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 085)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>85</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Action of Comee on Lots laying out Wade Lot ratified _'>Action of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots laying out Wade Lot ratified _</span></p>
<p>of their action in reference to the Wade lot,<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to them, with instructions, at the last <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting, which is as follows: _</p>
<p>At a meeting of the Committee on Lots, <span class='line-break'> </span>held <date when='1859-10-21'>October 21, 1859</date> it was ordered, with the <span class='line-break'> </span>consent of the heirs of <a href='/pages/subjects/70510' title='Wade, John'>Col Wade</a>, that a <span class='line-break'> </span>lot of land in the Cemetery be laid out on <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59993' title='Laburnum Path'>Laburnum Path</a>, according to the terms of the <span class='line-break'> </span>vote of the Trustees dated <date when='1859-10-03'>Oct 3<sup>d</sup>. 1859</date>.</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Uriel Crocker</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>William T Andrews</a>.</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted to accept the report of the Committee.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resolutions upon death of B.A. Gould, a Trustee _'>Resolutions upon death of <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B.A. Gould</a>, a Trustee _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> then presented the following <span class='line-break'> </span>resolutions, which, upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Mr Cheever</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>were accepted, and a copy was ordered to <span class='line-break'> </span>be sent to the family of the deceased.</p>
<p>On the occasion of the death of <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Benjamin <span class='line-break'> </span>A. Gould Esq.</a> a member of the Board it is <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted _ that</p>
<p>The Trustees of Mount Auburn Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>are deeply impressed by the act of Providence <span class='line-break'> </span>which has taken from them one of the oldest, <span class='line-break'> </span>most faithful and most esteemed of their <span class='line-break'> </span>number</p>
<p>They hold in grateful remembrance the <span class='line-break'> </span>long and friendly intercourse by which he <span class='line-break'> </span>has cooperated with them in the care of</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134478">
<h3><a name="page-1134478">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 086)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>86</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resolutions upon death of B.A. Gould _ continued _'>Resolutions upon death of <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>B.A. Gould</a> _ continued _</span></p>
<p>a solemn public trust, and the fidelity,<span class='line-break'> </span>zeal, and undeviating good temper, with which <span class='line-break'> </span>he has applied himself to the discharge  of this dut[y.]</p>
<p>They recollect with unmixed satisfaction <span class='line-break'> </span>the disinterested  and honorable character of their <span class='line-break'> </span>friend, his warm and generous instincts, the <span class='line-break'> </span>unalterable integrity with which he obeyed<span class='line-break'> </span>the promptings of a kind heart controlled and <span class='line-break'> </span>guided by a strong judgement and conscientious<span class='line-break'> </span>love of right.</p>
<p>To the family of the deceased they would <span class='line-break'> </span>convey the expression of their deep felt sympathy<span class='line-break'> </span>in aid of the higher consolation, which will <span class='line-break'> </span>always remain to them in contempating the <span class='line-break'> </span>example of his life, and in cherishing his <span class='line-break'> </span>unspotted memory.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> for the Com<sup>ee</sup> upon Grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>submitted a paper of which the following is a <span class='line-break'> </span>copy, being in part a report of matters referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to said Committee, and in part recommendation <span class='line-break'> </span>of new matters deemed important by the Committee</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Topographical Survey of Cemetery-'>Topographical Survey of Cemetery-</span></p>
<p>The Committee on Grounds beg leave respect<span class='line-break'></span>fully to report</p>
<p>That they recommend that a topo<span class='line-break'></span>graphical survey be made of the whole ceme<span class='line-break'></span>tery, on a scale at least four times as <span class='line-break'> </span>large as the largest maps now owned by <span class='line-break'> </span>the corporation, and at an expense not</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134479">
<h3><a name="page-1134479">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 087)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>87</p>
<p>exceeding one thousand dollars, showing the <span class='line-break'> </span>shape size and position of the lots, and the inter<span class='line-break'></span>-mediate spaces, and dividing said spaces so that <span class='line-break'> </span>the size and price may be known of the space<span class='line-break'> </span>which each proprietor is entitled to purchase.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Agent for the sale of spaces _'>Agent for the sale of spaces _</span></p>
<p>That the committee on grounds be author<span class='line-break'></span>ized to employ an agent to offer to any, or <span class='line-break'> </span>all, the proprietors the opportunity to purchase <span class='line-break'> </span>said spaces in conformity to the By-law<span class='line-break'> </span>provided in relation to the same.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Granite Front for Catacombs'>Granite Front for Catacombs</span></p>
<p>That <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->the superintendent</a> shall be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>under the direction of the committee on grounds,<span class='line-break'> </span>to contract for a granite front of a <a href='/pages/subjects/66005' title='Catacomb Tombs'>catacomb <!--tomb--></a><span class='line-break'> </span>in <a href='/pages/subjects/54338' title='Indian Ridge Path'>Indian ridge</a>, at a cost not exceeding <span class='line-break'> </span>three thousand dollars.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Changes in location of Avenues _'>Changes in location of Avenues _</span></p>
<p>To correct some mistakes and inconvenient <span class='line-break'> </span>locations of certain avenues on the old map<span class='line-break'> </span>they recommend that the following alterations <span class='line-break'> </span>be made in future maps and catalogues.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Garden Avenue _'><a href='/pages/subjects/58079' title='Garden Avenue'>Garden Avenue</a> _</span></p>
<p>That the whole avenue extending from the <span class='line-break'> </span>Gate to the north east corner of the cemetery be <span class='line-break'> </span>called "<a href='/pages/subjects/58079' title='Garden Avenue'>Garden avenue</a>"</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Maple Avenue _'><a href='/pages/subjects/58080' title='Maple Avenue'>Maple Avenue</a> _</span></p>
<p>That the avenue extending from the north<span class='line-break'></span>east corner of the cemetery ^<sup>to the south east corner</sup> of the same be<span class='line-break'> </span>called "<a href='/pages/subjects/58080' title='Maple Avenue'>Maple avenue</a>"<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134480">
<h3><a name="page-1134480">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 088)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>88</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Magnolia Avenue _'><a href='/pages/subjects/61227' title='Magnolia Avenue'>Magnolia Avenue</a> _</span></p>
<p>That the whole avenue leading from <a href='/pages/subjects/58080' title='Maple Avenue'>Maple<!--Ave--></a> <span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/60001' title='Walnut Avenue'>Walnut Avenue</a> be called <a href='/pages/subjects/61227' title='Magnolia Avenue'>Magnolia Avenue</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mountain Avenue _'><a href='/pages/subjects/61236' title='Mountain Avenue'>Mountain Avenue</a> _</span></p>
<p>That the avenue which leads from <a href='/pages/subjects/61227' title='Magnolia Avenue'>Magnolia<!--Ave--></a> <span class='line-break'> </span>as now described, extending up <a href='/pages/subjects/70948' title='Mount Auburn Hill'>Mount Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>hill</a> and round <a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>the Tower</a>, be called <a href='/pages/subjects/61236' title='Mountain Avenue'>Mountain <span class='line-break'> </span>Avenue</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oxalis Path _'><a href='/pages/subjects/61250' title='Oxalis Path'>Oxalis Path</a> _</span></p>
<p>That "<a href='/pages/subjects/57847' title='Fountain Path'>Fountain Path</a>" be called "<a href='/pages/subjects/61250' title='Oxalis Path'>Oxalis Path</a>"<span class='line-break'> </span>of which it is really a part.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ash Avenue _'><a href='/pages/subjects/58083' title='Ash Avenue'>Ash Avenue</a> _</span></p>
<p>That ^<sup>the</sup> avenue from Culvert to <a href='/pages/subjects/58080' title='Maple Avenue'>Maple Avenue</a> formerly <span class='line-break'> </span>a part of <a href='/pages/subjects/58079' title='Garden Avenue'>Garden<!--Ave--></a>, be called <a href='/pages/subjects/58083' title='Ash Avenue'>Ash Avenue</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Yew Avenue _'><a href='/pages/subjects/58084' title='Yew Avenue'>Yew Avenue</a> _</span></p>
<p>That the cross avenue from <a href='/pages/subjects/58079' title='Garden Avenue'>Garden<!--Ave--></a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/58083' title='Ash Avenue'>Ash<!--Ave--></a><span class='line-break'> </span>be called <a href='/pages/subjects/58084' title='Yew Avenue'>Yew Avenue</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Correction of Deeds in respect to location _'>Correction of Deeds in respect to location _</span></p>
<p>That for such proprietors as may desire <span class='line-break'> </span>it, <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the secretary</a> be authorized to exchange their <span class='line-break'> </span>deeds for others corrected in conformity to the <span class='line-break'> </span>above alterations without cost to them, and <span class='line-break'> </span>farther that <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> make apt notes of the <span class='line-break'> </span>vote of this date changing the name, on the <span class='line-break'> </span>margin of the record of all lots whenever such <span class='line-break'> </span>changes may occur.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Quarter Lots _'>Quarter Lots _</span></p>
<p>That the committee on grounds be author<span class='line-break'></span>ized to lay out such number of quarter <span class='line-break'> </span>lots not exceeding forty, as they may think <span class='line-break'> </span>proper, and to sell them for not less than fifty</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<h3><a name="page-1134481">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 089)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>89</p>
<p>dollars each.</p>
<p>That the same committee be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to carry into effect the provisions of this <span class='line-break'> </span>report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tombs in Hazel Dell _'>Tombs in <a href='/pages/subjects/59983' title='Hazel Dell'>Hazel Dell</a> _</span></p>
<p>That the same committee be <span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to build two more tombs in <a href='/pages/subjects/59983' title='Hazel Dell'>Hazel<span class='line-break'> </span>Dell</a>, at a cost not exceeding $1500 each.</p>
<p>The several orders^<sup>embraced</sup> in the foregoing report<span class='line-break'> </span>having been taken up seriatim were adopted.</p>

<p>Voted that a deed of the additional <span class='line-break'> </span>sixty nine feet be given to him without further <span class='line-break'> </span>consideration.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representation of Lots _'>Representation of Lots _</span></p>

<p>Upon the petition of the widow and <span class='line-break'> </span>daughter of <a href='/pages/subjects/70978' title='Daniell, Chester'>Chester Daniell</a> late proprietor <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/70977' title='Lot 1901'>lot numbered 1901</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/70979' title='Daniell, Henry W.'>Henry W. Daniell</a><span class='line-break'> </span>only son of said Chester was designated to <span class='line-break'> </span>represent said lot.</p>
<p>Upon the petition of the widow and <span class='line-break'> </span>children of <a href='/pages/subjects/70980' title='Tyler, William N.'>William N Tyler</a> deceased, late</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134484">
<h3><a name="page-1134484">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 092)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>92</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 1923 _'><a href='/pages/subjects/70981' title='Lot 1923'>Lot 1923</a> _</span></p>
<p>proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/70981' title='Lot 1923'>lot numbered 1923</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/70982' title='Lilley, John D.'>John D<span class='line-break'> </span>Lilley</a> son in law of said deceased was des<span class='line-break'></span>-ignated to represent said lot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 2201 _'><a href='/pages/subjects/70983' title='Lot 2201'>Lot 2201</a> _</span> <span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='{I do not find Petn for this appt on file} S. B. Jr., Sec&apos;y May 3, 1875 _'>{I do not find Pet<sup>n</sup> for this app<sup>t</sup> on file} <a href='/pages/subjects/54731' title='Batchelder, Samuel, Jr.'>S. B. Jr.</a>, Sec'y <date when='1875-05-03'>May 3, 1875</date> _</span></p>
<p>Upon the petition of the widow and <span class='line-break'> </span>children of <a href='/pages/subjects/70985' title='Porter, Joseph'>Joseph Porter</a> deceased, late <span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/70983' title='Lot 2201'>lot numbered 2201</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/70986' title='Porter, S. Maria'>S. Maria <span class='line-break'> </span>Porter</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a> widow of said Joseph <span class='line-break'> </span>was designated to represent said lot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 2205 _'><a href='/pages/subjects/70987' title='Lot 2205'>Lot 2205</a> _</span></p>
<p>Upon the petition of the widow and <span class='line-break'> </span>guardian of the only child of <a href='/pages/subjects/70988' title='Harris, John S.'>John S Harris</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>deceased late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/70987' title='Lot 2205'>lot numbered 2205</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/70989' title='Harris, Caroline R. M.'>Caroline R M Harris</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/64864' title='Cambridgeport, MA'>Cambridgeport</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>widow of said deceased was designated to rep<span class='line-break'></span>resent said lot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 2236 _'><a href='/pages/subjects/70990' title='Lot 2236'>Lot 2236</a> _</span></p>
<p>Upon the petition of the administra<span class='line-break'></span>-tor of the estate of <a href='/pages/subjects/70991' title='Nickerson, Francis F.'>Francis F Nickerson</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>deceased late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/70990' title='Lot 2236'>lot numbered 2236</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/70992' title='Doan, Herman S.'>Mr Herman S. Doan</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/54284' title='Charlestown, MA'>Charlestown</a> guardian <span class='line-break'> </span>of the devisee of said deceased ws designated <span class='line-break'> </span>to represent said lot</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 2613 _'><a href='/pages/subjects/70993' title='Lot 2613'>Lot 2613</a> _</span></p>
<p>Upon the petition of the Trustees and <span class='line-break'> </span>two of the children of <a href='/pages/subjects/70994' title='Hobbs, Prentiss'>Prentiss Hobbs</a> deceased <span class='line-break'> </span>late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/70993' title='Lot 2613'>lot numbered 2613</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/70995' title='Hobbs, Thomas J.'>Thomas J<span class='line-break'> </span>Hobbs</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/62295' title='Newton, MA'>Newton</a> the brother and one of the trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>of said deceased was designated to represent said lot</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134485">
<h3><a name="page-1134485">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 093)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>93</p>
<p>The secretary read the following letter addressed <span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Mr Bond</a>, the Treasurer in behalf of this Corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 1806 Application of Exor for sale of lot in discharge of bequest to Corporation _'><a href='/pages/subjects/60415' title='Lot 1806'>Lot 1806</a> Application of Ex<sup>or</sup> for sale of lot in discharge of bequest to Corporation _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54469' title='Washington, DC'>Washington City</a> <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1859-10-17'>Oct 17 1859</date></p>
<p>Sir</p>
<p>The late <a href='/pages/subjects/70997' title='Larkin, Thomas O.'>Thomas O Larkin</a> of Cal<sup>a</sup>  by his <span class='line-break'> </span>last will, left the sum of $400. _ to the directors <span class='line-break'> </span>or managers of Mt Auburn Cemetery the interest <span class='line-break'> </span>of which to be applied to the care and protection <span class='line-break'> </span>of two <a href='/pages/subjects/60415' title='Lot 1806'>lots (1806</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/60416' title='Lot 1807'><!--Lot-->1807</a>) in <a href='/pages/subjects/59904' title='Spruce Avenue'>Spruce avenue</a>, belonging<span class='line-break'> </span>to himself &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/60754' title='Wright, Otis'>Otis Wright</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/64279' title='Dorchester, MA'>Neponset</a>.</p>
<p>The remains of <a href='/pages/subjects/70997' title='Larkin, Thomas O.'>Mr Larkin</a> are interred <span class='line-break'> </span>in <a href='/pages/subjects/70998' title='Lone Mountian Cemetery, San Francisco'>Lone Mount Cemetery, San Francisco</a>, and <span class='line-break'> </span>his family are permanently settled in Cal<sup>a</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>and the lot in Mt Auburn (<a href='/pages/subjects/60415' title='Lot 1806'>No 1806</a>, _ 360 ft)<span class='line-break'> </span>will never be of any use to them.  It was <span class='line-break'> </span>their suggestion therefore, when I was in <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/70999' title='San Francisco, CA'>San Fr<sup>o</sup></a> last spring, that the lot be sold <span class='line-break'> </span>and the proceeds devoted to the discharge of <span class='line-break'> </span>the bequest.  It is occurred to me,  however, <span class='line-break'> </span>that the corporation might be disposed to <span class='line-break'> </span>become the purchaser, or receive the lot <span class='line-break'> </span>in offset of the legacy.  The two lots are<span class='line-break'> </span>enclosed in one common fence, and<span class='line-break'> </span>would require a division fence to separate <span class='line-break'> </span>them, but <a href='/pages/subjects/60415' title='Lot 1806'>No 1806</a> is entirely unoccupied,<span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/60754' title='Wright, Otis'>Mr Wright</a> has no objection to a sale.</p>
<p>I address  you in consequence of being one <span class='line-break'> </span>of the executors named in the will of <a href='/pages/subjects/70997' title='Larkin, Thomas O.'>Mr Lar<span class='line-break'></span>kin</a>, &amp; guardian of his minor children</p>
<p>Respfly [sic] <a href='/pages/subjects/79343' title='Childs, Ebenezer Larkin'>E. L. Childs</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134486">
<h3><a name="page-1134486">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 094)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>94</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='declined _'>declined _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the Trustees decline any other <span class='line-break'> </span>action than to receive the $400. above men<span class='line-break'></span>tioned, in accordance with the terms con<span class='line-break'></span>tained in the will of said <a href='/pages/subjects/70997' title='Larkin, Thomas O.'>Thomas O. Larkin</a></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> proposed certain amendments<span class='line-break'> </span>to the regulations respecting visitors with <span class='line-break'> </span>penalties annexed to the violation of <span class='line-break'> </span>the same, which were read and referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to the next meeting of the Trustees.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>,, Secretary</p>
<p>---------------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees December 5. 1859.'>Trustees <date when='1859-12-05'>December 5. 1859</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular meeting of the Trustees was<span class='line-break'> </span>held at the usual place on <date when='1859-12-05T10:00:00'>Monday, Dec<span class='line-break'> </span>5. 1859 at 10 o'clock a.m. </date></p>
<p>There were present, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a></p>
<p>The records of the last meeting were <span class='line-break'> </span>read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representn of Lots _'>Represent<sup>n</sup> of Lots _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> read petitions for the <span class='line-break'> </span>representation of lots as follows; and the <span class='line-break'> </span>persons therein nominated were severally <span class='line-break'> </span>designated.</p>
<p>Upon the petition of the devisees under<span class='line-break'> </span>the will of <a href='/pages/subjects/71000' title='Hooton, John'>John Hooton</a> deceased late</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134487">
<h3><a name="page-1134487">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 095)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>95</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 254'><a href='/pages/subjects/71001' title='Lot 254'>Lot 254</a></span></p>
<p>proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/71001' title='Lot 254'>lot numbered 254</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71002' title='Hooten, James'>James Hooten</a><span class='line-break'> </span>oldest son of said deceased was designa<span class='line-break'></span>-ted to represent said lot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='[Lot] 1146'><a href='/pages/subjects/71003' title='Lot 1146'>[Lot] 1146</a></span></p>
<p>Upon the petition of the widow of <a href='/pages/subjects/71004' title='Earl, William'>William <span class='line-break'> </span>Earl</a> deceased, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/71003' title='Lot 1146'>lot numbered <span class='line-break'> </span>1146</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71005' title='Earl, Amy A.'>Amy A Earl</a> widow of said deceased <span class='line-break'> </span>was designated to represent said lot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='[Lot] 1606'><a href='/pages/subjects/71006' title='Lot 1606'>[Lot] 1606</a></span></p>
<p>Upon the petition of the widow, adminis<span class='line-break'></span>-trix and guardian of the children (all being <span class='line-break'> </span>minors) of <a href='/pages/subjects/71007' title='Ellis, John S.'>John S. Ellis</a> deceased, late proprietor <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/71006' title='Lot 1606'>lot numbered 1606</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71008' title='Ellis, Lucinda A.'>Lucinda A Ellis</a><span class='line-break'> </span>widow of said deceased resident in <a href='/pages/subjects/71009' title='Weston, MA'>Weston</a><span class='line-break'> </span>was designated to represent said lot.</p>
<p>Upon the petition of the executors and <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees under the will of <a href='/pages/subjects/25005796' title='Whall, Joseph B.'>Joseph B Whall</a><span class='line-break'> </span>deceased, late Proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/71011' title='Lot 2682'>lot numbered<span class='line-break'> </span>2682</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/71012' title='Converse, James W.'>James W. Converse</a>, Trustee of said <span class='line-break'> </span>estate was designated to represent said lot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='New Edn of Catalogue ordered'>New Ed<sup>n</sup> of Catalogue ordered</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The secretary</a> stated that but a few copies<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Catalogue were remaining and that <span class='line-break'> </span>no order has been passed to print the <span class='line-break'> </span>amendments to the by-laws which have <span class='line-break'> </span>been adopted.  It was accordingly</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to have three thousand copies of the <span class='line-break'> </span>catalogue printed, including the by-laws</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134488">
<h3><a name="page-1134488">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 096)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>96</p>
<p>and such matter as is usually inserted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Union of lots 116 &amp; 2625 into one lot. no 116 _'>Union of <a href='/pages/subjects/67014' title='Lot 116'>lots 116</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/71435' title='Lot 2625'><!--Lot-->2625</a> into one lot. no 116 _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> stated that <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Jacob Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span>having purchased at full price all the <span class='line-break'> </span>land lying between his two lots, was desirous <span class='line-break'> </span>of uniting the same into one lot. _</p>
<p>It was accordingly voted that all the land <span class='line-break'> </span>now included within his <a href='/pages/subjects/71435' title='Lot 2625'>lot numbered 2625</a><span class='line-break'> </span>be hereby annexed to <a href='/pages/subjects/67014' title='Lot 116'>lot numbered 116</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that the number 2625 be free for use <span class='line-break'> </span>in connection with any other lot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasr authorized to discharge mortgage.'>Treas<sup>r</sup> authorized to discharge mortgage.</span></p>
<p>Upon suggestion by <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> the following <span class='line-break'> </span>vote was passed.</p>
<p>Whereas <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> of this Corpora<span class='line-break'></span>-tion did, on <date when='1859-10-13'>the 13<sup>th</sup> day of October, A<span class='line-break'> </span>D 1859</date>, execute a deed of release and <span class='line-break'> </span>discharge of a mortgage made by <a href='/pages/subjects/71548' title='Oliver, Sarah P.'>Sarah <span class='line-break'> </span>P. Oliver</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/71549' title='Blake, Samuel P.'>Samuel P. Blake</a> dated <date when='1859-10-01'>October<span class='line-break'> </span>1. 1856</date>, and recorded with Suffolk deeds, Book<span class='line-break'> </span>706, page 184, and by said Blake assigned to <span class='line-break'> </span>this corporation, under the supposed general <span class='line-break'> </span>authority which he had to sign conveyances, <span class='line-break'> </span>it is hereby</p>
<p>Voted that the execution of said <span class='line-break'> </span>^<sup>deed</sup> by him be hereby ratified and confirmed.<span class='line-break'> </span>Adjourned _ Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134489">
<h3><a name="page-1134489">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 097)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>97</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Jany. 2. 1860.'>Trustees <date when='1860-01-02'>Jany. 2. 1860</date>.</span></p>
<p>At the hour appointed for the regular monthly <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting on <date when='1860-01-02T10:00:00'>Monday January 2. 1860</date>, there <span class='line-break'> </span>were present, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> and messrs <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='No quorum'>No quorum</span></p>
<p>No quorum being present, the meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>was adjourned to the next regular meeting.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J Coolidge</a> Secretary.</p>
<p>-------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Feb. 6. 1860.'>Trustees <date when='1860-02-06'>Feb. 6. 1860</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular meeting of the Trustees was held at <span class='line-break'> </span>the usual  place on <date when='1860-02-01'>monday February 6<sup>th</sup> 1860. at<span class='line-break'> </span>10 o'clock. A.M.</date></p>
<p>There were present, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>. _</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees [An]nual Report'>Trustees [An]nual Report</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> read the annual report of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees which was accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Granite [f]ront for new [Ca]tacomb Tomb [P]lan of'>Granite [f]ront for new <a href='/pages/subjects/66005' title='Catacomb Tombs'>[Ca]tacomb Tomb</a> [P]lan of</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> for the Committee on Grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>submitted the draft of a granite front for <span class='line-break'> </span>the new <a href='/pages/subjects/66005' title='Catacomb Tombs'>Catacomb Tomb</a> which that Commit<span class='line-break'></span>-tee have been authorized to have constructed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Appropriation for same'>Appropriation for same</span></p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the Committee be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>contract for such front at an expense <span class='line-break'> </span>not exceeding four thousand dollars.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134490">
<h3><a name="page-1134490">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 098)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>98</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurers Annual Report'>Treasurers Annual Report</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->The Treasurer</a> read his annual report <span class='line-break'> </span>which upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a> was <span class='line-break'> </span>voted to be accepted. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='order for Duplicate Register of Interments'>order for Duplicate Register of Interments</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Mr Tobey</a>, the surviving member of the com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee on Regulations and Records of Interments, <span class='line-break'> </span>stated that it appeared to him important <span class='line-break'> </span>that a duplicate Register of the Interments <span class='line-break'> </span>should be made and kept in another place <span class='line-break'> </span>than at the gate, in order to secure greater <span class='line-break'> </span>safety to the record; _</p>
<p>and upon motion by him it was <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the Committee on Regulations &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>Records of Interments have authority to cause <span class='line-break'> </span>to be made a duplicate Register of the <span class='line-break'> </span>interments in the Cemetery from the beginning<span class='line-break'> </span>with such corrections in the same as can <span class='line-break'> </span>be made; that this duplicate Register <span class='line-break'> </span>be hereafter kept up, and that the books<span class='line-break'> </span>containing the same shall be kept in a <span class='line-break'> </span>safe at the Secretary's office.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='note of Mrs Gould to be put  on file'>note of <a href='/pages/subjects/71552' title='Gould, Lucretia D.'>Mrs Gould</a> to be put  on file</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> read a note received <span class='line-break'> </span>from <a href='/pages/subjects/71552' title='Gould, Lucretia D.'>Mrs Lucretia D Gould</a>, in reply to <span class='line-break'> </span>a copy of the resolutions passed by this Board <span class='line-break'> </span>upon the decease of her husband, and their <span class='line-break'> </span>late colleague, <a href='/pages/subjects/54772' title='Gould, Benjamin A. (1787-1859)'>Benjamin A Gould</a>,</p>
<p>which upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>was ordered to be placed on file.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134491">
<h3><a name="page-1134491">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 099)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>99</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Corrections on Large Plan'>Corrections on Large Plan</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->The Secretary</a> read a communication from <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/56692' title='Wadsworth, Alexander'>Mr Wadsworth</a>, the surveyor, requesting authority <span class='line-break'> </span>to change the following numbers upon the large <span class='line-break'> </span>plan, as numbers have been accidentally <span class='line-break'> </span>reported by the Superintendent which displace<span class='line-break'> </span>old numbers on the plan; _ to wit, <a href='/pages/subjects/71553' title='Lot 2886'>2886</a><span class='line-break'> </span>on <a href='/pages/subjects/61262' title='Primrose Path'>Primrose Path</a>, in place of <a href='/pages/subjects/71554' title='Lot 341'><!--Lot-->341</a>; <a href='/pages/subjects/71555' title='Lot 2931'><!--Lot-->2931</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/54338' title='Indian Ridge Path'>Indian <span class='line-break'> </span>Ridge Path</a> in place of <a href='/pages/subjects/71556' title='Lot 344'><!--Lot-->344</a>; <a href='/pages/subjects/67288' title='Lot 2852'>2852</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/54338' title='Indian Ridge Path'>Indian Ridge<span class='line-break'> </span>Path</a> in place of <a href='/pages/subjects/71557' title='Lot 348'><!--Lot-->348</a>; <a href='/pages/subjects/71558' title='Lot 2902'><!--Lot-->2902</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/60000' title='Sylvan Path'>Sylvan Path</a> in <span class='line-break'> </span>place of <a href='/pages/subjects/71560' title='Lot 2840'><!--Lot-->2840</a>; and the removal of <a href='/pages/subjects/71560' title='Lot 2840'><!--Lot-->2840</a><span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/61130' title='Bellwort Path'>Bellwort Path</a>;</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the surveyor be instructed to <span class='line-break'> </span>make the above changes upon the plan. _</p>

<div id="page-1134502">
<h3><a name="page-1134502">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 110)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>110</p>
<p><b>Mount Auburn Cemetery</b></p>
<p>The Annual Meeting of the Proprietors of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn will be held<span class='line-break'> </span>in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, at Mercantile Hall, 16 Summer St<span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1860-02-06T15:30:00'>Monday the sixth day of February at 3½<span class='line-break'> </span>o'clock P.M.</date> to hear the reports of the Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>and Treasurer, and to choose Trustees for the <span class='line-break'> </span>ensuing year.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J Coolidge</a> Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1860-01-28'>January 28, 1860</date>.</p>
<p>Pursuant to the foregoing notice which was <span class='line-break'> </span>published more than seven days before the time<span class='line-break'> </span>of meeting in the <a href='/pages/subjects/58551' title='Boston Daily Advertiser'>Boston Daily Advertiser</a>, and several <span class='line-break'> </span>other newspapers in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, the Proprietors met at the <span class='line-break'> </span>time and place therein named.</p>
<p>A quorum being in attendance, the Pres<span class='line-break'></span>-ident <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Jacob Bigelow</a> took the Chair.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Records read _'>Records read _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> read the printed notification<span class='line-break'> </span>of the meeting, also the record of the last <span class='line-break'> </span>Annual meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees&apos; Annual Rept'>Trustees' Annual Rep<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> read the annual report <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees, in print.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer&apos;s &amp; Supts Annual Report'>Treasurer's &amp; Sup<sup>ts</sup> Annual Report</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->The Treasurer</a> read his annual report;<span class='line-break'> </span>and that of the Superintendent, also in print.</p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/72372' title='Nichols, Thaddeus'>Mr Thaddeus Nichols</a>, Voted <span class='line-break'> </span>that the reports be severally accepted. _</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee to receive, sort, and count votes _'>Com<sup>ee</sup> to receive, sort, and count votes _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/62119' title='Lee, Thomas J.'>Mr Thomas J Lee</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>voted that a committee of five be nom<span class='line-break'></span>inated by the Chair to receive sort and <span class='line-break'> </span>count the votes for Trustees. - and Messrs</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/62119' title='Lee, Thomas J.'>Thomas J Lee</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/67759' title='Rice, Henry A.'>Henry A Rice</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/67761' title='Manning, F. C.'>F C Manning</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/72377' title='Emmons, Raymond'>Raymond Emmons</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>and</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/64689' title='Richardson, George C.'>George C Richardson</a></td> </tr> </tbody> </table></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Cutting of Grass in Lots _'>Cutting of Grass in Lots _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/62241' title='Paige, Lucius R.'>Mr Lucius R Paige</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted, that the Trustees be requested to cause <span class='line-break'> </span>the grass to be mowed in the several lots of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery, at suitable times, at the expense <span class='line-break'> </span>of the corporation.</p>

(1787-1859)'>Benjamin A Gould</a> deceased.</p>
