<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a> " [had]</th> <th>600<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Jacob Sleeper</a> " [had]</td> <td>599</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Edward S Tobey</a> " [had]</td> <td>600</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Edward Austin</a> " [had]</td> <td>599</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Edward S Rand</a> " [had]</td> <td>598</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/58506' title='Hastings, Thomas'>Thomas Hastings</a> " [had]</td> <td>2</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/72257' title='Adams, Paul'>Paul Adams</a> " [had]</td> <td>1</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/62241' title='Paige, Lucius R.'>Lucius R Paige</a> " [had]</td> <td>1</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>and the twelve gentlemen just named were <span class='line-break'> </span>declared to be elected Trustees for the ensuing year.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned without day.</p>
<p>Attest, <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary.</p>
<p>-------------</p>
<p>The Treasurer reports the following abstract <span class='line-break'> </span>of Receipts and Expenditures for the 28<sup>th</sup> year, 1859.</p>
<p>He has received:</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>From Income of Investments</th> <th>1,291.16<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>" [From] Sales of Lots</td> <td>25,675.79</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [From] Expenses for Deeds</td> <td>144.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [From] <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Jonathan Mann</a>, Superintendent</td> <td>538.44</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [From] Stock in <a href='/pages/subjects/58788' title='Boston &amp; Lowell Railroad'>Boston &amp; Lowell railroad</a> 2 shares ^<sup>sold</sup></td> <td>937.50</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [From]  " [Stock] " [in] <a href='/pages/subjects/58908' title='Boston &amp; Providence Railroad'>Boston &amp; Prov Railroad</a> 20" [shares] sold</td> <td>1.910.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [From] Sundry parties for Labor &amp;c. at the Cemetery</td> <td>2.487.98</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [From]  " [Sundry] " [parties] " [for] Tombs</td> <td>3.650.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [From] <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass Horticultural Society</a> for balance <a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>Stone farm</a></td> <td>6.129.15</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [From]  <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>" [Mass] " [Horticultural]  " [Society</a> ] for Interest on same</td> <td><u>367.75</u></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>$43.131.77</td> </tr> </tbody> </table></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134506">
<h3><a name="page-1134506">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 114)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>114</p>
<p>He has paid as follows:</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>To sundry parties, for expenses</th> <th>9.848.70<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>" [To] <a href='/pages/subjects/62098' title='Stone, William A.'>W A Stone</a>, for note for <a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>Stone Farm</a></td> <td>3.833.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [To] Notes Receivable, secured by mortgage, with Int. accrued</td> <td>5.056.75</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [To] <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Jonathan Mann</a> Superintendent</td> <td>2.267.16</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [To] <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J Coolidge</a> Secretary</td> <td>458.58</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [To] <a href='/pages/subjects/64235' title='Massachusetts Hospital Life Insurance Company'>Mass Hospital Life Ins Co for Permanent Fund</a></td> <td>5.041.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [To]<a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a> Treasurer for  2½% on  26.059.79</td> <td>651.49</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [To] <a href='/pages/subjects/73377' title='Francis, A., Mr.'>A Francis</a>, refunded amt overpaid by him</td> <td>37.67</td> </tr> <tr><td>There was due the Treasurer, <date when='1858-12-31'>Dec 31, 1858</date></td> <td>65.14</td> </tr> <tr><td>There now remains in his hands</td> <td><u>9.707.33</u></td> </tr> <tr><td><date when='1858-12-31'>Dec 31<sup>st</sup> 1859</date>  <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a>, Treasurer</td> <td>$43,131.77</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> ----------------</p>
<p>This certifies that we have examined the <span class='line-break'> </span>books and accounts of the Treasurer of Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn, for the year ending <date when='1859-12-31'>Dec 31, 1859</date>,<span class='line-break'> </span>and have found them correctly kept and <span class='line-break'> </span>properly balanced, with satisfactory vouchers for <span class='line-break'> </span>all payments charged.</p>
<p>The Certificates of Stock, and other evidences of <span class='line-break'> </span>property, were found in accordance with the <span class='line-break'> </span>statements in his accounts.</p>
<p>In the Fund for Repairs there appears<span class='line-break'> </span>to be due him nine hundred and sixty nine 76/100<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars; and there is due from him on the <span class='line-break'> </span>General Accounts of the Corporation, ninety<span class='line-break'> </span>seven hundred and seven 33/100 dollars.</p>

<div id="page-1134509">
<h3><a name="page-1134509">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 117)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>117</p>
<p><b>Trustees _ 1860-1.</b></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Feby. 13. 1860'>Trustees _ <date when='1860-02-13'>Feby. 13. 1860</date></span></p>
<p>The first meeting of the Trustees of Mount Auburn, <span class='line-break'> </span>for organization and business, was held at the usual <span class='line-break'> </span>place (the office of the Secretary No 39 Court Street)<span class='line-break'> </span>after due notice on <date when='1860-02-13T10:00:00'>Monday, February 13<sup>th</sup> 1860, at 10 o'clock.<span class='line-break'> </span>a.m.</date> ~</p>
<p>There were present, Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>, and at a subsequent <span class='line-break'> </span>stage of the meeting, Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> _  9 _ <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>occupied the chair.</p>
<p>The record of the last ^<sup>monthly</sup> meeting of the Trustees, and <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Annual meeting of the Proprietors was read.</p>
<p>The Board then proceeded to ballot for <span class='line-break'> </span>officers &amp; committees required to be chosen by ballot,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the following were chosen. ~</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Officers and Committees'>Officers and Committees</span></p>

<div id="page-1134510">
<h3><a name="page-1134510">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 118)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>118</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Messrs</th> <th>{<a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a></th> <th>Com. on Regulations &amp; Rec of Intern.<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{<a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a></td> <td>___ </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent &amp; Gate Keeper chosen _'>Superintendent &amp; Gate Keeper chosen _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Jonathan Mann</a> was chosen Superintendent.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Mr Cheever</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52579' title='Safford, Truman H.'>Truman H. Safford</a> was chosen Gate-Keeper &amp; Superintendnts ^<sup>clerk</sup></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gardener chosen.'>Gardener chosen.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/66870' title='Apple, Anthony'>Antone Apple</a> was chosen Gardener _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salaries &amp; Compensation'>Salaries &amp; Compensation</span></p>
<p>Voted that the compensation of the Treasurer, <span class='line-break'> </span>the salary of the secretary, also that of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent be the same as heretofore.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Mr Cheever</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the salary of the Gate-Keeper and <span class='line-break'> </span>superintendent's clerk be six hundred dollars per <span class='line-break'> </span>annum, instead of five hundred; as heretofore.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Committee to inquire into expediency of erecting Iron Fence - Removing Stockade Fence &amp; Introducing Fountains'>Committee to inquire into expediency of erecting <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->Iron Fence</a> - Removing Stockade Fence &amp; Introducing Fountains</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>be a Committee to inquire into the expediency <span class='line-break'> </span>of erecting an <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->Iron Fence</a> upon the front side <span class='line-break'> </span>of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>Stone Farm</a>;</p>
<p>Also of removing the Stockade Fence: _</p>
<p>Also of introducing fountains into the Cemetery.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee to import Flowering Shrubs &amp; Plants'>Com<sup>ee</sup> to import Flowering Shrubs &amp; Plants</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> be a com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee to import, during the present year, <span class='line-break'> </span>flowering shrubs and plants, at a cost not</p>
</div>
</div>

<div id="page-1134511">
<h3><a name="page-1134511">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 119)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>119</p>
<p>exceeding two hundred and fifty dollars ($250.).</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gratuitous  care of  Lots to a certain extent referred to Comee on Lots'>Gratuitous  care of  Lots to a certain extent referred to Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots</span></p>
<p>Voted that the request made by the Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>at the annual meeting "that the Trustees would cause <span class='line-break'> </span>the grass in the several lots of the Cemetery to be <span class='line-break'> </span>mowed at suitable times, at the expense of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation", be referred to the committee on Lots <span class='line-break'> </span>to consider and report thereon.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned<span class='line-break'> </span>attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J Coolidge</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
<p>-------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oath of Secretary _'>Oath of Secretary _</span></p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts <span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk s.s. <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1860-02-20'>February 20. 1860</date></p>
<p>Thre personally appeared <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J Coolidge</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>and made oath that he would faithfully <span class='line-break'> </span>perform the duties of the Secretary of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn.<span class='line-break'> </span>for the ensuing year.<span class='line-break'> </span>before me: _  <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Justice of the Peace</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134512">
<h3><a name="page-1134512">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 120)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>120</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees March 5th 1860.'>Trustees <date when='1860-03-05'>March 5<sup>th</sup> 1860</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular meeting of the  Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held at the usual place on <date when='1850-03-05T10:00:00'>Monday <span class='line-break'> </span>March 5<sup>th</sup> 1860 at 10 o'clock a.m. </date></p>
<p>There were present, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>and Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>. = 8</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee report'>Com<sup>ee</sup> report</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> for the Special Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>appointed at the last meeting to inquire into<span class='line-break'> </span>the expediency of creating an <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->iron fence</a><span class='line-break'> </span>upon the front side of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>Stone Farm</a>, of <span class='line-break'> </span>removing the Stockade fence and intro<span class='line-break'></span>ducing fountains into the Cemetery, <span class='line-break'> </span>submitted a report in writing of which <span class='line-break'> </span>the following is a copy _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Inexpedient to erect an Iron Fence'>Inexpedient to erect an <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->Iron Fence</a></span></p>
<p>That it is inexpedient to <span class='line-break'> </span>erect, at present, an <a href='/pages/subjects/54812' title='Perimeter Fence'><!--Perimeter-->iron fence</a> about <span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>Stone farm</a> _ or to remove the Stockade<span class='line-break'> </span>fence. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Expedient to construct Fountains with Reservoirs, &amp;c'>Expedient to construct Fountains with Reservoirs, &amp;c</span></p>
<p>That it is expedient to construct <span class='line-break'> </span>one or more fountains in proper parts of <span class='line-break'> </span>the cemetery, with jets of water raised <span class='line-break'> </span>by steam power _ For which object they <span class='line-break'> </span>recommend the following votes.</p>
<p>That the committee be<span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to expend a sum not exceeding <span class='line-break'> </span>one thousand dollars in the construction <span class='line-break'> </span>of suitable cisterns or reservoirs to contain</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134513">
<h3><a name="page-1134513">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 121)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>121</p>
<p>the water necessary for said fountains,.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Steam Engine _ for raising water _'>Steam Engine _ for raising water _</span></p>
<p>That the same Committee be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to expend a sum not exceeding four thousand <span class='line-break'> </span>dollars for a steam engine, pipes and other <span class='line-break'> </span>appurtenances necessary &amp; proper for the con<span class='line-break'></span>struction of one or more fountains as afore<span class='line-break'></span>said provided that the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Massachusetts Horticul<span class='line-break'></span>tural Society</a> shall agree to pay one fourth <span class='line-break'> </span>part of the expense of said fountains <span class='line-break'> </span>and their appurtenances not exceeding <span class='line-break'> </span>_______ dollars."</p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that so much of the report <span class='line-break'> </span>as relates to the erection of an iron <span class='line-break'> </span>fence be accepted. _</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that when this meeting adjourn,<span class='line-break'> </span>it be to Monday next at 10 o'clock a.m.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Vote to visit Mount Auburn _'>Vote to visit Mount Auburn _</span></p>
<p>Also upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the secretary</a> notify the members <span class='line-break'> </span>of this board that they are requested to visit<span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn tomorrow (Sunday, if fair,<span class='line-break'> </span>if not on Thursday or Friday of this week,<span class='line-break'> </span>at 4 o'clock P.M. to examine the Grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>with reference to the proposed introduction <span class='line-break'> </span>of water, and that carriages be provided.</p>
<p>It was moved by <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a> and sec-</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees - Adjd Meeting Mar. 12. 1860.'>Trustees - Adj<sup>d</sup> Meeting <date when='1860-03-12'>Mar. 12. 1860</date>.</span></p>
<p>An adjourned meeting of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held at the usual place on <date when='1860-03-12T10:00:00'>Monday<span class='line-break'> </span>March 12<sup>th</sup> 1860, at 10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>,  <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>, &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>. = 9</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Reservoirs and Fountains _ Report on'>Reservoirs and Fountains _ Report on</span></p>
<p>The motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a> for the <span class='line-break'> </span>adoption of the report made at the last <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting recommending the construction <span class='line-break'> </span>of reservoirs and fountains came up <span class='line-break'> </span>for consideration. _</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134521">
<h3><a name="page-1134521">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 129)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>129</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Mr Tobey</a></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='referred back to Comee with instructions _'>referred back to Com<sup>ee</sup> with instructions _</span></p>
<p>Voted that the subject <span class='line-break'> </span>be referred back to the same committee, <span class='line-break'> </span>with instructions to employ one or more <span class='line-break'> </span>competent engineers, to furnish specifications <span class='line-break'> </span>of the whole work, and to obtain estimates<span class='line-break'> </span>thereon, and report the same to this <span class='line-break'> </span>board, at a meeting to be called by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Conference with Hort. Soc. as to apportion % of Expense of Fountains, &amp;c'>Conference with <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Hort. Soc.</a> as to apportion % of Expense of Fountains, &amp;c</span></p>
<p>Upon Motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a> _</p>
<p>Voted that the committee be <span class='line-break'> </span>empowered to confer with the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticul<span class='line-break'></span>tural Society</a> with a view to obtain their <span class='line-break'> </span>cooperation in the construction of <span class='line-break'> </span>fountains &amp;c. in the Cemetery.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots 1435 &amp; 1436 _ Perpetual Repair of _'><a href='/pages/subjects/74774' title='Lot 1435'>Lots 1435</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/70974' title='Lot 1436'><!--lot-->1436</a> _ Perpetual Repair of _</span></p>
<p>The Committee on Lots reported<span class='line-break'> </span>that they had contracted, subject to the <span class='line-break'> </span>ratification of this board, for the per<span class='line-break'></span>-petual care of <a href='/pages/subjects/74774' title='Lot 1435'>lots 1435</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/70974' title='Lot 1436'><!--lot-->1436</a> owned by <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/74775' title='Bigelow, Thaddeus B.'>Thaddeus B. Bigelow</a>, and the heirs of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54771' title='Bangs, Isaiah'>Isaiah Bangs</a>, for the sum of $300. ~ each.</p>
<p>Voted that said contract be <span class='line-break'> </span>hereby confirmed.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned<span class='line-break'> </span>to the call of the Committee as above stated.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134522">
<h3><a name="page-1134522">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 130)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>130</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ April 2. 1860.'>Trustees _ <date when='1860-04-02'>April 2. 1860</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular meeting of the Trustees, the same <span class='line-break'> </span>being an adjourned meeting, was held at the <span class='line-break'> </span>usual place on <date when='1860-04-02T10:00:00'>Monday April 2<sup>nd</sup> 1860, at<span class='line-break'> </span>10 o'clock a.m. </date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>and Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>. _</p>
<p>The Record of the last meeting was read</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Commee on Reservoirs &amp; Fountains.'>Report of Comm<sup>ee</sup> on Reservoirs &amp; Fountains.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> for the Committee on the<span class='line-break'> </span>introduction of fountains submitted a <span class='line-break'> </span>report of which the following is a copy.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1860-04-02'>April 2<sup>nd</sup> 1860</date>.</p>
<p>The Committee on the subject of Fountains <span class='line-break'> </span>in Mount Auburn beg leave to report.</p>
<p>That in pursuance of the instructions <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees they have employed two <span class='line-break'> </span>competent engineers to visit and survey <span class='line-break'> </span>the premises separately and to furnish <span class='line-break'> </span>estimates of the cost of the proposed works.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/74776' title='Parker, William'>Mr William Parker</a> estimates the <span class='line-break'> </span>expense of the whole work, including the <span class='line-break'> </span>well, engine house steam engine, and <span class='line-break'> </span>pump, pipes, brick reservoir at the summit<span class='line-break'> </span>and all necessary appendages, together with <span class='line-break'> </span>one fountain on <a href='/pages/subjects/57593' title='Auburn Lake'>Auburn Lake</a> at $5275. ~</p>
<p>If additional fountains are made in <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/57671' title='Forest Pond'>Forest pond</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/58209' title='Asa Gray Garden'>the Lawn</a>, the total <span class='line-break'> </span>expense without superintendence will be <span class='line-break'> </span>$6,976. ~  <a href='/pages/subjects/74777' title='Slade, James'>Mr James Slade</a> estimated the</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134523">
<h3><a name="page-1134523">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 131)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>131</p>
<p>same work with some variations in the details <span class='line-break'> </span>of size, place and materials, at $5,985. ~ for <span class='line-break'> </span>five jets in different ponds.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Votes recommended on Reservoirs and Fountains.'>Votes recommended on Reservoirs and Fountains.</span></p>
<p>The Committee also proposed the following <span class='line-break'> </span>votes, after amendments offered by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span>which were accepted. viz:</p>
<p>+  Voted = That the committee on Fountains <span class='line-break'> </span>be authorized to construct one or more <span class='line-break'> </span>fountain-jets at Mount Auburn at an <span class='line-break'> </span>expense not exceeding seven thousand <span class='line-break'> </span>dollars, provided the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>shall agree to contribute one quarter part <span class='line-break'> </span>of that sum.</p>
<p>+  Voted _ That the same committee <span class='line-break'> </span>be farther authorized to expend one thousand<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars of the above named sum without <span class='line-break'> </span>delay, if they shall think it expedient <span class='line-break'> </span>so to do.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report  &amp;c. adopted _'>Report  &amp;c. adopted _</span></p>
<p>+  Voted that the Committee be instructed <span class='line-break'> </span>to employ a suitable engineer to superintend<span class='line-break'> </span>the execution of the said work.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> desired the yeas <span class='line-break'> </span>and nays upon the foregoing votes, which <span class='line-break'> </span>were taken, and it appeared that the <span class='line-break'> </span>orders were unanimously adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on Grounds to superintend the'>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Grounds to superintend the</span></p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a> _</p>
<p>+  Voted that the Committee on Grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>have full power to contract with some <span class='line-break'> </span>competent surveyors for the topographical <span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134524">
<h3><a name="page-1134524">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 132)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>132</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Survey _'>Survey _</span></p>
<p>survey of the Cemetery, under the vote <span class='line-break'> </span>of <date when='1859-11-07'>Nov 7<sup>th</sup></date> and that they have charge of <span class='line-break'> </span>the execution of the same. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 2550 _ Perpetual Repair of'><a href='/pages/subjects/74843' title='Lot 2550'>Lot 2550</a> _ Perpetual Repair of</span></p>
<p>The committee on Lots reported <span class='line-break'> </span>that they had contracted, subject to the <span class='line-break'> </span>ratification of this board, for the perpetual <span class='line-break'> </span>care of <a href='/pages/subjects/74843' title='Lot 2550'>lot numbered 2550</a>, containing one <span class='line-break'> </span>hundred feet owned by <a href='/pages/subjects/74844' title='Burrows, Benjamin'>Benjamin Burrows</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>for the sum of one hundred dollars.</p>
<p>Voted that said contract be <span class='line-break'> </span>hereby confirmed.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned.</p>
<p>Attest, <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary</p>
<p>--------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees May 7. 1860'>Trustees <date when='1860-05-07'>May 7. 1860</date></span></p>
<p>The regular meeting of the Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held at the usual place, on <date when='1860-05-07T10:00:00'>Monday, May <span class='line-break'> </span>7<sup>th</sup> 1860, at 10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chairman pro tempore _'>Chairman pro tempore _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> being absent, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span>was called to the chair. _</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was <span class='line-break'> </span>read and approved.</p>
<p>The following vote was offered by <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> and passed.  viz: _</p>
<p>Whereas the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass. Horticultural Society</a> by</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134525">
<h3><a name="page-1134525">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 133)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>133</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fountains &amp;c. Conditional appropriation made absolute _'>Fountains &amp;c. Conditional appropriation made absolute _</span></p>
<p>their vote of <date when='1860-04-07'>April 7<sup>th</sup> 1860</date> have appropriated <span class='line-break'> </span>a sum not exceeding $1500. ~ towards the expense<span class='line-break'> </span>of constructing fountains in Mount Auburn: _</p>
<p>Voted that the proviso annexed to the <span class='line-break'> </span>order of this Board passed <date when='1860-04-02'>april 2<sup>nd</sup> 1860</date> be <span class='line-break'> </span>rescinded.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chapel _ repairs of'><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> _ repairs of</span></p>
<p>+ Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> be a committee <span class='line-break'> </span>to cause the walls of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->chapel</a> to be <span class='line-break'> </span>cleansed from marks of lime wash,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the joints to be pointed up as far <span class='line-break'> </span>as necessary, also to repair the plastering <span class='line-break'> </span>inside where it is defaced.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 439 contract for  Perpetual repair of ratified _'><a href='/pages/subjects/74845' title='Lot 439'>Lot 439</a> contract for  Perpetual repair of ratified _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> of the committee on Lots, <span class='line-break'> </span>reported that the committee had made <span class='line-break'> </span>a contract for the perpetual repair <span class='line-break'> </span>of the lot of <a href='/pages/subjects/58355' title='Shaw, Charles B.'>Charles B Shaw</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/74845' title='Lot 439'>numbered <span class='line-break'> </span>439</a>, for the sum of three hundred dollars.</p>
<p>Voted that said contract be hereby<span class='line-break'> </span>confirmed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Flowering Shrubs _ appropriation for _'>Flowering Shrubs _ appropriation for _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> reported for the committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on introduction of flowering shrubs, that, on <span class='line-break'> </span>account of having the quantity ordered by <span class='line-break'> </span>the committee under the appropriation of <date when='1860-02-13'>February 13<sup>th</sup></date>,<span class='line-break'> </span>transported by steamer, the cost had somewhat <span class='line-break'> </span>exceeded the amount of the appropriation,<span class='line-break'> </span>which the committee had authorized<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> to defray. <span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>

<p>----------------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees June 4. 1860.'>Trustees <date when='1860-06-04'>June 4. 1860</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees was held on <date when='1860-06-04T10:00:00'>Monday June <span class='line-break'> </span>4<sup>th</sup> 1860 at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> at the usual <span class='line-break'> </span>place.</p>
<p>There were present, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Catalogue'>Catalogue</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> reported that <span class='line-break'> </span>the preparation and printing of 3000<span class='line-break'> </span>copies of the catalogue had been com<span class='line-break'></span>pleted and would be ready for pro<span class='line-break'></span>prietors this week.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134530">
<h3><a name="page-1134530">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 138)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>138</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Extra Compensation to Secretary for preparing Catolgue &amp;c _ '>Extra Compensation to Secretary for preparing Catolgue &amp;c _ </span></p>
<p>Voted the Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a><span class='line-break'> </span>be a committee to consider whether<span class='line-break'> </span>any and what sum should be allowed<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> for extraordinary services in<span class='line-break'> </span>connections with the preparation and<span class='line-break'> </span>publication of the new catalogue,<span class='line-break'> </span>with full power.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Compensation for Dupl. Register of Interments &amp; Index _'>Compensation for Dupl. Register of Interments &amp; Index _</span></p>
<p>Voted that the committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Regulations and Records of Interments<span class='line-break'> </span>be authorized to approve the payment<span class='line-break'> </span>of such sum as they may consider proper<span class='line-break'> </span>for correcting the Register of Interments,<span class='line-break'> </span>and making the duplicate Register and<span class='line-break'> </span>Index.</p>
<p>Voted that the question of<span class='line-break'> </span>building two new tombs in <a href='/pages/subjects/59983' title='Hazel Dell'>Hazel Dell</a><span class='line-break'> </span>be referred to the Committee on Grounds</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned.<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest  <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> Secretary</p>
<p>--------------------------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ July 2,1860.'>Trustees _ <date when='1860-07-02'>July 2,1860</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held on <date when='1860-07-02T10:00:00'>Monday, July 2, 1860 at 10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> and Messrs<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read<span class='line-break'> </span>and approved.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134531">
<h3><a name="page-1134531">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 139)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>139</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, the following<span class='line-break'> </span>vote was passed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Visit of Comee of Hort. Socy to Mt Auburn'>Visit of Com<sup>ee</sup> of <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Hort. Soc<sup>y</sup></a> to Mt Auburn</span></p>
<p>Whereas the Garden Committee of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Massa<span class='line-break'></span>chusetts Horticultural Society</a> have proposed to <span class='line-break'> </span>visit Mount Auburn on or about the <date when='1860-07-12'>12<sup>th</sup> day<span class='line-break'> </span>of July.</date></p>
<p>Voted that the Committee upon Grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>be requested to meet them, and show them such<span class='line-break'> </span>attentions as the occasion shall suggest.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chapel, floor of'><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>, floor of</span></p>
<p>+ Upon motion also by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>.</p>
<p>Voted that  <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> and <span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs  { <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a> and <span class='line-break'> </span>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a></p>
<p>be a committee to expend one thousand <span class='line-break'> </span>dollars, if necessary, in causing the floor of the<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> to be laid with encaustic tiles, and<span class='line-break'> </span>that the work shall be done in such manner<span class='line-break'> </span>as they shall deem expedient.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Additional Appropriation for Reservoirs &amp; Fountains _'>Additional Appropriation for Reservoirs &amp; Fountains _</span></p>
<p>+ The Committee upon Reservoirs and Fountains<span class='line-break'> </span>reported progress.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>.</p>
<p>Voted that one thousand dollars be appropri<span class='line-break'></span>ated in addtion to the appropriation of seven thou<span class='line-break'></span>sand dollars of <date when='1860-04-02'>April 2<sup>d</sup> last</date> for the construc<span class='line-break'></span>tion of one or more fountain jets at Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134532">
<h3><a name="page-1134532">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 140)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>140</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tax on Stone Farm _ refusal to pay.'>Tax on <a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>Stone Farm</a> _ refusal to pay.</span></p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, the following<span class='line-break'> </span>preamble and vote were adopted _</p>
<p>Whereas the <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>town of Watertown</a> has <span class='line-break'> </span>demanded payment of taxes for the year<span class='line-break'> </span>1859 upon that part of the Cemetery called<span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>Stone Farm</a>, which was annexed to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery proper by a vote of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1858-12-20'>December 20, 1858</date> of which vote the said town<span class='line-break'> </span>then had due notice.</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> be directed again to<span class='line-break'> </span>notify them that this Corporation denies any <span class='line-break'> </span>liability for taxes upon said estate, and that<span class='line-break'> </span>it will resist in a lawful way any such<span class='line-break'> </span>claim.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>------------------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Aug. 6, 1860'>Trustees <date when='1860-08-06'>Aug. 6, 1860</date></span></p>
<p>At the hour appointed for the regular meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees of Mount Auburn on <date when='1860-08-06T10:00:00'>Monday,<span class='line-break'> </span>August 6, 1860, at 10 o'clock am</date>,, there were <span class='line-break'> </span>present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> and Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='No Quorum'>No Quorum</span></p>
<p>No quorum being present, the meeting was <span class='line-break'> </span>adjourned to the next regular meeting.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134533">

<div class="page-content">
<p>141</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Septr 3. 1860 _'>Trustees <date when='1860-09-03'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 3. 1860</date> _</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held on <date when='1860-09-03T10:00:00'>Monday September 3<sup>rd</sup> 1860,<span class='line-break'> </span>at 10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a></p>
<p>The record of the July meeting was<span class='line-break'> </span>read and approved.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> presented petitions for the<span class='line-break'> </span>designation of persons to represent lots as<span class='line-break'> </span>follows; and they were severally appointed.</p>

Cranston</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/54459' title='Newport, RI'>Newport R.I.</a> guardian<span class='line-break'> </span>of the only child ^<sup>of</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/79320' title='Derby, Richard C.'>Richard C. Derby</a>, late<span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/79318' title='Lot 52'>lot numbered 52</a>, to represent that lot.</p>

Thayer</a>, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/79321' title='Lot 289'>lot num<span class='line-break'></span>bered 289</a>, to represent that lot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 293'><a href='/pages/subjects/79324' title='Lot 293'>Lot 293</a></span></p>

Mandell</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/54347' title='Roxbury, MA'>Roxbury</a>, one of the<span class='line-break'> </span>next of kin of <a href='/pages/subjects/79326' title='Utley, Mary S.'>Mary S. Utley</a>, late propri<span class='line-break'> </span>etor of <a href='/pages/subjects/79324' title='Lot 293'>lot numbered 293</a>, to represent that lot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 331'><a href='/pages/subjects/66001' title='Lot 331'>Lot 331</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58394' title='Howard, Abraham'>Abraham Howard</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, (at present in<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/79327' title='China'>China</a>) eldest son of <a href='/pages/subjects/58394' title='Howard, Abraham'>Abraham Howard</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/66001' title='Lot 331'>lot numbered 331</a>, to rep<span class='line-break'></span>resent that lot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 876'><a href='/pages/subjects/79328' title='Lot 876'>Lot 876</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/79329' title='Washburn, Dolly B.'>Dolly B. Washburn</a> ^<sup>of <a href='/pages/subjects/79330' title='North Bridgewater, MA'>North Bridgewater</a></sup>, widow of <a href='/pages/subjects/79331' title='Washburn, Henry'>Henry Washburn</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/79328' title='Lot 876'>lot numbered 876</a> to represent that lot.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134534">
<h3><a name="page-1134534">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 142)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>142</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 995'><a href='/pages/subjects/79332' title='Lot 995'>Lot 995</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/73757' title='Willard, Abel'>Abel Willard</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a>, brother<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/79333' title='Willard, Lyman'>Lyman Willard</a> late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/79332' title='Lot 995'>lot<span class='line-break'> </span>numbered 995</a>, to represent said lot.</p>

Stone</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a>, only child <span class='line-break'> </span>who has attained majority of <a href='/pages/subjects/79336' title='Stone, Isaac'>Isaac Stone</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/79334' title='Lot 1348'>lot numbered 1348</a>, to rep<span class='line-break'></span>-resent that lot.</p>

Balfour</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/54284' title='Charlestown, MA'>Charlestown</a>, brother <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/79339' title='Balfour, Charles D.'>Charles D. Balfour</a> late proprietor <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/79337' title='Lot 1554'>lot numbered 1554</a>, to represent that lot.</p>

Walton</a> late proprietor of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/79340' title='Lot 1602'>lot numbered 1602</a>, to represent said lot</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 1806'><a href='/pages/subjects/60415' title='Lot 1806'>Lot 1806</a></span></p>

Larkin</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/60415' title='Lot 1806'>lot numbered 1806</a>, to <span class='line-break'> </span>represent that lot.</p>

Clapp</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, eldest <span class='line-break'> </span>son of <a href='/pages/subjects/79346' title='Clapp, Joshua B.'>Joshua B Clapp</a> late proprietor <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/79344' title='Lot 2635'>lot numbered 2635</a>, to represent that lot.</p>
