</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134535">
<h3><a name="page-1134535">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 143)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>143</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='P. Kennedy&apos;s Memorial _'><a href='/pages/subjects/79353' title='Kennedy, Patrick'>P. Kennedy's</a> Memorial _</span></p>
<p>A written statement by <a href='/pages/subjects/79353' title='Kennedy, Patrick'>Patrick Kennedy</a><span class='line-break'> </span>late a workman in the cemetery, representing <span class='line-break'> </span>that he saw another workman, <a href='/pages/subjects/79354' title='Barrington, Thomas'>Thomas <span class='line-break'> </span>Barrington</a> remove trees from the cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>in violation of the regulations, and that <span class='line-break'> </span>for giving such information he had been <span class='line-break'> </span>discharged was read and referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Grounds.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Perpetual Repair of Lots _'>Perpetual Repair of Lots _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, chairman of the committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots, stated that the Corporation had <span class='line-break'> </span>no means of knowing the extent of its <span class='line-break'> </span>liability under the contract for perpetual <span class='line-break'> </span>repair of any lot in case of enlargement,<span class='line-break'> </span>or of erections thereupon, after the making <span class='line-break'> </span>of such contract; and for future security <span class='line-break'> </span>would offer the following orders, which <span class='line-break'> </span>had been agreed to by the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots _ Those were read and adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Record of Condition of such lots to be kept.'>Record of Condition of such lots to be kept.</span></p>
<p>It is recommended by the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Lots, that hereafter a record shall be <span class='line-break'> </span>kept of the condition of all lots which <span class='line-break'> </span>this Corporation may contract to keep <span class='line-break'> </span>in perpetual repair and preservation,<span class='line-break'> </span>in which shall be sufficiently described <span class='line-break'> </span>the fences, trees, shrubbery, plants, tombs, <span class='line-break'> </span>monuments, head-stones, tablets or other <span class='line-break'> </span>memorials, which are or may be in and <span class='line-break'> </span>upon said lots at the time when such</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134536">
<h3><a name="page-1134536">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 144)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>144</p>
<p>contracts shall be made or begin to run</p>
<p>It is further recommended that <span class='line-break'> </span>such record shall be made of the <span class='line-break'> </span>condition in which all lots which this <span class='line-break'> </span>corportion has <u>heretofore</u> contracted to <span class='line-break'> </span>keep in perpetual repair were, at the time <span class='line-break'> </span>when such obligations commenced, <span class='line-break'> </span>so far as the same can now be <span class='line-break'> </span>asceratained; and where the same cannot <span class='line-break'> </span>be ascertained with certainty, that the <span class='line-break'> </span>present condition shall be deemed the <span class='line-break'> </span>one which limits such obligation or contract.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Office for the Corporation'>Office for the Corporation</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> read a paper repre<span class='line-break'></span>senting that the increase of the business <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery necessary to be transacted <span class='line-break'> </span>at the office of the Secretary made it <span class='line-break'> </span>inconvenient to the Messrs Loring to accom<span class='line-break'></span>modate him longer in the present location<span class='line-break'> </span>that his salary was insufficient to enable <span class='line-break'> </span>him to hire such a room or rooms as <span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation ought to have, and inquiring <span class='line-break'> </span>whether the Trustees desire him, in his <span class='line-break'> </span>removal, to have regard to the wants of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation.</p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> be a committee <span class='line-break'> </span>to inquire where &amp; upon what terms a suitable office<span class='line-break'> </span>for the Corporation can be obtained, and</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134537">
<h3><a name="page-1134537">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 145)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>145</p>
<p>report thereon at a meeting to be called for <span class='line-break'> </span>that purpose, if deemed expedient, before <span class='line-break'> </span>the next regular meeting.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>,, Secretary.</p>
<p>---------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Octr. 1. 1860.'>Trustees <date when='1860-10-01'>Oct<sup>r</sup>. 1. 1860</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees was held <date when='1860-10-01T10:00:00'>Monday October 1<sup>st</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>1860 at 10 o'clock a.m. </date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the Presi<span class='line-break'></span>dent</a>, Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, ^<sup><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a></sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Office for Corporation'>Office for Corporation</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Mr Cheever</a> of the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>to inquire when and upon what terms <span class='line-break'> </span>a suitable office for the Corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>could be procured, reported that <span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee had examined several <span class='line-break'> </span>places – at 30 Court Street, at 31 and 36<span class='line-break'> </span>Washington Street, and different rooms <span class='line-break'> </span>in Niles Block, but that they had <span class='line-break'> </span>not fixed upon any one, although<span class='line-break'> </span>they gave a preference to Niles Block.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted, That a committee of three <span class='line-break'> </span>be appointed by the chair, with <span class='line-break'> </span>full power, to make such arrange<span class='line-break'></span>ments for rooms and such division</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134538">
<h3><a name="page-1134538">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 146)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>146</p>
<p>of the expense with the Sec'y if <span class='line-break'> </span>any, as they may deem proper.</p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a> were <span class='line-break'> </span>appointed as such a Committee.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Public Grounds of Cemetery _'>Public Grounds of Cemetery _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the Committee on Grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>be instructed to inquire whether <span class='line-break'> </span>any measures are expedient for <span class='line-break'> </span>keeping open permanently the spaces <span class='line-break'> </span>about the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->Gate</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'>Chapel</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>Tower</a> &amp;c,<span class='line-break'> </span>and to report to this Board.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> Secretary</p>
<p>------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Nov. 5. 1860.'>Trustees <date when='1860-11-05'>Nov. 5. 1860</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees, was held <date when='1860-11-05T10:00:00'>Monday Nov. <span class='line-break'> </span>5. 1860, at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> at the <span class='line-break'> </span>office of the Secretary, No 33 School St.</p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>was read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Public Grounds of the Cemetery,'>Public Grounds of the Cemetery,</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> for the committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Grounds, to whom was referred at <span class='line-break'> </span>the last meeting the inquiry whether <span class='line-break'> </span>any measures are expedient for keeping <span class='line-break'> </span>open permanently the Spaces about <span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->Gate</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'>Chapel</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>Tower</a> &amp;c, submitted<span class='line-break'> </span>a report, recommending the reservation</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134539">
<h3><a name="page-1134539">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 147)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>147</p>
<p>of certain lands therein described as pub<span class='line-break'></span>lic grounds of the Cemetery, and the <span class='line-break'> </span>appropriation of a certain sum for enclosing <span class='line-break'> </span>the space in front of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->chapel</a>.</p>
<p>After discussion, upon motion of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Mr Tobey</a>, it was</p>
<p>Voted – that the report be recom<span class='line-break'></span>mitted with instructions to make such <span class='line-break'> </span>modifications therein as the Com<sup>ee</sup> shall deem <span class='line-break'> </span>expedient after listening to the views ex<span class='line-break'></span>pressed at this meeting, and submit <span class='line-break'> </span>the same if they see fit at the <span class='line-break'> </span>next meeting of the board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Area in front of Chapel.'><a href='/pages/subjects/61306' title='Bigelow Chapel Lawn'>Area in front of Chapel</a>.</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>,</p>
<p>+ Voted _ that the space in front of <span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->chapel</a>, bounded by <a href='/pages/subjects/61148' title='Chapel Avenue'>Chapel <!--Ave--></a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59585' title='Pine Avenue'>Pine<!--Ave--></a><span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/59584' title='Cypress Avenue'>Cypress Avenues</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/61254' title='Peony Path'>Peony Path</a>, and <span class='line-break'> </span>enclosing two trees planted there last <span class='line-break'> </span>month by <a href='/pages/subjects/79963' title='Prince of Wales Beech'>the Prince of Wales</a>, be enclosed<span class='line-break'> </span>or surrounded by an edge-stone of hammered <span class='line-break'> </span>granite, and that the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Grounds be authorized to cause this <span class='line-break'> </span>to be done at an expense not exceeding<span class='line-break'> </span>seven hundred and fifty ($750.~) dollars.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Office for Corporation.'>Office for Corporation.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> submitted a <span class='line-break'> </span>report of which the following is a copy:</p>
<p>"The committee to whom was ref<span class='line-break'></span>erred the matter of arranging with <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the<span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</a> for the use of rooms for <span class='line-break'> </span>the purposes of the Corporation, have</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134540">
<h3><a name="page-1134540">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 148)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>148</p>
<p>attended to that duty, and Report;</p>
<p>That after examination of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Rooms in Niles' Block, the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>unanimously decided to pay to <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Mr Cool<span class='line-break'></span>idge</a> one hundred and fifty-dollars<span class='line-break'> </span>per annum, in full for the use <span class='line-break'> </span>of his rooms so long as they shall <span class='line-break'> </span>be occupied by the Corporation.</p>
<p>For the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Cha's G. Nazro</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1860-11-05'>Nov 5<sup>th</sup> 1860</date>. Chairman"</p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted ^<sup>to accept the report: and further</sup> _ that this board authorize <span class='line-break'> </span>this payment of the sum of $43.63 for furniture<span class='line-break'> </span>purchased for the room occupied by <span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives appointed'>Representatives appointed</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> read the following <span class='line-break'> </span>petitions for representation of lots, and <span class='line-break'> </span>the persons therein named were sev<span class='line-break'></span>erally designated to represent lots as follows;</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 361'><a href='/pages/subjects/79964' title='Lot 361'>Lot 361</a></span></p>
<p>Lot of <a href='/pages/subjects/79965' title='Webster, John W.'>John W Webster</a>, deceased<span class='line-break'> </span>(361) Rep. by <a href='/pages/subjects/104069' title='Merrill, James C.'>James C. Merrill</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>legal attorney for the heirs.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot  225'><a href='/pages/subjects/79966' title='Lot 225'>Lot  225</a></span></p>
<p>Lot of <a href='/pages/subjects/79967' title='Pratt, J. Elliot'>J. Elliot Pratt</a>, deceased <span class='line-break'> </span>(225) Rep by <a href='/pages/subjects/79968' title='Hazelton, Martha E.'>Martha E. Hazelton</a> (formerly <span class='line-break'> </span>Pratt) of <a href='/pages/subjects/72701' title='West Newton, MA'>West Newton</a>, the youngest daughter <span class='line-break'> </span>of said deceased.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134541">
<h3><a name="page-1134541">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 149)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>149</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 829'><a href='/pages/subjects/79969' title='Lot 829'>Lot 829</a></span></p>
<p>Lot of <a href='/pages/subjects/79970' title='Cheney, Jonathan H.'>Jonathan H Cheney</a>, deceased <span class='line-break'> </span>(829) Rep. by <a href='/pages/subjects/79971' title='Cheney, Sarah A. B.'>Sarah A. B. Cheney</a> of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, widow of said deceased.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 2187'><a href='/pages/subjects/79972' title='Lot 2187'>Lot 2187</a></span></p>
<p>Lot of <a href='/pages/subjects/79973' title='Bellows, Mary W.'>Mary W. Bellows</a>, deceased <span class='line-break'> </span>(2187), Rep. by <a href='/pages/subjects/79974' title='Bellows, William W.'>William W. Bellows</a><span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, youngest child of deceased.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest.  <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> Secretary</p>
<p>------------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees December 3. 1860.'>Trustees <date when='1860-12-03'>December 3. 1860</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees was held at ^<sup>the</sup> office of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary on <date when='1860-12-03T10:00:00'>Monday December 3. 1860, at 10<span class='line-break'> </span>o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>and Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was <span class='line-break'> </span>read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Memorial of M. Tisdale'>Memorial of <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>M. Tisdale</a></span></p>
<p>A communication from <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mr. Mace <span class='line-break'> </span>Tisdale</a> requesting the Trustees of Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn to pass an order restricting in<span class='line-break'></span>terments in his lot, <a href='/pages/subjects/70103' title='Lot 1080'>No 1080</a>, beyond <span class='line-break'> </span>that of certain persons specified in <span class='line-break'> </span>the paper presented, was read, – and,<span class='line-break'> </span>upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>, was re<span class='line-break'></span>ferred to a special committee consisting <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>, to confer with <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mr Tisdale</a>.</p>
<p>A communication from <a href='/pages/subjects/66870' title='Apple, Anthony'>Anthony Apple</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134542">
<h3><a name="page-1134542">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 150)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>150</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resignation of A. Apple, Gardener-'>Resignation of <a href='/pages/subjects/66870' title='Apple, Anthony'>A. Apple</a>, Gardener-</span></p>
<p>resigning his place as Gardener, was read <span class='line-break'> </span>and referred to the Committee on Grounds.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Roof over vestibule at Gate.'>Roof over vestibule at <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->Gate</a>.</span></p>
<p>A communication was also received from <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->the Superintendent</a>, recommending that, <span class='line-break'> </span>as the awning which had been placed <span class='line-break'> </span>over the vestibule between the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>Gateway</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>Keeper's Lodge</a> was an insuffi<span class='line-break'></span>cient protection against sun and rain,<span class='line-break'> </span>something of a more substantial character <span class='line-break'> </span>be placed there _ was read and <span class='line-break'> </span>referred to <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Mr Cheever</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>to get estimates of the cost of a suitable <span class='line-break'> </span>roof, both of stone, and of wood, and <span class='line-break'> </span>report thereon.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned.<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
<p>--------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Jan:y 7, 1861.'>Trustees <date when='1861-01-07'>Jan:y 7, 1861</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees was held <date when='1861-01-07'>Monday Janu<span class='line-break'></span>ary 7, 1861. at 10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>. _</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Bill of Architect for plans of new Recg Tomb _'>Bill of Architect for plans of new <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Rec<sup>g</sup> Tomb</a> _</span></p>
<p>The President presented the bill of <a href='/pages/subjects/57479' title='Bryant, Gridley J. F.'>G. J. F. <span class='line-break'> </span>Bryant</a> amounting to $250. ~ for drawing <span class='line-break'> </span>plans &amp;c for <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Receiving Tomb</a>.</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> be author<span class='line-break'></span>ized to pay the same upon the approval</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134543">
<h3><a name="page-1134543">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 151)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>151</p>
<p>of the Committee on Grounds. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stone Roof over Vestibule at Gate _'>Stone Roof over Vestibule at <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->Gate</a> _</span></p>
<p>The President also from the special Com<s>mit</s>-<span class='line-break'> </span>mittee chosen at the last meeting to get <span class='line-break'> </span>estimates of the comparative cost of a wood<span class='line-break'></span>en roof and a stone roof for the vestibule, <span class='line-break'> </span>at the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>main entrance to Mt Auburn</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>reported that the former would cost <span class='line-break'> </span>about $450, and the later $1500. ~ or $1600. ~<span class='line-break'> </span>and he submitted the following as the <span class='line-break'> </span>recommendation of the Committee.</p>
<p>+ That the committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Grounds be authorized to contract with <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/80027' title='Whitcher, J. B.'>J. B. Whitcher</a> for two granite rooms <span class='line-break'> </span>adjoining the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>two lodges of Mt Auburn Gate</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>to be made mostly conformable to a <span class='line-break'> </span>wooden model exhibited at the last <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Trustees by <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> _<span class='line-break'> </span>and to pay for the same a sum not <span class='line-break'> </span>exceeding sixteen hundred dollars.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the recommendation of the Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee be adopted. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resignation of Gardener _'>Resignation of Gardener _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> as chairman of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Grounds in relation to the <span class='line-break'> </span>resignation of the Gardener, which was <span class='line-break'> </span>referred to them at the last meeting, <span class='line-break'> </span>submitted their report as follows. _</p>
<p>The Committee on Grounds, to <span class='line-break'> </span>whom was referred the resignation<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/66870' title='Apple, Anthony'>Mr Anthony Apple</a> as Gardener to</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134544">
<h3><a name="page-1134544">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 152)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>152</p>
<p>the corporation beg leave to report _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resignation of Gardener. (continued)'>Resignation of Gardener. (continued)</span></p>
<p>That, in 1858, a lease was execu<span class='line-break'></span>ted to <a href='/pages/subjects/66870' title='Apple, Anthony'>Mr Apple</a> of the  piece of ground <span class='line-break'> </span>now occupied by the garden, <a href='/pages/subjects/61312' title='Greenhouse'>greenhouse</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>and stone cutter's shop, for ten years at <span class='line-break'> </span>a rent of thirty dollars, the corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>having the right to resume the premises,<span class='line-break'> </span>at any time after three months notice,<span class='line-break'> </span>on paying the said <a href='/pages/subjects/66870' title='Apple, Anthony'><!--Anthony-->Apple</a> the estimated <span class='line-break'> </span>value of the improvements made by him <span class='line-break'> </span>thereon, not exceding the sum of $1500. ~</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/66870' title='Apple, Anthony'>Mr Apple</a> has been accustomed to <span class='line-break'> </span>employ in his operations certain workmen <span class='line-break'> </span>attached to the cemetery, and to pay for <span class='line-break'> </span>their labour a stipulated price.  But <span class='line-break'> </span>this year, owing to sickness and want of <span class='line-break'> </span>success, he has failed to pay his arrearage<span class='line-break'> </span>and is now in debt to the corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>about $1074. ~</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/66870' title='Apple, Anthony'>Mr Apple</a> has sent his resigna<span class='line-break'></span>tion to the Trustees and proposes to <span class='line-break'> </span>this committee to liquidate his debt by <span class='line-break'> </span>transferring to a new party his unexpired <span class='line-break'> </span>lease together with his fixtures, improve<span class='line-break'></span>ments, trees, plants, &amp;c. for a sum suf<span class='line-break'></span>ficient to indemnify this corporation.</p>
<p>The Committee find that competent <span class='line-break'> </span>persons stand ready to assume the lease <span class='line-break'> </span>and pay the debt of <a href='/pages/subjects/66870' title='Apple, Anthony'>Mr Apple</a> to <span class='line-break'> </span>the corporation, on being duly authorized<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134545">
<h3><a name="page-1134545">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 153)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>154</p>
<p>so to do by action of the Trustees.</p>
<p>The committee therefore recommended <span class='line-break'> </span>that the resignation of <a href='/pages/subjects/66870' title='Apple, Anthony'>Mr Apple</a> be accepted,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that the Trustees proceed to the choice <span class='line-break'> </span>of a Gardener.</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a></th> <th>}   Com<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Edward S.Rand</a></td> <td>}</td> </tr> <tr><td>(signed)</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>James Cheever</a></td> <td>}  on</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a></td> <td>}</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Jacob Sleeper</a></td> <td>}  Grounds</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted, upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>that the report be accepted, and that <span class='line-break'> </span>the Board proceed to make choice of <span class='line-break'> </span>Gardener for the unexpired portion <span class='line-break'> </span>of the current year. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Spooner, Wm H. Jr chosen Gardener'><a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Spooner, W<sup>m</sup> H. Jr</a> chosen Gardener</span></p>
<p>It was further voted, upon motion <span class='line-break'> </span>by <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>, that <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>W<sup>m</sup> H. Spooner, Jr.</a><span class='line-break'> </span>be appointed Gardener, upon such terms <span class='line-break'> </span>as the Committee upon Grounds and he<span class='line-break'> </span>may agree. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Memorial of Mace Tisdale _'>Memorial of <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mace Tisdale</a> _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> to whom was referred <span class='line-break'> </span>the memorial of <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mace Tisdale</a>, reported<span class='line-break'> </span>that <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mr Tisdale</a> had withdrawn his <span class='line-break'> </span>former request, and desired the <span class='line-break'> </span>following paper to be presented as <span class='line-break'> </span>a substitute.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1860-12-08'>December 8. 1860</date></p>
<p>To the Trustees of Mount Auburn Cemetery.</p>
<p>The undersignd hereby requests that <span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees of the Proprietors of the Cem<span class='line-break'></span>etery of Mount Auburn, will cause to <span class='line-break'> </span>be entered upon the Records of the</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134546">
<h3><a name="page-1134546">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 154)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>154</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Memorial of M. Tisdale ordered to be recorded _'>Memorial of <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>M. Tisdale</a> ordered to be recorded _</span></p>
<p>Corporation his desire that, after his <span class='line-break'> </span>burial, no interment shall ever be <span class='line-break'> </span>authorized or permitted in his <a href='/pages/subjects/70103' title='Lot 1080'>lot <span class='line-break'> </span>numbered ten hundred and eighty</a> (1080)<span class='line-break'> </span>in said cemetery, nor in the grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>contiguous thereto in which he is inter<span class='line-break'></span>ested _ meaning the borders and orna<span class='line-break'></span>mental grounds appurtenant thereto –<span class='line-break'> </span>saving and excepting only the following <span class='line-break'> </span>persons – namely: <a href='/pages/subjects/80029' title='Bradlee, Frances Ann Tisdale'>Frances Ann Tisdale<span class='line-break'> </span>Bradlee</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/80030' title='Hewins, Cynthia'>Cynthia Hewins</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/80031' title='Savels, Ann'>Ann Savels</a> –<span class='line-break'> </span>his intention being to have the same other<span class='line-break'></span>wise unbroken for graves, forever. _</p>
<p>Respectfully</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mace Tisdale</a></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the secretary</a> be author<span class='line-break'></span>ized to enter the request of <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mr Tisdale</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>upon the records with the express dec<span class='line-break'></span>laration that the Trustees do not thereby <span class='line-break'> </span>assume any responsibilitiy in regard to <span class='line-break'> </span>the execution of <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mr Tisdale</a>'s wishes <span class='line-break'> </span>concerning the use of his lot.</p>
<p>Voted that when this meeting ad<span class='line-break'></span>journ it be to the last monday in January, <span class='line-break'> </span>to hear the reports, and for any other <span class='line-break'> </span>business that may come before the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees.</p>
<p>adjourned.</p>
<p>attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134547">
<h3><a name="page-1134547">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 155)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>155</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees&apos; Adjd meeting Jan.y. 28. 1861.'>Trustees' Adj<sup>d</sup> meeting <date when='1861-01-28'>Jan.y. 28. 1861</date>.</span></p>
<p>A meeting of the Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held, according to adjournment, on <date when='1861-01-28T10:00:00'>Monday, <span class='line-break'> </span>January 28<sup>th</sup> 1861 at 10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Roof over Vestibules at Gate _'>Roof over Vestibules at <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->Gate</a> _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>, Voted<span class='line-break'> </span>that, whereas, at the last meeting, <span class='line-break'> </span>upon recommendation of the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Grounds, a motion was made to ap<span class='line-break'></span>propriate a sum not exceeding $1600. ~<span class='line-break'> </span>to the erection of the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>two granite rooms<span class='line-break'> </span>at the Gate</a>, which under the bye law<span class='line-break'> </span>should have lain over to another meeting, <span class='line-break'> </span>but was then inadvertently adopted, _<span class='line-break'> </span>said vote be now reconsidered.</p>
<p>It was then moved by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> and <span class='line-break'> </span>voted that said motion for the appro<span class='line-break'></span>priation of $1600. ~ as aforesaid be adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer&apos;s Annual Rept _'>Treasurer's Annual Rep<sup>t</sup> _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->The Treasurer</a> read his annual <span class='line-break'> </span>report: also that of the Superintendent.</p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Mr Austin</a>, the report <span class='line-break'> </span>was accepted and ordered to be printed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees&apos; Annual Report.'>Trustees' Annual Report.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> read the annual <span class='line-break'> </span>report of the Trustees.</p>
<p>Voted, upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr <span class='line-break'> </span>Read</a>, that the same be adopted and <span class='line-break'> </span>ordered to be printed.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> for the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>appointed in July last to cause the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134548">
<h3><a name="page-1134548">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 156)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>156</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chapel Floor _ : Report of Comee on,'><a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> Floor _ : Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> on,</span></p>
<p>floor to be covered with encaustic tiles<span class='line-break'> </span>reported _ That agreeably to their in<span class='line-break'></span>structions, they have caused the whole <span class='line-break'> </span>floor to be paved with English burnt<span class='line-break'> </span>tiles of various colours, those in the <span class='line-break'> </span>name or central part being laid in ce<span class='line-break'></span>ment, and those of the side<s>s</s> aisles which <span class='line-break'> </span>commonly are not exposed to be trod<span class='line-break'> </span>upon, being laid without cement.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/80034' title='Story, J., Mr.'>Mr J Story</a>'s bill for tiles furnished <span class='line-break'> </span>to Mount Auburn is $899.89 – from which<span class='line-break'> </span>is to be deducted $66.48 for tiles used in <span class='line-break'> </span>tombs built by the Corporation, leaving <span class='line-break'> </span>to account of <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> $833.41.  The <span class='line-break'> </span>tiles were laid by workmen belonging <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Cemetery.</p>
<p><sup><u>signed</u></sup>  Respectfully <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1861-01-29'>Jan'y 29<sup>th</sup> 1861</date>.   Chairman</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tax on Stone Farm - Question of referred to Comee'>Tax on <a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>Stone Farm</a> - Question of referred to Com<sup>ee</sup></span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the report be accepted.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> stated that he had <span class='line-break'> </span>recently been called upon by <a href='/pages/subjects/80035' title='Healy, J. P., Mr.'>Mr J. P. <span class='line-break'> </span>Healy</a> in behalf of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>town of Watertown</a><span class='line-break'> </span>relative to the right claimed by that town <span class='line-break'> </span>to assess a tax upon the <a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>stone Farm</a>.</p>
<p>It was thereupon Voted that the <span class='line-break'> </span>questions of  liability of this Corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>to any tax upon the <a href='/pages/subjects/53229' title='Stone Farm'>Stone farm</a> be referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, with full power.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->The Treasurer</a> stated that there <span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134549">
<h3><a name="page-1134549">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 157)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>157</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer authorized to Endorse note for discount.'>Treasurer authorized to Endorse note for discount.</span></p>
<p>is a present deficiency in the treasury of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation, and as he expected <span class='line-break'> </span>soon to receive the note of <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>W<sup>m</sup> H Spooner<span class='line-break'> </span>Jr.</a> with sufficient security, he asked <span class='line-break'> </span>that he might be authorized to endorse<span class='line-break'> </span>and have the same discounted.</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>be authorized to endorse said note <span class='line-break'> </span>for the purpose aforesaid.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasr _ increase of compensation _'>Treas<sup>r</sup> _ increase of compensation _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->The Treasurer</a> also stated that <span class='line-break'> </span>the care of the Repair Fund had <span class='line-break'> </span>become somewhat onerous, without <span class='line-break'> </span>any compensation being allowed him <span class='line-break'> </span>therefor: and he requested that the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>to consider whether anything should <span class='line-break'> </span>be allowed him for that duty.</p>
<p>Voted that this question be <span class='line-break'> </span>referred to the Committee on Finance, <span class='line-break'> </span>to report thereon at the next meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Correction of Plan _'>Correction of Plan _</span></p>
<p>Upon information by the surveyor,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/56692' title='Wadsworth, Alexander'>Mr Wadsworth</a>, that <a href='/pages/subjects/59227' title='Lot 537'>lot 537</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/59901' title='Olive Path'>Olive Path</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>had been sold as <a href='/pages/subjects/59226' title='Lot 3013'>lot 3013</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/59229' title='Lot 2139'>2139</a> on <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59902' title='Hibiscus Path'>Hibiscus Path</a> had been sold as <a href='/pages/subjects/59228' title='Lot 3054'>lot 3054</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that <a href='/pages/subjects/59903' title='Lot 2933'>lot 2933</a> had been removed from <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61196' title='Harebell Path'>Harebell Path</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/59904' title='Spruce Avenue'>Spruce Avenue</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>and as deeds had been made<span class='line-break'> </span>accordingly,</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/56692' title='Wadsworth, Alexander'>Mr Wadsworth</a> be <span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to make the above named <span class='line-break'> </span>corrections upon the plan.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134550">
<h3><a name="page-1134550">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 158)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>158</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representation of Lot 2315'>Representation of <a href='/pages/subjects/80036' title='Lot 2315'>Lot 2315</a></span></p>
<p>Upon the petition of the children <span class='line-break'> </span>and heirs at law of <a href='/pages/subjects/80037' title='Goddard, William'>W<sup>m</sup> Goddard</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/80036' title='Lot 2315'>lot numbered 2315</a><span class='line-break'> </span>in Mount Auburn,</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/80038' title='Goddard, Thomas'>Thomas Goddard</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> the son, be designated to <span class='line-break'> </span>represent said lot.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned.</p>
<p>Attest, <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Sec<sup>y</sup></p>
<p>--------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Feb.y. 4, 1861.'>Trustees _ <date when='1861-02-04'>Feb.y. 4, 1861</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees, was held <date when='1861-02-04T10:00:00'>Monday February 4<sup>th</sup> 1861<span class='line-break'> </span>at 10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>and Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was <span class='line-break'> </span>read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Compensation of Treasurer, for care of Repair Fund.'>Compensation of Treasurer, for care of Repair Fund.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> for the Committee on Finance,<span class='line-break'> </span>to which was referred at the last meeting, <span class='line-break'> </span>the queston whether any and what com<span class='line-break'></span>pensation shall be allowed the Treasurer <span class='line-break'> </span>for the care of the Repair Fund, <span class='line-break'> </span>submitted a report in writing.</p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a> the report was accepted.</p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>, in <span class='line-break'> </span>accordance with the recommendation of <span class='line-break'> </span>the report _</p>
<p>Voted, _ that <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> shall be <span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134551">
<h3><a name="page-1134551">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 159)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>159</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Recommendation of Finance Comee on _ adopted.'>Recommendation of Finance Com<sup>ee</sup> on _ adopted.</span></p>
<p>allowed for his compensation for the duties <span class='line-break'> </span>pertaining to the "Repair Fund", one half <span class='line-break'> </span>of  one per cent per annum on the <span class='line-break'> </span>amount of said fund as it shall ap<span class='line-break'></span>pear at the close of each year, begin<span class='line-break'></span>ning with the fiscal year now drawing to <span class='line-break'> </span>a close.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report, in part, referred to next Board _'>Report, in part, referred to next Board _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted,  _ that so much of the report <span class='line-break'> </span>as refers to the management of the affairs <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation by officers at the Cem<span class='line-break'></span>etery be referred to the next Board _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Question about Tomb-Rights referred to Comee on Lots.'>Question about Tomb-Rights referred to Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots.</span></p>
<p>In accordance with a suggestion <span class='line-break'> </span>from the Committee on Lots, and upon motion <span class='line-break'> </span>by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>, Voted that the question <span class='line-break'> </span>whether persons who purchased lots or rights <span class='line-break'> </span>to locate lots prior to the enactment of <span class='line-break'> </span>any by law restricting the erection of <span class='line-break'> </span>tombs, or prescribing the manner in <span class='line-break'> </span>which they should be built, and who <span class='line-break'> </span>have not yet erected tombs upon such <span class='line-break'> </span>lots, are by such priority exempted from <span class='line-break'> </span>the operation of said by law – be re<span class='line-break'></span>ferred to the Committee on Lots to report<span class='line-break'> </span>thereon.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 2730  Represented.'><a href='/pages/subjects/80040' title='Lot 2730'>Lot 2730</a>  Represented.</span></p>
<p>Upon the petition of the Executors and trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>under the will of <a href='/pages/subjects/80041' title='Chase, Theodore'>Theodore Chase</a>, late <span class='line-break'> </span>the proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/80040' title='Lot 2730'>lot numbered 2730</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/80042' title='Chase, George B.'>George B. Chase</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, as son was <span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>designated to represent said lot..</th> <th>} Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td><small>the meeting was then adjourned without day.</small></td> <td>} Secy.</td> </tr> </tbody> </table></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134552">
<h3><a name="page-1134552">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 160)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>160</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Meeting'>Annual Meeting</span></p>
<p>Mount Auburn Cemetery.</p>
<p>The Annual Meeting of the Proprietors of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery of Mount Auburn, will be <span class='line-break'> </span>held in <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, at Mercantile Hall, <span class='line-break'> </span>16 Summer Street, on <date when='1861-02-04T15:30:00'>Monday, the fourth <span class='line-break'> </span>day of February, at 3½ o'clock P. M.</date> to <span class='line-break'> </span>hear the Reports of the Trustees, Treasurer <span class='line-break'> </span>and Superintendent, and to choose Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>for the ensuing year.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1861-01-29'>Jan. 29. 1861</date>.</p>
<p>Pursuant to the foregoing notice, which <span class='line-break'> </span>was published seven days before the time <span class='line-break'> </span>of meeting in the <a href='/pages/subjects/58551' title='Boston Daily Advertiser'>Boston Daily Advertiser</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>and in several other newspapers, the Proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>met at the time and place therein named.</p>
<p>A quorum being in attendance, the <span class='line-break'> </span>President, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Jacob Bigelow</a>, took the chair.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Records read.'>Records read.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> read the printed notification <span class='line-break'> </span>of the meeting, also the record of the <span class='line-break'> </span>last annual meeting. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Rept of Trustees _'>Annual Rep<sup>t</sup> of Trustees _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> read the annual report <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees in print, which upon <span class='line-break'> </span>motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/60332' title='Richardson, Jeffrey'>Jeffrey Richardson Esq.</a> was <span class='line-break'> </span>accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Reports of Treasurer &amp; Superintendent'>Annual Reports of Treasurer &amp; Superintendent</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->The Treasurer</a> read his annual <span class='line-break'> </span>report, also that of the Superintendent, <span class='line-break'> </span>both in print, which upon motion of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/80043' title='Plummer, Farnham'>Farnham Plummer</a> ^<sup>Esq.</sup> were severally accepted.</p>
</div>
</div>

<p>On the motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/62119' title='Lee, Thomas J.'>Thomas J. Lee, Esq.</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that a Committee of three be chosen <span class='line-break'> </span>to receive, sort and count the votes. _</p>
<p>The chair appointed Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/62119' title='Lee, Thomas J.'>Tho's J. Lee</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/80044' title='Burrage, Johnson C.'>Johnson <span class='line-break'> </span>C. Burrage</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/80045' title='Wetherell, John G.'>John G Wetherell</a> as such a <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee.</p>
<p><b>"Mount Auburn Memorial."</b></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/80046' title='Bird, Joseph'>Mr Joseph</a> Bird offered the following <span class='line-break'> </span>resolution: _ That the Mt Auburn Memorial <span class='line-break'> </span>edited and published by <a href='/pages/subjects/52579' title='Safford, Truman H.'>Mr Safford</a> and his <span class='line-break'> </span>sons, containing as it does, well selected <span class='line-break'> </span>and original articles upon cemeteries, mon<span class='line-break'></span>uments, Tombs, Scenery &amp;c is worth of the <span class='line-break'> </span>support of the Proprietors of Mt Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>and other Cemeteries,</p>
<p>The resolution was seconded by <a href='/pages/subjects/78123' title='Fuller, Arthur B.'>Rev. A. <span class='line-break'> </span>B. Fuller</a>, and was unanimously adopted.</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees - Febr.y. 18, 1861.'>Trustees - <date when='1861-02-18'>Febr.y. 18, 1861</date>.</span></p>
<p><b>Trustees Records 1861-2</b></p>
<p>The first meeting of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Proprietors of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn, for organization<span class='line-break'> </span>and business, was held at the office<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Secretary (No 33 School Street)<span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1861-02-18T10:00:00'>Monday February 18<sup>th</sup> at 10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a>. _</p>
<p>The record of the last monthly <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Trustees was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Officers and Committees chosen'>Officers and Committees chosen</span></p>
<p>The Trustees then proceeded to <span class='line-break'> </span>ballot for officers and Committees re<span class='line-break'></span>quired to be chosen by ballot, and the <span class='line-break'> </span>following were chosen. _</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Jacob Bigelow</a></th> <th>–</th> <th>President<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J Coolidge</a></td> <td>–</td> <td>Secretary</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>George W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a></td> <td>–</td> <td>Treasurer</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Messrs</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a></th> <th>Com. on Finance<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___ </td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>Messrs</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a></td> <td>Com. on Lots </td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___ </td> </tr> <tr><td>Messrs</td> <td>{<a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a></td> <td>Com. on Regulations &amp; Records</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a></td> <td>of Interments</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134559">
<h3><a name="page-1134559">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 167)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>167</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th>{<a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{<a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>Messrs</td> <td>{<a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a></td> <td>Com. on Grounds</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{<a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{<a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent'>Superintendent</span></p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Jonathan Mann</a> was chosen Superintenent.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gate Keeper &amp; Clerk to Supt and Gardener chosen _'>Gate Keeper &amp; Clerk to Sup<sup>t</sup> and Gardener chosen _</span></p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52579' title='Safford, Truman H.'>Truman H Safford</a> was chosen Gate<span class='line-break'></span>Keeper and  Superintendents Clerk.</p>
<p>Also on motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>W<sup>m</sup> H Spooner Jr</a> was chosen gardener.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salaries and Compensation _'>Salaries and Compensation _</span></p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the salaries and compen<span class='line-break'></span>sation of the several paid officers be the <span class='line-break'> </span>same as for the last year. _<span class='line-break'> </span>viz: _ to the Secretary three hundred dollars <span class='line-break'> </span>and the accustomed fees, together with <span class='line-break'> </span>one half the office rent;  to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer a commission of two and one <span class='line-break'> </span>half percent on the sales of land,<span class='line-break'> </span>and one half of one percent on the <span class='line-break'> </span>amount of the Repair fund, for the care <span class='line-break'> </span>of the same:  to the Superintendent, one<span class='line-break'> </span>thousand dollars and the use of the house <span class='line-break'> </span>occupied by him: _ to the Gate Keeper &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendents Clerk six hundred dollars.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer to execute Lease for Gardener _'>Treasurer to execute Lease for Gardener _</span></p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>,</p>
<p>Voted, _ that when the new lease with <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'><!--Spooner-->the Gardener</a> shall have been approved by</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134560">
<h3><a name="page-1134560">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 168)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>168</p>
<p>the Committee on Grounds, <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>be authorized to Execute the same and <span class='line-break'> </span>affix the Corporate Seal. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Committees charged with business un-finished rechosen _'>Committees charged with business un-finished rechosen _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that ^<sup>all</sup> the Committees appointed <span class='line-break'> </span>last year who have not completed <span class='line-break'> </span>their duties, be rechosen, with the <span class='line-break'> </span>same powers. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Management of Affairs at the Cemetery.'>Management of Affairs at the Cemetery.</span></p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the subject contained in <span class='line-break'> </span>the report of the Finance Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>which was referred to this board <span class='line-break'> </span>viz: the management of the affairs <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation at the Cemetery, <span class='line-break'> </span>in its bearing upon its financial affairs _<span class='line-break'> </span>be referred to the Committee on Regulation <span class='line-break'> </span>and Records of Interments. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives of Lots _'>Representatives of Lots _</span></p>
<p>Upon petition by the parties in inter<span class='line-break'></span>est the following  persons were severally <span class='line-break'> </span>designated to represent the lots of deceased <span class='line-break'> </span>proprietors in connection with which they <span class='line-break'> </span>are named; _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 214'><a href='/pages/subjects/64172' title='Lot 214'>Lot 214</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/80051' title='Raymond, Freeborn F.'>Freeborn F Raymond</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/80052' title='Lexington, MA'>Lexington</a>, a <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustee under the will of <a href='/pages/subjects/64173' title='Raymond, Thatcher R.'>Thatcher R Ray<span class='line-break'></span>mond</a>, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/64172' title='Lot 214'>lot numbered<span class='line-break'> </span>214</a> to represent said lot.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oath of Secretary'>Oath of Secretary</span></p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts <span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk ss. <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1861-02-18'>February 18<sup>th</sup> 1861</date><span class='line-break'> </span>Then personally appeared <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J Coolidge</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>and made oath that he would faithfully <span class='line-break'> </span>perform the duties of the Secretary of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn before me</p>

<div id="page-1134563">
<h3><a name="page-1134563">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 171)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>171</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ March 4. 1861.'>Trustees _ <date when='1861-03-04'>March 4. 1861</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>was held on <date when='1861-03-04T10:00:00'>Monday March 4<sup>th</sup> 1861, at 10 o'clock<span class='line-break'> </span>a.m.</date>   There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>.</p>
<p>The records of the meeting for organization <span class='line-break'> </span>were read.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Application of G. Brewer for admission on horseback.'>Application of <a href='/pages/subjects/59933' title='Brewer, Gardner'>G. Brewer</a> for admission on horseback.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> read a communication <span class='line-break'> </span>from <a href='/pages/subjects/59933' title='Brewer, Gardner'>Gardner Brewer</a> requesting admission of <span class='line-break'> </span>himself to Mt Auburn on horse-back.</p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the request of <a href='/pages/subjects/59933' title='Brewer, Gardner'>Mr Brewer</a> be <span class='line-break'> </span>referred to a special committee consisting <span class='line-break'> </span>of Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proposed Amendt of regulations concerning Admissions.'>Proposed Amend<sup>t</sup> of regulations concerning Admissions.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> moved that to the regu<span class='line-break'></span>lation prohibiting the admission of any <span class='line-break'> </span>person on horseback, be added the words <span class='line-break'> </span>"except by special vote of the Trustees." _<span class='line-break'> </span>which under the rule lies over to the <span class='line-break'> </span>next meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Additl Appropn for Waterworks.'>Addit<sup>l</sup> Approp<sup>n</sup> for Waterworks.</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted, That the committee on waterworks<span class='line-break'> </span>be authorized to expend a sum not exceed<span class='line-break'></span>ing one thousand dollars additional to <span class='line-break'> </span>the sums already appropriated.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives designated for'>Representatives designated for</span></p>
<p>Upon petition of the parties in interest<span class='line-break'> </span>the following persons were designated to <span class='line-break'> </span>represent the lots in connection with <span class='line-break'> </span>whih they are severally named. _</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/80093' title='Upham, George P.'>George P. Upham</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> only son of Phineas</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<h3><a name="page-1134564">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 172)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>172</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 573.'><a href='/pages/subjects/80094' title='Lot 573'>Lot 573</a>.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/80095' title='Upham, Phineas'><!--Phineas-->Upham</a> deceased late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/80094' title='Lot 573'>lot <span class='line-break'> </span>numbered 573</a>, to represent said lot. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 640.'><a href='/pages/subjects/80096' title='Lot 640'>Lot 640</a>.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/80097' title='Proctor, John C.'>John C Proctor</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> son of <a href='/pages/subjects/80097' title='Proctor, John C.'>John<span class='line-break'> </span>C. Proctor</a>, deceased, late proprietor of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/80096' title='Lot 640'>lot numbered 640</a>, to represent said lot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 1522.'><a href='/pages/subjects/80098' title='Lot 1522'>Lot 1522</a>.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/80099' title='Barnard, Mary D.'>Mary D Barnard</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, widow of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/80100' title='Barnard, Joseph'>Joseph Barnard</a>, deceased, late pro<span class='line-break'></span>prietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/80098' title='Lot 1522'>lot numbered 1522</a>, to represent said lot.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned.</p>
<p>Attest, <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J Coolidge</a> Sec.</p>
<p>------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ April 1. 1861.'>Trustees _ <date when='1861-04-01'>April 1. 1861</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of <span class='line-break'> </span>the  Trustees was held <date when='1861-04-01T10:00:00'>Monday April 1<sup>st</sup> 1861,<span class='line-break'> </span>at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> at office of Secretary</p>
<p>There were present _ <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>and Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>.</p>
<p>The records of the last meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>were read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Amendt to Rules of Admission'>Amend<sup>t</sup> to Rules of Admission</span></p>
<p>The amendment to the regulation<span class='line-break'> </span>prohibiting the admission to the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>of persons on horseback, proposed at <span class='line-break'> </span>the last meeting, by the addition thereto <span class='line-break'> </span>of the words "except by special vote of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees", came up, and was unan<span class='line-break'></span>imously adopted. _</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134565">
<h3><a name="page-1134565">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 173)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>173</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> submitted the following report, <span class='line-break'> </span>which, upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>, was ac<span class='line-break'></span>cepted, and the recommendations contained <span class='line-break'> </span>therein were adopted.  viz:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Special Committee respecting Admissions on Horseback _'>Report of Special Committee respecting Admissions on Horseback _</span></p>
<p>The Committee to whom was referred <span class='line-break'> </span>the Letter of <a href='/pages/subjects/59933' title='Brewer, Gardner'>Gardner Brewer Esq.</a> recommending <span class='line-break'> </span>that Proprietors be admitted into Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn on horseback, have examined the subject and</p>
<p>_________________ <b>Report:</b> ________________</p>
<p>Many years ago, the rule was established <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Board of  Trustees, that no person <span class='line-break'> </span>should be admitted on horseback, in <span class='line-break'> </span>consequence of abuses to which that prac<span class='line-break'></span>tice was liable.  Carriages must be <span class='line-break'> </span>kept in the regular drive-ways and <span class='line-break'> </span>but little injury is liable to occur to the <span class='line-break'> </span>grounds in consequence of their admission,<span class='line-break'> </span>particularly if the rules be enforced regarding <span class='line-break'> </span>the rate at which they may be driven;<span class='line-break'> </span>but a person riding in the saddle can very <span class='line-break'> </span>easily cross through the narrow paths or even <span class='line-break'> </span>over some of the lots, and in this way <span class='line-break'> </span>much injury might be done to the grounds;<span class='line-break'> </span>and experience has proved in similar cases <span class='line-break'> </span>that the "Golden Rule" is but a feeble barrier<span class='line-break'> </span>agains acts of this description. _ There <span class='line-break'> </span>is a class of persons, and that by no <span class='line-break'> </span>means a small one, who can be made <span class='line-break'> </span>to respect the rights of their fellow citizens</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134566">
<h3><a name="page-1134566">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 174)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>174</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Meeting _ April 1, 1861. contind'>Meeting _ <date when='1861-04-01'>April 1, 1861</date>. contin<sup>d</sup></span></p>
<p>only by the enactment of a strict code<span class='line-break'> </span>of laws, and the rigid enforcement of them.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report continued-'>Report continued-</span></p>
<p>While therefore it is necessary to have <span class='line-break'> </span>some general law prohibiting the admis<span class='line-break'></span>sion of persons on horseback, the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee are of opinion that there <span class='line-break'> </span>may be a modification of it without <span class='line-break'> </span>injury to the grounds on the one hand,<span class='line-break'> </span>or injustice to any of the proprietors on <span class='line-break'> </span>the other.
