It would of course be improper<span class='line-break'> </span>for the Trustees to grant a privilege to <span class='line-break'> </span>one proprietor, which they denied to anoth<span class='line-break'></span>er, _ therefore they cannot give the priv<span class='line-break'></span>ilege to one, without granting it to all. _<span class='line-break'> </span>In making their general rules however, <span class='line-break'> </span>it is perfectly competent for them to grant <span class='line-break'> </span>privileges under certain conditions, and any <span class='line-break'> </span>one of the proprietors who chooses can avail <span class='line-break'> </span>of that privilege, and if there be no distinction, <span class='line-break'> </span>no reasonable ground of complaint can exist.</p>
<p>In this way we prohibit the indiscriminate <span class='line-break'> </span>right of building tombs _ but grant that right <span class='line-break'> </span>to any and all proprietors who will comply <span class='line-break'> </span>with certain rules, and pay a reasonable <span class='line-break'> </span>bonus for the privilege. _</p>
<p>The Committee think that in such <span class='line-break'> </span>cases as <a href='/pages/subjects/59933' title='Brewer, Gardner'>Mr Brewer</a>'s and many others, it <span class='line-break'> </span>may not only be for the personal comfort<span class='line-break'> </span>and convenience of the proprietors, but for <span class='line-break'> </span>the interest of Mount Auburn that permission</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134567">
<h3><a name="page-1134567">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 175)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>175</p>
<p>should be granted to enter on horseback.</p>
<p>In view therefore of these suggestions, the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee unanimously recommend the <span class='line-break'> </span>adoption of the following rules, which after <span class='line-break'> </span>a fair trial can be either modified or <span class='line-break'> </span>repealed. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Rules respecting Admission on Horseback _'>Rules respecting Admission on Horseback _</span></p>
<p><u>1<sup>st</sup></u> That any proprietor who shall make <span class='line-break'> </span>application in writing to the Board of Trustees, <span class='line-break'> </span>may upon the payment of Ten dollars, <span class='line-break'> </span>receive a ticket which shall entitle said <span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor and no one else, to ride into <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn on horseback for the <span class='line-break'> </span>term of one year, and the transferring, <span class='line-break'> </span>or loaning or allowing the ticket to be <span class='line-break'> </span>used by any other person, shall work <span class='line-break'> </span>the forfeiture of the privilege, which shall <span class='line-break'> </span>immediately be revoked. _</p>
<p><u>2<sup>nd</sup></u> That no horse shall be allowed to enter<span class='line-break'> </span>any other part of the grounds than the <span class='line-break'> </span>regular drive ways used by carriages, neither <span class='line-break'> </span>crossing any lot nor entering any foot-path, _<span class='line-break'> </span>nor allowed to go at any faster rate <span class='line-break'> </span>than a walk. _ Any violation of this <span class='line-break'> </span>rule shall cause the forfeiture of the ticket.</p>
<p><u>3<sup>rd</sup></u> That the above rules be printed on the tickets, <span class='line-break'> </span>and that the superintendent be instructed to <span class='line-break'> </span>see that they are rigidly enforced, and that <span class='line-break'> </span>no evasion or violation of them be allowed <span class='line-break'> </span>under any circumstances.</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Charles G. Nazro</a></th> <th>}<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a></td> <td>} Com.</td> </tr> <tr><td>All of which is respectfully submitted.</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Edward S. Rand</a></td> <td>}</td> </tr> </tbody> </table></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134568">
<h3><a name="page-1134568">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 176)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>176</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Comee on Regulations &amp;c of Interment respecting management of affairs at Cem.y.'>Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Regulations &amp;c of Interment respecting management of affairs at Cem.y.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Mr Tobey</a> of the Committee on Reg<span class='line-break'></span>ulations &amp; Records of Interments, to which <span class='line-break'> </span>was referred the Management of the <span class='line-break'> </span>affairs of the Corporation at the Cem<span class='line-break'></span>etery in their bearing upon its financial <span class='line-break'> </span>condition, submitted a report in <span class='line-break'> </span>writing.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Laid on table _'>Laid on table _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that this report be accepted <span class='line-break'> </span>and laid upon the table. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Special Comee to Examine Supts books &amp; accounts, &amp; suggest any necessary change in conduct of businss at the Cemetery _'>Special Com<sup>ee</sup> to Examine Sup<sup>ts</sup> books &amp; accounts, &amp; suggest any necessary change in conduct of businss at the Cemetery _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that a committee consisting of <span class='line-break'> </span>the committee on Regulations &amp; Records of <span class='line-break'> </span>Interments together with the Finance Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee, be requested to investigate the <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent's books and accounts, and <span class='line-break'> </span>be authorized to employ a suitable clerk <span class='line-break'> </span>or clerks about the same, and report <span class='line-break'> </span>the result of their investigations to <span class='line-break'> </span>this board at the next meeting, or <span class='line-break'> </span>at a meeting to be called by them earlier, <span class='line-break'> </span>if they deem it expedient, and that <span class='line-break'> </span>they also be requested to make any recommen<span class='line-break'></span>dations as to the mode of keeping said accounts, <span class='line-break'> </span>and of conducting the affairs of the Corpora<span class='line-break'></span>tion at the Cemetery in the future, which <span class='line-break'> </span>in their judgement, the interests of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation may require.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134569">
<h3><a name="page-1134569">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 177)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>177</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Special Meeting, April 5, 1861.'>Trustees _ Special Meeting, <date when='1861-04-05'>April 5, 1861</date>.</span></p>
<p>A Special Meeting of the Trustees, called <span class='line-break'> </span>by request of the committee chosen at the <span class='line-break'> </span>last meeting, who were empowered so to <span class='line-break'> </span>do, was held on <date when='1861-04-05T10:00:00'>Friday April 5<sup>th</sup> 1861 at <span class='line-break'> </span>10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a>, and Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>were present.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Record _'>Record _</span></p>
<p>So much of the record of the last <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting as pertained to the matter for <span class='line-break'> </span>which this meeting was called, was read,<span class='line-break'> </span>together with the report of the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Interments which ^<sup>report</sup> was laid on the table <span class='line-break'> </span>at the last meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mr Tobey Excused from service on the Comee on Supts Accts.'><a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Mr Tobey</a> Excused from service on the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Supt<sup>s</sup> Accts.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Mr Tobey</a> chairman of the special <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee chosen at the last meeting, sub<span class='line-break'></span>mitted a written report. _</p>
<p>As he expected tomorrow to leave the <span class='line-break'> </span>city to be absent for a period, he reques<span class='line-break'></span>ted that he might be excused from fur<span class='line-break'></span>ther service on the  Committee.</p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>, _ Voted <span class='line-break'> </span>that <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Mr Tobey</a> be excused.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='above vote reconsidered _'>above vote reconsidered _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Mr Tobey</a> stated, upon reflection, that <span class='line-break'> </span>as the committee consisted of two of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Standing Committees of the Board, of one <span class='line-break'> </span>of which he was chairman, he did not <span class='line-break'> </span>see how he could properly be excused;<span class='line-break'> </span>that the remaining members of the committee<span class='line-break'> </span>were competent to act in the matter; but <span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134570">
<h3><a name="page-1134570">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 178)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>178</p>
<p>that he would be very willing to act <span class='line-break'> </span>with them if he should be providential<span class='line-break'></span>ly detained.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Reconsideration of vote to Excuse Mr Tobey _'>Reconsideration of vote to Excuse <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Mr Tobey</a> _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, Voted <span class='line-break'> </span>to reconsider the vote by which <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Mr Tobey</a><span class='line-break'> </span>was excused. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report recommitted _'>Report recommitted _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion also by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the report be recommitted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mr Austin added to Comee'><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Mr Austin</a> added to Com<sup>ee</sup></span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> Voted that <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Mr Austin</a> be added to the Committee.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Mr Tobey</a> chairman  of the <span class='line-break'> </span>committee on the investigation of <span class='line-break'> </span>the superintendent's accounts, having <span class='line-break'> </span>stated verbally that <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> has <span class='line-break'> </span>proposed to deposite in the hands <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Treasurer of this Corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>one thousand dollars to meet any <span class='line-break'> </span>deficiencies or inaccuracies which in a <span class='line-break'> </span>further and full investigation of his<span class='line-break'> </span>accounts may be proved</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer authorized to receive one thousand dolls [sic], on deposite from the Supt'>Treasurer authorized to receive one thousand dolls [sic], on deposite from the Sup<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> be <span class='line-break'> </span>and hereby is authorized to receive of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Jonathan Mann</a>, Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>the sum of one thousand dollars <span class='line-break'> </span>as proposed by him and to give a re<span class='line-break'></span>ceipt therefor.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>, _<span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that this meeting be adjourned <span class='line-break'> </span>to next Monday, at 3½ o'clock P.M.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J Coolidge</a>,, Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134571">
<h3><a name="page-1134571">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 179)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>179</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Adjd meeting April 8. 1861.'>Trustees _ Adj<sup>d</sup> meeting <date when='1861-04-08'>April 8. 1861</date>.</span></p>
<p>A meeting of the Trustees of Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn was held, according to adjournment, <span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1861-04-08T15:30:00'>Monday April 8<sup>th</sup> at 3½ o'clock P. M.</date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, and <span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> for the Committee on Super<span class='line-break'></span>intendent's accounts presented the following report: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Comee on Supts Accounts _'>Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Sup<sup>ts</sup> Accounts _</span></p>
<p>"The Committee who are charged <span class='line-break'> </span>with the investigation of the Accounts <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Superintendent, and to whom <span class='line-break'> </span>was recommitted the report made by <span class='line-break'> </span>them at the last meeting of the Board, <span class='line-break'> </span>have again considered the subject, <span class='line-break'> </span>and are convinced that it is of vital <span class='line-break'> </span>importance that the Board at once<span class='line-break'> </span>examine the matter and give the <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent a hearing _ and also <span class='line-break'> </span>examine other witnesses _ and for this <span class='line-break'> </span>purpose they have requested <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>and other persons to be present at this <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting, that the Board may proceed<span class='line-break'> </span>immediately with the examination <span class='line-break'> </span>and take such action as their wisdom <span class='line-break'> </span>shall dictate. _ From what has been <span class='line-break'> </span>revealed by the examination thus far, <span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee are of opinion and now <span class='line-break'> </span>recommend, that further security<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134572">
<h3><a name="page-1134572">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 180)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>180</p>
<p>should immediately be required of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>.</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Chas G Nazro</a></th> <th>}<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>Signed</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Charles C. Little</a></td> <td>} Committee</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Uriel Crocker</a></td> <td>}</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Edward Austin</a></td> <td>}</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1861-04-06'>April 6. 1861</date>"</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Hearing on the Report of Comee _ Testimony and the Superintendent&apos;s reply _'>Hearing on the Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> _ Testimony and the Superintendent's reply _</span></p>
<p>The report being accepted, the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee proceeded to introduce evidence.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Jonathan Mann</a> the Superintendent was <span class='line-break'> </span>invited in, and <a href='/pages/subjects/66870' title='Apple, Anthony'>Antone Apple</a>, the former <span class='line-break'> </span>gardener, was called by the Committee, <span class='line-break'> </span>to prove that the Superintendent had, in <span class='line-break'> </span>behalf of the Corporation, paid him bills,<span class='line-break'> </span>which were receipted by him (Apple) for <span class='line-break'> </span>larger amounts than the sum paid,<span class='line-break'> </span>the charge to the corporation, on the <span class='line-break'> </span>books, corresponding with the sums receipted <span class='line-break'> </span>for.</p>
<p>These allegations were denied by <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->the <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent</a>, who claimed, in reference <span class='line-break'> </span>to one or more of the bills shown, that <span class='line-break'> </span>the difference between the amount paid <span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/66870' title='Apple, Anthony'>Mr Apple</a>, and that charged to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation, was for money due from <span class='line-break'> </span>Apple to him on his private account.</p>
<p>The Committee also producd the <span class='line-break'> </span>books of the Corporation kept by <a href='/pages/subjects/52579' title='Safford, Truman H.'><!--Safford-->the Superin<span class='line-break'></span>tendent's clerk</a>, and sundry bills which <span class='line-break'> </span>had been paid by proprietors for work <span class='line-break'> </span>done, and showed that the corporation</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134573">
<h3><a name="page-1134573">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 181)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>181</p>
<p>had been credited with less than the <span class='line-break'> </span>face of the bills, the proprietors having <span class='line-break'> </span>paid the full amount for which the <span class='line-break'> </span>bills were rendered.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Hearing on accounts of Supt continued.'>Hearing on accounts of Sup<sup>t</sup> continued.</span></p>
<p>To this charge <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->the superintendent</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>replied that as the books were kept entire<span class='line-break'></span>ly by <a href='/pages/subjects/52579' title='Safford, Truman H.'>Mr Safford</a>, the clerk, he did <span class='line-break'> </span>not know how the errors occurred, if <span class='line-break'> </span>there were such errors;  but that he held <span class='line-break'> </span>himself in readiness to respond to any such <span class='line-break'> </span>deficiencies as should be proved.</p>
<p>The Committee also showed that <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->the Superintendent</a> had been in the practice <span class='line-break'> </span>of receiving the money on bills due <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Corporation for upwards of <span class='line-break'> </span>one hundred dollars (in contravention <span class='line-break'> </span>of the by law which requires all such bills <span class='line-break'> </span>to be paid to the Treasurer,) and crediting<span class='line-break'> </span>the same on the books of the Corporation,<span class='line-break'> </span>in two or more sums of less than one <span class='line-break'> </span>hundred dollars each, at different <span class='line-break'> </span>dates, for the sake of evading the by-law,<span class='line-break'> </span>when the bills had been paid in one sum.</p>
<p>This charge was admitted by <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->the <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent</a>, but alleged to be done <span class='line-break'> </span>by him as a matter of convenience,<span class='line-break'> </span>giving him no more trouble than to <span class='line-break'> </span>obtain the approval of the person <span class='line-break'> </span>with whom the contract had been <span class='line-break'> </span>made. _</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134574">
<h3><a name="page-1134574">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 182)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>182</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Hearing on case of Supt continued'>Hearing on case of Sup<sup>t</sup> continued</span></p>
<p>The Committee also introduced <a href='/pages/subjects/60426' title='Safford, De Forest'>DeForest <span class='line-break'> </span>Safford</a>, son of the Gate Keeper, who <span class='line-break'> </span>testified to conversations; heard by him, <span class='line-break'> </span>between <a href='/pages/subjects/52579' title='Safford, Truman H.'><!--Safford-->his father</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->the superintendent</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and harsh words used by the latter <span class='line-break'> </span>which tended greatly to excite his father, <span class='line-break'> </span>who had been removed to the insane <span class='line-break'> </span>asylum. This testimony also elicited the <span class='line-break'> </span>fact that insanity was hereditary in his father['s]<span class='line-break'> </span>family.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Votes proposed _'>Votes proposed _</span></p>
<p>The Committee then offered the fol<span class='line-break'></span>lowing votes and moved their adoption.</p>
<p>"That <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> be required to furnish <span class='line-break'> </span>forthwith further security to the amount <span class='line-break'> </span>of one thousand dollars". _</p>
<p>"That from and after this date he be <span class='line-break'> </span>prohibited from receiving or paying<span class='line-break'> </span>any moneys for account of the Corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>or making contracts without the knowledge <span class='line-break'> </span>and approval of the Committee on Lots", _</p>
<p>"That an assistant Superintendent <span class='line-break'> </span>be appointed temporarily." _</p>
<p>Pending these, the Board adjourned <span class='line-break'> </span>to <date when='1861-04-09T10:00:00'>Tuesday morning, 9<sup>th</sup> inst, at 10 o'clock</date>.</p>
<p>Attest<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134575">
<h3><a name="page-1134575">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 183)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>183</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Adjd meeting _ April 9. 1861~'>Adj<sup>d</sup> meeting _ <date when='1861-04-09'>April 9. 1861</date>~</span></p>
<p><b>Adjourned meeting of the Trustees.</b></p>
<p><date when='1861-04-09T10:00:00'>Tuesday April 9<sup>th</sup> 1861, 10 o'clock a.m. </date></p>
<p>Present, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a>.</p>
<p>The record of yesterday's proceedings <span class='line-break'> </span>was read.</p>
<p>The following communication from <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->the Superintendent</a> was read.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Communication of the Supt requesting time for Examining the books and accounts.'>Communication of the Sup<sup>t</sup> requesting time for Examining the books and accounts.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1861-04-09'>April 9<sup>th</sup> 1861</date>.</p>
<p>To the Honorable Board of Trustees of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mt Auburn Cemetery,</p>
<p>Gentlemen,</p>
<p>Certain charges having been <span class='line-break'> </span>brought against me by the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>having in charge the investigation of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent's accounts, viz:<span class='line-break'> </span>1<sup>st</sup> A deficiency or short credits in the <span class='line-break'> </span>superintendents accounts. _<span class='line-break'> </span>2<sup>ondly</sup>  That the Superintendent had received<span class='line-break'> </span>commission or discount on certain <span class='line-break'> </span>bills paid by him in behalf of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation, while the full amount of <span class='line-break'> </span>bill was charged to the Corporation.</p>
<p>The latter charge I claim, has not <span class='line-break'> </span>been sustained.</p>
<p>On the former I ask for further <span class='line-break'> </span>time, that I may be enabled to make <span class='line-break'> </span>such explanation as the importance<span class='line-break'> </span>of the case demands, and that I</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134576">
<h3><a name="page-1134576">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 184)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>184</p>
<p>may have the books for this purpose.</p>
<p>Very Respfly submitted<span class='line-break'> </span>(signed) <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Jona Mann</a> Sup't.</p>
<p>The question then came up on the adop<span class='line-break'></span>tion of the votes moved by the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>yesterday, pending which the Board adjourned.</p>
<p>Ordered that they be acted upon <span class='line-break'> </span>one by one.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Motion to require further security of Supt. rejected.'>Motion to require further security of Supt. rejected.</span></p>
<p>Upon the first motion, "that <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr <span class='line-break'> </span>Mann</a> be required to furnish forthwith <span class='line-break'> </span>further security to the amount of one <span class='line-break'> </span>thousand dollars" _ <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> demanded<span class='line-break'> </span>the yeas and nays.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mr Cheever excused from voting _'><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Mr Cheever</a> excused from voting _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Mr Cheever</a> asked to be excused from <span class='line-break'> </span>voting _ which was granted.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a> moved to lay the motion <span class='line-break'> </span>on the table.  Lost _ not receiving five votes.</p>
<p>The question then recurred on adopting <span class='line-break'> </span>the main proposition, and it was lost _<span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a><span class='line-break'> </span>voting <u>yea</u>, and Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> voting <u>nay</u>.</p>
<p>The second motion then came up _ .<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a> moved an amendment by sub<span class='line-break'></span>stituting the words - "instructed not to receive<span class='line-break'> </span>or pay" in place of "prohibited from receiving <span class='line-break'> </span>or paying" and another slight verbal alteration <span class='line-break'> </span>to correspond to this, which was adopted.<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> moved further to amend by <span class='line-break'> </span>adding at the end of the motion these words _</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134577">
<h3><a name="page-1134577">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 185)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>185</p>
<p>"until the further order of this Board".<span class='line-break'> </span>which was adopted by unanimous consent.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Mr Cheever</a> asked and obtained leave <span class='line-break'> </span>of absence to attend the Senate Board, as <span class='line-break'> </span>business of importance demanded his pres<span class='line-break'></span>ence there _ but wished it to be understood<span class='line-break'> </span>that he was in favor of a full and impar<span class='line-break'></span>tial investigation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt to make contracts only with knowledge &amp; approval of Comee on Lots.'>Sup<sup>t</sup> to make contracts only with knowledge &amp; approval of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots.</span></p>
<p>The vote was then taken upon the main <span class='line-break'> </span>question, of the second motion, which as <span class='line-break'> </span>amended, reads _ "that from and after <span class='line-break'> </span>this date he be instructed not to <span class='line-break'> </span>receive or pay any moneys for account <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation, and also that he <span class='line-break'> </span>shall make no contracts without the <span class='line-break'> </span>knowledge and approval of the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots, until the further order of this <span class='line-break'> </span>Board". _ Upon this also the yeas &amp; nays were <span class='line-break'> </span>ordered, and the same was unanimusly <span class='line-break'> </span>adopted.</p>
<p>The Committee asked leave to withdraw <span class='line-break'> </span>the last motion, which was unanimously consented<span class='line-break'> </span>to, and another was substituted, which<span class='line-break'> </span>after discussion and modification was <span class='line-break'> </span>finally unanimously adopted in form fol<span class='line-break'></span>lowing:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on Supts accts. authorized to employ temporarily person [to] receive and pay moneys, and a Gate Keeper _'>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Sup<sup>ts</sup> accts. authorized to employ temporarily person [to] receive and pay moneys, and a Gate Keeper _</span></p>
<p>"That the Committee chosen to investigate <span class='line-break'> </span>the accounts of the superintendent, be <span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to appoint temporarily a <span class='line-break'> </span>clerk or clerks, to receive and disburse</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134578">
<h3><a name="page-1134578">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 186)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>186</p>
<p>moneys at Mt Auburn, and a person to <span class='line-break'> </span>take charge of <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->the Gate</a>."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt. to have access to books for examination, and a hearing when he shall desire _'>Supt. to have access to books for examination, and a hearing when he shall desire _</span></p>
<p>Upon the communication of <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->the <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> moved "that <span class='line-break'> </span>this Board will hear any explanation <span class='line-break'> </span>from <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> whenever <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a><span class='line-break'> </span>shall call a meeting for that purpose _<span class='line-break'> </span>that he shall have  free access to the <span class='line-break'> </span>books at this office, and that the Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee shall furnish him, so far as <span class='line-break'> </span>they may be able, with specifications of <span class='line-break'> </span>the charges made against him".</p>
<p>And the motion was unanimously adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Division of lot 2025, – T. T. Sawyer&apos;s – authorized, and two lots to be made of same _'>Division of <a href='/pages/subjects/82732' title='Lot 2025'>lot 2025</a>, – <a href='/pages/subjects/82733' title='Sawyer, Timothy T.'>T. T. Sawyer's</a> – authorized, and two lots to be made of same _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, Chairman of the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots presented the following commu<span class='line-break'></span>nication from <a href='/pages/subjects/82733' title='Sawyer, Timothy T.'>Timothy T Sawyer</a>, proprietor <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/82732' title='Lot 2025'>Lot No 2025</a>, and stated that the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>saw no objection to the request being granted.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54284' title='Charlestown, MA'>Charlestown</a> <date when='1861-04-06'>April 6<sup>th</sup> 1861</date>.</p>
<p>To the Trustees of Mt Auburn Cemetery</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/82732' title='Lot 2025'>Lot No 2025</a>, standing in <span class='line-break'> </span>my name, really belongs one half to me,<span class='line-break'> </span>and one half to <a href='/pages/subjects/82734' title='Sawyer, Susan M.'>Mrs Susan M Sawyer</a>, widow <span class='line-break'> </span>of my brother, the late <a href='/pages/subjects/74526' title='Sawyer, William'>William Sawyer</a>, and <span class='line-break'> </span>I respectfully request that it may be divided, <span class='line-break'> </span>and a deed given to <a href='/pages/subjects/82734' title='Sawyer, Susan M.'>Mrs Sawyer</a> for one <span class='line-break'> </span>half, or 320 feet, the whole lot containing <span class='line-break'> </span>640 feet.</p>
<p>signed <a href='/pages/subjects/82733' title='Sawyer, Timothy T.'>Timothy T. Sawyer</a>.</p>
<p>Voted that a division of <a href='/pages/subjects/82732' title='Lot 2025'>lot 2025</a> be</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134579">
<h3><a name="page-1134579">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 187)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>187</p>
<p>authorized, in accordance with the petition <span class='line-break'> </span>of the proprietor, _ that, upon reconveyance<span class='line-break'> </span>to the corporation, new deeds be issued gran<span class='line-break'></span>ting 320 feet each to the said <a href='/pages/subjects/82733' title='Sawyer, Timothy T.'>Timothy T.<!--Sawyer--></a> <span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/82734' title='Sawyer, Susan M.'>Susan M. Sawyer</a>.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary.</p>
<p>---------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees - Special Meeting April 17. 1861.'>Trustees - Special Meeting <date when='1861-04-17'>April 17. 1861</date>.</span></p>
<p>A Special  meeting of the Trustees of Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn was held on <date when='1861-04-17T10:00:00'>Wednesday, April 17, 1861.<span class='line-break'> </span>at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> called by <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> upon<span class='line-break'> </span>the written request of five trustees.</p>
<p>There were present, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the adjourned meeting was read.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> stated that the meeting had <span class='line-break'> </span>been called at the request of several of the Trustees, <span class='line-break'> </span>because ^<sup>under</sup> the vote passed at the last meeting a doubt<span class='line-break'> </span>had arisen whether <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->the Superintendent</a> was authorized to attend <span class='line-break'> </span>to any business at the Cemetery except by the direction of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots, in each specific case, and that said Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>were unwilling to assume any such duty of detail.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on Lots to instruct the Superintendent to attend to &amp; perform the necessary work at Cemetery _'>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots to instruct the Superintendent to attend to &amp; perform the necessary work at Cemetery _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a> it was</p>
<p>Voted that the Committee on Lots be requested, at their dis<span class='line-break'></span>cretion, to instruct <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->the Superintendent</a> to attend to and perform <span class='line-break'> </span>the necessary work at Mount Auburn.</p>
<p>~ Adjourned, Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134580">
<h3><a name="page-1134580">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 188)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>188</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ May 6. 1861.'>Trustees _ <date when='1861-05-06'>May 6. 1861</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>was held on <date when='1861-05-06T10:00:00'>Monday, May 6<sup>th</sup> A D 1861, at 10 o'clock<span class='line-break'> </span>Am.</date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, Messrs <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>, = 7.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read, also the <span class='line-break'> </span>marginal abstracts of the previous meetings in April.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on Supts a/cs report progress _'>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Supt<sup>s</sup> a/cs report progress _</span></p>
<p>The Chairman of the Committee appointed  to examine <span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent's accounts stated that the examina<span class='line-break'></span>tion was progressing, but that the Committee were not <span class='line-break'> </span>yet able to report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives designated to'>Representatives designated to</span></p>
<p>Upon petition of the parties in interest, the following <span class='line-break'> </span>persons were severally designated to represent the lots <span class='line-break'> </span>of deceased proprietors in connection with which they are <span class='line-break'> </span>named.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 120'><a href='/pages/subjects/82742' title='Lot 120'>Lot 120</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/82743' title='Walker, Edward C.'>Edward C. Walker</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/54347' title='Roxbury, MA'>Roxbury</a>, son of the late <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/82744' title='Walker, Samuel'>Samuel Walker</a>, proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/82742' title='Lot 120'>lot numbered <span class='line-break'> </span>120</a>, to represent said lot: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 475 '><a href='/pages/subjects/82745' title='Lot 475'>Lot 475</a> </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/82746' title='Scholfield, Isaac'>Isaac Scholfield</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, son of <a href='/pages/subjects/82747' title='Scholfield, Grace'>Grace Scholfield</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/82745' title='Lot 475'>lot no. 475</a>. to represent said <span class='line-break'> </span>lot: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 1565'><a href='/pages/subjects/82748' title='Lot 1565'>Lot 1565</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/82749' title='Smith, Chauncy'>Chauncy Smith</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a>, son-in law of <a href='/pages/subjects/82750' title='Marshall, Josiah N., Mrs.'>Mrs <span class='line-break'> </span>Josiah N. Marshall</a>, deceased, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/82748' title='Lot 1565'>lot <span class='line-break'> </span>numbered 1565</a>, to represent said lot: _</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134581">
<h3><a name="page-1134581">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 189)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>189</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 2221'><a href='/pages/subjects/82755' title='Lot 2221'>Lot 2221</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/82756' title='Rice, Thomas G.'>Thomas G. Rice</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/64864' title='Cambridgeport, MA'>Cambridgeport</a>, eldest son <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/82757' title='Rice, Aaron'>Aaron Rice</a>, deceased, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/82755' title='Lot 2221'>lot <span class='line-break'> </span>numbered 2221</a>, to represent said lot. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Letter from Dr J. V. C. Smith – charge against the Superintendent'>Letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/79959' title='Smith, Jerome V. C.'>Dr J. V. C. Smith</a> – charge against the Superintendent</span></p>
<p>A communication from <a href='/pages/subjects/79959' title='Smith, Jerome V. C.'>Dr J. V. C. Smith</a><span class='line-break'> </span>was read _ to the effect that he had been <span class='line-break'> </span>informed by <a href='/pages/subjects/59951' title='Lunt, E. L., Mr.'>Mr E. L. Lunt</a>, a painter, that <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr <span class='line-break'> </span>Mann</a>, the  Superintendent, had demanded of him <span class='line-break'> </span>a per centage on his labor there, for the privilege allowed<span class='line-break'> </span>him working on the premises.</p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Adjd Meeting _'>Adj<sup>d</sup> Meeting _</span></p>
<p>Voted that when the meeting adjourn, it be <span class='line-break'> </span>to next <date when='1861-05-13T10:00:00'>Monday, May 13<sup>th</sup>, at 10 o'clock a.m.</date>,<span class='line-break'> </span>to hear such testimony as the said <a href='/pages/subjects/59951' title='Lunt, E. L., Mr.'>E. L. Lunt</a><span class='line-break'> </span>may give in regard to the allegation said to be <span class='line-break'> </span>made by him, and to transact any other busi<span class='line-break'></span>ness that may come before the Board; and <span class='line-break'> </span>that <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->the Secretary</a> be directed to request the attendance <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/59951' title='Lunt, E. L., Mr.'>Mr Lunt</a>  upon  that day, and inform him that</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt required to reply to certain charges at next meeting'>Sup<sup>t</sup> required to reply to certain charges at next meeting</span></p>
<p>he shall be paid for his time; and also to <span class='line-break'> </span>notify <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> that he will be expected to <span class='line-break'> </span>attend that meeting, and make answer to the above<span class='line-break'></span>named charge, and to the following charges _ to wit,<span class='line-break'> </span>of short credits in the following accounts, viz. of <a href='/pages/subjects/59952' title='Thayer, Nathaniel'>Nathan<span class='line-break'></span>il Thayer</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59953' title='Drake, Tisdale'>Tisdale Drake</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/82759' title='Hooper, R. W.'>R. W. Hooper</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/82760' title='Reed, Benjamin'>Benj. T.  <span class='line-break'> </span>Reed</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/25005796' title='Whall, Joseph B.'>J. B. Whall's</a> Estate and <a href='/pages/subjects/55006' title='Wales, Thomas B.'>T. B. Wales</a>; and of <span class='line-break'> </span>receiving compensation for his services from <a href='/pages/subjects/59958' title='Borland, John'>John Borland</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Appropriation for Receiving Tomb _'>Appropriation for <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Receiving Tomb</a> _</span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>, Voted that the Committee on Grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>be authorized to expend one thousand dollars in addition to the ap<span class='line-break'></span>propriations already made for the construction of the <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Receiving Tomb</a>.</p>
<p>Adjourned, Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134582">
<h3><a name="page-1134582">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 190)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>190</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Adjd Meeting _ May 13, 1861 ~'>Trustees _ Adj<sup>d</sup> Meeting _ <date when='1861-05-13'>May 13, 1861</date> ~</span></p>
<p>The Trustees of Mount Auburn Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>met according to adjournment, on <date when='1861-05-13T10:00:00'>Monday May <span class='line-break'> </span>13<sup>th</sup> 1861, at 10 o'clock, a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, and <span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Alleged charge by E. L. Lunt not sustained _'>Alleged charge by <a href='/pages/subjects/59951' title='Lunt, E. L., Mr.'>E. L. Lunt</a> not sustained _</span></p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> moved that the Trustees proceed <span class='line-break'> </span>to examine the witness called in reference<span class='line-break'> </span>to the communication made to the Trustees, <span class='line-break'> </span>at the last meeting, by <a href='/pages/subjects/79959' title='Smith, Jerome V. C.'>Dr. J. V. C. Smith</a>, and <span class='line-break'> </span>as <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>'s counsel had requested it, that <span class='line-break'> </span>the witnesses be sworn, which motion was <span class='line-break'> </span>adopted.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/59951' title='Lunt, E. L., Mr.'>Mr Lunt</a> was sworn, and <a href='/pages/subjects/79959' title='Smith, Jerome V. C.'>Dr Smith</a>, upon <span class='line-break'> </span>request was affirmed.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/59951' title='Lunt, E. L., Mr.'>Mr Lunt</a> stated that the alleged <span class='line-break'> </span>conversation took place between his man <span class='line-break'> </span>named <a href='/pages/subjects/82761' title='Kinsman, William M.'>W<sup>m</sup>. M. Kinsman</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->the Superinten<span class='line-break'></span>dent</a>, as his man informed him _ that <span class='line-break'> </span>he himself never had any conversation <span class='line-break'> </span>with the superintendent on the subject _<span class='line-break'> </span>that he did wrong in so stating it as <span class='line-break'> </span>to give <a href='/pages/subjects/79959' title='Smith, Jerome V. C.'>Dr Smith</a> the impression that <span class='line-break'> </span><u>he</u> had the conversation.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/79959' title='Smith, Jerome V. C.'>Dr Smith</a> explained that he had <span class='line-break'> </span>no acquaintance with the superintendent,<span class='line-break'> </span>that he made his communication to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Board because he believed that <span class='line-break'> </span>so grave a charge should be brought</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134583">
<h3><a name="page-1134583">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 191)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>191</p>
<p>to the knowledge of the Trustees.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the testimony being only of <span class='line-break'> </span>a hearsay character, the allegation is not <span class='line-break'> </span>sustained, and the matter be dismissed.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent requests to appear by counsel _'>Superintendent requests to appear by counsel _</span></p>
<p>A written communication was <span class='line-break'> </span>laid before the Board by <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>declining to be a party to any hearing, <span class='line-break'> </span>unless he could have the assistance of <span class='line-break'> </span>his counsel.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Granted _'>Granted _</span></p>
<p>After some discussion, it was voted, <span class='line-break'> </span>upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>, that liberty be <span class='line-break'> </span>granted to <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> to appear with his <span class='line-break'> </span>counsel at the adjournment of this mee<span class='line-break'></span>ting.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, Voted <span class='line-break'> </span>that when this meeting adjourn, it <span class='line-break'> </span>be to <date when='1861-05-15T16:00:00'>Wednesday next 15<sup>th</sup> inst. at 4 o'clock<span class='line-break'> </span>P.M.</date>   Adjourned</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> Secy.</p>
<p>----------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='May 15. 1861 _ Trustees _ Adjourned meeting _'><date when='1861-05-15'>May 15. 1861</date> _ Trustees _ Adjourned meeting _</span></p>
<p>Adjourned meeting <date when='1861-05-15T16:00:00'>Wednesday May 15. 1861.<span class='line-break'> </span>4 O clock P. M.</date></p>
<p>Present, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, and Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read.</p>
<p>A communication from <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->the Superintendent</a>, Jonathan</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134584">
<h3><a name="page-1134584">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 192)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>192</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Communication of Jona Mann, declining to answer to charges except to them altogether, and Resigning the office of Superintent _'>Communication of <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Jon<sup>a</sup> Mann</a>, declining to answer to charges except to them altogether, and Resigning the office of Superintent _</span></p>
<p>Mann, was laid before the Board, declining <span class='line-break'> </span>upon advice of his counsel to appear at this meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>and reply to charges, on the ground that he was <span class='line-break'> </span>informed that other errors exist in the accounts, and <span class='line-break'> </span>that any hearing, unless upon all the allegations made<span class='line-break'> </span>against him and upon due notice of the same,<span class='line-break'> </span>would be imperfect, and most unjust.</p>
<p>He also tendered his resignation as<span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resignation accepted.'>Resignation accepted.</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Mr Tobey</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the resignation of <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Jon<sup>a</sup> Mann</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>as Superintendent of Mount Auburn be <span class='line-break'> </span>accepted, this Board having no reference <span class='line-break'> </span>by this act to any other portion of the <span class='line-break'> </span>subject matter of <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>'s communication  <span class='line-break'> </span>of this date, in which his resignation is tendered.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on Grounds authorized to employ Mr Mann, or other person until the further order of this Board.'>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Grounds authorized to employ <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>, or other person until the further order of this Board.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> stated that he was informed by <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59961' title='Merwin, Mr.'>Mr Merwin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>'s Counsel, that <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>was ready to serve the Corporation until the works in <span class='line-break'> </span>progress at Mount Auburn should be completed, <span class='line-break'> </span>if such was the pleasure of the Trustees, and <span class='line-break'> </span>upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> it was</p>
<p>Voted that the Committee on Grounds be <span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to employ <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>, or any other <span class='line-break'> </span>person, as they may see fit, until the <span class='line-break'> </span>further order of this Board. _</p>
<p>Adjourned _</p>
<p>Attest  <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134585">
<h3><a name="page-1134585">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 193)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>193</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ June 3. 1861.'>Trustees _ <date when='1861-06-03'>June 3. 1861</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn Cemetery was held on <date when='1861-06-03T10:00:00'>Monday,<span class='line-break'> </span>June 3<sup>d</sup>, 1861. at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> _</p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, and <span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>, Chairman of the Special Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>charged with the duty of making any recommenda<span class='line-break'></span>tions as to the mode of conducting the affairs of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation at the Cemetery, in future, stated that <span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee were not quite ready to report, but <span class='line-break'> </span>expected to be able to do so after another meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Adjd Meeting'>Adj<sup>d</sup> Meeting</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that when this meeting adjourn, it be <span class='line-break'> </span>to <date when='1861-06-05T16:00:00'>Wednesday next (5<sup>th</sup> inst) at 4 O'clock P. M.</date></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resignation of W. H. Spooner, Jr. as Gardener _ referred to Special Comee'>Resignation of <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>W. H. Spooner, Jr</a>. as Gardener _ referred to Special Com<sup>ee</sup></span></p>
<p>A communication from <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>W<sup>m</sup> H. Spooner, Jr</a><span class='line-break'> </span>complaining of the dishonorable competition into which <span class='line-break'> </span>the Gardener is brought with various other persons at <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery who solicit from proprietors the care of their <span class='line-break'> </span>lots, and tendering his resignation, as Gardener, <span class='line-break'> </span>was read, and upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that this communication be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the special committee on the reorganization of <span class='line-break'> </span>duties at the Cemetery.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned to <span class='line-break'> </span>Wednesday next, at 4 P.M.</p>
<p>Attest  <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134586">
<h3><a name="page-1134586">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 194)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>194</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees – Adjd Meeting. June 5. 1861.'>Trustees – Adj<sup>d</sup> Meeting. <date when='1861-06-05'>June 5. 1861</date>.</span></p>
<p><b>Adjourned Meeting of the Trustees of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn Cemetery</b></p>
<p><date when='1861-06-05T16:00:00'>June 5. 1861. 4 O'clock P. M.</date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, Messrs <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Comee on mode of conducting affairs at Cemetery _'>Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> on mode of conducting affairs at Cemetery _</span></p>
<p>The Committee appointed to investigate the <span class='line-break'> </span>accounts of the Superintendent, who were also <span class='line-break'> </span>requested to make any recommendations as to the <span class='line-break'> </span>mode of keeping said accounts, and of conducting <span class='line-break'> </span>the affairs of the Corporation at the Cemetery in<span class='line-break'> </span>the future, which in their judgment, the interests <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation might require, through <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr <span class='line-break'> </span>Nazro</a>, the Chairman, reported upon the mode<span class='line-break'> </span>of conducting the affairs of the Cemetery, reserving <span class='line-break'> </span>their report upon the Superintendents accounts to <span class='line-break'> </span>another day, and upon this duly asking farther<span class='line-break'> </span>time:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ordered to be printed _'>Ordered to be printed _</span></p>
<p>The report was read a second time by <span class='line-break'> </span>paragraphs, and informal conversation was had<span class='line-break'> </span>thereon, without a motion to adopt.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the report be printed, and a <span class='line-break'> </span>copy be sent to each of the Trustees.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned.</p>
<p>Attest  <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134587">
<h3><a name="page-1134587">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 195)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>195</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees - July 1. 1861'>Trustees - <date when='1861-07-01'>July 1. 1861</date></span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trus<span class='line-break'></span>tees was held on <date when='1861-07-01T10:00:00'>Monday, July 1. 1861. at <span class='line-break'> </span>10 o'clock, a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, Messrs <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a></p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mr Spooner the Gardener, requests to be heard on subject of his resignation _'><a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> the Gardener, requests to be heard on subject of his resignation _</span></p>
<p>A written request was received from <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>W<sup>m</sup> H.<span class='line-break'> </span>Spooner, Jr</a> to be heard on the matter of his res<span class='line-break'></span>ignation at this meeting.</p>
<p>No objection being made, <s>and</s> <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>was introduced, and he made some statements not con<span class='line-break'></span>tained in his letter of conditional resignation; but <span class='line-break'> </span>no action was taken.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of progress on Supt&apos;s accts.'>Report of progress on Supt's accts.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>, chairman of <small>the</small> committee appointed<span class='line-break'> </span>to investigate the accounts of the Superintendent,<span class='line-break'> </span>made a written report of progress in the examination,<span class='line-break'> </span>detailing some of the results so far as the investigation <span class='line-break'> </span>has proceeded: and the Committee asked for <span class='line-break'> </span>further time, which was granted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report in print on mode of conducting business of Cemetery.'>Report in print on mode of conducting business of Cemetery.</span></p>
<p>The report of the same Committee upon the mode<span class='line-break'> </span>of keeping the accounts, and of conducting the affairs <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation at the Cemetery, which had been <span class='line-break'> </span>printed, by order of the Board, next came up for <span class='line-break'> </span>action.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134588">
<h3><a name="page-1134588">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 196)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>196</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Acceptance of Report _ and informal discussion _ '>Acceptance of Report _ and informal discussion _ </span></p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>,</p>
<p>Voted to accept the report, for the purpose of <span class='line-break'> </span>discharging the Committee.</p>
<p>A considerable time was passed in discussing <span class='line-break'> </span>the different propositions embraced in the report;<span class='line-break'> </span>and several amendments were informally agreed to; but <span class='line-break'> </span>without any vote to adopt, the meeting was <span class='line-break'> </span>adjourned to the next <date when='1861-07-05T16:00:00'>Friday, July 5<sup>th</sup> at 4 O'clock P.M.</date></p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary.</p>
<p>------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Adjd meeting July 5, 1861 _'>Trustees Adj<sup>d</sup> meeting <date when='1861-07-05'>July 5, 1861</date> _</span></p>
<p><b>Adjourned Meeting of the Trustees</b> <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1861-07-05T16:00:00'>Friday July 5, 1861<span class='line-break'> </span>4 O'clock P. M.</date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, Messrs <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, _<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Complaint of Mrs M. E. Buttrick of injury to her lot _'>Complaint of <a href='/pages/subjects/82762' title='Buttrick, Margaret E.'>Mrs M. E. Buttrick</a> of injury to her lot _</span></p>
<p>Some letters were read which had been <span class='line-break'> </span>addressed to <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> on the subject of abuses <span class='line-break'> </span>upon lots, and impositions upon proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>by persons doing work on their own account.<span class='line-break'> </span>among which was one containing the complaint <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/82762' title='Buttrick, Margaret E.'>Mrs Margaret E. Buttrick</a>, that her lot <span class='line-break'> </span>being surrounded with a hedge, had been <span class='line-break'> </span>used as a repository of the stock and tools <span class='line-break'> </span>of some painter, whom <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->the Superintendent</a> had <span class='line-break'> </span>identified, as he stated in a note addressed <span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134589">
<h3><a name="page-1134589">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 197)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>197</p>
<p>to a friend of the proprietor, to be <a href='/pages/subjects/59951' title='Lunt, E. L., Mr.'>E. L. Lunt</a>, of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a>,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. on Lots authorized to repair damage to lot of Mrs Buttrick _'>Com. on Lots authorized to repair damage to lot of <a href='/pages/subjects/82762' title='Buttrick, Margaret E.'>Mrs Buttrick</a> _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>.</p>
<p>Voted that the Committee on Lots be author<span class='line-break'></span>ized to repair the damage done to the lot of <a href='/pages/subjects/82762' title='Buttrick, Margaret E.'>Mrs <span class='line-break'> </span>Buttrick</a>, at the expense of the Corporation, if they <span class='line-break'> </span>see fit.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='also to commence suit vs. E. L. Lunt for the injury _'>also to commence suit vs. <a href='/pages/subjects/59951' title='Lunt, E. L., Mr.'>E. L. Lunt</a> for the injury _</span></p>
<p>And it was further voted _ upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>That the Committee on Lots be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>cause a suit to be commenced at the expense of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation, against the said <a href='/pages/subjects/59951' title='Lunt, E. L., Mr.'>E. L. Lunt</a>, if they <span class='line-break'> </span>shall be satisfied that the foregoing charge can <span class='line-break'> </span>be sustained, or against any other person or persons<span class='line-break'> </span>who may have committed depredations upon lots <span class='line-break'> </span>or the grounds.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Conduct of Affairs at Cemetery _ Report taken up _'>Conduct of Affairs at Cemetery _ Report taken up _</span></p>
<p>The unfinishd business _ the printed report <span class='line-break'> </span>upon the mode of conducting the affairs of the Ceme<span class='line-break'></span>tery _ then came up.</p>
<p>Upon that portion which recommends proprietors <span class='line-break'> </span>wishing work done on their lots to employ the super<span class='line-break'></span>intendent only _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resolution offered _'>Resolution offered _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> moved a resolution <span class='line-break'> </span>to the effect that no person other than the Superinten<span class='line-break'></span>dent and those in his employ should perform any <span class='line-break'> </span>work on a lot without a permit obtained by the pro<span class='line-break'></span>prietor wishing work done on his lot, upon certain <span class='line-break'> </span>terms and conditions specified.</p>
<p>Which was lost not having five votes.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134590">
<h3><a name="page-1134590">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 198)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>198</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resolutions proposed for Conduct of Work at Cem.y.'>Resolutions proposed for Conduct of Work at Cem.y.</span></p>
<p>He then moved a similar resolution, <span class='line-break'> </span>but with some modification, and that the <span class='line-break'> </span>same be printed together with those that were <span class='line-break'> </span>agreed upon at the last meeting, and that <span class='line-break'> </span>copies of the same be sent to the Trustees,<span class='line-break'> </span>which was ordered. _</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>, it was <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that a resolution embracing the recom<span class='line-break'></span>mendations of the report upon the same subject, <span class='line-break'> </span>be also printed and sent to the members of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee chosen to nominate three candidates for office of Superintendent _'>Com<sup>ee</sup> chosen to nominate three candidates for office of Superintendent _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that a Committee of three be chosen <span class='line-break'> </span>to nominate to this board three persons as <span class='line-break'> </span>suitable candidates for the office of Superintendent,<span class='line-break'> </span>and Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> were <span class='line-break'> </span>so chosen. _</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Mr Tobey</a></p>
<p>Voted that when this meeting adjourn <span class='line-break'> </span>it be to <date when='1861-07-13T09:30:00'>Saturday, July 13<sup>th</sup> at 9½ O'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134591">
<h3><a name="page-1134591">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 199)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>199</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Adjd meeting _ July 13. 1861.'>Adj<sup>d</sup> meeting _ <date when='1861-07-13'>July 13. 1861</date>.</span></p>
<p>Adjourned meeting of the Trustees,<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1861-07-13T09:30:00'>Saturday, July 13<sup>th</sup>, 9½ A.M.</date></p>
