<p>Present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>and subsequently Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read.</p>
<p>The resolves which were moved and <span class='line-break'> </span>ordered to be printed, were read as printed.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> moved to take up the unfinished <span class='line-break'> </span>business of the report, and submitted the <span class='line-break'> </span>following resolution: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resolution to abolish the office of Gardener rejected _'>Resolution to abolish the office of Gardener rejected _</span></p>
<p>"That, as <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a>, the Gardener, has <span class='line-break'> </span>resigned his position, and as that officer,<span class='line-break'> </span>although appointed by the Trustees, is merely a <span class='line-break'> </span>nominal employee of the Corporation, and not <span class='line-break'> </span>accountable to the Trustees, except for any viola<span class='line-break'></span>tion of the rules of the Cemetery, the office <span class='line-break'> </span>of Gardener be hereby abolished." _</p>
<p>and moved the adoption of it which was <span class='line-break'> </span>put, and rejected.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> also submitted the following resolu<span class='line-break'></span>tion: _</p>
<p>"It being necessary that a suitable room be pro<span class='line-break'></span>vided for the transaction of the business of the <span class='line-break'> </span>office, where the books and accounts can</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134592">
<h3><a name="page-1134592">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 200)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>200</p>
<p>be properly kept, and there being no room <span class='line-break'> </span>now of sufficient capacity, and as there is <span class='line-break'> </span>no room for the accommodation of ladies <span class='line-break'> </span>and children , in the grounds,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resolution to finish off additional rooms at the Gate and Water Closet _ rejected by yea &amp; nay vote _'>Resolution to finish off additional rooms at the Gate and Water Closet _ rejected by yea &amp; nay vote _</span></p>
<p>That a room be finished between<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>the principal gate</a> and the office now used<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Gate Keeper, which, in connection with <span class='line-break'> </span>the present office, shall be used as the office <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Treasurer, and that a similar room <span class='line-break'> </span>be made on the right of <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->the Gate</a> for the accom<span class='line-break'></span>modation of visitors _ and that water-closets <span class='line-break'> </span>be placed in the small apartment for <span class='line-break'> </span>the accommodation of ladies and children,"</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> moved the adoption of this resolution <span class='line-break'> </span>by a yea and nay vote, _</p>
<p>and Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> voted nay, and <span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a> voted yea _<span class='line-break'> </span>so the resolution was rejected.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Printed resolves on conduct of affairs at Cemetery - taken up, &amp; verbal amendts offered _ .'>Printed resolves on conduct of affairs at Cemetery - taken up, &amp; verbal amend<sup>ts</sup> offered _ .</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> then moved to take up the resolu<span class='line-break'></span>tions printed as ordered at the last meeting,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that the Second Resolution be amended <span class='line-break'> </span>by striking out in the first line the words _ "He <span class='line-break'> </span>shall attend at his office at all times except<span class='line-break'> </span>on Sunday," and insert instead - "He shall <span class='line-break'> </span>attend at his office there at such times as the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Finance shall order." _<span class='line-break'> </span>and by striking out at the end of the res<span class='line-break'></span>olution the words "It shall be distinctly under-</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134593">
<h3><a name="page-1134593">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 201)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>201</p>
<p>stood that his whole time shall be given <span class='line-break'> </span>to the work and interest of Mount Auburn". _</p>
<p>and the amendment was adopted.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> then moved _</p>
<p>That it is the sense of this Board <span class='line-break'> </span>that the following resolutions be adopted, <span class='line-break'> </span>subject to such verbal alterations as may <span class='line-break'> </span>hereafter be made: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resolve on  Duties of amended July 20.1861, Superintenent _'>Resolve on  Duties of amended <date when='1861-07-20'>July 20.1861</date>, Superintenent _</span></p>
<p>Resolved, _<span class='line-break'> </span><u>First</u>, The Superintendent shall have no charge <span class='line-break'> </span>or control of the receiving and disbursing of moneys of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation.  It shall be his duty at the close <span class='line-break'> </span>of each [^<sup>week</sup>day] to render to the Treasurer, or his clerk, <span class='line-break'> </span>an accurate statement of the name of each laborer<span class='line-break'> </span>employed, the amount of labor performed, and the <span class='line-break'> </span>rate of wages to be paid.  If any work be done by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation for proprietors, he shall keep a particular <span class='line-break'> </span>account of the same, and, when finished, report <span class='line-break'> </span>it immediately to the Treasurer.  In all other respects <span class='line-break'> </span>his duties shall be the same as at present.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resolve on duties as amended July 20. 1861, of Treasurer.'>Resolve on duties as amended <date when='1861-07-20'>July 20. 1861,</date> of Treasurer.</span></p>
<p><u>Second</u>. The Treasurer shall have an office at <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn, and shall attend ______<span class='line-break'> </span>there, at such times as the Committee on Finance<span class='line-break'> </span>shall order, [^<sup>either in person</sup> himself] or by his Clerk, who shall <span class='line-break'> </span>be a person approved by the Committee on Finance,<span class='line-break'> </span>and for whose acts the Treasurer shall be <span class='line-break'> </span>responsible.  He shall have a time-table,</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134594">
<h3><a name="page-1134594">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 202)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>202</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='as amended July 20.1861'>as amended <date when='1861-07-20'>July 20.1861</date></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resolve (as amended July 20 1861 by striking out) on duties of Treasurer _ continued _'>Resolve (as amended <date when='1861-07-20'>July 20 1861</date> by striking out) on duties of Treasurer _ continued _</span></p>
<p>[<sup>in which</sup>and] shall ^<sup>be</sup> enter <sup>ed</sup> [therein daily], in accordance <span class='line-break'> </span>with the report to be made to him by the Superinten<span class='line-break'></span>dent, the name of each laborer, the amount of <span class='line-break'> </span>labor performed, and the rate of wages; and at <span class='line-break'> </span>the end of each month make <span class='line-break'> </span>and exhibit [<s>the same</s>] to the Committee on Finance <sup>a pay-roll,</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>which shall contain the names of all the laborers <span class='line-break'> </span>employed during that month, the amount of labor <span class='line-break'> </span>performed by each, and wages paid therefor,<span class='line-break'> </span>duly receipted for by said laborers.</p>
<p>He shall pay and receive, as Treasurer, and <span class='line-break'> </span>in the name of the Corporation, only such money <span class='line-break'> </span>as the Corporation shall be liable for, or as may <span class='line-break'> </span>be due to it, and not receive and receipt for sums <span class='line-break'> </span>which may be due from the proprietors to contractors,<span class='line-break'> </span>independent of the Corporation.  He shall collect<span class='line-break'> </span>and pay all bills, receive and disburse all <span class='line-break'> </span>moneys, and perform all the duties usually per<span class='line-break'></span>taining to the office of Treasurer, as well as <span class='line-break'> </span>others which it may be found expedient here<span class='line-break'></span>after to assign to him.  He shall give bonds<span class='line-break'> </span>with surety satisfactory to the Board of Trustees, <span class='line-break'> </span>in the sum of five thousand dollars.  He shall <span class='line-break'> </span>keep all moneys belonging to the Corporation depos<span class='line-break'></span>ited in such Bank as the Committee on Finance <span class='line-break'> </span>shall designate, to his credit as Treasurer of <span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn Cemetery.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gatekeeper.'>Gatekeeper.</span></p>
<p><u>Third</u>, There shall be a Gate Keeper, whose duty <span class='line-break'> </span>shall be to attend the Gate and perform such</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134595">
<h3><a name="page-1134595">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 203)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>203</p>
<p>other services as he can without interference <span class='line-break'> </span>with that work; and in the necessary absence <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Treasurer, or his Clerk, he shall receive <span class='line-break'> </span>such burial fees as may be paid, and <span class='line-break'> </span>pass the same immediately to the Treasurer<span class='line-break'> </span>or his Clerk, on his return.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Restriction upon Work _'>Restriction upon Work _</span></p>
<p><u>Fourth</u>.  No person other than the proper<span class='line-break'> </span>officers and servants of the Corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>shall be allowed to perform any work on <span class='line-break'> </span>any lot in the Cemetery without the written <span class='line-break'> </span>authority of the proprietor of such lot, and <span class='line-break'> </span>upon a permit to be issued as hereinafter<span class='line-break'> </span>provided.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Not to be performed by persons other than officers or Servants of the Corpn without a Permit _'>Not to be performed by persons other than officers or Servants of the Corp<sup>n</sup> without a Permit _</span></p>
<p>Any proprietor desiring work to be done <span class='line-break'> </span>upon his lot by any person other than the <span class='line-break'> </span>officers or servants of the Corporation shall apply<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Secretary for a permit, stating in his <span class='line-break'> </span>application the work to be done, and the per<span class='line-break'></span>son whom he proposes to employ, and enga<span class='line-break'></span>ging to be responsible for all injury and damage<span class='line-break'> </span>done by his workmen, either to the grounds or <span class='line-break'> </span>^<sup>other</sup> property of the Corporation or of any ~~~<span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor.  Upon such application, a permit <span class='line-break'> </span>shall be granted which shall in like manner, <span class='line-break'> </span>specify the work to be done, and the person <span class='line-break'> </span>by whom to be done, and that such propri<span class='line-break'></span>etor is responsible for the acts of those employed.<span class='line-break'> </span>All such work shall be done under the charge <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Superintendent.  Nothing herein con-</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134596">
<h3><a name="page-1134596">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 204)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>204</p>
<p>tained shall be held to prevent any proprietor <span class='line-break'> </span>from performing, in person, any work on his <span class='line-break'> </span>own lot."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Amendt. proposed by Mr Nazro-'>Amend<sup>t</sup>. proposed by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>-</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> moved as an amendment to <span class='line-break'> </span>these resolutions to strike out all after the <span class='line-break'> </span>word "Resolved"- and to insert the propo<span class='line-break'></span>sitions contained in the report of the Committee, <span class='line-break'> </span>which motion was lost.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Foregoing Resolutions adopted as a whole by a yea &amp; nay vote.'>Foregoing Resolutions adopted as a whole by a yea &amp; nay vote.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> called for the yeas and nays, <span class='line-break'> </span>which were ordered, with the following <span class='line-break'> </span>result. _</p>
<p>Yeas - Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>. _</p>
<p>Nays - Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='and referred to comee of three for Verbal amendts.'>and referred to com<sup>ee</sup> of three for Verbal amend<sup>ts</sup>.</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the resolutions as adopted be <span class='line-break'> </span>referred to a Committee of three for such <span class='line-break'> </span>verbal corrections as may be needed, and</p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a> were <span class='line-break'> </span>chosen as the Committee.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a> came in, and desired that his <span class='line-break'> </span>vote should be recorded against the four <span class='line-break'> </span>resolutions offered by <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>, and leave was <span class='line-break'> </span>accordingly granted.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134597">
<h3><a name="page-1134597">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 205)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>205</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mr Nazro resigns as member of Comee on Investigation of Accounts _ and withdraws same _'><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> resigns as member of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Investigation of Accounts _ and withdraws same _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> tendered his resignation as <span class='line-break'> </span>a member of the Committee on investigation <span class='line-break'> </span>of accounts, but subsequently withdrew it <span class='line-break'> </span>at the request of members of the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Compensation of Officers referred to Comee of Three'>Compensation of Officers referred to Com<sup>ee</sup> of Three</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> moved that the question <span class='line-break'> </span>of the general subject of salaries and compen<span class='line-break'></span>sation of officers of the Corporation be referred<span class='line-break'> </span>to a Committee of three to report upon at <span class='line-break'> </span>the next meeting, which was adopted. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Reconsidered and re-ferred to Comee on Inves-tigation of accounts _ '>Reconsidered and re-ferred to Com<sup>ee</sup> on Inves-tigation of accounts _ </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> moved that the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>of Finance together with <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a> be that<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> objecting to serve on that Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee on the ground that the subject had <span class='line-break'> </span>already been referred to the other Committee, <span class='line-break'> </span>and that the portion of their report relating <span class='line-break'> </span>to this matter had not been acted upon, _</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> moved a reconsideration <span class='line-break'> </span>of the last vote _</p>
<p>And that so much of the report of the <span class='line-break'> </span>investigating Committee as relates to the <span class='line-break'> </span>compensation of officers be referred back to <span class='line-break'> </span>that Committee, to report upon at the next <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting,</p>
<p>The reconsidertion prevailed, and <span class='line-break'> </span>the motion was adopted.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134598">
<h3><a name="page-1134598">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 206)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>206</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee to nominate Candidates for Office of  Supt. report _'>Com<sup>ee</sup> to nominate <u>Candidates</u> for <u>Office of</u> <u> Supt.</u> report _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> as Chairman presented the <span class='line-break'> </span>following report: _</p>
<p>"The Committee to whom was assigned <span class='line-break'> </span>the duty of selecting the names of three per<span class='line-break'></span>sons to be presented to the Board as Candidates <span class='line-break'> </span>for the office of Superintendent of Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn Cemetery, report the following: _</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Daniel L. Winsor</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52528' title='Folsom, Charles W.'>Charles W. Folsom</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/82766' title='Story, E. Augustus'>E. Augustus Story</a>.</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Chas. G. Nazro</a></th> <th>}<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>(signed)</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C.P. Curtis</a></td> <td>} Com<sup>ee</sup> </td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Edw<sup>d</sup> Rand</a></td> <td>}</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Accepted _'>Accepted _</span></p>
<p>The report was accepted. _</p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that when this meeting is adjourned<span class='line-break'> </span>it be to <date when='1861-07-20T10:00:00'>Saturday, July 20<sup>th</sup> at 10 o'clock am</date></p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned,</p>
<p>Attest <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Sec.y</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134599">
<h3><a name="page-1134599">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 207)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>207</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Adjd Meeting _  July 20, 1861 _'>Trustees _ Adj<sup>d</sup> Meeting _  <date when='1861-07-20'>July 20, 1861</date> _</span></p>
<p>Trustees Adjourned Meeting, <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1861-07-20T10:00:00'>Saturday, July 20, 1861. 10 o'clock a.m. </date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, and <span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee to suggest Verbal Alterations _ Report _'>Com<sup>ee</sup> to suggest Verbal Alterations _ Report _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> for the Committee appointed <span class='line-break'> </span>to suggest any verbal alterations in the resolu<span class='line-break'></span>tions adopted at the last meeting, which might <span class='line-break'> </span>be deemed necessary, reported back the resolutions <span class='line-break'> </span>with the following suggestions. _</p>
<p>In the second resolution, second line _ instead of the words<span class='line-break'> </span>"himself, or by his Clerk, insert, either in person or by his <span class='line-break'> </span>Clerk."</p>
<p>In third line insert, instead of the words "and shall enter<span class='line-break'> </span>therein daily", the words "in which shall be entered daily."</p>
<p>and transpose the last sentence so as to read, <span class='line-break'> </span>"and at the end of each month make and exhibit<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Committee on Finance a pay-roll."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Further Amendments proposed and Adopted _'>Further Amendments proposed and Adopted _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the verbal alterations recommended be adopted.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted to reconsider the first resolution, and amend<span class='line-break'> </span>the same by substituting the word "week" for "day" in the <span class='line-break'> </span>second line.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134600">
<h3><a name="page-1134600">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 208)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>208</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='July 20. 1861 _'><date when='1861-07-20'>July 20. 1861</date> _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion also by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted to reconsider the first paragraph of <span class='line-break'> </span>the second resolution and amend the same <span class='line-break'> </span>by striking out the word "daily" in the second line.</p>
<p>And for convenience the several verbal alterations and <span class='line-break'> </span>amendments were allowed to be inserted in the <span class='line-break'> </span>resolutions as recorded with the transactions of the <span class='line-break'> </span>last previous meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Amendt to By-laws refd to Comee which reported Verbal Alterations _'>Amend<sup>t</sup> to By-laws ref<sup>d</sup> to Com<sup>ee</sup> which reported Verbal Alterations _</span></p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the Committee which has reported the <span class='line-break'> </span>verbal amendments be requested to examine and <span class='line-break'> </span>report what alterations of and amendments to <span class='line-break'> </span>the by-laws are rendered necessary by the adoption <span class='line-break'> </span>of the above-named orders.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='#'>#</span><span class='line-break'> </span>[For a part of the record omitted in this place, see next page]</p>
<p>It was then voted to proceed to the choice of a <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent, to fill the vacancy occasioned by <span class='line-break'> </span>the resignation of <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Jonathan Mann</a>.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> stated that of the three candidates sub<span class='line-break'></span>mitted at the last meeting for the consideration of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees, <a href='/pages/subjects/52528' title='Folsom, Charles W.'>Mr Folsum</a> had accepted an appointment<span class='line-break'> </span>in Col. Lee's Regiment of Massachusetts volunteers for<span class='line-break'> </span>the war, and ^<sup>his name</sup> was therefore no longer before the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Capt. Daniel L. Winsor Chosen Superintendent _'><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Daniel L. Winsor</a> Chosen Superintendent _</span></p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, it was</p>
<p>Voted unaminously that <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Daniel L. Winsor</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134601">
<h3><a name="page-1134601">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 209)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>209</p>
<p>be chosen Superintendent as aforesaid.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Capt. Winsor requested to enter upon his duties prior to 1st day of September'><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor</a> requested to enter upon his duties prior to <date when='1861-09-01'>1<sup>st</sup> day of September</date></span></p>
<p>It was further voted</p>
<p>That <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor</a> be requested to enter<span class='line-break'> </span>upon his duties at such time after the 1<sup>st</sup> day <span class='line-break'> </span>of August and prior to the 1<sup>st</sup> day of September,<span class='line-break'> </span>as shall suit his convenience.</p>
<p>Voted that when this meeting adjourn, <span class='line-break'> </span>it be to Saturday next at 10 o'clock.</p>
<p>Adjourned,<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Sec.y.</p>
<p>[ The following was accidentally omitted on the preceding page]<span class='line-break'> </span>[ and is to be taken as a part of the record of the doings]<span class='line-break'> </span>[ at the meeting of <date when='1861-07-20'>July 20<sup>st</sup>.</date>]</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salaries and  Compensation of Officers fixed-'>Salaries and  Compensation of Officers fixed-</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> for the Special Committee submitted<span class='line-break'> </span>the following report: _</p>
<p>"The Committee on Investigation &amp;c having had the sub<span class='line-break'></span>ject of salaries of the officers recommitted to them, and having <span class='line-break'> </span>given their attention to it, now recommend _</p>
<p>That the salary of the Superintendent be $1000 per annum,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the use of the house now occupied by <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>: _</p>
<p>That the Treasurer shall receive the same compensation <span class='line-break'> </span>as at present: -</p>
<p>That the Gatekeeper shall receive $400 per annum: _</p>
<p>That the Secretary shall receive $500 per annum and <span class='line-break'> </span>the fees for deeds ^<sup>as</sup> now charged.</p>
<p>And the report was adopted.  Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134602">
<h3><a name="page-1134602">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 210)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>210</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Adjd Meeting _ July 27, 1861 _'>Trustees Adj<sup>d</sup> Meeting _ <date when='1861-07-27'>July 27, 1861</date> _</span></p>
<p>Trustees Adjourned Meeting <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1861-07-27T10:00:00'>Saturday, July 27<sup>th</sup> 1861. 10 a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on Amendts to By-laws report _ Laid on table till next meeting _'>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Amend<sup>ts</sup> to By-laws report _ Laid on table till next meeting _</span></p>
<p>The Committee chosen to consider and <span class='line-break'> </span>report what alterations of and amendments <span class='line-break'> </span>to the by-laws were necessary reported in <span class='line-break'> </span>writing, proposing various amendments <span class='line-break'> </span>detailed at length in their report.</p>
<p>These were read twice, and laid on <span class='line-break'> </span>the table until the next meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Additional Amendt proposed by Mr Rand _'>Additional Amend<sup>t</sup> proposed by <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> proposed the following <span class='line-break'> </span>amendment in addition to those reported, <span class='line-break'> </span>viz.  In Art 31<sup>st</sup>, line 7, to strike out the <span class='line-break'> </span>words _"music nor".</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mr Spooner, the Gardener, again sends in his resignation _ which was Refd  to Comee.'><a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a>, the Gardener, again sends in his resignation _ which was Ref<sup>d</sup>  to Com<sup>ee</sup>.</span></p>
<p>A communication was received from <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>reiterating his resignation, and making some <span class='line-break'> </span>suggestions, as to what might be realized by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation from the care of lots.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the communication of <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>be referred to Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a><span class='line-break'> </span>to consider the expediency of accepting his resig<span class='line-break'></span>nation, and to report on the whole subject. _</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134603">
<h3><a name="page-1134603">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 211)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>211</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Standard of prices for Work - Books and Forms refd to Comee'>Standard of prices for Work - Books and Forms ref<sup>d</sup> to Com<sup>ee</sup></span></p>
<p>Also on motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the question what standard <span class='line-break'> </span>shall be adopted for charges for work or <span class='line-break'> </span>materials upon the lots of proprietors, and <span class='line-break'> </span>what books and forms shall be used for the<span class='line-break'> </span>same be referred to the Committee last named.</p>
<p>Inquiry was made when the Investigating Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>would be prepared to report.</p>
<p>The Committee stated that they would report<span class='line-break'> </span>at the next meeting, and if the investigations <span class='line-break'> </span>should not then have been finished, the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>would order the investigation to be completed or <span class='line-break'> </span>otherwise as they should see fit. _</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned,</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Sec.y.</p>
<p>-----------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Aug. 5. 1861 _'>Trustees <date when='1861-08-05'>Aug. 5. 1861</date> _</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held on <date when='1861-08-05T10:00:00'>Monday, August 5. 1861, at 10 o'clock<span class='line-break'> </span>a.m. </date></p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tomb authorized on lot of John Clark - no. 2105 _'>Tomb authorized on lot of <a href='/pages/subjects/72322' title='Clark, John'>John Clark</a> - <a href='/pages/subjects/82770' title='Lot 2105'>no. 2105</a> _</span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/72322' title='Clark, John'>Mr John Clark</a>, proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/82770' title='Lot 2105'>lot <span class='line-break'> </span>numbered 2105</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/61175' title='Elm Avenue'>Elm Avenue</a>, be authorized, upon <span class='line-break'> </span>payment of fifty dollars, to build a tomb in said <span class='line-break'> </span>lot, under the direction of the Committee on Lots,</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134604">
<h3><a name="page-1134604">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 212)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>212</p>
<p><date when='1861-08-05'>Aug. 5. 1861.</date></p>
<p>and in conformity with the by-laws.</p>
<p>The adoption of the following amendments to the <span class='line-break'> </span>by-laws was moved by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, and passed unanimously.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Amendts to By-laws adopted _'>Amend<sup>ts</sup> to By-laws adopted _</span></p>
<p>[The references are to the finished code.]</p>
<p>Page 30, art 3. _ Officers.</p>
<p>the words "and Superintendent's Clerk" stricken out,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary-'>Secretary-</span></p>
<p>Art. 5. Secretary,<span class='line-break'> </span>Page 32 line 10, the words "cards of admission" inserted <span class='line-break'> </span>instead of – "tickets".</p>
<p>And, at the end of the sentence, the following –</p>
<p>"He  shall, when requested, issue a permit to any <span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor to employ persons to work upon his lot,<span class='line-break'> </span>other than the Superintendent and his workmen;<span class='line-break'> </span>and such proprietor shall sign a written agreement<span class='line-break'> </span>to be responsible for all injury and damage done <span class='line-break'> </span>by the persons so employed to the grounds or property <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation or of any proprietor."</p>
<p>At the end of the paragraph the following added: _</p>
<p>"He shall keep a duplicate register  of the inter<span class='line-break'></span>ments in the Cemetery, together with all the vouchers<span class='line-break'> </span>or orders of interment properly filed."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer'>Treasurer</span></p>
<p>Art 6 _ Treasurer.</p>
<p>Page 32, Art 6. line 2. _ "five" instead of "three".</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134605">
<h3><a name="page-1134605">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 213)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>213</p>
<p>Page 33. line 2 &amp;c. Instead of "He shall collect <span class='line-break'> </span>dues and pay bills approved by the President, or <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Chairman of any committee duly authorizing <span class='line-break'> </span>an expenditure" _ the following inserted: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer continued _'>Treasurer continued _</span></p>
<p>"He shall collect all moneys that may be due <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Corporation, and pay all bills which shall <span class='line-break'> </span>be first approved by the President, or by the <span class='line-break'> </span>chairman of any committee duly authorizing an <span class='line-break'> </span>expenditure, or by the Secretary and Superintendent, <span class='line-break'> </span>of expenditures not otherwise provided for within <span class='line-break'> </span>their respective departments."</p>
<p>At the end of the paragraph on p. 33 line 12<span class='line-break'> </span>inserted: _</p>
<p>"He shall have an office at Mount Auburn, <span class='line-break'> </span>where he shall be in attendance at such times <span class='line-break'> </span>as the Committee on Finance shall order, either in <span class='line-break'> </span>person, or by his Clerk, who shall be a person <span class='line-break'> </span>approved by the Committee on Finance, and for whose<span class='line-break'> </span>acts the Treasurer shall be responsible.  He shall<span class='line-break'> </span>keep a time table, in which shall be entered, in <span class='line-break'> </span>accordance with the report to be made to him by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent, the name of each laborer the amount <span class='line-break'> </span>of labor performed, and the rate of wages; and at <span class='line-break'> </span>the end of each month make and exhibit to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Finance a pay-roll, which shall contain <span class='line-break'> </span>the names of all the laborers employed during that <span class='line-break'> </span>month, the amount of labor performed by each,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the wages paid threfor, duly receipted for <span class='line-break'> </span>by said laborers."</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134606">
<h3><a name="page-1134606">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 214)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>214</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Aug. 5. 1861. '><date when='1861-08-05'>Aug. 5. 1861</date>. </span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent _'>Superintendent _</span></p>
<p>Superintendent</p>
<p>Page 33, Art 7. 9<sup>th</sup> line stricken out _ "and to pay <span class='line-break'> </span>their wages not othrwise provided for."</p>
<p>Page 34.  From 18<sup>th</sup> line, beginning with "Also of all <span class='line-break'> </span>moneys" _ down to "The Compensation of the Super<span class='line-break'></span>intendent" &amp;c, stricken out, and the following inserted ;</p>
<p>"He shall have no charge or control of the <span class='line-break'> </span>receiving and disbursing of moneys of the Corporation.<span class='line-break'> </span>He shall, at the close of each week, render to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer, or his Clerk, an accurate statement of<span class='line-break'> </span>the name of each laborer employed, the amount <span class='line-break'> </span>of labor performed, and the rate of wage to be<span class='line-break'> </span>paid.  He shall enter in a book kept for the purpose <span class='line-break'> </span>every order for work of any kind upon a lot, or for <span class='line-break'> </span>materials to be furnished, which order shall specify,<span class='line-break'> </span>so far as may be, the work to be done, and the <span class='line-break'> </span>price therefor, and which shall be signed by the <span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor, or other person who  he shall be satisfied <span class='line-break'> </span>is authorized to give the order. He shall keep in <span class='line-break'> </span>particular account of all work done by the Corpor<span class='line-break'></span>ation for proprietors, and report the same when <span class='line-break'> </span>finished immediately to the Treasurer. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supts Clerk _ Art. abolished _'>Supt<sup>s</sup> Clerk _ Art. abolished _</span></p>
<p>Page 35. Art 8. "Superintendent's Clerk" - stricken out,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gatekeeper _'>Gatekeeper _</span></p>
<p>Page 35, Art 9. Gatekeeper _ the following clause added <span class='line-break'> </span>at the end: _</p>
<p>"And in the absence of the Treasurer or his Clerk shall receive <span class='line-break'> </span>such burial fees as may be paid, and pass the same</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134607">
<h3><a name="page-1134607">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 215)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>215</p>
<p>immediately to the Treasurer or his Clerk, on his return;<span class='line-break'> </span>and shall perform such other duties as the Super<span class='line-break'></span>intendent or other officers may require, without inter<span class='line-break'></span>ference with his regular occupation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Collection &amp; Payment  _ art. abolished _'>Collection &amp; Payment  _ art. abolished _</span></p>
<p>Art 28, "Collection and payment of money"<span class='line-break'> </span>stricken out, and in place thereof, the <span class='line-break'> </span>following new article inserted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Work on Lots _'>Work on Lots _</span></p>
<p>"Work on Lots."</p>
<p>"No person other than the proper officrs and <span class='line-break'> </span>servants of the Corporation shall be allowed<span class='line-break'> </span>to perform any work on any lot in the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>without the written authority of the proprietor <span class='line-break'> </span>of such lot, and upon a permit to be issued<span class='line-break'> </span>in the following manner: _</p>
<p>Such proprietor shall apply to the Secretary <span class='line-break'> </span>for a permit, stating in his application the work <span class='line-break'> </span>to be done, and the person whom he proposes<span class='line-break'> </span>to employ, and agreeing to be responsible for all <span class='line-break'> </span>injury and damage done by his workmen, <span class='line-break'> </span>either to the grounds or other property of the Corpor<span class='line-break'></span>ation, or of any proprietor.  Thereupon, a permit <span class='line-break'> </span>shall be granted stating the facts contained<span class='line-break'> </span>in the application, and that such proprietor<span class='line-break'> </span>is responsible for the acts of those employed <span class='line-break'> </span>by him.  All such work shall be done under<span class='line-break'> </span>the supervision and control of the Superintendent.<span class='line-break'> </span>Nothing herein contained shall be held to <span class='line-break'> </span>prevent any proprietor from performing, in</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134608">
<h3><a name="page-1134608">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 216)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>206</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Aug. 5. 1861-'><date when='1861-08-05'>Aug. 5. 1861</date>-</span></p>
<p>person, any work on his own lot." _</p>
<p>Art 31, line 7. (page 52)</p>
<p>'The words "music nor" stricken out.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Comee on Resignation of Mr Spooner _'>Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Resignation of <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a> of the Committee to whom was <span class='line-break'> </span>referred the resignation of <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a>, in the <span class='line-break'> </span>absence of <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>, reported verbally that the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee had had an interview with <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr <span class='line-break'> </span>Spooner</a>, and found that he had been subject <span class='line-break'> </span>to great annoyance in an unjust competition,<span class='line-break'> </span>as well as in the loss of plants and flowers set <span class='line-break'> </span>out that they thought it desirable to retain <span class='line-break'> </span>him,  and believed that if the Trustees would <span class='line-break'> </span>adopt stringent measures for the regulation of <span class='line-break'> </span>outside workmen, he would eventually find <span class='line-break'> </span>encouragement to continue.  <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> had <span class='line-break'> </span>also asked for additional protection.</p>
<p>The Committee therefore recommended, and he <span class='line-break'> </span>moved, the following vote, which was adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Further Regulations for Protection of the Grounds _'>Further Regulations for Protection of the Grounds _</span></p>
<p>"Whereas injury has often been done <span class='line-break'> </span>to the property ___________________ of other proprietors,<span class='line-break'> </span>and great untidiness caused by the negligence<span class='line-break'> </span>or wilfulness of persons employed in the preparation <span class='line-break'> </span>and care of lots:</p>
<p>Voted that, whenever any person so employed<span class='line-break'> </span>shall hereafter be guilty of such offenses, the Trus<span class='line-break'></span>tees shall instruct the Secretary not to grant a <span class='line-break'> </span>permit allowing such offender again to do work</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134609">
<h3><a name="page-1134609">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 217)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>217</p>
<p>within the Cemetery; and in case any person,<span class='line-break'> </span>^<sup>who</sup> is now or shall hereafter be so employed,<span class='line-break'> </span>shall offend in like manner, the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Grounds shall, on information thereof given<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Superintendent, instruct him to exclude <span class='line-break'> </span>such person from the Cemetery.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Term of payment on moneys due from Mr Spooner extended to Novemr 1st'>Term of payment on moneys due from <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> extended to Novem<sup>r</sup> 1<sup>st</sup></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a> further stated that <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>had incurred a good deal of expense in his first <span class='line-break'> </span>purchase and in the hire of workmen, and was <span class='line-break'> </span>owing the Corporation about four hundred and fifty <span class='line-break'> </span>dollars for laborers which indebteness would be <span class='line-break'> </span>further considerably increased before he should <span class='line-break'> </span>be in receipt of moneys from proprietors.</p>
<p>Upon motion by him, it was therefore</p>
<p>Voted that the term of payment of moneys <span class='line-break'> </span>now due and which may become due from <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> to the Corporation be extended to <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1861-11-01'>the first day of November next</date>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Charges for work _ books &amp; forms for same _ refd to another Comee _'>Charges for work _ books &amp; forms for same _ ref<sup>d</sup> to another Com<sup>ee</sup> _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a> asked that _ the question as to what <span class='line-break'> </span>standard shall be adopted for charges for work <span class='line-break'> </span>or materials upon the lots of proprietors, and what <span class='line-break'> </span>books and forms shall be used for the same, <span class='line-break'> </span>which was referred to the Special Committee on <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr.<span class='line-break'> </span>Spooner's</a> resignation, be taken from that Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee, and referred to a committee consisting <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, with full <span class='line-break'> </span>power thereon.</p>
<p>which was adopted.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134610">
<h3><a name="page-1134610">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 218)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>218</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Aug. 5. 1861 Report of Investigating Comee _'><date when='1861-08-05'>Aug. 5. 1861</date> Report of Investigating Com<sup>ee</sup> _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> for the Investigating Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>submitted the following report: _</p>
<p>"The Committee on Investigation &amp;c having made<span class='line-break'> </span>reports to the Board from time to time of their <span class='line-break'> </span>progress, it only remains for them now to state <span class='line-break'> </span>the final result of their examination, so far as <span class='line-break'> </span>they have been able to arrive at it, although a few <span class='line-break'> </span>days more may be required to complete the work <span class='line-break'> </span>assigned to them, should the Board deem it ad<span class='line-break'></span>visable to finish it.  The result however will<span class='line-break'> </span>not probably be affected to any considerable extent<span class='line-break'> </span>and although some further trifling discrepancies<span class='line-break'> </span>may be discovered, the present statement shows<span class='line-break'> </span>substantially the deficit in the accounts of the Sup<span class='line-break'></span>erintendent so far as the partial returns from <span class='line-break'> </span>proprietors and the confused state of the books <span class='line-break'> </span>allow of any examination. _</p>
<p>The Committee have received bills from about <span class='line-break'> </span>800 proprietors.  How many others have paid <span class='line-break'> </span>bills, it is impossible to tell.</p>
<p>These bills as stated in a former report are <span class='line-break'> </span>of two classes - one for work actually done <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Corporation for proprietors, the amount of <span class='line-break'> </span>which belongs exclusively to the Corporation, and <span class='line-break'> </span>the other in whole or in part for granite work,<span class='line-break'> </span>a part of which may have been collected <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Superintendent, for account of the Stone-cutters,<span class='line-break'> </span>and what proportion of which belongs to the Cor<span class='line-break'></span>poration, it is impracticable for the Committee</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134611">
<h3><a name="page-1134611">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 219)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>219</p>
<p>to determine.</p>
<p>In the first class _ to wit, bills exclusively <span class='line-break'> </span>for account of the Corporation, the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>find that in 131 cases the bills receipted are <span class='line-break'> </span>for a larger sum than the amount credited<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Superintendent, the aggregate of which<span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>discrepancies is</th> <th>$4,152.14<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>In seven cases, an excess was credited of</td> <td><u>54.50</u></td> </tr> <tr><td>which leaves a balance of</td> <td>$4,097.64</td> </tr> <tr><td>The difference in the bills</td> <td>___</td> </tr> <tr><td>in whole or in part for granite is</td> <td>$4,377.74</td> </tr> <tr><td>To which we add the bills</td> <td>___</td> </tr> <tr><td>of <a href='/pages/subjects/60951' title='O&apos;Donnell'>O'Donnell</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/57835' title='Black, James'>Black</a> referred</td> <td>___</td> </tr> <tr><td>to in the last report</td> <td><u>463.25</u></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___</td> </tr> <tr><td>which makes a total of</td> <td>$8,938.63</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>Thus much is derived from a comparison <span class='line-break'> </span>of bills with the accounts of the Superintendent.</p>
<p>The examination of the books shows that in <span class='line-break'> </span>numerous instances amounts are charged <span class='line-break'> </span>to proprietors in the Leger or Journal or both <span class='line-break'> </span>which are not accounted for in the Cash book;<span class='line-break'> </span>and others again which have been credited only <span class='line-break'> </span>in part. _ Until the final the final close of <span class='line-break'> </span>the examination, we cannot state precisely what <span class='line-break'> </span>this deficiency is; but the approximate amount <span class='line-break'> </span>is $600 _ which added to the previous amount <span class='line-break'> </span>makes a total of $9,538.63 unaccounted for.</p>
<p>All of which is respectfully submitted, <span class='line-break'> </span>For the Committee, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Chas. G. Nazro</a>, Chairman <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1861-08-03'>Aug. 3. 1861</date>.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134612">
<h3><a name="page-1134612">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 220)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>220</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Aug. 5. 1861.'><date when='1861-08-05'>Aug. 5. 1861</date>.</span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted to accept the report of the Committee</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Demand on J. Mann ordered to be made by the Sec.y _'>Demand on <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>J. Mann</a> ordered to be made by the Sec.y _</span></p>
<p>also on motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that a copy of the same be sent to <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> by <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a>, accompanied with <span class='line-break'> </span>a demand in the name of the Corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>that he shall pay the amount claimed <span class='line-break'> </span>in the report to be due to the Corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. to complete examn of books &amp; accts.'>Com. to complete exam<sup>n</sup> of books &amp; accts.</span></p>
<p>It was further voted that the Committee be <span class='line-break'> </span>requested to continue the examination of the <span class='line-break'> </span>books and accounts to the close, in accordance <span class='line-break'> </span>with the suggestion of the report.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned,</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
<p>-----------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Septemr 2. 1861 _'>Trustees <date when='1861-09-02'>Septem<sup>r</sup> 2. 1861</date> _</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>was held on <date when='1861-09-02T10:00:00'>Monday, September 2<sup>d</sup> 1861. at 10 o'clock<span class='line-break'> </span>a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> as Chairman of the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Grounds submitted the following as the re-</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134613">
<h3><a name="page-1134613">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 221)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>221</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Recommendn of Com. on Grounds of a Plan to fill up and layout lots on the Lawn _'>Recommend<sup>n</sup> of Com. on Grounds of a Plan to fill up and layout lots on <a href='/pages/subjects/58209' title='Asa Gray Garden'>the Lawn</a> _</span></p>
<p>commendation of the Committee, which, on motion <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>, was adopted, excepting the clause <span class='line-break'> </span>appropriating fifteen hundred dollars, the <span class='line-break'> </span>adoption of which was moved, and under <span class='line-break'> </span>the by-law, laid on the table until the next<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting.</p>
<p>"<a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1861-08-30'>August 30, 1861</date></p>
<p>The Committee on Grounds recommend <span class='line-break'> </span>the following votes to be  passed by the Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>in consequence of the introduction of a Fountain <span class='line-break'> </span>into <a href='/pages/subjects/58209' title='Asa Gray Garden'>the area called the "Lawn,"</a> at Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='to extend Lawn Ave., &amp;c.'>to extend <a href='/pages/subjects/55287' title='Lawn Avenue'>Lawn Ave.</a>, &amp;c.</span></p>
<p>That the Committee on Grounds be instruc<span class='line-break'></span>ted to lay out and finish an extension of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/55287' title='Lawn Avenue'>Lawn Avenue</a> across <a href='/pages/subjects/58209' title='Asa Gray Garden'>the Lawn</a>, so as to <span class='line-break'> </span>surround the Fountain lately constructed<span class='line-break'> </span>there, with a circle or circular carriage<span class='line-break'> </span>way.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='with restrictions as to right to plant trees &amp;c.'>with restrictions as to right to plant trees &amp;c.</span></p>
<p>That the Committee on Grounds be author<span class='line-break'></span>ized to raise the grade of all the land between <span class='line-break'> </span>the northerly part of said circular carriage <span class='line-break'> </span>way and <a href='/pages/subjects/59585' title='Pine Avenue'>Pine avenue</a>, so as to make it <span class='line-break'> </span>available for cemetery purposes, at an expense<span class='line-break'> </span>not exceeding fifteen hundred dollars; _</p>
<p>And that, in order that the view of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Fountain and <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>, as seen from the road, <span class='line-break'> </span>may not be obstructed, it is also</p>
<p>Voted that a clause be inserted in all deeds <span class='line-break'> </span>of conveyance of said land or any part<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134614">
<h3><a name="page-1134614">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 222)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>222</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sept 2. 1861 _'><date when='1861-09-02'>Sept 2. 1861</date> _</span></p>
<p>thereof, providing that no trees nor shrubs<span class='line-break'> </span>exceeding five feet in height shall be planted<span class='line-break'> </span>or maintained on the said land so conveyed<span class='line-break'> </span>or on its borders or intermediate spaces.</p>
<p>For the Committee</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, Chairman</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Recommendn of Com. on Gr. for reservation of certain spaces &amp;c _'>Recommend<sup>n</sup> of Com. on Gr. for reservation of certain spaces &amp;c _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> also submitted for the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Grounds, a paper declaring the expedience<span class='line-break'> </span>of making certain portions of the ground described<span class='line-break'> </span>therein forever exempt from use for burial pur<span class='line-break'></span>poses, buildings, monuments, fountains, &amp;c.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ordered to be printed _'>Ordered to be printed _</span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a></p>
<p>Voted that the recommendations be printed <span class='line-break'> </span>and copies sent to each of the Trustees.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mr Spooner again tenders resignation as Gardener'><a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> again tenders resignation as Gardener</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> read a letter from <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a><span class='line-break'> </span>reconsidering his purpose to continue in the situation<span class='line-break'> </span>of Gardener, and expressing a desire to be<span class='line-break'> </span>released from his contract.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Ref back to same Comee as before, with full power _'>Ref back to same Com<sup>ee</sup> as before, with full power _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a></p>
<p>Voted that the Committee to whom the<span class='line-break'> </span>resignation of <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> was previously<span class='line-break'> </span>referred (Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>)<span class='line-break'> </span>be authorized to consider and report on what<span class='line-break'> </span>terms the resignation of <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> should be<span class='line-break'> </span>accepted, and with full power to make such<span class='line-break'> </span>settlement with him as they shall deem advisable.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134615">
<h3><a name="page-1134615">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 223)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>223</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Final Report of Investigating Comee _'>Final Report of Investigating Com<sup>ee</sup> _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> for the Investigating Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>submitted the following report, _ which on motion <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, was accepted. _</p>
<p>The Committee on Investigation, &amp;c. having com<span class='line-break'></span>pleted their labors, so far as it is practicable to do so, now<span class='line-break'> </span>make their final report.</p>
<p>As it has been stated in our previous commun<span class='line-break'></span>cations, it must be obvious to all, that this exami<span class='line-break'></span>nation must in the nature of the case, be only <span class='line-break'> </span>a partial one, and that there may be a further <span class='line-break'> </span>deficit of thousands of dollars entirely unknown <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Committee.  As an instance of this, we will <span class='line-break'> </span>state the case of <a href='/pages/subjects/57848' title='Merriam, Charles'>Mr Charles Merriam</a>.  Within a <span class='line-break'> </span>few days he has sent in two bills _ one of over a <span class='line-break'> </span>thousand dollars to the <a href='/pages/subjects/66004' title='Granite Railway Company'>Granite Railway Co.</a> which <span class='line-break'> </span>was paid to <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>, and which we have ascer<span class='line-break'></span>tained was paid by him to <a href='/pages/subjects/66004' title='Granite Railway Company'>the Railway Co</a>: the other <span class='line-break'> </span>was for work done by the Cemetery amounting to $328, <span class='line-break'> </span>and the amount of which should have been cred<span class='line-break'></span>ited by <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>.  Of this money, however, paid <span class='line-break'> </span>by <a href='/pages/subjects/57848' title='Merriam, Charles'>Mr Merriam</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>, no trace can be <span class='line-break'> </span>found either in the cash book, leger or journals:<span class='line-break'> </span>the only place where <a href='/pages/subjects/57848' title='Merriam, Charles'>Mr Merriam's</a> name appears <span class='line-break'> </span>upon the books being for a small charge of $8 the <span class='line-break'> </span>following year.  How many other cases of like na<span class='line-break'></span>ture may have occurred we have not the means <span class='line-break'> </span>of knowing, and we did not discover this until <span class='line-break'> </span>some three or four months after the proprietors<span class='line-break'> </span>had been requested to send in their bills.</p>
<p>The Committee addressed a circular to each of the</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134616">
<h3><a name="page-1134616">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 224)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>224</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Septemr 2. 1861. '><date when='1861-09-02'>Septem<sup>r</sup> 2. 1861</date>. </span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Investig. Com. continued _'>Report of Investig. Com. continued _</span></p>
<p>proprietors - nearly three thousand in all, only  seven <span class='line-break'> </span>or eight hundred of whom responded.  It is, therefore, <span class='line-break'> </span>entirely impossible, with our present means of information<span class='line-break'> </span>to know whether the residue have paid any bills or not.</p>
<p>The books and bills have been examined with the <span class='line-break'> </span>most minute and elaborate care, and, so far as we<span class='line-break'> </span>have the evidence, an exact knowledge arrived at.</p>
<p>There is but one way in which a certain result <span class='line-break'> </span>can be reached, and that is to employ some one <span class='line-break'> </span>who shall personally visit all those proprietors who <span class='line-break'> </span>have not sent any bills, and learn from them <span class='line-break'> </span>whether they have paid any or not.  In no other <span class='line-break'> </span>manner can we be sure in regard to it.</p>
<p>The Committee have now only to submit the <span class='line-break'> </span>final details of their examination, and ask to <span class='line-break'> </span>be discharged.</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>In 134 cases of bills for account of the Cemetery there is a deficit of</th> <th>___</th> <th>$4.685.14<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>From which we deduct amounts over credited including items twice credited in 27 cases</td> <td>___</td> <td><u>$141.25</u></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___</td> <td>$4.538.89 </td> </tr> <tr><td>___ </td> </tr> <tr><td>Amounts entered in Leger or Journal as received, but not entered in cash book nor credited in settlement with Treas<sup>r</sup> 187 cases</td> <td>$1114.44</td> </tr> <tr><td>Less over-credited in 8 cases</td> <td><u>9.</u></td> <td>1.105.44</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/60951' title='O&apos;Donnell'>O'Donnell</a>'s and <a href='/pages/subjects/57835' title='Black, James'>Black</a>'s bills evidently twice charged</td> <td>___</td> <td><u>$463.25</u></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___</td> <td>$6.107.58</td> </tr> </tbody> </table></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134617">
<h3><a name="page-1134617">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 225)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>225</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Bills in whole or in part of granite not entered</th> <th>$4.522.74<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>Amounts paid to <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> by <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W. Bond</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a> as per their cashbooks for bills collected by them, but not credited by <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a></td> <td>$667.40</td> </tr> <tr><td>Amounts charged to proprietors on Leger for which there is no credit in Leger or Cash and whether paid or not is unknown</td> <td>2.086.90</td> </tr> <tr><td>Disbursements charged in  Cash Book as paid for which there are no vouchers</td> <td>4.744.55</td> </tr> <tr><td>Bills in the Leger or Journal not Entered in cash book about which the Com<sup>ee</sup> are in doubt</td> <td>52.75</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>All of which is respectfully submitted<span class='line-break'> </span>For the Com<sup>ee</sup><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1861-08-30'>Aug 30. 1861</date> <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Chas. G. Nazro</a>, Chairman</p>
<p>Since the foregoing report was closed, a bill has been <span class='line-break'> </span>sent by <a href='/pages/subjects/82775' title='Lamber, Mrs.'>Mrs Lambert</a> which she paid to <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>amounting to $50 – no entry of which appears on the <span class='line-break'> </span>books.  <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>C. G. N.</a> _ "</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee chosen to prosecute claim against Mr Mann-'>Com<sup>ee</sup> chosen to prosecute claim against <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>-</span></p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that a Committee of three be chosen to pros<span class='line-break'></span>ecute this claim against <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>, and upon<span class='line-break'> </span>nomination by <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a></p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> were chosen.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134618">
<h3><a name="page-1134618">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 226)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>226</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Septr 2. 1861'><date when='1861-09-02'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 2. 1861</date></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. on Grounds requested to discontinue services of Mr Mann _ except _ &amp;c'>Com. on Grounds requested to discontinue services of <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> _ except _ &amp;c</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the Committee on Grounds be requested <span class='line-break'> </span>to discontinue the services of <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>, except <span class='line-break'> </span>so far as may be necessry in completing the fountains <span class='line-break'> </span>and indicating the course of the water pipes, culverts, <span class='line-break'> </span>drains &amp;c and in giving such informaton as the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee may desire.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Repairs on Supts house _'>Repairs on <a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>Supt<sup>s</sup> house</a> _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the incoming Superintendent<span class='line-break'> </span>(<a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor</a>) be authorized to expend a sum <span class='line-break'> </span>not exceeding $100 in repairs upon the house.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sec.y to procure Special Police Appointments for himself, Suptt &amp;c _'>Sec.y to procure Special Police Appointments for himself, Supt<sup>t</sup> &amp;c _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> be authorized in behalf <span class='line-break'> </span>of this Board to apply to the authorities of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a> for the appointment <span class='line-break'> </span>of himself and <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superintendent</a>, and such <span class='line-break'> </span>other persons as the Superintendent may designate <span class='line-break'> </span>as Special Police at Mount Auburn.</p>
<p>Adjourned</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secy</p>
<p>----------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Special Meeting _ Sept. 12. 1861.'>Trustees _ Special Meeting _ <date when='1861-09-12'>Sept. 12. 1861</date>.</span></p>
<p>A special meeting of the Trustes of Mount Auburn<span class='line-break'> </span>called at the request of five Trustees was held on <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1861-09-12T10:00:00'>Thursday, September 12<sup>th</sup>, at half past 10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
