<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134619">
<h3><a name="page-1134619">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 227)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>227</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='$1500 appropriated to fill and grade the Lawn _'>$1500 appropriated to fill and grade <a href='/pages/subjects/58209' title='Asa Gray Garden'>the Lawn</a> _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted to take from the table the motion submitted <span class='line-break'> </span>at the last meeting to appropriate ($1500) fifteen hundred <span class='line-break'> </span>dollars for the completion of <a href='/pages/subjects/55287' title='Lawn Avenue'>Lawn Avenue</a> and filling and <span class='line-break'> </span>grading the adjoining land, and the same was <span class='line-break'> </span>put and adopted. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Horse &amp; Carriage for Supt. _'>Horse &amp; Carriage for Supt. _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a> be a <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee to provide a suitable horse and vehicle <span class='line-break'> </span>for the Superintendent's use at Mt Auburn. _</p>
<p>It was moved by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,</p>
<p>That <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>'s services at Mount Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>be discontinued after this day. _ and that the <span class='line-break'> </span>question be taken by yeas and nays.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Mr Little</a> moved to amend by substituting the <span class='line-break'> </span>words "this week" for "this day", was was lost.</p>
<p>The principal motion was then put, and lost.</p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> voting yea, and Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> voting nay.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mr Mann&apos;s services to be discontinued within one week.'><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>'s services to be discontinued within one week.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a> then moved that the time for the perform<span class='line-break'></span>ance by <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> of the services specified in a vote <span class='line-break'> </span>passed at the last meeting be limited to one week <span class='line-break'> </span>from date.</p>
<p>Upon this, the yeas and nays were ordered,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the motion was adopted by a unanimous vote.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134620">
<h3><a name="page-1134620">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 228)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>228</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mr Crocker authorized to purchase lots on Laurel Hill _'><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a> authorized to purchase lots on <a href='/pages/subjects/55347' title='Laurel Hill'>Laurel Hill</a> _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a> be authorized to purchase<span class='line-break'> </span>on the best terms in his power the six lots on<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/55347' title='Laurel Hill'>Laurel Hill</a> belonging to <a href='/pages/subjects/83584' title='Fisher, Francis'>Francis Fisher</a>.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>-------------------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ October 7, 1861.'>Trustees _ <date when='1861-10-07'>October 7, 1861</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>was held on <date when='1861-10-07T10:00:00'>Monday October 7, 1861, at 10<span class='line-break'> </span>o'clock a.m. </date></p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='S. H. Russell&apos;s Complt of encroachment on his lot _ refd to Comee on Lots.'><a href='/pages/subjects/74111' title='Russell, Samuel H.'>S. H. Russell</a>'s Compl<sup>t</sup> of encroachment on his lot _ ref<sup>d</sup> to Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> read a note from <a href='/pages/subjects/74111' title='Russell, Samuel H.'>Samuel <span class='line-break'> </span>H. Russell</a>, complaining that his <a href='/pages/subjects/60678' title='Lot 730'>lot numbered <span class='line-break'> </span>730</a> situated on <a href='/pages/subjects/61285' title='Sweetbrier Path'>Sweetbrier Path</a> had been covered <span class='line-break'> </span>by a new <a href='/pages/subjects/83585' title='Lot 3090'>lot numbered 3090</a> conveyed to <a href='/pages/subjects/83586' title='Sampson, Edwin H.'>Edwin <span class='line-break'> </span>H. Sampson</a>.</p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the Committee on Lots be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to negotiate with <a href='/pages/subjects/74111' title='Russell, Samuel H.'>Mr Russell</a> for another lot on <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61285' title='Sweetbrier Path'>Sweet Brier Path</a> adjoining the lot of <a href='/pages/subjects/83587' title='Gibson, Mrs.'>Mrs Gibson</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>or any other unoccupied lot which they may <span class='line-break'> </span>deem advisable.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> read a communication from <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/83588' title='Breck, Joseph'>Joseph Breck</a> as Chairman of the Executive Committee</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134621">
<h3><a name="page-1134621">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 229)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>229</p>
<p>of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass. Hort. Society</a>, on the subject of <span class='line-break'> </span>conveying the lot containing the remains of <span class='line-break'> </span>the late <a href='/pages/subjects/58800' title='Fessenden, Thomas Green'>Thomas Green  Fessenden</a> to his heirs <span class='line-break'> </span>at law, and protecting it from further interments <span class='line-break'> </span>except of the remains of <a href='/pages/subjects/83589' title='Fessenden, Lydia'>Mrs Lydia Fessenden</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>who has expressed a desire that her body shall <span class='line-break'> </span>be interred in said lot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Conditional grant of right of burial to Mrs L. Fessenden.'>Conditional grant of right of burial to <a href='/pages/subjects/83589' title='Fessenden, Lydia'>Mrs L. Fessenden</a>.</span></p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that this Corporation will convey the<span class='line-break'> </span>lot on which the Fessenden monument stands,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/72204' title='Lot 680'>(no. 680)</a> to the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Massachusettts Horticultural Society</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>on the condition that said <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'><!--Mass Hort-->Society</a> shall forever <span class='line-break'> </span>keep the same in good repair, and that <span class='line-break'> </span>no interment shall be made therein, except that <span class='line-break'> </span>of the body of <a href='/pages/subjects/83589' title='Fessenden, Lydia'>Mrs Lydia Fessenden</a>. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Partial rept of Comee on resignation of Mr Spooner _ and further instructions to Comee _'>Partial rep<sup>t</sup> of Com<sup>ee</sup> on resignation of <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> _ and further instructions to Com<sup>ee</sup> _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> for the Committee to which was <span class='line-break'> </span>referred the resignation of <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a>, as Gardener, <span class='line-break'> </span>reported that <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> is still desirous that <span class='line-break'> </span>his resignation should be accepted; they also <span class='line-break'> </span>reported the state of accounts between him and <span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation, and the terms on which he<span class='line-break'> </span>offers a settlement, and they desired further <span class='line-break'> </span>instructions.</p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that this Committee be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to make such settlement with <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> as <span class='line-break'> </span>they may deem right, and also to make any <span class='line-break'> </span>further arrangement regarding the <a href='/pages/subjects/61312' title='Greenhouse'>green-house</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>that in their judgment is proper, either to sell</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134622">
<h3><a name="page-1134622">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 230)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>230</p>
<p>the plants, lease the <a href='/pages/subjects/61312' title='Greenhouse'>Green house</a>, or employ <span class='line-break'> </span>a suitable person to take care of the plants.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Reservation of certain grounds _ laid on table till next meeting.'>Reservation of certain grounds _ laid on table till next meeting.</span></p>
<p>The printed recommendations for the reservation<span class='line-break'> </span>of certain spaces or grounds to be forever kept open,<span class='line-break'> </span>was then taken from the table and briefly dis<span class='line-break'></span>cussed.</p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the subject of the reservation of <span class='line-break'> </span>spaces be laid on the table to the next meeting,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that special notice be given to members of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Board that the subject will then come up<span class='line-break'> </span>for action.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Finance Comee authorized to have accts. of last Supt properly posted _'>Finance Com<sup>ee</sup> authorized to have accts. of last Sup<sup>t</sup> properly posted _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the Committee on Finance be <span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to employ a suitable person to write <span class='line-break'> </span>up the books and accounts of the old Superinten<span class='line-break'></span>dent, and put them in  suitable condition for <span class='line-break'> </span>reference and use. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Refusal to accept Granite Front of new Tombs _ '>Refusal to accept Granite Front of new Tombs _ </span></p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the Committee on Grounds be instructed<span class='line-break'> </span>by this Board to give notice to the contractors for <span class='line-break'> </span>the granite front of the new <a href='/pages/subjects/66005' title='Catacomb Tombs'>catacombs tombs</a> in<span class='line-break'> </span>course of construction between <a href='/pages/subjects/59984' title='Rosebay Avenue'>Rosebay<!--Ave--></a> and <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59985' title='Culvert Avenue'>Culvert Avenues</a> that this Corporation will not <span class='line-break'> </span>accept said granite front on account of imperfec<span class='line-break'></span>tions in the stones and for defective construction.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134623">
<h3><a name="page-1134623">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 231)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>231</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='memorial of sundry persons on bad condition of Coolidge Av. = Ref to Specl Comee'>memorial of sundry persons on bad condition of <a href='/pages/subjects/62104' title='Coolidge Avenue'>Coolidge Av.<!--road--></a> = Ref to Spec<sup>l</sup> Com<sup>ee</sup></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> read a memorial from <span class='line-break'> </span>several citizens of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>representing the road running on the easterly side <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery, and called <a href='/pages/subjects/62104' title='Coolidge Avenue'>Coolidge Avenue<!--road--></a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>to be in a bad condition, needing repairs.</p>
<p>Voted that the memorial be referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> to ascer<span class='line-break'></span>tain what are the rights and obligations, if <span class='line-break'> </span>any, of this Corporation in connection with <span class='line-break'> </span>said road.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Represents for lots _'>Represent<sup>s</sup> for lots _</span></p>
<p>Petitions for the representation of certain <span class='line-break'> </span>lots were then passed as follows: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1743'><a href='/pages/subjects/83591' title='Lot 1743'><!--Lot-->1743</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/83592' title='Stearns, Charles J.'>Charles J. Stearns</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, Executor of <span class='line-break'> </span>the will of <a href='/pages/subjects/83593' title='Greene, Harriet'>Harriet Greene</a>, late proprietor <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/83591' title='Lot 1743'>lot numbered 1743</a>, to represent said lot: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1897'><a href='/pages/subjects/83594' title='Lot 1897'><!--Lot-->1897</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/83595' title='Sears, George O.'>George O. Sears</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, son of <a href='/pages/subjects/83596' title='Sears, Susan'>Susan <span class='line-break'> </span>Sears</a>, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/83594' title='Lot 1897'>lot numbered 1897</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>to represent said lot: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2070'><a href='/pages/subjects/83597' title='Lot 2070'><!--Lot-->2070</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/83598' title='Brackett, Charles W.'>Charles W. Brackett</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a>, third <span class='line-break'> </span>son of <a href='/pages/subjects/83599' title='Brackett, Joseph'>Joseph Brackett</a>, late proprietor of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/83597' title='Lot 2070'>lot numbered 2070</a>, to represent said lot.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned</p>
<p>Attest, <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a></p>
<p>Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134624">
<h3><a name="page-1134624">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 232)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>232</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Novr 4. 1861.'>Trustees _ <date when='1861-11-04'>Nov<sup>r</sup> 4. 1861</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>was held on <date when='1861-11-04T10:00:00'>Monday November 4.<sup>th</sup> 1861 at 10 o'clock<span class='line-break'> </span>am.</date></p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Reservation of certain spaces for Public Grounds adopted _'>Reservation of certain spaces for Public Grounds adopted _</span></p>
<p>The subject specially assigned _ viz. the con<span class='line-break'></span>sideration of the printed recommendations of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Grounds, for the reservation of cer<span class='line-break'></span>tain spaces forever from sale, and their devotion <span class='line-break'> </span>to use only as public grounds _ first came up, and <span class='line-break'> </span>it was moved by <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>,</p>
<p>That the report be accepted, and that the <span class='line-break'> </span>vote recommended by the Committee be passed.<span class='line-break'> </span>viz.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Viz:'>Viz:</span></p>
<p>That the following described spaces within the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn be forever kept open,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that no interments be ever made, nor building<span class='line-break'> </span>nor monuments of any description be erected thereon.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='South of the Gate'>South of the Gate</span></p>
<p>1<sup>st</sup> The space near the <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'>front gate or entrance</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>bounded as follows: beginning at a point in the <span class='line-break'> </span>front fence, thirty feet west of the western <span class='line-break'> </span>stone obelisk, thence running, at right angles<span class='line-break'> </span>with said fence, in a southerly direction, to the <span class='line-break'> </span>southerly side of <a href='/pages/subjects/59585' title='Pine Avenue'>Pine Avenue</a>, being about fifty<span class='line-break'></span>five feet; thence easterly in a line parallel to</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134625">
<h3><a name="page-1134625">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 233)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>233</p>
<p>said fence, until it intersects a line drawn from a <span class='line-break'> </span>point in said fence thirty feet east of the eastern <span class='line-break'> </span>stone obelisk, and at right angles therewith; thence<span class='line-break'> </span>northerly by the said line so drawn , at right angles<span class='line-break'> </span>with said fence, to the said point in said fence <span class='line-break'> </span>thirty feet east of the eastern stone obelisk; and <span class='line-break'> </span>thence in a straight line to the place of beginning.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='East, North and West of Chapel _'>East, North and West of <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a> _</span></p>
<p>2<sup>nd</sup> A space or passageway twenty feet wide on <span class='line-break'> </span>the east, north, and west sides of the <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'><!--Bigelow-->Chapel</a>; the <span class='line-break'> </span>said twenty feet to be measured from the outer face <span class='line-break'> </span>of the stone buttresses.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Front of Chapel _'>Front of <a href='/pages/subjects/53239' title='Bigelow Chapel'>Chapel</a> _</span></p>
<p>3<sup>rd</sup> All that <a href='/pages/subjects/61306' title='Bigelow Chapel Lawn'>space in front of the Chapel</a>, bound<span class='line-break'></span>ed by <a href='/pages/subjects/61148' title='Chapel Avenue'>Chapel<!--Avenue--></a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/59585' title='Pine Avenue'>Pine<!--Ave--></a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/59584' title='Cypress Avenue'>Cypress Avenues</a>, and <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61254' title='Peony Path'>Peony Path</a>, as now laid out.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Around the Tower _'>Around<a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'> the Tower</a> _</span></p>
<p>4<sup>th</sup> The whole space adjacent to and surround<span class='line-break'></span>ing <a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>the Tower</a>, now enclosed by the circular or <span class='line-break'> </span>wal [sic] part of <a href='/pages/subjects/61236' title='Mountain Avenue'>Mountain Avenue</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Auburn Lake.'><a href='/pages/subjects/57593' title='Auburn Lake'>Auburn Lake</a>.</span></p>
<p>5<sup>th</sup> All the space included within the stone curb<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/57593' title='Auburn Lake'>Auburn Lake</a>, together with the avenues or <span class='line-break'> </span>paths surrounding and next adjacent to the said <span class='line-break'> </span>curb; also all land between said avenues or paths <span class='line-break'> </span>and said curb,not exceeding thirty feet in width.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lawn Ave'><a href='/pages/subjects/55287' title='Lawn Avenue'>Lawn Av<sup>e</sup></a></span></p>
<p>6<sup>th</sup> All the land included within the circular part <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/55287' title='Lawn Avenue'>Lawn Avenue</a>, and which is not more than ninety <span class='line-break'> </span>feet from <a href='/pages/subjects/25004462' title='Lawn Fountain'>the <!--Lawn-->Foundain</a> now in the central  part of</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134626">
<h3><a name="page-1134626">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 234)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>234</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/58209' title='Asa Gray Garden'>the lawn</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Conveyances to be made as to secure certain spaces for Public Grounds with Plans of same _'>Conveyances to be made as to secure certain spaces for Public Grounds with Plans of same _</span></p>
<p>And the Committee recommend that such con<span class='line-break'></span>veyances be made as shall secure the said objects,<span class='line-break'> </span>and shall prevent interments or the erection of <span class='line-break'> </span>new buildings or monuments, on the said several <span class='line-break'> </span>spaces, or their appropriation to any other uses<span class='line-break'> </span>than those hitherto allowed.</p>
<p>And the Committee that the said <span class='line-break'> </span>conveyances, together with suitable plans of the <span class='line-break'> </span>said spaces to be forever kept open, be entered <span class='line-break'> </span>on the records of the  Corporation.  And they also <span class='line-break'> </span>recommend that plans of the said spaces be en<span class='line-break'></span>tered on the large sectional maps now in process <span class='line-break'> </span>of being made by <a href='/pages/subjects/57826' title='Shedd &amp; Edson'>Messrs Shedd and Edson</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Drains &amp;c to be indicated on Sectional Survey.'>Drains &amp;c to be indicated on Sectional Survey.</span></p>
<p>And they also recommend that the situation <span class='line-break'> </span>of all drains, water pipes, cess-pools, reservoirs, water<span class='line-break'></span>locks, and gates, be carefully laid down in ^<sup>said</sup> sectional <span class='line-break'> </span>maps.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Adopted by yea &amp; nay vote _'>Adopted by yea &amp; nay vote _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the question be taken by yeas and <span class='line-break'> </span>nays.  The question was then taken and the rec<span class='line-break'></span>ommendations of the Committee were adopted by<span class='line-break'> </span>the following vote:</p>
<p>Yeas. Messrs. <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <sup><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a></sup>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Nays Messsrs <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134627">
<h3><a name="page-1134627">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 235)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>235</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Male Swan offered to the Corporation'>Male Swan offered to the Corporation</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a> presented a written communication <span class='line-break'> </span>containing the offier of <a href='/pages/subjects/83600' title='Green, Andrew H.'>Mr Andrew H. Green</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>Comptroller of the <a href='/pages/subjects/83601' title='Central Park'>Central Park</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>made through <a href='/pages/subjects/58506' title='Hastings, Thomas'>Mr Thomas Hastings</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/72695' title='East Cambridge, MA'>East <span class='line-break'> </span>Cambridge</a>, to let the Corporation have one of <span class='line-break'> </span>the male swans for the Cemetery,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary authorized to accept same _'>Secretary authorized to accept same _</span></p>
<p>And it was</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>accept the offer, and notify <a href='/pages/subjects/83600' title='Green, Andrew H.'>Mr Green</a> thereof.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Comee on Resignation of Mr. Spooner.'>Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Resignation of <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr. Spooner</a>.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> for the Committee to whom was referred <span class='line-break'> </span>the resignation of <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a>, submitted a report <span class='line-break'> </span>of which the following is a copy: _</p>
<p>"The Committee to whom were referred the several <span class='line-break'> </span>communications of <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a>, touching his resigna<span class='line-break'></span>tion of the office of Gardener at Mount A^<sup>u</sup>burn"<span class='line-break'> </span>with power to make such settlement as they should <span class='line-break'> </span>deem advisable _ and also to make such arrange<span class='line-break'></span>ments respecting the <a href='/pages/subjects/61312' title='Greenhouse'>Greenhouse</a>, plants &amp;c. as in their <span class='line-break'> </span>judgment should be proper beg leave to report,</p>
<p>That after many interviews with <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr.<span class='line-break'> </span>Spooner</a> and much consideration, <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr. Spooner</a> has<span class='line-break'> </span>withdrawn his resignation, and an arrangement <span class='line-break'> </span>has been effected with him on the following terms.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='new Arrangement proposed with Mr Spooner _'>new Arrangement proposed with <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> _</span></p>
<p>The Corporation shall purchase back <span class='line-break'> </span>from <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a>, the <a href='/pages/subjects/61312' title='Greenhouse'>Greenhouse</a> at the price paid <span class='line-break'> </span>for the same by him, with the interest added,<span class='line-break'> </span>and shall lease the same with the land now under<span class='line-break'> </span>lease to him for the yearly rent of one hundred and <span class='line-break'> </span>twenty five dollars.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134628">
<h3><a name="page-1134628">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 236)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>236</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Com^ee on Mr Spooner&apos;s resignation _ continued _'>Report of Com^<sup>ee</sup> on <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a>'s resignation _ continued _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> shall collect all the bills <span class='line-break'> </span>for labor and care of lots now due for his own use,<span class='line-break'> </span>and shall pay all his indebtedness to the Corpo<span class='line-break'></span>ration, as the same would have been done under <span class='line-break'> </span>the previous agreements _ He shall purchase of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation the stock of plants, pots &amp;c in the <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61312' title='Greenhouse'>Greenhouse</a> at the price of five hundred dollars, and <span class='line-break'> </span>shall take a lease of the <a href='/pages/subjects/61312' title='Greenhouse'>greenhouse</a> and grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>as aforesaid &amp; shall during the term of the lease <span class='line-break'> </span>keep the <a href='/pages/subjects/61312' title='Greenhouse'>greenhouse</a> in good repair at his own expense</p>
<p>This arrangement being satisfactory to <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a>, and as the Committee think for the <span class='line-break'> </span>interest of the Corporation they recommend that <span class='line-break'> </span>authority be given to carry the same into effect."<span class='line-break'> </span><small>(signed) <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Edwd S. Rand</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Jas. Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>W<sup>m</sup> T. Andrews</a> _ Com<sup>ee</sup></small></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr. Read</a> the report was accepted.</p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the Treasurer be authorized to settle<span class='line-break'> </span>with <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a>, on the basis of the report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tomb under Park St. Church Release to Soc.y requested, and ordered _'><a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Tomb under Park St. Church</a> Release to Soc.y requested, and ordered _</span></p>
<p>A paper was presented from a Committee of the <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/83602' title='Park Street Church'>Park St. Cong. Society</a>, containing the signature of sev<span class='line-break'></span>eral proprietors of tombs under the meeting-house of <span class='line-break'> </span>said society, agreeing to release their rights in said <span class='line-break'> </span>tombs _ with the request that the Trustees would <span class='line-break'> </span>authorize the release of the tomb owned by this Cor<span class='line-break'></span>poration, on the ground that such tombs are a <span class='line-break'> </span>nuisance.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134629">
<h3><a name="page-1134629">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 237)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>237</p>
<p>Voted - that <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> be authorized to sign <span class='line-break'> </span>said paper, and to execute in behalf of this Cor<span class='line-break'></span>poration a release of its interest in tomb no. 13,<span class='line-break'> </span>under said church.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tileston lot, no. 2317. _'>Tileston lot, <a href='/pages/subjects/59999' title='Lot 2317'>no. 2317</a>. _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> read a letter from the heirs of <a href='/pages/subjects/80071' title='Tileston, Sarah'>Mrs <span class='line-break'> </span>Sarah Tileston</a>, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/59999' title='Lot 2317'>lot 2317</a>, on <a href='/pages/subjects/60000' title='Sylvan Path'>Sylvan <span class='line-break'> </span>Path</a>, related to a passage to and from the same <span class='line-break'> </span>from <a href='/pages/subjects/60001' title='Walnut Avenue'>Walnut Avenue</a>, and moved that the subject <span class='line-break'> </span>be referred to Committee on Lots with full power _<span class='line-break'> </span>which motion was adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Police at Mt Auburn, and Badges _'>Police at Mt Auburn, and Badges _</span></p>
<p>Voted, that <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> be authorized to procure <span class='line-break'> </span>the appointment of <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> as a policeman _<span class='line-break'> </span>if it can be done _ and that he and those already <span class='line-break'> </span>appointed be provided with police badges to be <span class='line-break'> </span>worn on suitable occasions</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y.</p>
<p>-------------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Decr 2. 1861 _ no quorum _'>Trustees _ <date when='1861-12-02'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 2. 1861</date> _ no quorum _</span></p>
<p><date when='1861-12-02T10:00:00'>Monday December 2. 1861.<span class='line-break'> </span>At 10 o'clock, a.m.</date>, the regular hour for the meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Board of Trustees, there were in attendance, <span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>, who,<span class='line-break'> </span>not constituting a quorum, adjourned to the <span class='line-break'> </span>next regular meeting.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Sec.y.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134630">
<h3><a name="page-1134630">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 238)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>238</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Jany. 6. 1862.'>Trustees _ <date when='1862-01-06'>Jany. 6. 1862</date>.</span></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Trustees was held <span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1862-01-06T10:00:00'>Monday January 6, 1862, at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> _</p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>: but no business was <span class='line-break'> </span>transacted and the meeting was adjourned to <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1862-01-28T10:00:00'>Monday January 28<sup>th</sup> inst. at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> to<span class='line-break'> </span>hear the reports of the President, Treasurer &amp;c and <span class='line-break'> </span>for other business. _</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Sec.y.</p>
<p>------------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _  Jany. 27. 1862'>Trustees _ <date when='1862-01-27'> Jany. 27. 1862</date></span></p>
<p>A meeting of the Trustees was held according <span class='line-break'> </span>to adjournment on <date when='1862-01-27T10:00:00'>Monday January 27<sup>th</sup> 1862 at<span class='line-break'> </span>10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>. _</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting and the subse<span class='line-break'></span>quent memoranda were read</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Rept of Trustees _ accepted _'>Annual Rep<sup>t</sup> of Trustees _ accepted _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> read the annual report of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees, which by motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Mr Little</a> was accep<span class='line-break'></span>ted and ordered to be printed</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasr made statement _ Report not ready _'>Treas<sup>r</sup> made statement _ Report not ready _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->The Treas<sup>r</sup></a> stated that in consequence of not <span class='line-break'> </span>getting, as yet, from the late Superintendent his ac<span class='line-break'></span>count of work &amp;c. up to the <date when='1861-09-01'>1<sup>st</sup> of September</date>, he <span class='line-break'> </span>was not ^<sup>yet</sup> prepared to report, but he gave a brief<span class='line-break'> </span>verbal statement of the general receipts and expenditures<span class='line-break'> </span>and it was understood that the report would be presen<span class='line-break'></span>ted to the meeting next Monday Morning</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134631">
<h3><a name="page-1134631">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 239)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>239</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Committee &amp; as to rights and obligations of Corporation in respect to Coolidge Avee'>Report of Committee &amp; as to rights and obligations of Corporation in respect to <u><a href='/pages/subjects/62104' title='Coolidge Avenue'>Coolidge Ave<sup>e</sup><!--road--></a></u></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> for he Committee appointed to <span class='line-break'> </span>inquire and report upon the petition of sundry <span class='line-break'> </span>persons representing <a href='/pages/subjects/62104' title='Coolidge Avenue'>Coolidge Avenue<!--road--></a> to be in a <span class='line-break'> </span>bad condition, submitted their report of which <span class='line-break'> </span>the following is a copy _ and the report was accepted.</p>
<p>The Committee to whom was referred the rep<span class='line-break'></span>resentation of sundry persons, citizens of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>living near Mt Auburn that the road called<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62104' title='Coolidge Avenue'>Coolidge Avenue<!--road--></a> is very much out of repair so as <span class='line-break'> </span>to render it uncomfortable if not unsafe, have <span class='line-break'> </span>considered the subject and now report.  The <span class='line-break'> </span>document in question terminates without any <span class='line-break'> </span>suggestions of the wishes or expectations of the <span class='line-break'> </span>subscribers as to the sd. road or way and there<span class='line-break'></span>fore it would be competent for your Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>to dismiss the subject without more; but in <span class='line-break'> </span>as much as they have heard that some of the <span class='line-break'> </span>signers of the sd. paper entertain the belief<span class='line-break'> </span>that the fee simple of sd. way is vested in the <span class='line-break'> </span>Prop<sup>rs</sup> of Mt Auburn and that they are there<span class='line-break'></span>fore bound to keep it in good repair; Your <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee have caused the title to the <span class='line-break'> </span>land included in sd. road to be investiga<span class='line-break'></span>ted by a competent lawyer whose report on <span class='line-break'> </span>the same accompanies this report of your <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee.  Your Committee have examined <span class='line-break'> </span>the minutes of the title, and of a plan sub<span class='line-break'></span>mitted therewith and they have come to the <span class='line-break'> </span>following opinion, that the <a href='/pages/subjects/62104' title='Coolidge Avenue'>Coolidge Avenue<!--road--></a><span class='line-break'> </span>from country road to the South East corner of</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134632">
<h3><a name="page-1134632">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 240)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>240</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report on Coolidge Ave continued _'>Report on <a href='/pages/subjects/62104' title='Coolidge Avenue'>Coolidge Av<sup>e</sup><!--road--></a> continued _</span></p>
<p>the Cem<sup>y</sup> as now enclosed is owned in fee <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Prop<sup>rs</sup> of the Cem<sup>y</sup> of Mt. Auburn, <span class='line-break'> </span>but has been open to public travel since 1830<span class='line-break'> </span>Southwardly from the sd. SE. corner to the <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58907' title='Pomroy, Mrs.'>Pomeroy</a> house sd. Avenue was made upon <span class='line-break'> </span>lands formerly of <a href='/pages/subjects/59733' title='Stone, Moses'>Moses Stone</a>.  A right of <span class='line-break'> </span>way <u>two</u> <u>rods</u> wide being purchased of <a href='/pages/subjects/58907' title='Pomroy, Mrs.'>Pomeroy's <span class='line-break'> </span>wife</a> (<a href='/pages/subjects/58907' title='Pomroy, Mrs.'>Moses Stone's widow</a>) for her lifetime by <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a> and the right of reversion<span class='line-break'> </span>having passed to the <a href='/pages/subjects/59752' title='Brasee, Morton P.'>Brasee</a>, were purchased <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Prop<sup>rs</sup> of Mt Auburn.  Beyond this <span class='line-break'> </span>point westwardly the road is a town way.</p>
<p>The whole of sd. Avenue was made at the ex<span class='line-break'></span>pense of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Mass. Hort. Soc<sup>y</sup></a> the part from <span class='line-break'> </span>A to B in the plan, in 1830, from B to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Pomeroy house in 1832: excepting, that one half <span class='line-break'> </span>of the part from A to B was at the expense <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/100503' title='Coolidge, Josiah'>Josiah Coolidge</a> for privileges then granted<span class='line-break'> </span>The northerly part of said Avenue for about<span class='line-break'> </span><u>twenty</u> <u>nine</u> <u>rods</u> is within the <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>City of Cam<span class='line-break'></span>bridge</a>.  The remainder of it is in <a href='/pages/subjects/53204' title='Watertown, MA'>Watertown</a>.</p>
<p>Nothing is contained in any agree<span class='line-break'></span>ment that has been found, respecting the <span class='line-break'> </span>maintenance of sd. road and it is not believed<span class='line-break'> </span>that any such agreement was made; and we <span class='line-break'> </span>are of opinion that the proprietor of land <span class='line-break'> </span>embraced in a private way cannot be com<span class='line-break'></span>pelled to repair the same, unless there be an<span class='line-break'> </span>agreement between him and the grantee of the <span class='line-break'> </span>use of the way to that effect.  From the length</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134633">
<h3><a name="page-1134633">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 241)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>241</p>
<p>of time during which this way has been open <span class='line-break'> </span>to the public, we should think that it <span class='line-break'> </span>had been dedicated to and accepted by <span class='line-break'> </span>the public and is to be kept in repair by <span class='line-break'> </span>the towns in which it is lies. But if this <span class='line-break'> </span>case does not fall within this principle<span class='line-break'> </span>of law, it is unclear that the Corporation <span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn is under no obligation <span class='line-break'> </span>to keep the way in repair.  This must be <span class='line-break'> </span>done by those that make use of it.</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>(Signed)</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis</a></th> <th>} Committee<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>E. S. Rand</a></td> <td>}</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Inquiry abt taking gravel from Coolidge Ave refd to Comee on Grounds.'>Inquiry ab<sup>t</sup> taking gravel from <a href='/pages/subjects/62104' title='Coolidge Avenue'>Coolidge Av<sup>e</sup></a> ref<sup>d</sup> to Com<sup>ee</sup> on Grounds.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> moved that the Committee on Grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>be requested to inqure into the practicability <span class='line-break'> </span>of taking gravel from <a href='/pages/subjects/62104' title='Coolidge Avenue'>Coolidge Avenue</a> and <span class='line-break'> </span>report thereon, _ and the motion was adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer represents his Compensation to be inadequate _'>Treasurer represents his Compensation to be inadequate _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Mr Bond</a> stated that by the devolving upon the <span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer of the duty of collecting and paying <span class='line-break'> </span>all monies for the Corporation, increased labor <span class='line-break'> </span>in ^<sup>the</sup> keeping of books and otherwise had been <span class='line-break'> </span>imposed upon him &amp; that the compensation of<span class='line-break'> </span>the same was inadequate.</p>
<p>Voted, that the subject be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee on Finance</p>
<p>Upon the petition of ^<sup>the</sup> parties in interest, the <span class='line-break'> </span>following persons were severally designated to</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134634">
<h3><a name="page-1134634">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 242)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>242</p>
<p>represent lots as follows: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representative for Lot 210 _'>Representative for <a href='/pages/subjects/83697' title='Lot 210'>Lot 210</a> _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/59955' title='Reed, Benjamin T.'>Benj T. Reed</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> the son in law <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/58341' title='Coolidge, Samuel F.'>Samuel F Coolidge</a>, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/83697' title='Lot 210'>numbered <span class='line-break'> </span>210</a> to represent said lot</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 683 _'><a href='/pages/subjects/83699' title='Lot 683'>Lot 683</a> _</span></p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Feby. 3. 1862 _'>Trustees _ <date when='1862-02-03'>Feby. 3. 1862</date> _</span></p>
<p>The regular meeting of the Trustees was held on <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1862-02-03T10:00:00'>Monday, February 3<sup>d</sup> at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> _</p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>. _</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Comee on Finance recommending increase of Treasrs compensation _'>Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Finance recommending increase of Treas<sup>rs</sup> compensation _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr. Nazro</a> read the following report: _</p>
<p>"The Committee on Finance, to whom was referred<span class='line-break'> </span>the question what extra compensation, if any, shall <span class='line-break'> </span>be allowed <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> for extra work in his office<span class='line-break'> </span>during the past year, have considered the subject and report: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Adopted _'>Adopted _</span></p>
<p>The Committee find, upon examination of the <span class='line-break'> </span>books and accounts of the Treasurer, that owing to the <span class='line-break'> </span>diminished sales of lots, his commissions for the year <span class='line-break'> </span>just closed amount to be a trifle over four hun-</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134636">
<h3><a name="page-1134636">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 244)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>244</p>
<p>dred dollars _ while the amount of work has <span class='line-break'> </span>been considerably increased, and they are <span class='line-break'> </span>satisfied that the compensation is inadequate <span class='line-break'> </span>to the amount of work, and the responsibility <span class='line-break'> </span>incurred in the performanc of his duties, and <span class='line-break'> </span>they therefore recommend that he be allowed<span class='line-break'> </span>the extra amount of 2½% on the receipts for <span class='line-break'> </span>bills &amp;c. which they learn will give him about <span class='line-break'> </span>$350 additional.</p>
<p>In view also of the prospective business of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation, they would recommend that he be <span class='line-break'> </span>allowed the same rates in the future; provi<span class='line-break'></span>ded however, that in no year shall his <span class='line-break'> </span>whole compensation, exclusive of the Repair <span class='line-break'> </span>Fund exceed the sum of eight hundred dollars.</p>
<p>All of which is respectfully submitted.<span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1862-02-03'>Feby. 3. 1862</date></th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Charles C. Little</a></th> <th>} Committee<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Chas. G. Nazro</a></td> <td>} on Finance</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Mr Tobey</a>, the report was accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and adopted. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasr authorized to execute lease to Mr Spooner, the Gardener _'>Treas<sup>r</sup> authorized to execute lease to <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a>, the Gardener _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>, of the Com<sup>ee</sup> authorized to settle with <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a>, the Gardener, and arrange with him <span class='line-break'> </span>the terms on which he should continue as Gardener<span class='line-break'> </span>reported that a lease had been drawn, leasing to <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> the <a href='/pages/subjects/61312' title='Greenhouse'>Greenhouse</a> and lot of land on which <span class='line-break'> </span>it stands for the terms of three years: _ and, upon <span class='line-break'> </span>motion by him, it was</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> be authorized to execute <span class='line-break'> </span>said lease, and affix the Corporate seal. _</p>
</div>
</div>

<p>Adjourned without day,</p>

<p><b>Mount Auburn Cemetery.</b></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors&apos; Annual Meeting _ Feb.y 3. 1862 _'>Proprietors' Annual Meeting _ <date when='1862-02-03'>Feb.y 3. 1862 </date>_</span></p>
<p>The Annual Meeting of the Proprietors of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn, will be held in <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, at Mercantile Hall, 16 Summer Street, <span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1862-02-03T15:30:00'>Monday ^<sup>Feby</sup> 3<sup>d</sup>, at 3½ o'clock P. M.</date> to hear the reports<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees, and Treasurer, and to choose Trus<span class='line-break'></span>tees for the ensuing year. _</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>,, Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>. <date when='1862-01-27'>Jan.y 27. 1862</date>. _ </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Notification _'>Notification _</span></p>
<p>In accordance with the foregoing notification which <span class='line-break'> </span>was published seven days before the time of meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>in several <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> newspapers, the Proprietors met <span class='line-break'> </span>at the time and place therein named. _</p>
<p>A quorum being in attendance, the President, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Jacob Bigelow</a> took the chair. _</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> read the records of the last annual <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Annual Report _ Treasr &amp; Supt.s annual Reports read _'>Trustees Annual Report _ Treas<sup>r</sup> &amp; Supt.<sup>s</sup> annual Reports read _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> read the Annual Report of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees in print: _</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->The Treasurer</a> read his Annual Report and that <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Superintendent, also in print. _</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/60332' title='Richardson, Jeffrey'>Jeffrey Richardson Esq.</a> the <span class='line-break'> </span>reports were severally accepted. _</p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/84830' title='Chase, Irah, Jr.'>Irah Chase Jr.</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that a Committee of three persons be<span class='line-break'> </span>appointed to receive, sort and count the votes for</p>

<p>250</p>
<p>This certifies that we have examined the books and <span class='line-break'> </span>accounts of the Treasurer of the Proprietors of Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn, for the ^<sup>year</sup> ending <date when='1861-12-31'>December 31st, 1861</date>. and have <span class='line-break'> </span>found them correctly kept and properly balanced, with <span class='line-break'> </span>satisfactory vouchers for all  payments charged</p>
<p>The  certificates of stocks and other evidence of prop<span class='line-break'></span>erty were found in accordance with he statements in <span class='line-break'> </span>his accounts.</p>
<p>In the Fund for Repairs there appears to be due from <span class='line-break'> </span>twenty-three hundred and thirty-six 74-100 dollars; and<span class='line-break'> </span>there is due to him on General Account, four hundred <span class='line-break'> </span>and forty-six 11-100 dollars.</p>

Nazro</a></td> <td>} Committee</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>---------------</p>
<p>The Property of the Corporation consists of: <span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Cemetery, cost to date,</th> <th>$308.736.83<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>Statuary,</td> <td>15.356.20.</td> </tr> <tr><td>Notes Receivable, secured by Mortgages</td> <td>$ 12.000.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>15 Shares <a href='/pages/subjects/58787' title='Shawmut Bank'>Shawmut Bank</a>,</td> <td>1.500.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>4 " [Shares] <a href='/pages/subjects/58788' title='Boston &amp; Lowell Railroad'>Boston and Lowell Railroad</a>,</td> <td>2.000.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>20 " [Shares] <a href='/pages/subjects/54867' title='Atlantic Bank'>Atlantic Bank</a>,</td> <td>2.000.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>20 " [Shares] <a href='/pages/subjects/57590' title='Fitchburg Railroad'>Fitchburg Railroad</a>,</td> <td>2.000.00</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/57665' title='Superintendent&apos;s House'>Superintendent's House</a> and lot</td> <td>6.892.21</td> </tr> <tr><td>Deposited for Permanent Fund,</td> <td>24.279.10</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/62009' title='Lot 567'>Lot 567</a>,</td> <td>100.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>Two Tombs on <a href='/pages/subjects/59983' title='Hazel Dell'>Hazel Dell</a>,</td> <td><u>3.800.00</u></td> <td>$54.571.31</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Number of Lots sold</th> <th>91<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>"  [Number] " [of] "[Lots]  added to,</td> <td>121</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>All of which is respectfully submitted,</p>
<p><date when='1862-01-31'>January 31<sup>st</sup> 1862</date>  <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a>, Treasurer</p>

<div id="page-1134644">
<h3><a name="page-1134644">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 252)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>252</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Feb.y 17. 1862 _'>Trustees _ <date when='1862-02-17'>Feb.y 17. 1862 </date>_</span></p>
<p>Trustees Records _  1862 - 3.</p>
<p>The first meeting of the Trustees of the Cem<span class='line-break'></span>etery of Mount Auburn for organization and <span class='line-break'> </span>business was held at the office of the Corporation, <span class='line-break'> </span>(No. 33 School St.) on <date when='1862-02-17T10:00:00'>Monday February 17<sup>th</sup> at 10<span class='line-break'> </span>o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>.</p>
<p>The records of the annual meeting of the Propri<span class='line-break'></span>etors and of the last meeting of the Trustees were read.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Choice of Officers and Committees _'>Choice of Officers and Committees _</span></p>
<p>The Trustees then proceeded to ballot for officers <span class='line-break'> </span>and Committees required to be chosen by ballot,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the following were chosen. _</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Jacob Bigelow</a> -</th> <th>President<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> -</td> <td>Secretary</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a> -</td> <td>Treasurer</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Messrs</th> <th>{<a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a></td> <td>Com. on Finance</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>Messrs</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a></td> <td>Com. on Lots</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>Messrs</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a></td> <td>Com. on Grounds</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a></td> </tr> </tbody> </table></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134645">
<h3><a name="page-1134645">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 253)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>253</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Messrs</th> <th>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a> -</td> <td>Com. on Regulations &amp; Records of Interments.</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt chosen'>Sup<sup>t</sup> chosen</span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Daniel L. Winsor</a> was chosen Superintendent.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gatekeeper chosen _'>Gatekeeper chosen _</span></p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/60426' title='Safford, De Forest'>De Forest Safford</a> was chosen Gatekeeper. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proposed Inquiry into department of Gardening _'>Proposed Inquiry into department of Gardening _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Mr Tobey</a> stated that a letter had been put <span class='line-break'> </span>into his hands received from <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superintendent</a> in <span class='line-break'> </span>reply to an inquiry addressed to him by <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>as to the relation of the new system adopted last year<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Trustees to the care of lots, and whether, <span class='line-break'> </span>in case the office of Gardener should be discontinued,<span class='line-break'> </span>or <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> should be released from his con<span class='line-break'></span>nection therewith, in accordance with his known <span class='line-break'> </span>wishes, the Corporation could or could not manage<span class='line-break'> </span>this ^<sup>business</sup> as well as under a separate department and he read <span class='line-break'> </span>the letter, the  purpose of which was that it would<span class='line-break'> </span>tend to the simiplification of the management of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery, if all the work was done by the Corporation.</p>
<p>He therefore moved, for the purpose of further inquiry<span class='line-break'> </span>upon the operation of this department of work,<span class='line-break'> </span>that a Committee of three be chosen to inquire <span class='line-break'> </span>and report on the subject of Gardener: _</p>
<p>Some objections being made, because a new contract <span class='line-break'> </span>had just been entered upon with the Gardener, and <span class='line-break'> </span>several gentlemen who were nominated by the Chair</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134646">
<h3><a name="page-1134646">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 254)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>254</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gardener chosen _'>Gardener chosen _</span></p>
<p>having declined to serve on the Committee,</p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>, it was</p>
<p>Voted that the last vote be reconsidered.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Mr Cheever</a></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>W<sup>m</sup> H. Spooner</a> was their chosen Gardener.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> being called away, requested <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a> to take the chair.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Comee on Regul. &amp; Record of Interments'>Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Regul. &amp; Record of Interments</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Mr Tobey</a> presesented the report of the Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee on Regulations and record of Interments, <span class='line-break'> </span>which was "that they had examined the <span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent's books of record and believe <span class='line-break'> </span>them correctly kept. "_</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salaries and Compensation of Officers _'>Salaries and Compensation of Officers _</span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the salary and fees of the Sec<span class='line-break'></span>retary be the same as established last  year. _</p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the compensation of the Treasurer<span class='line-break'> </span>be the same as proposed by the report of the Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee adopted last month. _</p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the salary of the Superintendent <span class='line-break'> </span>be the same as last year. _</p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the salary of the Gatekeeper be the same</p>

<div id="page-1134648">
<h3><a name="page-1134648">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 256)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>256</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Removal of Lot 2288 ref to Com. on Lots _'>Removal of <a href='/pages/subjects/100957' title='Lot 2288'>Lot 2288</a> ref to Com. on Lots _</span></p>
<p>of the lot belonging to the estate of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/100958' title='Goodenow, Luther'>Luther<span class='line-break'> </span>Goodenow</a>. <a href='/pages/subjects/100957' title='Lot 2288'>No. 2288</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/59904' title='Spruce Avenue'>Spruce Avenue</a>, which is sur<span class='line-break'></span>rounded on three sides by land proposed to be taken <span class='line-break'> </span>for the <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>new Public Lot</a>, be referred to the Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee on Lots with full power. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Seth Pettee designated to represent Lots {661 1080 _ Mace Tisdale&apos;s _'><a href='/pages/subjects/100959' title='Pettee, Seth'>Seth Pettee</a> designated to represent <a href='/pages/subjects/68568' title='Lot 661'>Lots {<sup>661</sup></a> <a href='/pages/subjects/70103' title='Lot 1080'>1080</a> _ <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mace Tisdale</a>'s _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> stated that he had made applica<span class='line-break'></span>tion to <a href='/pages/subjects/100959' title='Pettee, Seth'>Mr Seth Pettee</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, who is sole execu<span class='line-break'></span>tor and Trustee under the will of <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mace Tisdale</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/68568' title='Lot 661'>lots <sup>661 and</sup></a> <a href='/pages/subjects/70103' title='Lot 1080'>1080</a>, requesting his consent to be <span class='line-break'> </span>designated as the representative of said lot, as the <span class='line-break'> </span>legal control of <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mr Tisdale</a>'s entire property is <span class='line-break'> </span>vested in him: that <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mr Tisdale</a> made a contract with <span class='line-break'> </span>this Corporation for the perpetual care of said lot and the <span class='line-break'> </span>grounds appurtenant; and that, at <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mr Tisdale</a>'s request,<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees directed to be entered upon the record of <span class='line-break'> </span>Donations for the care of Lots his expressed wish that, <span class='line-break'> </span>after the interment of the boies of three persons named <span class='line-break'> </span>in said paper, no other interments should ever <span class='line-break'> </span>be made in said lot: _</p>
<p>that <a href='/pages/subjects/100959' title='Pettee, Seth'>Mr Pettee</a> was very desirous that <a href='/pages/subjects/100960' title='Bradlee, John Tisdale'>John<span class='line-break'> </span>Tisdale Bradlee</a>, grandson of <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mr Tisdale</a> should repre<span class='line-break'></span>sent said lot, and that <a href='/pages/subjects/100960' title='Bradlee, John Tisdale'>Mr Bradlee</a> is stated by <a href='/pages/subjects/100959' title='Pettee, Seth'>Mr <span class='line-break'> </span>Pettee</a> to be willing to be so designated.</p>
<p>It appearing to be the opinion of the Trustees that<span class='line-break'> </span>the person who has the entire management of <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mr <span class='line-break'> </span>Tisdale</a>'s estate is the only proper one, it was</p>
<p>Voted on motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>,</p>
<p>That <a href='/pages/subjects/100959' title='Pettee, Seth'>Seth Pettee</a> be designated to represent <span class='line-break'> </span>said lot. _</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

Buckingham</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, a son of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59290' title='Buckingham, Joseph T.'>Joseph T. Buckingham</a> late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/100961' title='Lot 134'>lots num<span class='line-break'></span>bered 134</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/100962' title='Lot 149'><!--Lot-->149</a> to represent said lots: _</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3068'><a href='/pages/subjects/100969' title='Lot 3068'>3068</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/100970' title='Bird, William, II'>William Bird 2<sup>d</sup></a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/60389' title='Brookline, MA'>Brookline</a>, nephew, as well <span class='line-break'> </span>as Executor and trustee under the will of <a href='/pages/subjects/100971' title='Stone, Eveline'>Eveline <span class='line-break'> </span>Stone</a>, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/100969' title='Lot 3068'>lot numbered 3068</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>to represent said lot. _</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned. _</p>

<div id="page-1134650">
<h3><a name="page-1134650">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 258)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>258</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ March 3. 1862.'>Trustees _ <date when='1862-03-03'>March 3. 1862</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular meeting of the Trustees was held <span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1862-03-03T10:00:00'>Monday, March 3<sup>d</sup>, 1862 at 10 o'clock A.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read.</p>
