<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Inquiry of Perpetl guaranty for repair of lots refd to Comee on Lots _'>Inquiry of Perpet<sup>l</sup> guaranty for repair of lots ref<sup>d</sup> to Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots _</span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the subject of guarantying the<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual repair of lots be referred to <span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee on Lots to examine and <span class='line-break'> </span>report upon at the next meeting of the Board.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representatives for Lots 1485'>Representatives for <a href='/pages/subjects/100972' title='Lot 1485'>Lots 1485</a></span></p>
<p>Upon the application of the children, heirs at law, <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/100973' title='Barnes, Martin'>Martin Barnes</a>, deceased, late proprietor <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/100972' title='Lot 1485'>lot numbered 1485</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/100974' title='Barnes, Ann Eliza'>Ann Eliza Barnes</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/72702' title='West Cambridge, MA'>West Cambridge</a>, widow of said deceased, was <span class='line-break'> </span>designated to represent said lot: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2842 designated _'><a href='/pages/subjects/100975' title='Lot 2842'>2842</a> designated _</span></p>
<p>Upon the application of <a href='/pages/subjects/100976' title='Curtis, James O.'>James O. Curtis</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/60036' title='Medford, MA'>Medford</a>, Executor and trustee under the will <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/70006' title='Ballou, Hosea'>Rev. Hosea Ballou 2<sup>nd</sup></a>, late proprietor of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/100975' title='Lot 2842'>lot numbered 2842</a>, in concurrence with the <span class='line-break'> </span>widow of said Ballou, said <a href='/pages/subjects/100976' title='Curtis, James O.'>James O. Curtis</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>was designated to represent said lot. _</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y _</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134651">
<h3><a name="page-1134651">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 259)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>259</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ April 7. 1862 no Quorum _'>Trustees _ <date when='1862-04-07'>April 7. 1862</date> no Quorum _</span></p>
<p><date when='1862-04-07T10:00:00'>Monday April 7. 1862</date></p>
<p>At 10 o'clock a.m. the regular hour for <span class='line-break'> </span>the meeting of the Board of Trustees, there <span class='line-break'> </span>were in attendance, Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->Bige<span class='line-break'></span>low</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, who not consti<span class='line-break'></span>tuting a quorum, adjourned to the next <span class='line-break'> </span>regular meeting.</p>
<p>Attest, <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
<p>------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ May 5. 1862'>Trustees _ <date when='1862-05-05'>May 5. 1862</date></span></p>
<p>The regular meeting of the Trustees was held <span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1862-05-05T10:00:00'>Monday May 5. 1862, at 10 o'clock a.m. </date></p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. ~ .</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Guaranty for Perpetl Repair of lots. _'>Guaranty for Perpet<sup>l</sup> Repair of lots. _</span></p>
<p>Upon the subject of the vote passed at the last meeting, <span class='line-break'> </span>referring to the Committeee on Lots the subject of examining <span class='line-break'> </span>and reporting upon the guaranty for the perpetual repair <span class='line-break'> </span>of lots. _</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, Chairman of the Committee reported <span class='line-break'> </span>^<sup>verbally</sup> that the Committee had taken what they deemed to <span class='line-break'> </span>be a safe and prudent course, in fixing the amount <span class='line-break'> </span>for which the Corporation should assume the obligation for <span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual care of lots high enough to secure th Corpor<span class='line-break'></span>ation against danger of loss, _ which report was  <span class='line-break'> </span>accepted.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134652">
<h3><a name="page-1134652">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 260)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>260</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Right to Erect tombs _'>Right to Erect tombs _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the Committee on Lots be authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>to grant to the purchasers of lots the privelege [sic] of <span class='line-break'> </span>constructing tombs and <a href='/pages/subjects/66005' title='Catacomb Tombs'>catacombs</a> within the same <span class='line-break'> </span>at prices to be fixed by the committee, not less <span class='line-break'> </span>than fifty dollars for each tomb or catacomb,<span class='line-break'> </span>and they shall be further authorized to grant <span class='line-break'> </span>to proprietors of lots heretofore purchased the same <span class='line-break'> </span>privilege at the same price - not less than fifty <span class='line-break'> </span>dollars for each tomb, which shall be constructed <span class='line-break'> </span>according to articles 23<sup>d</sup> and 34<sup>th</sup> of the By-laws.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Shedd &amp; Edson&apos;s Survey _ Additl compen-s[at]ion for. _'><a href='/pages/subjects/57826' title='Shedd &amp; Edson'>Shedd &amp; Edson</a>'s Survey _ Addit<sup>l</sup> compen-s[at]ion for. _</span></p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/57826' title='Shedd &amp; Edson'>Shedd &amp; Edson</a>, who recently completed the <span class='line-break'> </span>new topographical survey of the Cemetery, having repre<span class='line-break'></span>sented to the Committee on Grounds that the cost of the <span class='line-break'> </span>work had far exceeded the contract price, and  having <span class='line-break'> </span>shown by their books the actual cash expenses,</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>, it was</p>
<p>Voted that the Committee on Grounds be author<span class='line-break'></span>ized to pay Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/57826' title='Shedd &amp; Edson'>Shedd &amp; Edson</a> the sum of <span class='line-break'> </span>seven hundred thirty two &amp; 86/100 dollars, ($732.86)<span class='line-break'> </span>already paid, and for which the contract was made, <span class='line-break'> </span>it being understood that they have actually expended in <span class='line-break'> </span>cash, $1,482.86 in completing the survey of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery, it was also being understood that they <span class='line-break'> </span>are to correct all errors that may be found in <span class='line-break'> </span>the survey and plans (if any exist) free of charge.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134653">
<h3><a name="page-1134653">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 261)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>262</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Represents'>Represent<sup>s</sup></span></p>
<p>In accordance with the several petitions of the <span class='line-break'> </span>parties in interest, the following representatives<span class='line-break'> </span>of lots were designated: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 323'><a href='/pages/subjects/63913' title='Lot 323'>Lot 323</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63912' title='Lowell, Charles Russell, II'>Charles R. Lowell</a>, ^<sup>of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a>,</sup> eldest son of <a href='/pages/subjects/65225' title='Lowell, Charles'>Charles Lowell</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/63913' title='Lot 323'>lot numbered 323</a> to represent <span class='line-break'> </span>said lot: _</p>
<p><b> <a href='/pages/subjects/101230' title='Lot 599'>" [Lot] 599</a></b></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/101231' title='Shaw, Mary'>Mary Shaw</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, widow of <a href='/pages/subjects/101232' title='Shaw, Jesse'>Jesse Shaw</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/101230' title='Lot 599'>lot numbered 599</a>, to represent <span class='line-break'> </span>said lot: _</p>
<p><b>  <a href='/pages/subjects/93173' title='Lot 1454'>" [Lot] 1454</a></b></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/101233' title='Stearns, George L.'>George L. Stearns</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/60036' title='Medford, MA'>Medford</a>, son in law of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/101234' title='Preston, Warren'>Warren Preston</a>, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/93173' title='Lot 1454'>lot numbered<span class='line-break'> </span>1454</a>, to represent said lot: _</p>
<p><b>  <a href='/pages/subjects/101235' title='Lot 1790'>" [Lot] 1790</a></b></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/101236' title='Hyne, William S.'>W<sup>m</sup> S. Hyne</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, only son of <a href='/pages/subjects/101237' title='Coleman, Anna M.'>Anna M. <span class='line-break'> </span>Coleman</a>, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/101235' title='Lot 1790'>lot numbered 1790</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>to represent said lot. _</p>
<p><b>  <a href='/pages/subjects/101238' title='Lot 2007'>" [Lot] 2007</a></b></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/101239' title='Whittemore, Lovice C.'>Lovice C. Whittemore</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a>, widow of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/101240' title='Whittemore, Thomas'>Thomas Whittemore</a>, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/101238' title='Lot 2007'>lot numbered<span class='line-break'> </span>2007</a>, to represent said lot. ~</p>
<p><b>  <a href='/pages/subjects/101241' title='Lot 2206'>" [Lot] 2206</a></b></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/101242' title='Grant, Moses P.'>Moses P. Grant</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, son of <a href='/pages/subjects/101243' title='Grant, Moses'>Moses Grant</a>, late <span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/101241' title='Lot 2206'>lot numbered 2206</a>, to represent said lot: _</p>
<p><b>  <a href='/pages/subjects/101244' title='Lot 2403'>" [Lot] 2403</a></b></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/101245' title='Stickney, John K.'>John K. Stickney</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/101246' title='Monroe, NY'>Monroe N. Y.</a>, only son of <a href='/pages/subjects/101247' title='Stickney, Susannah'>Susannah Stick<span class='line-break'></span>ney</a>, late prop<sup>r</sup> of <a href='/pages/subjects/101244' title='Lot 2403'>lot numbered 2403</a>, to represent said lot. _</p>
<p>Adjourned, Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Sec.y _</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134654">
<h3><a name="page-1134654">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 262)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>262</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ June 2. 1862'>Trustees _ <date when='1862-06-02'>June 2. 1862</date></span></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Trustees was held<span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1862-06-02T10:00:00'>Monday, June 2<sup>d</sup>. 1862, at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> _</p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>. _</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on Grounds authorized to have Lawn raised _'>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Grounds authorized to have <a href='/pages/subjects/58209' title='Asa Gray Garden'><!--the-->Lawn</a> raised _</span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the Committee on Grounds be <span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to raise the upper  part  of <a href='/pages/subjects/58209' title='Asa Gray Garden'>the Lawn</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>one and a half feet higher than it has already <span class='line-break'> </span>been raised, and at an expense not exceeding <span class='line-break'> </span>five hundred dollars. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Application of Mr Hitchcock refd to Com. on Lots. '>Application of <a href='/pages/subjects/25002154' title='Hitchcock, John'>Mr Hitchcock</a> ref<sup>d</sup> to Com. on Lots. </span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the application of <a href='/pages/subjects/25002154' title='Hitchcock, John'>Mr Hitchcock</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>made through <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superintendent</a> to procure twelve <span class='line-break'> </span>hundred feet of land on <a href='/pages/subjects/58791' title='Central Avenue'>Central Avenue</a> be re<span class='line-break'></span>ferred to the Committee on Lots, together with the <span class='line-break'> </span>subject of the proper margin to be reserved in this <span class='line-break'> </span>part of <a href='/pages/subjects/58791' title='Central Avenue'>Central Avenue</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Application of A. Mc Donald to purchase land _'>Application of <a href='/pages/subjects/64030' title='McDonald, Alexander'>A. M<sup>c</sup> Donald</a> to purchase land _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/64030' title='McDonald, Alexander'>Mr Alex<sup>r</sup> M<sup>c</sup>Donald</a> having applied to purchase <span class='line-break'> </span>a strip of land on which his marble shop now <span class='line-break'> </span>stands,</p>
<p>On motion of  <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> and Read be a Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>to examine and report on the subject of this application.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134655">
<h3><a name="page-1134655">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 263)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>263</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Receiving Tomb _ Comee on Grounds authorized to complete same _'><a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Receiving Tomb</a> _ Com<sup>ee</sup> on Grounds authorized to complete same _</span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>, the following was submitted,</p>
<p>"That the Committee on Grounds be <span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to complete the ^<a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'><sup>Corporation</sup> <u>Receiving</u> Tomb</a><span class='line-break'> </span>now in progress, or a part threof, as they think <span class='line-break'> </span>proper, at an expense not exceeding three thou<span class='line-break'></span>sand five hundred dollars: _"</p>
<p>which motion lies over to the next meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasr authorized to pay Spooner&apos;s note to J. Mann'><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->Treas<sup>r</sup></a> authorized to pay <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Spooner's</a> note to <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>J. Mann</a></span></p>
<p>On motion also of <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> be authorized to <span class='line-break'> </span>pay to <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> the amount of said <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Spooner's</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>note to <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Jona. Mann</a>, amounting to $250 and <span class='line-break'> </span>interest, being one of the notes secured by the <span class='line-break'> </span>mortgage of the <a href='/pages/subjects/61312' title='Greenhouse'>Greenhouse</a> now owned by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees, upon the said note being delivered up <span class='line-break'> </span>to the Treasurer cancelled. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Amendt of By-Laws _ Art. 31 _'>Amend<sup>t</sup> of By-Laws _ Art. 31 _</span></p>
<p>On motion also of <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>, the following was submitted</p>
<p>That Art. 31<sup>st</sup> of the By-laws, as numbered in <span class='line-break'> </span>the last printed edition of the By-laws, be amended by <span class='line-break'> </span>inserting as a substitute for the last clause the following:</p>
<p>"In case of Military Funerals the firing of volleys<span class='line-break'> </span>over the grave may be allowed on the written permit <span class='line-break'> </span>of two Trustees _ the Superintendent arranging a <span class='line-break'> </span>suitable hour for the funeral. _</p>
<p>Adjourned,</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134656">
<h3><a name="page-1134656">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 264)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>264</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ July 7. 1862 _'>Trustees _ <date when='1862-07-07'>July 7. 1862</date> _</span></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Trustees was held <span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1862-07-07T10:00:00'>Monday, July 7<sup>th</sup> at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> _</p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 592 and Tomb purchased by the Corporation _'><a href='/pages/subjects/81822' title='Lot 592'>Lot 592</a> and Tomb purchased by the Corporation _</span></p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Mr Cheever</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the recent purchase by <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Super<span class='line-break'></span>intendent</a> of the <a href='/pages/subjects/81822' title='Lot 592'>lot and tomb No. 592</a>, situated on <span class='line-break'> </span>what was formerly known as <a href='/pages/subjects/61229' title='Mayflower Path'>Mayflower Path</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>be hereby ratifid _</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> was excused from further attendance.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proposed Amendt of by-law as to Military Funerals laid on table _'>Proposed Amend<sup>t</sup> of by-law as to Military Funerals laid on table _</span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Mr Austin</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the proposal amendment of the by<span class='line-break'></span>laws relating to military funerals be laid upon the table.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Appropriation for new-Tombs refd to meeting in Novr next _'>Appropriation for new-Tombs ref<sup>d</sup> to meeting in Nov<sup>r</sup> next _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the motion providing an appropriation <span class='line-break'> </span>for completing the new tombs on <a href='/pages/subjects/57593' title='Auburn Lake'>Auburn Lake</a> which <span class='line-break'> </span>was submitted at the last meeting, be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Trustees in November next. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Bill of G. S. Hillard, Auditor in Mann&apos;s case, refd to Com. on Prosecution _'>Bill of <a href='/pages/subjects/101263' title='Hillard, George S.'>G. S. Hillard</a>, Auditor in Mann's case, ref<sup>d</sup> to Com. on Prosecution _</span></p>
<p>The bill of <a href='/pages/subjects/101263' title='Hillard, George S.'>Mr G. S. Hillard</a>, Auditor in the case of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation vs <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Jona. Mann</a> was presented. _</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the same be referred to the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>of prosecution, to report thereon. _</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134657">
<h3><a name="page-1134657">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 265)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>265</p>
<p><b>$1000 appropriated for Lake on site of "<a href='/pages/subjects/57864' title='Halcyon Lake'>Garden Pond</a>", so called _</b></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Mr Austin</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the Committee on Grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>be authorized to expend a sum not exceeding <span class='line-break'> </span>one thousand dollars towards making and <span class='line-break'> </span>stoning up a lake in the place now called <span class='line-break'> </span>"<a href='/pages/subjects/57864' title='Halcyon Lake'>Garden Pond</a>" on the map of Mount Auburn.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Laid on table motion for appropriation for steps from the Tower down the hill, northward.'>Laid on table motion for appropriation for steps from the <a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>Tower</a> down the hill, northward.</span></p>
<p>The chairman of the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Grounds submitted <span class='line-break'> </span>the following for adoption, which on motion of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Mr Cheever</a>, was laid on the table to the <span class='line-break'> </span>next meeting: _</p>
<p>"That, until otherwise ordered, the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Grounds be authorized to expend <span class='line-break'> </span>one thousand dollars annually, in constructing <span class='line-break'> </span>a flight of stone steps from the northerly part<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/61236' title='Mountain Avenue'>Mountain Avenue</a>, near the <a href='/pages/subjects/54814' title='Washington Tower'>Tower</a>, down <span class='line-break'> </span>the hill towards <a href='/pages/subjects/61308' title='Consecration Dell'>Consecration Dell</a>; _ the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee to report annually." _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Represents designation for Lot 197'>Represent<sup>s</sup> designation for <a href='/pages/subjects/101264' title='Lot 197'>Lot 197</a></span></p>
<p>Upon the petition of <a href='/pages/subjects/101265' title='Appleton, Thomas G.'>Thomas G. Appleton</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>eldest son, and surviving Executor of <a href='/pages/subjects/55017' title='Appleton, Nathan'>Nathan Apple<span class='line-break'></span>ton</a>, deceased, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/101264' title='Lot 197'>lot numbered 197</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>he was designated to represent said lot. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 3126'><a href='/pages/subjects/101266' title='Lot 3126'>Lot 3126</a></span></p>
<p>Upon the petition of <a href='/pages/subjects/101267' title='Dorey, William'>William Dorey</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, guar<span class='line-break'></span>dian of the children of <a href='/pages/subjects/101268' title='Guppy, James H.'>James H. Guppy</a>, late proprietor <span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/101266' title='Lot 3126'>lot numbered 3126</a>, deceased, supported also by the <span class='line-break'> </span>request of the widow, he was designated to represent<span class='line-break'> </span>said lot.  _</p>
<p>Adjourned - Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134658">
<h3><a name="page-1134658">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 266)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>266</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Aug. 4. 1862.'>Trustees _ <date when='1862-08-04'>Aug. 4. 1862</date>.</span></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Trustees was held <span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1862-08-04T10:00:00'>Monday, August 4<sup>th</sup>, 1862, at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> _</p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>. _</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Edw. Austin&apos;s application _'><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Edw. Austin</a>'s application _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Mr Austin</a> stated that, by a recent survey <span class='line-break'> </span>of his lot, it had been ascertained that the late Sup<span class='line-break'></span>erintendent, <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>, had enclosed within the <span class='line-break'> </span>granite curb ninety two square feet more than the <span class='line-break'> </span>800 feet which he held by his deeds _ that as this sur<span class='line-break'></span>plus was not needed by him, and was enclosed without <span class='line-break'> </span>his knowledge or consent, he ought not to be held<span class='line-break'> </span>to pay for it.</p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Mr Cheever</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the matter be referred to the Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee on Lots with full power. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Auditor&apos;s fees in suit vs J. Mann'>Auditor's fees in suit vs <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>J. Mann</a></span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the fees of <a href='/pages/subjects/101263' title='Hillard, George S.'>Geo. S. Hillard Esq</a>, for <span class='line-break'> </span>auditing in the case of this Corporation vs <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>J. Mann</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>which amount to six hundred dollars, be paid.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Comee on Prosecution _ and '>Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Prosecution _ and </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> for the Committee to prosecute the <span class='line-break'> </span>claim of the Corporation vs <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>J. Mann</a>, reported <span class='line-break'> </span>that they had obtained an award from the Auditor <span class='line-break'> </span>against Mann of two thousand and ninety dollars and <span class='line-break'> </span>eight cents ($2.090.08) as the balance now due from him.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134659">
<h3><a name="page-1134659">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 267)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>267</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Instruction of Comee _'>Instruction of Com<sup>ee</sup> _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the Committee be instructed not <span class='line-break'> </span>to appeal from <a href='/pages/subjects/101263' title='Hillard, George S.'>Mr Hillard's</a> award. _</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a>, for the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Grounds, again <span class='line-break'> </span>introduced the subject of erecting a flight of steps <span class='line-break'> </span>down the Northerly side of the <a href='/pages/subjects/60404' title='Tower Hill'>Tower Hill</a>. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Stone Steps from Mountain Ave to Consecration Dell _'>Stone Steps from <a href='/pages/subjects/61236' title='Mountain Avenue'>Mountain Ave</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/61308' title='Consecration Dell'>Consecration Dell</a> _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the Committee on Grounds be re<span class='line-break'></span>quested to submit, at the next meeting of the Board, <span class='line-break'> </span>a plan for erecting a flight of stone steps from <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61236' title='Mountain Avenue'>Mountain Avenue</a> down northwardly to <a href='/pages/subjects/61308' title='Consecration Dell'>Conse<span class='line-break'></span>cration Dell</a>, accompanied with an estimate<span class='line-break'> </span>from some responsible person who will contract <span class='line-break'> </span>for the same at the estimated price _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='New form of Blank Deeds ordered _'>New form of Blank Deeds ordered _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> stated that there is occasion for <span class='line-break'> </span>printing an additional number of blank deeds for record,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that experience had shown the need of greater def<span class='line-break'></span>initeness in the descriptive part, _</p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the subject be referred to the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots with power to prepare a new form of deed with <span class='line-break'> </span>such amendments as may be needed. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 1172 Rep. appointed _'><a href='/pages/subjects/101273' title='Lot 1172'>Lot 1172</a> Rep. appointed _</span></p>
<p>Upon petition of the devisees under the will of <a href='/pages/subjects/101274' title='Pearson, John H.'>John H. <span class='line-break'> </span>Pearson</a>, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/101273' title='Lot 1172'>lot numbered 1172</a>, deceased,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/101275' title='Pearson, Charles L.'>Charles L. Pearson</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, the youngest son &amp; sole trustee<span class='line-break'> </span>under said will was designated to represent said lot. _</p>
<p>Adjourned, Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Sec.y.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134660">
<h3><a name="page-1134660">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 268)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>268</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees - Septr 1. 1862 no quorum _'>Trustees - <date when='1862-09-01'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 1. 1862</date> no quorum _</span></p>
<p><date when='1862-09-01T10:00:00'>Monday September 1. 1862</date></p>
<p>At 10 o'clock a.m., the regular hour for the <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Board of Trustees there were <span class='line-break'> </span>in attendance, Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, who, not constituting a quorum,<span class='line-break'> </span>adjourned the meeting for one week. _</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y.</p>
<p>---------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Septr 8.1862.'>Trustees <date when='1862-09-08'>Sept<sup>r</sup> 8.1862</date>.</span></p>
<p>A meeting of the Trustees of Mount Auburn <span class='line-break'> </span>was held according to adjournment on <date when='1862-09-08T10:00:00'>Monday, <span class='line-break'> </span>September 8<sup>th</sup> at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> _</p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> and <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='J. Mann&apos;s case _ Additional counsel authorized.'><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>J. Mann</a>'s case _ Additional counsel authorized.</span></p>
<p>The Chairman of the Committee to prosecute the claim <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation vs. <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>J. Mann</a> stated that <span class='line-break'> </span>notice had been received from the defendant's <span class='line-break'> </span>counsel that they should appeal from the auditor's<span class='line-break'> </span>report.  He also stated that additional counsel had<span class='line-break'> </span>been employed by them.</p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that it is expedient that the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>of prosecution should employ additional counsel<span class='line-break'> </span>for the Corporation.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on Grounds not ready to report'>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Grounds not ready to report</span></p>
<p>The Chairman of the Committee on Grounds stated that <span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee were not prepared, at present, to report</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134661">
<h3><a name="page-1134661">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 269)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>269</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='estimate for Flight of Granite Steps _'>estimate for Flight of Granite Steps _</span></p>
<p>an estimate for a flight of granite steps down the <a href='/pages/subjects/60404' title='Tower Hill'>northly <span class='line-break'> </span>slope of Mount Auburn</a>. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resignation of Gate Keeper _'>Resignation of Gate Keeper _</span></p>
<p>A communication was received from <a href='/pages/subjects/60426' title='Safford, De Forest'>De Forest Safford</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>resigning hs office as Gatekeeper, having enlisted in <span class='line-break'> </span>the Federal Army, for the war. _</p>
<p>Voted that the resignation be accepted. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Candidate for vacancy refd to Comee on Ints.'>Candidate for vacancy ref<sup>d</sup> to Com<sup>ee</sup> on Ints.</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,</p>
<p>Voted to refer the question of selecting a candidate<span class='line-break'> </span>to fill the vacancy existing in the office of Gatekeeper<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Committee on Interments.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Spooner, W. H. Jr. resignation subject to approval of the Board.'><a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Spooner, W. H. Jr.</a> resignation subject to approval of the Board.</span></p>
<p>A communication was read from the Gardener, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>W<sup>m</sup> H. Spooner</a> Jr, to the effect that he had sold out <span class='line-break'> </span>his stock of plants and lease of <a href='/pages/subjects/61312' title='Greenhouse'>greenhouse</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/64030' title='McDonald, Alexander'>Alex<sup>r</sup> M<sup>c</sup>-<span class='line-break'> </span>Donald</a>, subject to the approval of the Trustees, and <span class='line-break'> </span>requesting that the Board would choose said M<sup>c</sup>-<span class='line-break'> </span>Donald as Gardener in  his stead. _</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Refd to a Committee _'>Ref<sup>d</sup> to a Committee _</span></p>
<p>Voted that the subject contained in the commun<span class='line-break'></span>ication of <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> be referred to a committee <span class='line-break'> </span>consisting of Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, to report <span class='line-break'> </span>upon at the next meeting, and that they also be requested <span class='line-break'> </span>to report whether, in their view it is or is not expedient to <span class='line-break'> </span>abolish the office of Gardener, and to recommend what <span class='line-break'> </span>other course ought to be adopted, if the office should be abolished.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 1924'><a href='/pages/subjects/101279' title='Lot 1924'>Lot 1924</a></span></p>
<p>Upon the petition of the heirs at law of <a href='/pages/subjects/101280' title='Emery, F. W. R., Mr.'>F. W. R. Emery</a> late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/101279' title='Lot 1924'>lot <span class='line-break'> </span>No. 1924</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/101281' title='Emery, Francis F.'>Francis F. Emery</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, his eldest son, was designated to rep<span class='line-break'></span>resent said lot. _ Adjourned,, Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Sec. y.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134662">
<h3><a name="page-1134662">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 270)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>270</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ October 6. 1862 _'>Trustees _ <date when='1862-10-06'>October 6. 1862</date> _</span></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Trustees of Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn was held on <date when='1862-10-06T10:00:00'>Monday, October 6, 1862, at <span class='line-break'> </span>10 o'clock a.m.</date> _</p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Comee of Interments on appointment of a Gate Keeper _'>Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> of Interments on appointment of a Gate Keeper _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Mr Tobey</a> for the Committee on Interments read the <span class='line-break'> </span>following report: _</p>
<p>"The undersigned "Committee on Interments" charged <span class='line-break'> </span>with the duty of selecting a suitable gatekeeper in place of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60426' title='Safford, De Forest'>Mr Safford</a>, would respectfully report the name of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63799' title='Derby, James, Jr.'>James Derby Jr.</a> as a person suitable and competent <span class='line-break'> </span>to discharge the duties of that office.  They recommend<span class='line-break'> </span>that he be paid a salary of four hundred <span class='line-break'> </span>dollars per annum, and the additional sum of <span class='line-break'> </span>seventy five cents per week to enable him to compen<span class='line-break'></span>sate a substitute whom he shall procure to per<span class='line-break'></span>form his duties as Gatekeeper, one half of every Sab<span class='line-break'></span>bath.  Said substitute must (in the Judgment of the Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee and Superintendent) be as suitable and <span class='line-break'> </span>competent as <a href='/pages/subjects/63799' title='Derby, James, Jr.'>Mr Derby</a>.</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th>Respy. submitted by</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>E. S. Tobey</a></th> <th>} Committee <span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Uriel Crocker</a></td> <td>} on </td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___</td> <td>___</td> <td>} Interments</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1862-10-06'>Oct _ 6, 1862.</date></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='James Derby Jr. appointed Gate Keeper.'><a href='/pages/subjects/63799' title='Derby, James, Jr.'>James Derby Jr.</a> appointed Gate Keeper.</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the foregoing report be accepted and adopted, <span class='line-break'> </span>and that <a href='/pages/subjects/63799' title='Derby, James, Jr.'>James Derby Jr.</a> be chosen Gatekeeper<span class='line-break'> </span>in accordance with the terms therein stated. _</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134663">
<h3><a name="page-1134663">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 271)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>271</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Specl Comee recommend acceptance of Resignation of Mr Spooner as Gardener _ and purchase of his interest there in'>Spec<sup>l</sup> Com<sup>ee</sup> recommend acceptance of Resignation of <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a> as Gardener _ and purchase of his interest there in</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a> for the Special Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>the matter read the following report: _</p>
<p>"The Committee to whom was referred the <span class='line-break'> </span>letter of <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>W<sup>m</sup> H. Spooner</a> proposing to surrender <span class='line-break'> </span>his lease of the <a href='/pages/subjects/61312' title='Greenhouse'>Greenhouse</a> and grounds appur<span class='line-break'></span>tenant thereto, and to relinquish his situation <span class='line-break'> </span>as official Gardener of Mount Auburn, report <span class='line-break'> </span>that upon a full consideration of the subject, they <span class='line-break'> </span>are of opinion that it will be for the interest of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation to accede to <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a>'s request, so far <span class='line-break'> </span>as relates to his relinquishment of the office of Gardener,<span class='line-break'> </span>and they therefore recommend that <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> be <span class='line-break'> </span>authorized to cancel the lease with <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>upon a full settlement of all amounts due the Corpor<span class='line-break'></span>ation from <a href='/pages/subjects/63792' title='Spooner, William H., Jr.'>Mr Spooner</a>, and a surrender by him in <span class='line-break'> </span>good order of the leased premises.</p>
<p>And they further recommend that the office <span class='line-break'> </span>of Gardener be abolished, and that the care and <span class='line-break'> </span>superintendence of lots be committed to the Superin<span class='line-break'></span>tendent in such manner and under such direc<span class='line-break'></span>tions as the Trustees shall prescribe.</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th>___</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>W<sup>m</sup> T. Andrews</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td><date when='1862-10-06'>Oct. 6<sup>th</sup> 1862</date>.</td> <td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'> Edw<sup>d</sup> S. Rand</a>"</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Adopted'>Adopted</span></p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a></p>
<p>Voted to accept the report-</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Subject referred to same Comee _ to carry out recommendations _'>Subject referred to same Com<sup>ee</sup> _ to carry out recommendations _</span></p>
<p>Also Voted that the subject of carrying out the recommend<span class='line-break'></span>ations of their Committee be referred to Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, with power to make such purchases and arrangements <span class='line-break'> </span>as may be necessary in the premises. _<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134664">
<h3><a name="page-1134664">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 272)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>272</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Question of use of Internal Reve Stamps by the Corpn refd to Finance Comee'>Question of use of Internal Rev<sup>e</sup> Stamps by the Corp<sup>n</sup> ref<sup>d</sup> to Finance Com<sup>ee</sup></span></p>
<p>Upon the suggestion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a>, in a written com<span class='line-break'></span>munication it was</p>
<p>Voted that the subject of the rights <span class='line-break'> </span>and duties of the Corporation under the recent act of Congress <span class='line-break'> </span>requiring stamps to be affixed to contracts, certificates &amp;c, be <span class='line-break'> </span>referred to the Committee on Finance with full power. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Shedd &amp; Edson&apos;s Sectional Survey to be the Authorized Plans of the Corpn _'><a href='/pages/subjects/57826' title='Shedd &amp; Edson'>Shedd &amp; Edson</a>'s Sectional Survey to be the Authorized Plans of the Corp<sup>n</sup> _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that, in all future deeds of lots or additions <span class='line-break'> </span>thereto, the Sectional plans of Mount Auburn drawn <span class='line-break'> </span>by <a href='/pages/subjects/57826' title='Shedd &amp; Edson'>Shedd &amp; Edson</a> shall be referred to as the authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>map of the Cemetery; and that all additions and changes <span class='line-break'> </span>upon the same be made by the said <a href='/pages/subjects/57826' title='Shedd &amp; Edson'>Shedd &amp; Edson</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>on such terms as shall be satisfactory to the Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee on Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Clover Path _'><a href='/pages/subjects/61154' title='Clover Path'>Clover Path</a> _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a>, for the Committee on Grounds, reported that <span class='line-break'> </span>a path leading from <a href='/pages/subjects/58080' title='Maple Avenue'>Maple Avenue</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/61105' title='Acorn Path'>Acorn Path</a> had <span class='line-break'> </span>been named <a href='/pages/subjects/61154' title='Clover Path'>Clover Path</a>. _ and the report was accepted.</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th>Adjourned,<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___</td> <td>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>------------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Novr 3 1862 _'>Trustees _ <date when='1862-11-03'>Nov<sup>r</sup> 3 1862</date> _</span></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Trustees was held on <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1862-11-03T10:00:00'>Monday November 3<sup>d</sup> 1862, at 10 o'clock P. m. </date></p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Reed</a>. _</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134665">
<h3><a name="page-1134665">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 273)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>273</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. ~</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Tomb Front on Rosebay Ave'>Tomb Front on <a href='/pages/subjects/59984' title='Rosebay Avenue'>Rosebay Av<sup>e</sup></a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a>, as chairman of the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Grounds, stated that the question relating to the Corpor<span class='line-break'></span>ation tomb, on <a href='/pages/subjects/59984' title='Rosebay Avenue'>Rosebay Avenue</a>, was in July referred <span class='line-break'> </span>to this meeting _</p>
<p>That the tomb front had been taken down,<span class='line-break'> </span>hammered over, and set up again _  that the work <span class='line-break'> </span>was put up in a substantial manner by the contractors _<span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/66004' title='Granite Railway Company'>Granite Railway Company</a>, and appeared well, ex<span class='line-break'></span>cepting the bad stains which had reappeared in <span class='line-break'> </span>places, and still rendered the structure objection<span class='line-break'></span>able.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Question of acceptanc referred to Comee on Grounds with full power.'>Question of acceptanc referred to Com<sup>ee</sup> on Grounds with full power.</span></p>
<p>The other members of the Committee present <span class='line-break'> </span>expressed their dissatisfaction with its appearance.</p>
<p>And upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>, it was <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted to refer the question of the tomb front on <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59984' title='Rosebay Avenue'>Rosebay Avenue</a> to the Committee on Grounds, with <span class='line-break'> </span>full power to settle with the contractors on such <span class='line-break'> </span>terms as they shall think expedient.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Comee on Lots respecting lots cared for by the Corpn'>Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots respecting lots cared for by the Corp<sup>n</sup></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a> for the Committee on Lots</p>
<p>Reported that the Committee had visited Mount <span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn, and examined the lots cared for by the <span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation under funds provided; that certain lots are <span class='line-break'> </span>needing extra repairs, and, in two cases, curb or edge stones<span class='line-break'></span>that, in both cases, the accumulation of funds will <span class='line-break'> </span>warrant such expenditure.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee'>Com<sup>ee</sup></span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Reed</a>, it was</p>
<p>Voted that the Committee on Lots be authorized</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134666">
<h3><a name="page-1134666">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 274)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>275</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='authorized to make certain improvements on lots _'>authorized to make certain improvements on lots _</span></p>
<p>to make such repairs and improvements as they <span class='line-break'> </span>shall deem necessary on said lots.</p>
<p>Complaint being made that proprietors sometimes <span class='line-break'> </span>employ to cut down trees in their lots persons not <span class='line-break'> </span>in the service of the Corporation, and that such work <span class='line-break'> </span>is often done in a manner prejudicial to the inter<span class='line-break'></span>ests of the Corporation and individual proprietors,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Order for-bidding the cutting down of trees by persons not in employ of the Corpn'>Order for-bidding the cutting down of trees by persons not in employ of the Corp<sup>n</sup></span></p>
<p>It was</p>
<p>Voted that hereafter no trees shall be <span class='line-break'> </span>cut down in the Cemetery by any other person <span class='line-break'> </span>than those employed by the Corporation under the <span class='line-break'> </span>direction of the Superintendent, subject to the approval <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Committee on Grounds. _</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th>Adjourned,<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___</td> <td>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary.</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>------------------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Decr 1. 1862'>Trustees <date when='1862-12-01'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 1. 1862</date></span></p>
<p>The monthly meeting of the Trustees was held on <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1862-12-01T10:00:00'>Monday, December 1<sup>st</sup>, 1862, at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> _</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read.</p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> submitted the following vote which <span class='line-break'> </span>was adopted, but was subsequently reconsiderd and <span class='line-break'> </span>laid on the table till the next meeting.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134667">
<h3><a name="page-1134667">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 275)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>275</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proposition to take gravel from sides of Laurel Ave _'>Proposition to take gravel from sides of <a href='/pages/subjects/55284' title='Laurel Avenue'>Laurel Av<sup>e</sup></a> _</span></p>
<p>"That for the necessary uses of the Cemetery, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superintendent</a> be authorized to take earth and <span class='line-break'> </span>gravel from the sides of <a href='/pages/subjects/55347' title='Laurel Hill'>Laurel Hill</a>, by lowering<span class='line-break'> </span>the upper and oval part of <a href='/pages/subjects/55284' title='Laurel Avenue'>Laurel Avenue</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>not more than fifteen feet, and removing the <span class='line-break'> </span>earth and gravel upon and adjacent to the same <span class='line-break'> </span>so far as it can be done without trespassing on <span class='line-break'> </span>the rights of proprietors.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Drainage of the swamp between Thistle &amp; Anemone Paths.'>Drainage of the swamp between <a href='/pages/subjects/61286' title='Thistle Path'>Thistle<!--Path--></a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/61115' title='Anemone Path'>Anemone Paths</a>.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> read a communication from <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superintendent</a> in relation to draining the low <span class='line-break'> </span>swampy piece of ground between <a href='/pages/subjects/61286' title='Thistle Path'>Thistle<!--Path--></a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/61115' title='Anemone Path'>Anem<span class='line-break'></span>one Paths</a> into the pond at the southwesterly cor<span class='line-break'></span>ner and mostly outside of the Cemetery, at an ex<span class='line-break'></span>pense probably of $200 to 250. _</p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>, it was <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the Committee on  Grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>be authorized to have such drain constructed, <span class='line-break'> </span>from said swamp to the point indicated in such <span class='line-break'> </span>manner as they shall be satisfied will best answer <span class='line-break'> </span>the purpose. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proposition of Mrs M. Hemenway in reference to Fountain _'>Proposition of <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mrs M. Hemenway</a> in reference to <a href='/pages/subjects/58208' title='Alice Fountain'><!--Alice-->Fountain</a> _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a> also submitted the following prop<span class='line-break'></span>osition from <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mrs Mary Hemenway</a>. _</p>
<p>(Copy)</p>
<p>"<a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1862-11-06'>Nov. 6. 1862</date></p>
<p>If the Corporation of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn, <span class='line-break'> </span>will construct a fountain opposite my lot in the low <span class='line-break'> </span>land between <a href='/pages/subjects/61286' title='Thistle Path'>Thistle<!--Path--></a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/61159' title='Cowslip Path'>Cowslip Paths</a> equal to <a href='/pages/subjects/58209' title='Asa Gray Garden'>the <span class='line-break'> </span>fountain in the Lawn</a>, and which shall be kept</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134668">
<h3><a name="page-1134668">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 276)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>276</p>
<p>running as long as that fountain, and if they <span class='line-break'> </span>will also convey to me by deed one half of the <span class='line-break'> </span>said low land and half of the adjacent land <span class='line-break'> </span>between <a href='/pages/subjects/61159' title='Cowslip Path'>Cowslip<!--Path--></a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/61115' title='Anemone Path'>Anemone Paths</a>, to be forever <span class='line-break'> </span>kept open and in good condition, I will pay them <span class='line-break'> </span>six thousand dollars, as soon as <a href='/pages/subjects/58208' title='Alice Fountain'><!--Alice-->the fountain</a> is <span class='line-break'> </span>made.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mary Hemenway</a>"</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mrs Hemenway&apos;s Proposition referred to Comee on Grounds to report upon at adjd meeting.'><a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mrs Hemenway</a>'s Proposition referred to Com<sup>ee</sup> on Grounds to report upon at adj<sup>d</sup> meeting.</span></p>
<p>After some discussion of said proposition,</p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr <!--P-->Curtis</a>, it was</p>
<p>Voted, that the subject be referred to the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Grounds with instruction to report at an adjourned <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting to be held on Monday next, among other <span class='line-break'> </span>things specifically the cost of the execution of the work,<span class='line-break'> </span>the quantity of land  proposed to be conveyed to <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mrs <span class='line-break'> </span>Hemenway</a>, the cost of keeping up the fountain, and <span class='line-break'> </span>of the care of the grounds thus to be kept open, with <span class='line-break'> </span>such other facts as they may think proper. _</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned for one week.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y.</p>
<p>---------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ adjd meeting _ Dec. 8. 1862 _'>Trustees _ adj<sup>d</sup> meeting _ <date when='1862-12-08'>Dec. 8. 1862</date> _</span></p>
<p>An adjourned meeting of the Trustees was<span class='line-break'> </span>held on <date when='1862-12-08T10:00:00'>Monday, December 8<sup>th</sup> 1862, at 10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present, Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134669">
<h3><a name="page-1134669">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 277)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>277</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Comee on Grounds on proposition of Mrs Hemenway for Fountain _'>Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Grounds on proposition of <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mrs Hemenway</a> for Fountain _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a>, for the Committee on Grounds, <span class='line-break'> </span>submitted their report on the matter of the propo<span class='line-break'></span>sition of <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mrs Mary Hemenway</a> which was re<span class='line-break'></span>committed at the last meeting - as follows: _</p>
<p>"<a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mrs Mary Hemenway</a> by her communica<span class='line-break'></span>tion dated <date when='1862-11-06'>November 6. 1862</date>, offers to pay to the Cor<span class='line-break'></span>poration of Mount Auburn Cemtery six thousand <span class='line-break'> </span>dollars, if they will construct <a href='/pages/subjects/58208' title='Alice Fountain'><!--Alice-->a fountain opposite <span class='line-break'> </span>her lot</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/61286' title='Thistle Path'>Thistle Path</a>, and convey to her in trust <span class='line-break'> </span>to be forever kept open about twenty one thousand and <span class='line-break'> </span>ninety eight feet of land exclusive of water, as seen <span class='line-break'> </span>in a plan of the same drawn by Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/57826' title='Shedd &amp; Edson'>Shedd<span class='line-break'> </span>and Edson</a>.  This land is composed chiefly of a wet<span class='line-break'> </span>bog, and a very steep bank, neither of them convertible <span class='line-break'> </span>to Cemetery purposes without a large outlay for filling <span class='line-break'> </span>up and altering their grade.  The number of lots <span class='line-break'> </span>which could be constructed on this land, by <a href='/pages/subjects/81482' title='Shedd, J. H., Mr.'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Shedd's</a> estimate, would not exceed thirty five: _ and <span class='line-break'> </span>these would perhaps be the last part of Mount Au<span class='line-break'></span>burn to come into the market.  Supposing them to be <span class='line-break'> </span>all sold in twenty or twenty five years, at present <span class='line-break'> </span>full prices, they would not bring the accumulated <span class='line-break'> </span>value of three thousand dollars paid at the present <span class='line-break'> </span>time.</p>
<p>As to the cost of  constructing <a href='/pages/subjects/58208' title='Alice Fountain'><!--Alice-->the fountain</a>, if it <span class='line-break'> </span>is found on experiment that we can afford to waste <span class='line-break'> </span>the water after it is used, the fountain can be made<span class='line-break'> </span>for fifteen hundred dollars. _ But if the water is saved <span class='line-break'> </span>and returned to the well, the whole cost, including laid <span class='line-break'> </span>pipes and a water tight basin would not exceed three</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134670">
<h3><a name="page-1134670">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 278)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>278</p>
<p>thousand five hundred dollars ($3,500) according <span class='line-break'> </span>to the items furnished by <a href='/pages/subjects/81482' title='Shedd, J. H., Mr.'>Mr Shedd's</a> estimate.</p>
<p>The land, which is by convenant to be kept <span class='line-break'> </span>open forever, is the smallest amount which would <span class='line-break'> </span>allow the fountain to be seen to any advantage.  Indeed<span class='line-break'> </span>if half as much more land were added, it would <span class='line-break'> </span>increase the beauty of Mount Auburn, and <span class='line-break'> </span>add to the desirableness of the surrounding lots <span class='line-break'> </span>which will be prepared for sale.</p>
<p>The works being already made for running <span class='line-break'> </span>two fountains, a third fountain can be carried on <span class='line-break'> </span>with the same works, for an additional expense in <span class='line-break'> </span>coal, labor and repairs not probably exceeding<span class='line-break'> </span>one hundred dollars per annum. _"</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th>For the Committee</th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, Chairman</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Mrs Hemenway&apos;s proposition accepted in a modified form _'><a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mrs Hemenway</a>'s proposition accepted in a modified form _</span></p>
<p>After some conversation on the subject, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> submitted the following motion</p>
<p>"That the Trustees will accept the offer of <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mrs Hem<span class='line-break'></span>enway</a>, dated <date when='1862-11-06'>Nov<sup>r</sup> 6, 1862</date> _ for the construction and <span class='line-break'> </span>maintenance of <a href='/pages/subjects/58208' title='Alice Fountain'><!--Alice-->a fountain</a>, and the appropriation <span class='line-break'> </span>of certain land to her use for ornamental pur<span class='line-break'></span>poses, _ with the exception of the land between <a href='/pages/subjects/61159' title='Cowslip Path'>Cows<span class='line-break'></span>lip<!--Path--></a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/61115' title='Anemone Path'>Anemone paths</a>, the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a><span class='line-break'> </span>assenting thereto."</p>
<p>"That this subject be referred to the Committee on <span class='line-break'> </span>Grounds to arrange the details of a contract with <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mrs <span class='line-break'> </span>Hemenway</a>."</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> further moved that the vote on</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134671">
<h3><a name="page-1134671">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 279)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>279</p>
<p>this question be taken by yea and nay, _<span class='line-break'> </span>which was adopted. _</p>
<p>The vote being then taken on the main ques<span class='line-break'></span>tion, the proposition was adopted by a unanimous <span class='line-break'> </span>vote, _ Messsrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a> voting yea.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Amendt of motion to take Gravel from Laurel Hill -'>Amend<sup>t</sup> of motion to take Gravel from <a href='/pages/subjects/55347' title='Laurel Hill'>Laurel Hill</a> -</span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>,</p>
<p>Voted to amend the motion submitted at the last <span class='line-break'> </span>meeting authorizing <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superintendent</a> to take gravel <span class='line-break'> </span>from <a href='/pages/subjects/55347' title='Laurel Hill'>Laurel Hill</a>, so that the same shall be <span class='line-break'> </span>done "under the direction of the Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span>Grounds."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='main question as amended, adopted _'>main question as amended, adopted _</span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,</p>
<p>The vote on the main question was ordered to be <span class='line-break'> </span>taken by  yea and nay, _ on which</p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a> voted yea,</p>
<p>and <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> " [voted] nay.</p>
<p>and the order was declared to be adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='new Public Lot called the St. Matthew Lot _'><a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>new Public Lot</a> called the <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>St. Matthew Lot</a> _</span></p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>new public lot</a> lately com<span class='line-break'></span>pleted, and situated between <a href='/pages/subjects/59904' title='Spruce Avenue'>Spruce Avenue</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>and the westerly line of the Cemetery, and opposite to <span class='line-break'> </span>land embraced between <a href='/pages/subjects/57829' title='Snowdrop Path'>Snowdrop</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/61115' title='Anemone Path'>Anem<span class='line-break'></span>one paths</a> be called</p>
<p>the <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>"Saint Matthew Lot"</a>.</p>
<p>Adjourned</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134672">
<h3><a name="page-1134672">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 280)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>280</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Jany. 5, 1863'>Trustees _ <date when='1863-01-05'>Jany. 5, 1863</date></span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>was held on <date when='1863-01-05T10:00:00'>Monday, January 5<sup>th</sup> 1863,<span class='line-break'> </span>at 10 o'clock am.</date> _</p>
<p>Present, Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Question of New Lithograph Plan of the Cemetery for Proprietors referred to Com. on Grounds _ with full power _'>Question of New Lithograph Plan of the Cemetery for Proprietors referred to Com. on Grounds _ with full power _</span></p>
