<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> stated that no copies of the small <span class='line-break'> </span>lithograph plan of the Cemetery (last edition) are now <span class='line-break'> </span>remaining _ that there are copies of the edition of 1855,<span class='line-break'> </span>since which however seven or eight hundred lots <span class='line-break'> </span>have been sold _ and that he has ascertained that <span class='line-break'> </span>the lithographic stone on which the same was printed <span class='line-break'> </span>has been ground off _ that if the same were in ex<span class='line-break'></span>istence, no good impression could be obtained from it _<span class='line-break'> </span>&amp; that frequent requests are made by proprietors and <span class='line-break'> </span>parties wishing to purchase for some plan which may <span class='line-break'> </span>be of assistance to them. _</p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the execution and printing of a new <span class='line-break'> </span>lithographic plan of the Cemetery be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on  Grounds, with full power. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Rep&apos;s designated to Lot 220 _'>Rep's designated to <a href='/pages/subjects/101294' title='Lot 220'>Lot 220</a> _</span></p>
<p>Upon the application severally of the heirs at law <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/101295' title='Marshall, Susan'>Susan Marshall</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, widow ^<sup>of</sup> <a href='/pages/subjects/101296' title='Marshall, William'>W<sup>m</sup> Marshall</a>, late prop<sup>r</sup> of <a href='/pages/subjects/101294' title='Lot 220'>lot <span class='line-break'> </span>numbered 220</a> was designated to represent said lot: _ and</p>
<p><b> <a href='/pages/subjects/57844' title='Lot 3251'>" [Lot] 3251</a> _</b></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53184' title='Goddard, Lucy'>Lucy Goddard</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/54347' title='Roxbury, MA'>Roxbury</a>, was designated to represent <a href='/pages/subjects/57844' title='Lot 3251'>lot no<span class='line-break'> </span>3251</a>, recently purchased by the heirs of <a href='/pages/subjects/25001878' title='Goddard, Thatcher'>Thatcher Goddard</a>,</p>

<div id="page-1134673">
<h3><a name="page-1134673">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 281)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>281</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Adjd Meeting _ Jan.y 26, 1863.'>Trustees _ Adj<sup>d</sup> Meeting _ <date when='1863-01-26'>Jan.y 26, 1863</date>.</span></p>
<p>An adjourned meeting of the Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held on <date when='1863-01-26T10:00:00'>Monday, January 26, 1863, at 10 o'clock<span class='line-break'> </span>a.m.</date> ~</p>
<p>Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Com. on Grounds of '>Report of Com. on Grounds of </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> for the Committee on Grounds reported <span class='line-break'> </span>that the Committee had made a contract with <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mrs <span class='line-break'> </span>Mary Hemenway</a> for the construction of <a href='/pages/subjects/58208' title='Alice Fountain'><!--Alice-->a Foun<span class='line-break'></span>tain</a> near <a href='/pages/subjects/61286' title='Thistle Path'>Thistle Path</a>, in the words following, to wit:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Contract with Mrs Hemenway, for Construction of Fountains '>Contract with <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mrs Hemenway</a>, for Construction of <a href='/pages/subjects/58208' title='Alice Fountain'><!--Alice-->Fountains</a> </span></p>
<p>"<a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, <date when='1863-01-24'>January 24. 1863</date>. _</p>
<p>" The following agreement is this day made between <span class='line-break'> </span>" the Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn, of the <span class='line-break'> </span>" first part, and <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mrs Mary Hemenway</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, of<span class='line-break'> </span>the second part: _</p>
<p>" The said Proprietors will convey to the <span class='line-break'> </span>" said <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mary Hemenway</a>, in trust, and to be forever kept<span class='line-break'> </span>" open and without interments, a tract or parcel of <span class='line-break'> </span>" land in the Cemetery of Mount Auburn, situated and <span class='line-break'> </span>" bounded as follows, _ as shown on a plan of the <span class='line-break'> </span>" same herewith annexed, made by <a href='/pages/subjects/57826' title='Shedd &amp; Edson'>Shedd and Edson</a>;<span class='line-break'> </span>" Beginning at a point in <a href='/pages/subjects/61286' title='Thistle Path'>Thistle Path</a>, opposite <a href='/pages/subjects/61141' title='Cactus Path'>Cac- <span class='line-break'> </span>" tus</a> Path, thence running westerly by said <a href='/pages/subjects/61286' title='Thistle Path'>Thistle Path</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>" to <a href='/pages/subjects/101428' title='Cistus Path'>Cistus Path</a>, thence southerly by <a href='/pages/subjects/101428' title='Cistus path'>Cistus path</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/61159' title='Cowslip Path'>Cow- <span class='line-break'> </span>" slip Path</a>, thence easterly by <a href='/pages/subjects/61159' title='Cowslip Path'>Cowslip path</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/61141' title='Cactus path'>Cactus path</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>" thence northerly by <a href='/pages/subjects/61141' title='Cactus path'>Cactus path</a> to the point of beginning. _<span class='line-break'> </span>" the paths being excluded, and the whole consisting</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134674">
<h3><a name="page-1134674">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 282)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>282</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='(Trustees _ Jan.y 26. 1863 _ continued _)'>(Trustees _ <date when='1863-01-26'>Jan.y 26. 1863</date> _ continued _)</span></p>
<p>" fifteen thousand two hundred and five (15205) square <span class='line-break'> </span>" feet, more or less. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Contract for Construction of Fountain _'>Contract for Construction of <a href='/pages/subjects/58208' title='Alice Fountain'><!--Alice-->Fountain</a> _</span></p>
<p>" And the said Proprietors covenant with the said<span class='line-break'> </span>" <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mary Hemenway</a> that they will construct <a href='/pages/subjects/58208' title='Alice Fountain'><!--Alice-->a fountain <span class='line-break'> </span>" and basin</a> on said land, which as far as the height<span class='line-break'> </span>" of said land will permit, shall be equal and sim<span class='line-break'></span>" ilar to the fountain and basin in <a href='/pages/subjects/58209' title='Asa Gray Garden'>the "Lawn,"</a> in said <span class='line-break'> </span>" Cemetery, and which shall be kept running and in in <span class='line-break'> </span>" repair as long as the said fountain in <a href='/pages/subjects/58209' title='Asa Gray Garden'>said Lawn</a>.</p>
<p>" And the said Proprietors also contract that they will <span class='line-break'> </span>" cover with grass the said tract or parcel of land, and <span class='line-break'> </span>" will keep the same in good condition forever. _</p>
<p>" And the said <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mary Hemenway</a> hereby agrees and <span class='line-break'> </span>" promises to pay to the said Proprietors of the Cemetery of <span class='line-break'> </span>" Mount Auburn six thousand dollars ($6.000) as soon as <span class='line-break'> </span>" the said <a href='/pages/subjects/58208' title='Alice Fountain'><!--Alice-->fountain</a> shall be completed and in operation.<span class='line-break'> </span>" <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mary Hemenway</a></p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>" <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a></th> <th>} <span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>" <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a></td> <td>}  Committee</td> </tr> <tr><td>" <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>James Cheever</a></td> <td>} on</td> </tr> <tr><td>" <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Edward S. Rand</a></td> <td>} Grounds. "</td> </tr> <tr><td>" <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Jacob Sleeper</a></td> <td>}</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Assent of Horticultural Society'>Assent of <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a></span></p>
<p>The Committee on Grounds, through <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Bigelow</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>also reported that they had obtained from the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Massa<span class='line-break'></span>chusetts Horticultural Society</a> a release of their claim on <span class='line-break'> </span>the above-named premises, as explained in the words<span class='line-break'> </span>following: _</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134675">
<h3><a name="page-1134675">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 283)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>283</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='to same, and their Release of Claim to certain lands _'>to same, and their Release of Claim to certain lands _</span></p>
<p>"<a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1863-01-19'>January 19, 1863</date>.<span class='line-break'> </span>Office of <a href='/pages/subjects/101430' title='Fuller, H. W.'>H. W. Fuller</a>, U.S. Court House. _</p>
<p>The Committee of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'>Horticultural Society</a><span class='line-break'> </span>appointed to consider the proposition for the estab<span class='line-break'></span>lishment of a <a href='/pages/subjects/58208' title='Alice Fountain'><!--Alice-->new fountain</a> opposite <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mrs Hemenway</a>'s<span class='line-break'> </span>lot near <a href='/pages/subjects/61286' title='Thistle Path'>Thistle Path</a>, in Mt Auburn Cemetery _<span class='line-break'> </span>(consisting of <a href='/pages/subjects/101431' title='Hovey, Charles M.'>Charles M. Hovey</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/53210' title='Wilder, Marshall P.'>Marshall P. Wilder</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/101430' title='Fuller, H. W.'>H. W. Fuller</a>) met this day at the office of said <span class='line-break'> </span>Fuller _ all being present; and after a full ex<span class='line-break'></span>amination of the matter, and explanations had, <span class='line-break'> </span>it was by them unanimously _</p>
<p>' <u>Voted</u> _ that this Committee do approve <span class='line-break'> </span>' of the plan for a <a href='/pages/subjects/58208' title='Alice Fountain'><!--Alice-->new fountain</a> on the bog land <span class='line-break'> </span>' near <a href='/pages/subjects/61286' title='Thistle Path'>Thistle Path</a>, in Mount Auburn Cemetery, as <span class='line-break'> </span>' explained by <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Doct. Bigelow</a>, and do agree, in behalf <span class='line-break'> </span>' of said <a href='/pages/subjects/54281' title='Massachusetts Horticultural Society'><!--Mass Hort-->Society</a>, that they will relinquish for the purpose,<span class='line-break'> </span>' all the right which they may have to any part of the <span class='line-break'> </span>' proceeds of the following described parcel of land <span class='line-break'> </span>' devoted thereto, and to be conveyed therefor, and for orna<span class='line-break'></span>' mental purposes _ to wit _ Beginning at a point on <span class='line-break'> </span>' <a href='/pages/subjects/61286' title='Thistle Path'>Thistle Path</a>, opposite <a href='/pages/subjects/61141' title='Cactus Path'>Cactus Path</a>, thence running <span class='line-break'> </span>' westerly by said <a href='/pages/subjects/61286' title='Thistle Path'>Thistle Path</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/101428' title='Cistus Path'>Cistus Path</a>; thence<span class='line-break'> </span>' Southerly by <a href='/pages/subjects/101428' title='Cistus Path'>Cistus Path</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/61159' title='Cowslip Path'>Cowslip Path</a>; thence easterly <span class='line-break'> </span>' by <a href='/pages/subjects/61159' title='Cowslip Path'>Cowslip Path</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/61141' title='Cactus Path'>Cactus Path</a>; thence northerly by <a href='/pages/subjects/61141' title='Cactus Path'>Cactus <span class='line-break'> </span>' Path</a> to the point of beginning (exclusive of paths) contain<span class='line-break'></span>' ing fifteen thousand two hundred and five (15,205) square <span class='line-break'> </span>' feet, be the same more or less.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/101430' title='Fuller, H. W.'>H. W. Fuller</a>, Sec.t.y ~ "</p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the foregoing report be accepted and the contract</p>

</div>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Removal of Location of Lot 2288'>Removal of Location of <a href='/pages/subjects/100957' title='Lot 2288'>Lot 2288</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> for the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots, authorized <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Board under date of <date when='1862-02-17'>Feby. 17. 1862</date>, to effect <span class='line-break'> </span>the removal of <a href='/pages/subjects/100957' title='Lot 2288'>lot No. 2288</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/59904' title='Spruce Avenue'>Spruce Av<sup>e</sup></a>, belonging <span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/101432' title='Wilbur, Asa'>Asa Wilbur</a>, Trustee, submitted a report, to <span class='line-break'> </span>the effect that, with the consent of the proprietor,<span class='line-break'> </span>an exchange had been accomplished, and the <span class='line-break'> </span>lot had been removed to <a href='/pages/subjects/58079' title='Garden Avenue'>Garden Avenue</a>, _<span class='line-break'> </span>the title to the old lot had been released, and a deed<span class='line-break'> </span>had been made to said Wilbur of s<sup>d</sup> lot in its pre<span class='line-break'></span>sent location. _</p>
<p>The report was accepted. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lots to be kept in Perpetual Repair _'>Lots to be kept in Perpetual Repair _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> for the Committee on Lots, also reported <span class='line-break'> </span>that the Committee had, subject to the approval <span class='line-break'> </span>of their Board, contracted for the prepetual repair <span class='line-break'> </span>of the following lots: _</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><a href='/pages/subjects/60249' title='Lot 1611'>Lot 1611</a></th> <th>_ <a href='/pages/subjects/60335' title='Poplar Avenue'>Poplar Av.</a></th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/60250' title='Pierce, Sarah K.'>Sarah K. Pierce</a></th> <th>$200. _<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/101434' title='Lot 160'>" [Lot] 160</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/60390' title='Holly Path'>Holly Path</a>.</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/60417' title='Bacon, Thomas C.'>Thos. C. Bacon</a></td> <td>400. _</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/101435' title='Lot 736'>" [Lot] 736</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/58791' title='Central Avenue'>Central Av<sup>e</sup></a></td> <td>Estate of <a href='/pages/subjects/59944' title='Ward, Winthrop'>Winthrop Ward</a></td> <td>500.</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/72204' title='Lot 680'>" [Lot] 680</a></td> <td>- <a href='/pages/subjects/61304' title='Yarrow Path'>Yarrow P.</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/83589' title='Fessenden, Lydia'><!--Lydia-->Fessenden</a> Monument Lot</td> <td>150.</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/101436' title='Lot 743'>" [Lot] 473</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/61127' title='Beech Avenue'>Beech Av.</a></td> <td>Estate of <a href='/pages/subjects/64019' title='Putnam, Catherine'>Catherine Putnam</a></td> <td>500.</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the report be accepted, and the contracts <span class='line-break'> </span>ratified ~</p>

<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> submitted the Annual Report of the Trustees, <span class='line-break'> </span><small>and stated that the Treas<sup>r</sup>-s report, by reason of his absence, is not ready,</small><span class='line-break'> </span>on account of which certain blanks occur in the</p>

<div id="page-1134677">
<h3><a name="page-1134677">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 285)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>285</p>
<p>Trustees Report,</p>
<p>Voted to accept the report, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, ad<span class='line-break'></span>apting the same to the exigency of the case, filling <span class='line-break'> </span>them if the Treasurer's report shall be ready, and <span class='line-break'> </span>striking them out, if otherwise. _</p>
<p>Adjourned</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Feby. 2. 1863.'>Trustees _ <date when='1863-02-02'>Feby. 2. 1863</date>.</span></p>
<p>The Trustees held their regular monthly meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1862-02-02T10:00:00'>Monday, February 2<sup>d</sup>, 1863, at 10 o'clock,<span class='line-break'> </span>a.m.</date></p>
<p>Present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a>. _</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Absence of Treasr'>Absence of Treas<sup>r</sup></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> read a note from <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>at <a href='/pages/subjects/101437' title='Newbern, NC'>Newbern, North Carolina</a>, whither he had gone <span class='line-break'> </span>under a commission from the <a href='/pages/subjects/54945' title='Andrew, John Albion'><!--Andrew-->Governor of Massachusetts</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>to look after the wants of Massachusettts Soldiers, stating <span class='line-break'> </span>his inability to have his Annual Report ready in <span class='line-break'> </span>season for the Proprietors' meeting.</p>
<p>There being no other business, the meeting was <span class='line-break'> </span>adjourned without day. _</p>
<p>Attest, <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134678">
<h3><a name="page-1134678">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 286)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>286</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors&apos; Annual Meeting _ Feby. 2. 1863.'>Proprietors' Annual Meeting _ <date when='1863-02-02'>Feby. 2. 1863</date>.</span></p>
<p>Mount Auburn Cemetery</p>
<p>The Annual Meeting of the Proprietors of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn will be held in <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, at Mercantile Hall, 16 Summer Street,<span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1863-02-02T15:30:00'>Monday, February 2<sup>d</sup>, at 3½ o'clock P.M.</date> to <span class='line-break'> </span>hear the reports of the Trustees and Treasurer, and <span class='line-break'> </span>to choose Trustees for the ensuing year. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Notification _'>Notification _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, <date when='1863-01'>Jany. 1863</date></p>
<p>In accordance with the foregoing notification which<span class='line-break'> </span>was published seven days before the time of meeting in <span class='line-break'> </span>several Boston newspapers, the Proprietors met at <span class='line-break'> </span>the time and place therein named.</p>
<p>A quorum being in attendance, the President, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Jacob Bigelow</a> took the chair.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> read the record of the last <span class='line-break'> </span>annual meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annual Report of Trustees _'>Annual Report of Trustees _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> read the Annual Report of the Trustees, <span class='line-break'> </span>in print.</p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/60332' title='Richardson, Jeffrey'>Jeffrey Richardson Esq</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>The report was accepted. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer&apos;s  Rept not ready _'>Treasurer's  Rep<sup>t</sup> not ready _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> stated that in consequence of the absence <span class='line-break'> </span>of the <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->Treasurer</a>, at <a href='/pages/subjects/101437' title='Newbern, NC'>Newbern, North Carolina</a>, his report <span class='line-break'> </span>was not ready. _</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134679">
<h3><a name="page-1134679">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 287)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>287</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Adjournment to ^a day to be designated by Trustees _ '>Adjournment to ^<sup>a</sup> day to be designated by Trustees _ </span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/107377' title='Mackintire, Elias P.'>Mr E. P. Mackintire</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that when this meeting adjourn,<span class='line-break'> </span>it be to such day after <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer's</a> return, as<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees shall determine, to hear his report,<span class='line-break'> </span>and act thereon. ~</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Elections of Trustees'>Elections of Trustees</span></p>
<p>The Chairman stated that the next business <span class='line-break'> </span>in order would be the choice of twelve Trustees, <span class='line-break'> </span>by ballot, for the ensuing year; and he appointed<span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/64689' title='Richardson, George C.'>Geo. C. Richardson</a> <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/101448' title='Beck, Charles'>Dr. Charles Beck</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/64338' title='Rayner, John J.'>John J. Rayner</a>, a Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>to receive, sort and count votes for the Trustees.</p>
<p>While the Committee were out, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> explained <span class='line-break'> </span>portions of the report, and replied to several questions.</p>
<p>The Committee returned and reported: -<span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><small>Whole number of votes 452 _</small>}</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>William T. Andrews</a> had</th> <th>452<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td><small>necessary to a choice 227.</small>}</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Edward Austin</a> " [had]</td> <td>452</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a> " [had]</td> <td>452</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>James Cheever</a> " [had]</td> <td>452</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Uriel Crocker</a> " [had]</td> <td>452</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a> " [had]</td> <td>452</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Charles C. Little</a> " [had]</td> <td>452</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Charles G. Nazro</a> " [had]</td> <td>451</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Edward S. Rand</a> " [had]</td> <td>452</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a> " [had]</td> <td>452</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Jacob Sleeper</a> " [had]</td> <td>451</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Edward S. Tobey</a> " [had]</td> <td>452</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='(See p. 293)'>(See p. 293)</span></p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned<span class='line-break'> </span>to the call of the Trustees.  Attest, <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134680">
<h3><a name="page-1134680">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 288)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>288</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees ~ Feby. 16. 1863.'>Trustees ~ <date when='1863-02-16'>Feby. 16. 1863</date>.</span></p>
<p>Trustees. 1863 - 4.</p>
<p>The first meeting of the Trustees of the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn for organization and business was <span class='line-break'> </span>held at the office of the Corporation (33 School Street,)<span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1863-02-13T10:00:00'>Monday, February 16<sup>th</sup> at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> _</p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>. _</p>
<p>The record of the Annual Meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Choice of Officers and Committees _'>Choice of Officers and Committees _</span></p>
<p>The Trustees then proceeded to choose officers for <span class='line-break'> </span>the ensuing year.</p>
<p>Voted to choose officers and committees on one ballot.</p>
<p>Eight votes were cast, and the following were unan<span class='line-break'></span>imously chosen. _</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>President</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>Secretary</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>Treasurer</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>George W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Committee on Finance</th> <th>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Messrs Little</a> <span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ and <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>Committee on Lots - Messrs</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a></td> </tr> </tbody> </table></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134681">
<h3><a name="page-1134681">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 289)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>289</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>Committee on Grounds  Messrs</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>Committee on Regulations</th> <th>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/67763' title='Tobey, Edward S.'>Tobey</a> &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>and Records of Interment</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent chosen _'>Superintendent chosen _</span></p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p><u><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Daniel L. Winsor</a></u> was chosen Superintendent.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gatekeeper chosen _'>Gatekeeper chosen _</span></p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><u><a href='/pages/subjects/63799' title='Derby, James, Jr.'>James Derby Jr.</a></u> was chosen Gatekeeper _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Compensation of Secretary.'>Compensation of Secretary.</span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Mr Andrews</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the salary of the Secretary be the same <span class='line-break'> </span>at last year - $500, and such fees and allowances as before.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer'>Treasurer</span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the compensation of the Treasurer <span class='line-break'> </span>be the same as last year, _ viz. 2½ per cent on am<sup>t</sup> of <span class='line-break'> </span>sales, and bills collected, and ½ per cent on the am<sup>t</sup> of <span class='line-break'> </span>Repair fund, _ the whole compensation exclusive of the ½ per<span class='line-break'> </span>cent on the Repair Fund not to exceed eight hundred dollars.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='and Superintendent _'>and Superintendent _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> read a communication form <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superintendent</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>asking for an increase of salary.</p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>, Voted that the Superinten<span class='line-break'></span>dent's salary be fifteen hundred dollars &amp; the use of the house.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134682">
<h3><a name="page-1134682">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 290)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>290</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Feby. 16. 1863 _ continued _'>Trustees _ <date when='1863-02-16'>Feby. 16. 1863</date> _ continued _</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Compensation of Gatekeeper_'>Compensation of Gatekeeper_</span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the salary of the Gatekeeper be <span class='line-break'> </span>the same as last year, viz. $400, with the addition of <span class='line-break'> </span>seventy five cents per Sabbath when he shall employ a substi<span class='line-break'></span>tute.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on Fountains reappointed _'>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Fountains reappointed _</span></p>
<p>Voted that the Special Committee on the Fountains <span class='line-break'> </span>which were chosen in 1860 _</p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, _</p>
<p>be reappointed. _</p>
<p>Adjourned,,<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Sec.y.</p>
<p>-----------------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ March 3. 1863.'>Trustees _ <date when='1863-03-03'>March 3. 1863</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held on <date when='1863-03-03T10:00:00'>Monday, March 2<sup>d</sup> at 10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>. _</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasr&apos;s Report not ready _'>Treas<sup>r's</sup> Report not ready _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Mr Bond</a> the Treasurer, stated that his annual report<span class='line-break'> </span>was not quite ready.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Change of name of Culvert Ave authorized _'>Change of name of <a href='/pages/subjects/59985' title='Culvert Avenue'>Culvert Av<sup>e</sup></a> authorized _</span></p>
<p>An application from <a href='/pages/subjects/63912' title='Lowell, Charles Russell, II'>Charles R. Lowell</a> in behalf of the <span class='line-break'> </span>heirs of <a href='/pages/subjects/65225' title='Lowell, Charles'>Charles Lowell</a>, and others that the name of <a href='/pages/subjects/59985' title='Culvert Avenue'>Culvert <span class='line-break'> </span>Avenue</a> might be changed to some other appropriate name <span class='line-break'> </span>was laid before the Board: _ on which it was</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> be authorized to give such <span class='line-break'> </span>new name as he may think appropriate and satisfactory.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134683">
<h3><a name="page-1134683">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 291)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>291</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='St Matthew Lot to be laid out _'><a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>St Matthew Lot</a> to be laid out _</span></p>
<p>Voted that that the laying out of the <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>St. <span class='line-break'> </span>Matthew Lot</a> in proper order be referred to the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Grounds, with full power. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Proprietors who have neglected to have bounds set to their lots to be again addressed _'>Proprietors who have neglected to have bounds set to their lots to be again addressed _</span></p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> be authorized again <span class='line-break'> </span>to address the proprietors who have neglected to <span class='line-break'> </span>have bounds set to their lots, requesting their <span class='line-break'> </span>immediate attention to the matter.</p>
<p>Adjourned</p>
<p>Attest, <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>----------------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ April 6. 1863 no quorum'>Trustees _ <date when='1863-04-06'>April 6. 1863</date> no quorum</span></p>
<p><date when='1863-04-06T10:00:00'>Monday April 6. 1863.</date></p>
<p>At 10 o'clock A. M., the regular hour for the meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Board of Trustees, there were in attendance<span class='line-break'> </span>Mesrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, who <span class='line-break'> </span>not constituting a quorum, adjourned to the next reg<span class='line-break'></span>ular meeting.</p>
<p>Attest  <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary.</p>
<p>----------------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ May 4. 1863.'>Trustees _ <date when='1863-05-04'>May 4. 1863</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held on <date when='1863-05-04T10:00:00'>Monday, May 4<sup>th</sup> at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> _</p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Chairman pro tem.'>Chairman pro tem.</span></p>
<p>The President being absent, on motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> was chosen chairman pro tempore.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasrs Annual Report _'>Treas<sup>rs</sup> Annual Report _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->The Treasurer</a> read his Annual Report.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134684">
<h3><a name="page-1134684">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 292)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>292</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees meeting May 4. 1863 _ continued _'>Trustees meeting <date when='1863-05-04'>May 4. 1863</date> _ continued _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> subsequently came in and took the Chair.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer&apos;s Annual Report accepted &amp; ordered to be printed _'>Treasurer's Annual Report accepted &amp; ordered to be printed _</span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the Treasurer's Report be accepted. _</p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the report be printed, and laid before <span class='line-break'> </span>the Proprietors at the adjourned annual meeting. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Adjd Annl Meeting to be called on May 11th _'>Adj<sup>d</sup> Ann<sup>l</sup> Meeting to be called on <date when='1863-05-11'>May 11<sup>th</sup></date> _</span></p>
<p>Also voted, on motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> call an adjourned annual meeting on <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1863-05-11T16:00:00'>Monday next, at 4 o'clock P. M.</date>, to hear the Treasurer's<span class='line-break'> </span>Annual Report.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gatekeeper&apos;s Salary increased _'>Gatekeeper's Salary increased _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> read a communication from <a href='/pages/subjects/63799' title='Derby, James, Jr.'><!--Derby-->the Gatekeeper</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>requesting an increase of his salary.</p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the salary of the Gatekeeper be increased <span class='line-break'> </span><u>one</u> <u>hundred</u> <u>dollars</u> per annum, for the current year.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Quest. of increase of salary of Secretary refd to Spec.l Comee.'>Quest. of increase of salary of Secretary ref<sup>d</sup> to Spec.<sup>l</sup> Com<sup>ee</sup>.</span></p>
<p>Voted that the expediency of increasing the com<span class='line-break'></span>pensation of the Secretary be referred to a Special <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee of three persons; and upon nomination by the <span class='line-break'> </span>chair, Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> were chosen <span class='line-break'> </span>said Committee.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Com. on prosecution vs Mann to report'>Com. on prosecution vs Mann to report</span></p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Mr Austin</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the Committee chosen to prosecute the claim of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Corporation against <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Jonathan Mann</a>, be instructed</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134685">
<h3><a name="page-1134685">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 293)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>293</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='cost of suit thus far.'>cost of suit thus far.</span></p>
<p>to make a report at the next meeting, of their proceedings<span class='line-break'> </span>in the suit, and of the expenses thus far incurred <span class='line-break'> </span>from the commencement of the investigation of <span class='line-break'> </span>his accounts.</p>
<p>Adjourned <span class='line-break'> </span>Attest, <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> Secy _</p>
<p>-----------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Adjourned Annual Meeting May 11, 1863'>Adjourned Annual Meeting <date when='1863-05-11'>May 11, 1863</date></span></p>
<p>Adjourned Annual Meeting of Proprietors.</p>
<p>The adjourned Annual Meeting of the Proprietors of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn, was held, in accordance<span class='line-break'> </span>with a vote of the Trustees (the time to which the meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>should be adjourned having been referred to the Board <span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees) and after due notice in the newspapers, on <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1863-05-11T16:00:00'>Monday, May 11<sup>th</sup> at 4 o'clock P. M.</date> _</p>
<p>A quorum being in attendance, the President, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Jacob Bigelow</a>, took the Chair.</p>
<p>The record of the Annual Meeting was read.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasurer&apos;s Report.'>Treasurer's Report.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->The Treasurer</a> read his Annual Report.</p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/60332' title='Richardson, Jeffrey'>Jeffrey Richardson</a> seconded by <a href='/pages/subjects/62839' title='Torrey, Charles'>Charles <span class='line-break'> </span>Torrey, Esq<sup>r</sup></a>, the report was acepted. _</p>
<p>After informal conversation on matters relating to the <span class='line-break'> </span>management of the business of the Corporation, <span class='line-break'> </span>the meeting was dissolved.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
