<h3><a name="page-1134688">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 296)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>296</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='May 11, 1863 _ Treasurer&apos;s Annual Report continued _'><date when='1863-05-11'>May 11, 1863</date> _ Treasurer's Annual Report continued _</span></p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>The Indebtedness of the Corporation was about</th> <th>5.000.00<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>The was due the Corporation in bills for Labor and Material over</td> <td>3.000.00</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>All of which is respectfully submitted,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a>, Treas<sup>r</sup></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Audited _'>Audited _</span></p>
<p>This certifies that we have examined the books and accounts<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Treasurer of the Proprietors of Mount Auburn, for the <span class='line-break'> </span>year ending <date when='1862-12-31'>December 31, 1862</date>, and have found them cor<span class='line-break'></span>rectly kept and properly balanced, with satisfactory vouchers <span class='line-break'> </span>for all payments charged.</p>
<p>The certificates of Stocks and other evidence of property<span class='line-break'> </span>are found in accordance with the statements in his accounts.</p>
<p>In the Fund for Repairs there appears to be due to him <span class='line-break'> </span>twenty eight 85/100 dollars, and there is due from him on <span class='line-break'> </span>general account fifty four hundred and forty five 47/100<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars.</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th> <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Charles C. Little</a></th> <th>} <span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td> <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Charles G. Nazro</a></td> <td>}  Finance Committee</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>_________________</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Oath of the Secretary _'>Oath of the Secretary _</span></p>
<p>Commonwealth of Massachusetts <span class='line-break'> </span>Suffolk Ss. <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, <date when='1863-06-27'>June 27, 1863</date>.  There personally <span class='line-break'> </span>appeared <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, and made oath that <span class='line-break'> </span>he would faithfully perform the duties of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary of Mount Auburn, before me;</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Justice of the Peace</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134689">
<h3><a name="page-1134689">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 297)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>297</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ June 1, 1863 _'>Trustees _ <date when='1863-06-01'>June 1, 1863</date> _</span></p>
<p>The Trustees of Mount Auburn held their reg<span class='line-break'></span>ular meeting on <date when='1863-06-01T10:00:00'>Monday June 1, 1863, at 10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Big<span class='line-break'></span>elow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a> = 10 _</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting of the Trustees, and of <span class='line-break'> </span>the adjourned annual meeting of the Proprietors was<span class='line-break'> </span>read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee on Suit vs J. Mann report Expense of Suit _'>Com<sup>ee</sup> on Suit vs <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>J. Mann</a> report Expense of Suit _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, in behalf of the Committee to prosecute the <span class='line-break'> </span>claim of this Corporation vs <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Jon<sup>a</sup> Mann</a> reported: _</p>
<p>That the amount of expenses paid for the inves<span class='line-break'></span>tigation of the Superintendent's accounts and of the prosecu<span class='line-break'></span>tion of said suit, is, by the Treasurer's Statement ($2.161.57)<span class='line-break'> </span>twenty one hundred and sixty one &amp; 57/100 dollars: _<span class='line-break'> </span>that the amount now due to the counsel for the Corpor<span class='line-break'></span>ation and incidental expenses is (550.92)<span class='line-break'> </span>five hundred and fifty dollars and 92/100 _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Adjt of meeting _'>Adj<sup>t</sup> of meeting _</span></p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that when this meeting adjourn it be to Friday <span class='line-break'> </span>next, at 10 o'clock a.m. for the purpose of hearing the report of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Auditor in the above named case, and for such other business <span class='line-break'> </span>as may come before the meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Removal of Tree _'>Removal of Tree _</span></p>
<p>The question of removing a tree near <a href='/pages/subjects/101468' title='Wingate, Mrs.'>Mrs Wingate's</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/101469' title='Lot 363'>lot (363)</a><span class='line-break'> </span>was referred to the Committee on Grounds, with full power,</p>
<p>Adjourned  Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Sec.y.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134690">
<h3><a name="page-1134690">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 298)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>298</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ June 5, 1863 _ Adjd Meeting _ '>Trustees _ <date when='1863-06-05'>June 5, 1863</date> _ Adj<sup>d</sup> Meeting _ </span></p>
<p>An adjourned meeting of the Trustees was held<span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1863-06-05T10:00:00'>Friday June 5, 1863, at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> ~</p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> = 9</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Auditor&apos;s Report in Mann suit read _ '>Auditor's Report in Mann suit read _ </span></p>
<p>The Trustees proceeded, according to assignment, to hear<span class='line-break'> </span>the reading of the Auditor's report in the case of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation vs. <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Jon<sup>a</sup> Mann</a>.</p>
<p>After which, it was moved by <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Mr Cheever</a>,</p>
<p>That the Committee on the prosecution of the suit vs <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>J.<span class='line-break'> </span>Mann</a> be instructed to discontinue its prosecution and<span class='line-break'> </span>that the question be taken by yeas and nays. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Notion to discontinue suit vs him rejected _ '>Notion to discontinue suit vs him rejected _ </span></p>
<p>The question was then ordered to be taken by yeas<span class='line-break'> </span>and nays: _</p>
<p>And upon a call</p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a> voted yea,<span class='line-break'> </span>and Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> voted nay _ and the motion was declared<span class='line-break'> </span>to be not adopted. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Expediency of purchasing the Watriss Land refd to Comee on Grounds _ '>Expediency of purchasing the <a href='/pages/subjects/58521' title='Watriss, William'>Watriss</a> Land ref<sup>d</sup> to Com<sup>ee</sup> on Grounds _ </span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the Expediency of purchasing a strip<span class='line-break'> </span>of land adjoining the westerly line of the Cemetery (known as<span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/58521' title='Watriss, William'>Watriss</a> lot) containing between six and seven acres, and which<span class='line-break'> </span>is now held as collateral security by the <a href='/pages/subjects/101470' title='Charles River Bank'>Charles River Bank</a> for<span class='line-break'> </span><small>the sum of Eight thousand five hundred &amp; ninety six &amp; <sup>92</sup>/<sub>100</sub> dollars (principal &amp; interest)</small><span class='line-break'> </span>($8,596.92) <small>be referred to the Committee on Grounds to report thereon.</small></p>
<p>Adjourned _ Attest, <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>. Sec.y</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134691">
<h3><a name="page-1134691">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 299)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>299</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ July 6, 1863.'>Trustees _ <date when='1863-07-06'>July 6, 1863</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular meeting of the Trustees of Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn was held on <date when='1863-07-06'>Monday, July 6<sup>th</sup> at 10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a>. _</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Com. on Grounds on Purchase of Watriss Land.'>Report of Com. on Grounds on Purchase of <a href='/pages/subjects/58521' title='Watriss, William'>Watriss</a> Land.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a>, as Chairman of the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Grounds read<span class='line-break'> </span>the report of the Committee which concluded with recommending<span class='line-break'> </span>that the Trustees decline to purchase the <a href='/pages/subjects/58521' title='Watriss, William'>Watriss</a><span class='line-break'> </span>land west of the Cemetery.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='not accepted _'>not accepted _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Mr Little</a> moved that the report be accepted: the<span class='line-break'> </span>vote being put, the report was declared not accepted,<span class='line-break'> </span>five trustees not voting in favor of it. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report referred to next meeting &amp; survey to be shown _ '>Report referred to next meeting &amp; survey to be shown _ </span></p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the report be referred to the next<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting, and that <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> cause a sketch showing<span class='line-break'> </span>the relative situation of this land and the adjoining lots to<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery prepared for the Trustees.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Comee on Compensation of Secretary _ '>Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Compensation of Secretary _ </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>, as Chairman of Special Com<sup>ee</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>read a report of which the following is a copy,</p>
<p>"The Committee to whom was referred the matter of<span class='line-break'> </span>compensation to the Secretary have considered the<span class='line-break'> </span>subject attentively and now report: _</p>
<p>In the early days of the Cemetery when the financial<span class='line-break'> </span>affairs were of such small dimensions as to<span class='line-break'> </span>require but little care, and the clerical work of</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134692">
<h3><a name="page-1134692">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 300)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>300</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ July 6, 1863 _Report of Comee on Compensation of Secretary continued _ '>Trustees _ <date when='1863-07-06'>July 6, 1863</date> _Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Compensation of Secretary continued _ </span></p>
<p>the Company so inconsiderable as to need only occa<span class='line-break'></span>sional attention, the offices of Treasurer and Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span>could be filled by persons who had little or no regard<span class='line-break'> </span>to compensation, considering the performance of their duties<span class='line-break'> </span>rather a labor of love than one of business. At<span class='line-break'> </span>the present time, however, the matter stands very dif<span class='line-break'></span>ferently. The Corporation having grown to be a large<span class='line-break'> </span>one, the details in the management of those offices<span class='line-break'> </span>necessarily consume much time. _ It's important<span class='line-break'> </span>not only to have a Secretary, but that he should give<span class='line-break'> </span>a large part of his time to the affairs of the Company,<span class='line-break'> </span>be ready to give all information to the proprietors and<span class='line-break'> </span>those who many wish to become such and to give a con<span class='line-break'></span>stant attention to the affairs of the Company so far<span class='line-break'> </span>as relates to his office. If the Secretary properly per<span class='line-break'></span>forms his duties, they involve the obtaining and im<span class='line-break'></span>parting information in relation to purchase of lots; _<span class='line-break'> </span>to work; _ the general management of affairs by the Cor<span class='line-break'></span>poration; the necessity of explaining the details of oper<span class='line-break'></span>ations and of making proper explanations to those<span class='line-break'> </span>proprietors who may suppose that their wishes or requests<span class='line-break'> </span>have been neglected; _ of suggesting to them in a proper man<span class='line-break'></span>ner the advisability of making provision for the perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>care of their lots, involving much time in details in<span class='line-break'> </span>the accomplishment of their plans, if acceded to; the issuing<span class='line-break'> </span>of permits for work under the recent rule of the Trustees; -<span class='line-break'> </span>the proper registers of interments; - the Examinations at the<span class='line-break'> </span>offices of Registers of Probate in the different counties to obtain<span class='line-break'> </span>the necessary information in regard to the disposition of estates<span class='line-break'> </span>of deceased proprietors; by which means also the Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134693">
<h3><a name="page-1134693">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 301)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>301</p>
<p>is apprized of legacies or endowments of lots made by<span class='line-break'> </span>them; and many other things which might be enu<span class='line-break'></span>merated, but the facts are so obvious, that the Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee deem it unnecessary to consume time by a<span class='line-break'> </span>fuller statement of them. _</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>The present compensation of the Secretary is a salary of $500 and fees amounting to about $130. say</th> <th>___</th> <th>$630,<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>From which he pays Rent</td> <td>$150.</td> </tr> <tr><td>care of Room &amp; Porterage</td> <td>52.</td> </tr> <tr><td>Fuel &amp; Lights</td> <td><u>23</u></td> <td><u>225.</u></td> </tr> <tr><td>which leaves him a net income of</td> <td>___</td> <td>$405</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>It will be obvious, we think, to the Trustees,<span class='line-break'> </span>that no competent man can reasonably be ex<span class='line-break'></span>pected to devote the larger part of his time for such<span class='line-break'> </span>a compensation. We want an officer who shall<span class='line-break'> </span>feel it for his interest to retain the position and<span class='line-break'> </span>render his services as useful as possible to the Cor<span class='line-break'></span>poration, _ considering himself as fairly renumerated, _<span class='line-break'> </span>not one who shall perform the duties with as much<span class='line-break'> </span>economy of time and labor to himself as possible,<span class='line-break'> </span>with the idea that the office is looked upon merely<span class='line-break'> </span>as a sinecure and a nominal compensation paid.</p>
<p>Were we now commencing anew, we should re<span class='line-break'></span>commend a union of the offices of Treasurer and Sec<span class='line-break'></span>retary; for we believe that all the duties pertaining<span class='line-break'> </span>to those two could be performed by one person in<span class='line-break'> </span>a better manner and at less cost than the two<span class='line-break'> </span>can be filled separately. _ The compensation in<span class='line-break'> </span>neither case as it now stands is sufficient for a complete<span class='line-break'> </span>person to make it his whole business, and therefore the </p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134694">
<h3><a name="page-1134694">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 302)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>302</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ July 6, 1863 _ Report of Comee on Compensation of Secretary continued _'>Trustees _ <date when='1863-07-06'>July 6, 1863</date> _ Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Compensation of Secretary continued _</span></p>
<p>duties have to be performed as it were incidentally,<span class='line-break'> </span>and in connection with other occupations. _ It is<span class='line-break'> </span>necessary to have two offices, and proprietors are<span class='line-break'> </span>referred from one to the other, and great perplexity<span class='line-break'> </span>and inconvenience are occasional thereby _ whereas,<span class='line-break'> </span>the union of the two would remedy all these dif<span class='line-break'></span>ficulties and render it an object for one person<span class='line-break'> </span>to fill the position at a less compensation than<span class='line-break'> </span>we are obliged to pay for two. _ This view of<span class='line-break'> </span>the question, were it before as, could be sustained<span class='line-break'> </span>by very cogent arguments, but we now only refer to it<span class='line-break'> </span>as one deserving attention, and which, at some future<span class='line-break'> </span>time may have more full consideration and delib<span class='line-break'></span>eration, and we are moved to speak of it in this<span class='line-break'> </span>connection from our conviction of its great impor<span class='line-break'></span>tance. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report adopted.'>Report adopted.</span></p>
<p>In conclusion your Committee would say, that<span class='line-break'> </span>it is their opinion that it would be a reasonable<span class='line-break'> </span>compensation to the Secretary to increase his salary<span class='line-break'> </span>to ($800) Eight hundred dollars, and they recommend<span class='line-break'> </span>that that sum be paid from the beginning of the<span class='line-break'> </span>present fiscal year, leaving all other matters as they<span class='line-break'> </span>are at the present time.</p>
<p>All of which is respectfully submitted<span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1863-07-06'>July 6, 1863</date></th> <th>___</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Charles G Nazro</a></th> <th>}<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td>(signed)</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a></td> <td>}</td> <td>Committee</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>James Cheever</a></td> <td>}</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Salary fixed at $800. &amp; fees - '>Salary fixed at $800. &amp; fees - </span></p>
<p>The report was accepted, and</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>, Voted that the Salary of<span class='line-break'> </span><small>the Secretary be fixed at $800 per annum from the beginning of the present</small><span class='line-break'> </span>financial year, in conforming with the report of the Committee,</p>
<p>Adjourned _ Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134695">
<h3><a name="page-1134695">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 303)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>303</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Aug. 3, 1863 _'>Trustees _ <date when='1863-08-03'>Aug. 3, 1863 </date>_</span></p>
<p>The regular meeting of the Trustees of Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn Cemetery was held on <date when='1863-08-03T10:00:00'>Monday, August<span class='line-break'> </span>3<sup>d</sup> 1863, at 10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Purchase of Watriss lot _ referred to next meeting _'>Purchase of <a href='/pages/subjects/58521' title='Watriss, William'>Watriss</a> lot _ referred to next meeting _</span></p>
<p>The subject of the purchase of the lot of land<span class='line-break'> </span>west of and adjoining the Cemetery came up by assign<span class='line-break'></span>ment. As there was a bare quorum of the Board<span class='line-break'> </span>present, on motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, it was</p>
<p>Voted that the subject be referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the next meeting in September. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Lot 2326 _ to be reconveyed to Corporation and division into three lots authorized _'><a href='/pages/subjects/65316' title='Lot 2326'>Lot 2326</a> _ to be reconveyed to Corporation and division into three lots authorized _</span></p>
<p>On the application of <a href='/pages/subjects/100959' title='Pettee, Seth'>Seth Pettee</a>, Trustee under the will<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/54952' title='Tisdale, Mace'>Mace Tisdale</a>, deceased, late proprietor of lot <a href='/pages/subjects/65316' title='Lot 2326'>no. 2326</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>situated upon <a href='/pages/subjects/61222' title='Lime Avenue'>Lime Avenue</a>, and upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the Trustees hereby accept the recon<span class='line-break'></span>veyance of said lot for the purpose of conveying the land<span class='line-break'> </span>contained therein in three lots to <a href='/pages/subjects/57321' title='Baldwin, Life'>Life Baldwin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/53156' title='Hollis, John W.'>John<span class='line-break'> </span>W. Hollis</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/101491' title='Fuller, Granville'>Granville Fuller</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/60948' title='Brighton, MA'>Brighton</a>, and<span class='line-break'> </span>that said conveyances be made under the direction<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Committee on Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Bill of F. Haskell referred to Mr Curtis _'>Bill of <a href='/pages/subjects/101492' title='Haskell, F.'>F. Haskell</a> referred to <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> _</span></p>
<p>A bill against the Corporation amounting to $8.00 made by<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/101492' title='Haskell, F.'>F. Haskell</a>, on motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>was referred to <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> with full power. ~</p>
<p>Adjourned<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Sec.y _<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134696">
<h3><a name="page-1134696">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 304)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>304</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Sept. 7. 1863.'>Trustees _ <date when='1863-09-07'>Sept. 7. 1863</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular meeting of the Trustees of the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn was held on <date when='1863-09-07T10:00:00'>Monday, <span class='line-break'> </span>September 7<sup>th</sup>, at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> _</p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>.</p>
<p>The Record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><b>Purchase of the <a href='/pages/subjects/58521' title='Watriss, William'>Watriss</a> lot _ Report of the Com<sup>ee</sup> that it is "inexpedient to purchase" accepted _</b></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> stated the question before the meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>to be the purchase of the lot of land west of the Cemetery <span class='line-break'> </span>called the <a href='/pages/subjects/58521' title='Watriss, William'>Watriss</a> Lot, and the disposition of the report <span class='line-break'> </span>of the Committee on Grounds.</p>
<p>After the situation of this land and the adjacent par<span class='line-break'></span>cels of real estate had been pointed out upon the plan, <span class='line-break'> </span>and the expediency of acquiring this lot had been <span class='line-break'> </span>discussed,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> moved that the report of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Grounds _ that it is "inexpedient to pur<span class='line-break'></span>chase" the same _ be accepted, _ upon which motion <span class='line-break'> </span>the yeas and nays were ordered: _ and <span class='line-break'> </span>the report was declared to be accepted,<span class='line-break'> </span>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>voting <u>yea</u>, and Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <u>Nay</u>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Attention called to Rule concerning Admission of Visitors _'>Attention called to Rule concerning Admission of Visitors _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> stated that complaint had been made to him <span class='line-break'> </span><small>that the regulaton requiring visitors to the Cemetery in carriages to present</small><span class='line-break'> </span><small>cards of admission at <a href='/pages/subjects/57664' title='Entrance Gateway'><!--entrance-->the Gate</a> had not been uniformly observed, and he</small><span class='line-break'> </span><small>called the attention of the Trustees to the rule, suggesting that it ought</small><span class='line-break'> </span><small>to be enforced; but without taking any action of the Board  Adjourned:_</small></p>
<p>Attest,, <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>,, Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134697">
<h3><a name="page-1134697">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 305)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>305</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees _ October 5, 1863 _ '> Trustees _ <date when='1863-10-05'>October 5, 1863</date> _ </span></p>
<p>The regular meeting of the Trustees of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn was held on <date when='1863-10-05T10:00:00'>Monday,<span class='line-break'> </span>October 5<sup>th</sup> at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> _</p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a><span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a>. _</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Judge Story Lot, no. 313 '> <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Judge Story</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/56311' title='Lot 313'>Lot, no. 313</a> </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> for the Committee on Lots reported<span class='line-break'> </span>that the Committee had, with the approval of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53238' title='Story, William W.'>W<sup>m</sup> W. Story</a>, representative of his late father, <a href='/pages/subjects/53237' title='Story, Joseph'>Judge Story's</a><span class='line-break'> </span>estate, authorized the erection of a granite curb upon<span class='line-break'> </span>his lot in the Cemetery, <a href='/pages/subjects/56311' title='Lot 313'>no. 313</a>, with such other improve<span class='line-break'></span>ments as are rendered necessary, to be paid for out<span class='line-break'> </span>of surplus income from the fund for the perpetual<span class='line-break'> </span>repair of said lot: and he asked leave to file<span class='line-break'> </span>the correspondance on the subject, embracing a letter from<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superintendent</a> to the Committee, one from the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/53238' title='Story, William W.'>Mr Story</a>, and his reply thereto. _</p>
<p>Voted that the report he accepted and said<span class='line-break'> </span>letters be filed. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Avenue from Walnut to Spruce '> Avenue from <a href='/pages/subjects/60001' title='Walnut Avenue'>Walnut<!--Ave--></a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/59904' title='Spruce Avenue'>Spruce<!--Ave--></a> </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> read a letter from the Superin<span class='line-break'></span>tendent recommending the opening of an avenue from<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/60001' title='Walnut Avenue'>Walnut Avenue</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/59904' title='Spruce Avenue'>Spruce Avenue</a>, doubling on both sides<span class='line-break'> </span>of the <a href='/pages/subjects/58208' title='Alice Fountain'><!--Alice-->new fountain</a>, over the courses of <a href='/pages/subjects/61286' title='Thistle Path'>Thistle<!--Path--></a> and<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61159' title='Cowslip Path'>Cowslip paths</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134698">
<h3><a name="page-1134698">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 306)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>306</p>
<p>The proposition was discussed, and objections<span class='line-break'> </span>being found to exist to the laying out of an avenue on<span class='line-break'> </span>the northerly side of said fountain over the whole<span class='line-break'> </span>course of <a href='/pages/subjects/61286' title='Thistle Path'>Thistle Path</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' new Avenue from Walnut to Spruce ordered _ '> new Avenue from <a href='/pages/subjects/60001' title='Walnut Avenue'>Walnut<!--Ave--></a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/59904' title='Spruce Avenue'>Spruce<!--Ave--></a> ordered _ </span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Mr Sleeper</a>, it was</p>
<p>Voted that the Committee on Grounds be author<span class='line-break'></span>ized to lay out an avenue, of the usual width, from<span class='line-break'> </span>the easterly end of <a href='/pages/subjects/61286' title='Thistle Path'>Thistle Path</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/61159' title='Cowslip Path'>Cowslip Path</a> (as here<span class='line-break'></span>to fore known on the plan) thence by said <a href='/pages/subjects/61159' title='Cowslip Path'>Cowslip Path</a><span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/59904' title='Spruce Avenue'>Spruce Avenue</a>; provided the same is done without<span class='line-break'> </span>infringing the rights of any proprietor.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> ,, Secretary.</p>
<p>---------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees - Nov. 2, 1863. '> Trustees - <date when='1863-11-02'>Nov. 2, 1863</date>. </span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees was<span class='line-break'> </span>held on <date when='1863-11-02'>Monday, November 2<sup>d</sup> 1863, at 10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Chairman pro tem.'> Chairman pro tem.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> being absent from town, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a><span class='line-break'> </span>was chosen Chairman pro tempore.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Report of Com on Lots on the [Lots kept in repair by Corporation under contract]'> Report of Com on Lots on the [Lots kept in repair by Corporation under contract]</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> for the Committee on Lots submitted a<span class='line-break'> </span>written report upon the condition of the lots which are<span class='line-break'> </span>kept in repair by the Corporation under contract.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134699">
<h3><a name="page-1134699">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 307)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>307</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='[Report of Com on Lots on the] Lots kept in repair by Corporation under contract '>[Report of Com on Lots on the] Lots kept in repair by Corporation under contract </span></p>
<p>which report was accepted. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Statement of surplus income on same to be sent to Supt _ '> Statement of surplus income on same to be sent to Sup<sup>t</sup> _ </span></p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> send to <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superinten<span class='line-break'></span>dent</a> the Statement of the Committee on several lots<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to in their report which need repairs, with the<span class='line-break'> </span>amount of the fund for each lot according to the last<span class='line-break'> </span>report of the Treasurer, and instruct him to cause such<span class='line-break'> </span>repairs as may be necessary within the income of the funds<span class='line-break'> </span>upon the lots not guarantied, and put the guarantied<span class='line-break'> </span>lots in order. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Supt requested to furnish list of lots neglected by Proprietors '> <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->Sup<sup>t</sup></a> requested to furnish list of lots neglected by Proprietors </span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superintendent</a> be requested to<span class='line-break'> </span>furnish <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> with a list of lots in the<span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery which appear to have been neglected by<span class='line-break'> </span>the proprietors, and for which no contract for re<span class='line-break'></span>pair had been made with the Corporation.</p>
<p>Adjourned Attest, <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A.J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>-------------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees _ Dec. 7, 1863 '> Trustees _ <date when='1863-12-07'>Dec. 7, 1863</date> </span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees of the <span class='line-break'> </span>Cemetery of Mount Auburn was held on <date when='1863-12-07T10:00:00'>Monday,<span class='line-break'> </span>December 7<sup>th</sup> at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> _</p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>. _</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134700">
<h3><a name="page-1134700">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 308)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>308</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Dec. 7, 1863 _'> <date when='1863-12-07'>Dec. 7, 1863</date> _</span></p>
<p>Petitions for the representation of lots were presented<span class='line-break'> </span>as follows; and persons named below, were severally designated: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Representatives designated for Lots _ '> Representatives designated for Lots _ </span></p>
<p>for ~~~</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='no 73, '><a href='/pages/subjects/101907' title='Lot 73'>no 73</a>, </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/101908' title='Furbush, Mary'>Mary Furbush</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/66737' title='Quincy, MA'>Quincy</a>, widow of <a href='/pages/subjects/101909' title='Furbush, Milo'>Milo Fur<span class='line-break'></span>bush</a>, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/101907' title='Lot 73'>lot No. 73</a>, to represent said lot: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' 355 '> <a href='/pages/subjects/101910' title='Lot 355'><!--Lot-->355</a> </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/101911' title='Dana, William P. W.'>W<sup>m</sup> P. W. Dana</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/64140' title='New York, NY'>New York City</a>, son of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/101912' title='Dana, Nancy'>Nancy Dana</a>, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/101910' title='Lot 355'>lot No. 355</a> to represent said lot:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' 1657 '> <a href='/pages/subjects/101913' title='Lot 1657'><!--Lot-->1657</a> </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/25005808' title='White, Artemas'>Artemas White</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/72025' title='Belmont, MA'>Belmont</a>, eldest son of <a href='/pages/subjects/25005808' title='White, Artemas'>Artemas<span class='line-break'> </span>White</a> late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/101913' title='Lot 1657'>lot numbered 1657</a>, to represent said lot: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' 1812 '> <a href='/pages/subjects/101915' title='Lot 1812'><!--Lot-->1812</a> </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/101916' title='Coolidge, Sarah A.'>Sarah A. Coolidge</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/54284' title='Charlestown, MA'>Charlestown</a>, daughter of <a href='/pages/subjects/101917' title='Trafton, Sarah A.'>Sarah<span class='line-break'> </span>A. Trafton</a>, deceased, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/101915' title='Lot 1812'>lot No. 1812</a> to<span class='line-break'> </span>represent said lot: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' 2829 '> <a href='/pages/subjects/101918' title='Lot 2829'><!--Lot-->2829</a> </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/101919' title='Leland, Thomas S.'>Thomas S. Leland</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/55343' title='Somerville, MA'>Somerville</a>, only son of <a href='/pages/subjects/101920' title='Leland, Thomas J.'>Thomas<span class='line-break'> </span>J. Leland</a>, deceased, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/101918' title='Lot 2829'>lot numbered 2829</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>to represent said lot: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' 3306 _ '> <a href='/pages/subjects/101921' title='Lot 3306'><!--Lot-->3306</a> _ </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/101922' title='Nichols, Edward O.'>Edward O. Nichols</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/54284' title='Charlestown, MA'>Charlestown</a>, brother and<span class='line-break'> </span>heir at law of <a href='/pages/subjects/101923' title='Nichols, Gilbert'>Gilbert Nichols</a>, deceased by whose heirs at<span class='line-break'> </span>law <a href='/pages/subjects/101921' title='Lot 3306'>lot numbered 3306</a> was purchased, to represent said lot.</p>
<p>Adjourned<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Sec.y</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134701">
<h3><a name="page-1134701">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 309)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>309</p>
<p>Deed to <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mary Hemenway</a>.</p>
<p>Know all men by these presents, that the Pro<span class='line-break'></span>prietors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn, in consider<span class='line-break'></span>ation of <u>six thousand dollars,</u> paid to them by <u><a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mary<span class='line-break'> </span>Hemenway</a></u>, wife of <a href='/pages/subjects/65215' title='Hemenway, Augustus'>Augustus Hemenway</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>in the county of Suffolk, and commonwealth of Massa<span class='line-break'></span>chusetts, the receipt whereof is hereby acknowledged, do<span class='line-break'> </span>hereby grant, bargain, sell and convey to the said<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mary Hemenway</a> and her heirs and assigns, a certain<span class='line-break'> </span>piece of land in the Cemetery of Mount Auburn, situ<span class='line-break'></span>ated, bounded and measuring as follows, (as shown<span class='line-break'> </span>upon a plan of land made by <a href='/pages/subjects/57826' title='Shedd &amp; Edson'>Shedd and Edson</a>, a<span class='line-break'> </span>copy whereof is hereto annexed; _ Beginning on the westerly<span class='line-break'> </span>side of <a href='/pages/subjects/61141' title='Cactus Path'>Cactus Path</a>, at the intersection of the same with<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/61286' title='Thistle Path'>Thistle Path</a>, thence running westwardly by said <a href='/pages/subjects/61286' title='Thistle Path'>Thistle <span class='line-break'> </span>Path</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/101428' title='Cistus Path'>Cistus Path</a>, thence southwardly by said <a href='/pages/subjects/101428' title='Cistus Path'>Cistus<span class='line-break'> </span>Path</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/61159' title='Cowslip Path'>Cowslip Path</a>, thence eastwardly by <a href='/pages/subjects/61159' title='Cowslip Path'>Cowslip<span class='line-break'> </span>Path</a> to <a href='/pages/subjects/61141' title='Cactus Path'>Cactus Path</a>, thence northwardly by <a href='/pages/subjects/61141' title='Cactus Path'>Cactus Path</a><span class='line-break'> </span>to the point of beginning,) containing fifteen thousand two<span class='line-break'> </span>hundred and five (15,205) square feet, more or less.</p>
<p>To have and to hold the aforegranted prem<span class='line-break'></span>ises unto the said <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mary Hemenway</a>, her heirs and<span class='line-break'> </span>assiged forever, for ornamental purposes, upon the<span class='line-break'> </span>following conditions; viz.</p>
<p><u>First</u>: That no part of said premises shall ever be<span class='line-break'> </span>used as a place for burial for the dead: but the whole<span class='line-break'> </span>of said premises shall forever remain as a part of<span class='line-break'> </span>the open grounds of the Cemetery: _</p>
<p><u>Second</u>: That no alterations shall be made in</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134702">
<h3><a name="page-1134702">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 310)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>310</p>
<p>said premises by introducing or removing any landmark,<span class='line-break'> </span>monument, fence or other structure, or any trees, without<span class='line-break'> </span>the consent of the Board of Trustees for the time being<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Cemetery. But the said Trustees shall have the<span class='line-break'> </span>right, at any time, to enter and remove from said<span class='line-break'> </span>premises, any objects which are incompatible with<span class='line-break'> </span>this contract, or in their Judgment, detrimental and im<span class='line-break'></span>proper. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Record of deed to Mary Hemenway _ '> Record of deed to <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mary Hemenway</a> _ </span></p>
<p>And the said Proprietors of the Cemetery of Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn do hereby covenant to and with the said <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mary<span class='line-break'> </span>Hemenway</a>, her heirs and assigns, that they are lawfully<span class='line-break'> </span>seized of the aforegranted premises and of the ways leading,<span class='line-break'> </span>to the same from the highway, in fee simple; that<span class='line-break'> </span>they are free from all incumbrances; that the Corpor<span class='line-break'></span>ation have a right to sell and convey the said premises<span class='line-break'> </span>to the said <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mary Hemenway</a> for the purposes above Expressed;<span class='line-break'> </span>and that they will warrant and defend the same<span class='line-break'> </span>unto the said <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mary Hemenway</a> her heirs and assigns<span class='line-break'> </span>forever. _</p>
<p>And the said Proprietors of the Cemetery of<span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn do further covenant to and with the said<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mary Hemenway</a>, her heirs and assigns that <a href='/pages/subjects/58208' title='Alice Fountain'><!--Alice-->the basin<span class='line-break'> </span>and fountain</a> which have been constructed in and upon<span class='line-break'> </span>said premises, under the authority and at the expense of said<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation, shall be kept in repair and said fountain be<span class='line-break'> </span>kept running so long as the fountain situated in <a href='/pages/subjects/58209' title='Asa Gray Garden'>the Lawn</a> (so<span class='line-break'> </span>called) in said Cemetery shall be kept running: and that<span class='line-break'> </span>the portion of said premises which is not covered with<span class='line-break'> </span>said basin, with the gravel walks and grass plats,<span class='line-break'> </span>as shown upon said plan, shall forever be kept</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<div class="page-content">
<p>page not numbered</p>
<p>[Plan of <a href='/pages/subjects/58208' title='Alice Fountain'>Alice Fountain</a> AREA 15,205 SQ. FT.]<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/57826' title='Shedd &amp; Edson'>SHEDD &amp; EDSON ENG<sup>s</sup></a><span class='line-break'> </span>SCALE 50 FT. TO AN INCH.<span class='line-break'> </span>COPY</p>

<div id="page-1134704">
<h3><a name="page-1134704">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 311)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>311</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Copy of Deed to Mary Hemenway '> Copy of Deed to <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mary Hemenway</a> </span></p>
<p>in suitable and good repair and preservation:<span class='line-break'> </span>and further, that the said <a href='/pages/subjects/65211' title='Hemenway, Mary Tileston'>Mary Hemenway</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>her heirs and assigns, shall be permitted<span class='line-break'> </span>to keep and maintain, at her and their<span class='line-break'> </span>own Expense, such ornamental appendages to<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/58208' title='Alice Fountain'><!--Alice-->said basin and fountain</a> as shall be ap<span class='line-break'></span>proved by the Board of Trustees for the<span class='line-break'> </span>time being of said Corporation.</p>
<p>In testimony whereof the said Proprie<span class='line-break'></span>tors of the Cemetery of Mount Auburn have<span class='line-break'> </span>caused this instrument to be signed by <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->their<span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer</a> and countersigned by <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->their Secretary</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>and their common seal to be hereto affixed<span class='line-break'> </span>the <date when='1863-12-11'>Eleventh day of December, A.D. Eighteen hundred<span class='line-break'> </span>and sixty three</date>.</p>
<p>Countersigned <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a> Treas<sup>r</sup><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary</p>
<p>[hand drawn seal that reads: sic panditur via immortalitatis]</p>
<p>[On margin of deed are these words:]<span class='line-break'> </span>Recorded on this <date when='1863-12-12'>twelfth day of December, AD 1863</date>,<span class='line-break'> </span>with the Records of doings of the Trustees of the Cemetery of Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn. By <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary.</p>
<p>(see p. 64 Vol IV<span class='line-break'> </span>for amendment )<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134705">
<h3><a name="page-1134705">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 312)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>312</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees. _ Jan.y. 4. 1864'>Trustees. _ <date when='1864-01-04'>Jan.y. 4. 1864</date></span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held on <date when='1864-01-04T10:00:00'>Monday January 4. 1864, at 10 0'clock a.m.</date> ~</p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Question of Ground Rent due from A. Mc Donald for Marble Shop referred to late Comee on Greenhouse'>Question of Ground Rent due from <a href='/pages/subjects/64030' title='McDonald, Alexander'>A. M<sup>c</sup> Donald</a> for Marble Shop referred to late Com<sup>ee</sup> on <a href='/pages/subjects/61312' title='Greenhouse'>Greenhouse</a></span></p>
<p>A communication was received from <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superintendent</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>relating to the ground rent due from <a href='/pages/subjects/64030' title='McDonald, Alexander'>Alex<sup>r</sup> M<sup>c</sup>Donald</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>which is claimed by <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Jonathan Mann</a>, the mortgagee of <span class='line-break'> </span>the <a href='/pages/subjects/61312' title='Greenhouse'>greenhouse</a>, and to whom the rent under the lease to <a href='/pages/subjects/64030' title='McDonald, Alexander'>M<sup>c</sup>-<span class='line-break'> </span>Donald</a> is made payable. _</p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>, Voted that the question <span class='line-break'> </span>of rent due from <a href='/pages/subjects/64030' title='McDonald, Alexander'>M<sup>c</sup>Donald</a> be referred to the same gen<span class='line-break'></span>tlemen that composed the former Committee upon the transfer <span class='line-break'> </span>of the <a href='/pages/subjects/61312' title='Greenhouse'>Greenhouse</a> to this Corporation _</p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/65205' title='Andrews, William T.'>Andrews</a>. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Workshop, Tool and Store house for Cemetery _'><a href='/pages/subjects/102073' title='Workshop'>Workshop, Tool and Store house</a> for Cemetery _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->The Superintendent</a> also, in the same communication, urged<span class='line-break'> </span>the importance of erecting a <a href='/pages/subjects/102073' title='Workshop'>workshop, tool and stove house</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>in the vicinity of the <a href='/pages/subjects/102074' title='Engine house'>Engine house</a>.</p>
<p>Upon motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr. Rand</a>, Voted that the expediency<span class='line-break'> </span>of erecting such building be referred to the Committee on Grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>with full power. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Communication from Jona Mann _ referred to [Comee on Prosecution _]'>Communication from <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Jon<sup>a</sup> Mann</a> _ referred to [Com<sup>ee</sup> on Prosecution _]</span></p>
<p>A communicaiton was received from <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Jonathan Mann</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>asking this Board to discontinue the suit against him, and <span class='line-break'> </span>urging certain reasons why they should do so. _</p>
<p>The same was read, and upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>it was Voted that this communication be referred<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134706">
<h3><a name="page-1134706">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 313)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>313</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='[Communication from Jona Mann _ referred to] Comee on Prosecution _'>[Communication from <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Jon<sup>a</sup> Mann</a> _ referred to] Com<sup>ee</sup> on Prosecution _</span></p>
<p>to the Committee on the prosecution of the claim against <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>, with instruction to them to report the <span class='line-break'> </span>condition of said suit at the adjourned meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Adjournt'>Adjourn<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p>Voted that when this meeting adjourn, it be <span class='line-break'> </span>to <date when='1864-01-25T10:00:00'>Monday, January 25<sup>th</sup>, at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> <span class='line-break'> </span>one week before the annual meeting.</p>
<p>Adjourned,<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary.</p>
<p>---------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Adjd meeting-'>Trustees Adj<sup>d</sup> meeting-</span></p>
<p>An adjourned meeting of the Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held on <date when='1864-01-25T10:00:00'>Monday, January 25. 1864, at 10 o'clock<span class='line-break'> </span>a.m.</date> _</p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read . _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Comee on suit vs J. Mann-'>Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> on suit vs <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>J. Mann</a>-</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> for the Committee on the suit against <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>, read the report of that Committee,<span class='line-break'> </span>with which was submitted a written statement of the <span class='line-break'> </span>case, by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Chas. P. Curtis</a> Jr, of counsel for the Cor<span class='line-break'></span>poration, _ which on motion by him was accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Workhouse, &amp;c _ Comee not prepared to report _'><a href='/pages/subjects/102073' title='Workshop'>Workhouse</a>, &amp;c _ Com<sup>ee</sup> not prepared to report _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> for the Committee on Grounds <span class='line-break'> </span>stated that the Committee had not been able, on <span class='line-break'> </span>account of bad weather, to examine and determine <span class='line-break'> </span>upon the expediency of erecting a <a href='/pages/subjects/102073' title='Workshop'>workhouse</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134707">
<h3><a name="page-1134707">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 314)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>314</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Annual Report of Trustees _'> Annual Report of Trustees _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> read the Annual Report<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees, which upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Nazro</a>, was accepted, and ordered to be printed<span class='line-break'> </span>for the Proprietors.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Treasurer&apos;s Report _'> Treasurer's Report _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->The Treasurer</a> read his Annual Report,<span class='line-break'> </span>which upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a> was accepted<span class='line-break'> </span>and ordered to be printed for the Proprietors,</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Superintendent&apos;s Report _'> Superintendent's Report _</span></p>
<p>The Superintendent's Report was also read<span class='line-break'> </span>and ordered to be printed with the others.</p>
<p>Adjourned,<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>A. J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees _ Feby. 1, 1864 '> Trustees _ <date when='1864-02-01'>Feby. 1, 1864</date> </span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees was<span class='line-break'> </span>held on <date when='1864-02-01T10:00:00'>Monday, February 1<sup>st</sup>, 1864, at 10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>. _</p>
<p>The records of the last meeting were read and approved.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Representatives designated for Lots '> Representatives designated for Lots </span></p>
<p>In the following cases, applications were received for the<span class='line-break'> </span>representation of lots of deceased proprietors, and the persons<span class='line-break'> </span>nominated were severally designated to represent the lots: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='311 _ '><a href='/pages/subjects/73415' title='Lot 311'><!--Lot-->311</a> _ </span><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/102077' title='Simmons, Mary E.'>Mary E. Simmons</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/64860' title='Concord, MA'>Concord</a>, widow and devisee of one of<span class='line-break'> </span><small>the heirs of <a href='/pages/subjects/58446' title='Simmons, William'>W<sup>m</sup> Simmons</a>, deceased, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/73415' title='Lot 311'>lot numbered 311</a>, </small></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p>315</p>
<p>to represent said lot: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='[Representatives designated for Lots] 521'>[Representatives designated for Lots] <a href='/pages/subjects/102078' title='Lot 521'><!--Lot-->521</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/102079' title='Grubb, William F.'>W<sup>m</sup> F. Grubb</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, a son of <a href='/pages/subjects/102080' title='Grubb, William'>W<sup>m</sup> Grubb</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/102078' title='Lot 521'>lot numbered 521</a>, to<span class='line-break'> </span>represent said lot: _</p>

Storrow</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, son of <a href='/pages/subjects/102083' title='Storrow, Thomas W.'>Thomas W.<span class='line-break'> </span>Storrow</a>, deceased, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/102081' title='Lot 1699'>lot numbered 1699</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>to represent said lot: _</p>

Rand Jr.</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, one of the trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>under the will of <a href='/pages/subjects/66763' title='Foster, Sarah B.'>Sarah B. Foster</a>, deceased, to<span class='line-break'> </span>represent her <a href='/pages/subjects/66761' title='Lot 1862'>lot, no. 1862</a>.</p>

Baldwin</a>, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/102088' title='Lot 2251'>lots numbered<span class='line-break'> </span>2251</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/102089' title='Lot 3160'><!--Lot-->3160</a>, to represent said lots. _</p>

<div id="page-1134709">
<h3><a name="page-1134709">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 316)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>316</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Feby 1. 1864 Annual Meeting of the Proprietors _'><date when='1864-02-01'>Feby 1. 1864</date> Annual Meeting of the Proprietors _</span></p>
<p>Mount Auburn Cemetery _</p>
<p>The Annual Meeting of the Proprietors of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery of Mount Auburn will be held in<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, at Mercantile Hall, 16 Summer Street, on<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1864-02-01T16:00:00'>Monday, February 1, at 4 o'clock P.M.</date>, to hear the<span class='line-break'> </span>Annual Reports, and to choose Trustees for the ensuing<span class='line-break'> </span>year. ~ <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1864-01-25'>Jany 25, 1864</date>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Notification _'> Notification _</span></p>
<p>In accordance with the foregoing notification which<span class='line-break'> </span>was published seven days before the time of meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>in several <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> newspapers, the Proprietors met<span class='line-break'> </span>at the time and place therein named,</p>
<p>A quorum being in attendance, the President,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Jacob Bigelow</a>, took the chair. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Records read _'> Records read _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> read the record of the last<span class='line-break'> </span>annual meeting, and the adjournment thereof. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Annual Reports of Trustees, Treasurer &amp; Superintendent read _ &amp; accepted '> Annual Reports of Trustees, Treasurer &amp; Superintendent read _ &amp; accepted </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> read the annual report of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees; <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> that of the Superintendent,<span class='line-break'> </span>and <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> his own report, all of them<span class='line-break'> </span>in print, which, on motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62839' title='Torrey, Charles'>Chas. Torrey Esq</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>were severally accepted. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Comee chosen to nominate Trustees - '> Com<sup>ee</sup> chosen to nominate Trustees - </span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/62839' title='Torrey, Charles'>Charles Torrey</a> Esq.</p>
<p>Voted that a committee of three be appointed<span class='line-break'> </span>to retire and nominate a board of twelve trus<span class='line-break'></span>tees for the ensuing year. -_</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134710">
<h3><a name="page-1134710">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 317)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>317</p>
<p>The Chairman appointed as said Committee,<span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/62839' title='Torrey, Charles'>Charles Torrey</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>Messrs</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54278' title='Jewell, Harvey'>Harvey Jewell</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/64695' title='Faulkner, Charles'>Charles Faulkner</a></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>While the Committee were out attending to<span class='line-break'> </span>this duty</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' motion to request Trustees to discontinue suit vs J. Mann. _'> motion to request Trustees to discontinue suit vs <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>J. Mann</a>. _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/64700' title='Wightman, J. M.'>Mr J M. Wightman</a> moved that the<span class='line-break'> </span>incoming board of Trustees be requested to<span class='line-break'> </span>discontinue the lawsuit against <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='motion to refer _'>motion to refer _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/60695' title='Brigham, William'>Mr William Brigham</a> moved that the<span class='line-break'> </span>subject of <a href='/pages/subjects/64700' title='Wightman, J. M.'>Mr Wightman's</a> motion be referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>the next board of Trustees, which motion was sec<span class='line-break'></span>onded. _</p>
<p>The Committee to nominate Trustees came<span class='line-break'> </span>in and reported the following list.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Report of Com to nominate _'> Report of Com to nominate _</span></p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Jacob Bigelow</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Edward Austin</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>James Cheever</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Jacob Sleeper</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Edward S. Rand</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'>Charles C. Little</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>James Read</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54833' title='Bowditch, J. Ingersoll'>J. Ingersoll Bowditch</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/65964' title='Livermore, George'>George Livermore</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54936' title='Appleton, William'>William Appleton</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Otis Norcross</a></td> </tr> </tbody> </table></p>
</div>
</div>
