<div id="page-1134711">
<h3><a name="page-1134711">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 318)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>318</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' amendt to motion to discontinue suit _'> amend<sup>t</sup> to motion to discontinue suit _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54278' title='Jewell, Harvey'>Mr Harvey Jewell</a> moved to amend<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/64700' title='Wightman, J. M.'>Mr Wightman's</a> motion, (and the amendment<span class='line-break'> </span>was accepted by the mover,) by adding the words _<span class='line-break'> </span>"and to return to <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> the $1000 deposited<span class='line-break'> </span>by him with interest." _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Prinl motion with Amendt adopted _'> Prin<sup>l</sup> motion with Amend<sup>t</sup> adopted _</span></p>
<p>and this with the principal motion was<span class='line-break'> </span>adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Comee to receive, sort and count ballots for Trustees _'>Com<sup>ee</sup> to receive, sort and count ballots for Trustees _</span></p>
<p>The Chairman appointed as a Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>to receive, sort, and count the votes,</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54278' title='Jewell, Harvey'>Harvey Jewell</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>Messrs</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/102092' title='Stone, Anson J.'>Anson J. Stone</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/64695' title='Faulkner, Charles'>Charles Faulkner</a></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> and the ballots were then received.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Comee unable to report at present meeting _'> Com<sup>ee</sup> unable to report at present meeting _</span></p>
<p>The Committee subsequently came in, and their<span class='line-break'> </span>Chairman stated that it was impossible for the<span class='line-break'> </span>committee to make a satisfactory report at the present<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the votes cast, from the defective character<span class='line-break'> </span>of the ballot itself, and he asked for the com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee further time.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Time of Adjourned meeting _'> Time of Adjourned meeting _</span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/62235' title='Pierce, Silas'>Mr Silas Pierce</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that when this meeting adjourn it be<span class='line-break'> </span>to <date when='1864-02-16T16:00:00'>Tuesday, February 16<sup>th</sup>, at 4 o'clock P.M.</date> in this<span class='line-break'> </span>place, to hear the report of the Committee and<span class='line-break'> </span>act thereon.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134712">
<h3><a name="page-1134712">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 319)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>319</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Form of notice for adjd meeting '> Form of notice for adj<sup>d</sup> meeting </span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54278' title='Jewell, Harvey'>Mr Harvey Jewell</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> be directed to notify<span class='line-break'> </span>the adjournment of this meeting, by suitable<span class='line-break'> </span>notice in the <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> newspapers, to be for the pur<span class='line-break'></span>pose of hearing the report of the committee on the<span class='line-break'> </span>ballot for Trustees, and, if needful, to com<span class='line-break'></span>plete the election of Trustees.</p>
<p>The meeting was adjourned</p>
<p>Attest. <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>-------------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Feby. 16, 1864 _ Adjourned Annual Meeting of the Proprietors _'> <date when='1864-02-16'>Feby. 16, 1864</date> _ Adjourned Annual Meeting of the Proprietors _</span></p>
<p>"Mount Auburn Cemetery. _</p>
<p>Adjourned Annual Meeting. The adjourned<span class='line-break'> </span>Annual Meeting of the Proprietors of the Cem<span class='line-break'></span>etery of Mount Auburn will be held at Mer<span class='line-break'></span>cantile Hall, 16 Summer Street, on <date when='1864-02-16T16:00:00'>Tuesday,<span class='line-break'> </span>February 16<sup>th</sup> at 4 o'clock P.M.</date>, for the purpose of<span class='line-break'> </span>hearing the report of the Committee on the ballot<span class='line-break'> </span>for Trustees, and, if needful to complete the election<span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees." _ <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1864-02-02'>Feby. 2, 1864</date>.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='notification _'>notification _</span></p>
<p>In accordance with the vote passed at the last<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting, and a notice, of which the foregoing is a copy,<span class='line-break'> </span>published in several <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> newspapers more<span class='line-break'> </span>than seven days before the time of meeting, _ the<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors met at the time and place above<span class='line-break'> </span>named.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134713">
<h3><a name="page-1134713">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 320)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>320</p>
<p>A quorum being in attendance, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Jacob<span class='line-break'> </span>Bigelow</a> took the chair. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Record read _'> Record read _</span></p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Statement of Mr C.G. Nazro by permission of Proprietors _'> Statement of <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr C.G. Nazro</a> by permission of Proprietors _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Charles G. Nazro</a>, a member of the board<span class='line-break'> </span>of Trustees, asked permission, before the meeting should<span class='line-break'> </span>proceed to other business to make a statement<span class='line-break'> </span>of facts in relation to the suit of law maintained<span class='line-break'> </span>by this Corporation against <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Jonathan Mann</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>such a statement having been asked for at the <span class='line-break'> </span>last meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Interrupted with point of order _'> Interrupted with point of order _</span><span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Decided by Chairman to be out of order. '> Decided by Chairman to be out of order. </span></p>
<p>No objection having been made, the Chairman<span class='line-break'> </span>stated that he could proceed. _</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> had proceeded to read a part of<span class='line-break'> </span>his statement, when <a href='/pages/subjects/68087' title='Ladd, John S.'>Judge John S. Ladd</a> of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a> interrupted him with a point of order,<span class='line-break'> </span>and asked the Chairman to rule that the business<span class='line-break'> </span>for which the meeting was notified _ viz. to hear the<span class='line-break'> </span>report of the Committee on the ballot for Trustees,<span class='line-break'> </span>was the first in order.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Appeals _'> Appeals _</span></p>
<p>After some discussion, the chair ruled as requested<span class='line-break'> </span>from which decision <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> appealed to<span class='line-break'> </span>the meeting. The vote was taken, and the Chair<span class='line-break'></span>man declared his decision to be sustained. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Is overruled. '> Is overruled. </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54278' title='Jewell, Harvey'>Mr Jewell</a> for the Committee on balloting for<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees then read the report of the Committee,<span class='line-break'> </span>a copy of which follows: _</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134714">
<h3><a name="page-1134714">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 321)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>321</p>
<p>"The Committee appointed to receive, assort<span class='line-break'> </span>and count the votes for Trustees of Mount<span class='line-break'> </span>Auburn Cemetery have attended to that duty<span class='line-break'> </span>and report: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Report of Committee on Ballot for Trustees _'> Report of Committee on Ballot for Trustees _</span></p>
<p>That by reason of the fact<span class='line-break'> </span>that proxies were represented bearing date<span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1863-01-30'>Jany. 30, 1863</date>, and other proxies bearing<span class='line-break'> </span>date Jany. 30<sup>th</sup> &amp; <date when='1864-01-31'>31<sup>st</sup> 1864</date>, and of the further<span class='line-break'> </span>fact that some persons whose names were on<span class='line-break'> </span>these proxies were found to have cast votes in<span class='line-break'> </span>person at the meeting, and that some persons<span class='line-break'> </span>represented by proxy were present and voted<span class='line-break'> </span>who did not endorse their names upon their<span class='line-break'> </span>votes, the Committee found great difficulty<span class='line-break'> </span>in arriving at the time state of the balloting.</p>
<p>There were also twenty four votes cast by<span class='line-break'> </span>persons who did not endorse their ballots.</p>
<p>The Committee decided that all votes<span class='line-break'> </span>cast, although not endorsed, should be counted.</p>
<p>They have carefully, at several sessions,<span class='line-break'> </span>collated the votes cast, and the proxies bearing<span class='line-break'> </span>different dates. They have rejected proxies<span class='line-break'> </span>where the person had executed a proxy of later<span class='line-break'> </span>date, or where he in person was present at the<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting and voted.</p>
<p>The execution of a proxy of later date,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the exercise of the right to vote in person<span class='line-break'> </span>was deemed to be a cancelling of the earlier<span class='line-break'> </span>proxy.</p>
<p>They annex the result of their</p>
</div>
</div>

<p>323</p>
<p>The report was accepted, and<span class='line-break'> </span>the chairman declared that the twelve<span class='line-break'> </span>gentlemen first above-named were<span class='line-break'> </span>chosen Trustees for the ensuing year. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' meeting Adjourned _'> meeting Adjourned _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/102128' title='Hatch, Samuel'>Mr Samuel Hatch</a> then moved that<span class='line-break'> </span>the meeting do adjourn.</p>
<p>The question was taken, and upon a<span class='line-break'> </span>count, the motion was declared to be adopted,<span class='line-break'> </span>forty six having voted for and forty five against<span class='line-break'> </span>adjournment.</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Treasurer&apos;s Annual Report. '> Treasurer's Annual Report. </span></p>

<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1863 _ Treasurer&apos;s Annual Report _'>1863 _ Treasurer's Annual Report _</span></p>
<p><u>Treasurer's Report _ continued _</u></p>
<p>Permanent Fund</p>

<div id="page-1134720">
<h3><a name="page-1134720">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 327)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>327</p>
<p>Trustees _ 1864-5.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees _ Feby. 22, 1864. Meeting for Organization '> Trustees _ <date when='1864-02-22'>Feby. 22, 1864</date>. Meeting for Organization </span></p>
<p>The first meeting of the Trustees of the Cemetery<span class='line-break'> </span>of Mount Auburn for organization and business<span class='line-break'> </span>was held at the office of the Corporation (33<span class='line-break'> </span>School Street) on <date when='1864-02-22T10:00:00'>Monday, February 22 at 10 O'clock<span class='line-break'> </span>a.m.</date> _</p>
<p>There were present, Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65964' title='Livermore, George'>Livermore</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Reed</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a>. _</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> read the records of the two last<span class='line-break'> </span>meetings of the Trustees, and of the annual meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Proprietors and of the adjournment thereof.</p>
<p>The Trustees proceeded to the choice<span class='line-break'> </span>of officers and Committees for the ensuing year. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Choice of President '> Choice of President </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a> acted as a committee to receive<span class='line-break'> </span>and count the votes. _</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr Jacob Bigelow</a> was unanimously chosen Pres<sup>t</sup></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Expediency of uniting duties Sec.y &amp; Treasr referred to Specl Comee'> Expediency of uniting duties Sec.y &amp; Treas<sup>r</sup> referred to Spec<sup>l</sup> Com<sup>ee</sup></span></p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the question of the expediency of writing <span class='line-break'> </span>the duties of Secretary and Treasurer in our person,<span class='line-break'> </span>be referred to a Committee of three, to report upon<span class='line-break'> </span>as soon as they may deem it expedient.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

<p>The Trustees then proceeded to choose the remaining<span class='line-break'> </span>officers and committees, in the manner pre<span class='line-break'></span>scribed in the by-laws _ as follows: _</p>

<p>Voted that the Superintendent and<span class='line-break'> </span>Gatekeeper be paid the same salary, respec<span class='line-break'></span>tively as was allowed for the last year.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Suit vs. J. Mann _'>Suit vs. <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>J. Mann</a> _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the subject of the suit against <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Mann</a> be referred to a committee of three,<span class='line-break'> </span>to report thereon at a future meeting; and<span class='line-break'> </span>upon nomination by the Chairman,</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>Messrs</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a> &amp;</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a></td> <td>were chosen. _</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representation of Lots numbered as follows _'>Representation of Lots numbered as follows _</span></p>

<div id="page-1134724">
<h3><a name="page-1134724">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 331)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>331</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees _ March 7, 1864'> Trustees _ <date when='1864-03-07'>March 7, 1864</date></span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees of<span class='line-break'> </span>Mount Auburn was held on <date when='1864-03-07T10:00:00'>Monday March 7<sup>th</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>1864, at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> _</p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65964' title='Livermore, George'>Livermore</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Norcross</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>. _</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Special Committee on Suit vs J. Mann _'>Report of Special Committee on Suit vs <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>J. Mann</a> _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> for the Committee to which was referred<span class='line-break'> </span>the subject of the suit against <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>, read<span class='line-break'> </span>the report of the Committee of which the following<span class='line-break'> </span>is a copy: _</p>
<p>"The Committee to whom was referred the sub<span class='line-break'></span>ject of the suit against <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>, beg leave to report,</p>
<p>That inasmuch as this subject has been referred to<span class='line-break'> </span>them in consequence of the action of the Proprietors at their<span class='line-break'> </span>last annual meeting requesting the Trustees to discon<span class='line-break'></span>tinue said suit and to refund the money deposited<span class='line-break'> </span>by <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> with <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a>, deeming a concise<span class='line-break'> </span>history of the case necessary to a right understanding<span class='line-break'> </span>and appreciation of the past doings and the present<span class='line-break'> </span>situation of the Trustees in relation to their matter,<span class='line-break'> </span>they present such history as a part of their report.</p>
<p>Early in 1861 in the course of an examination of<span class='line-break'> </span>the accounts of the Superintendent at the Cemetery, made by<span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee on Interments the attention of the Committee</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134725">
<h3><a name="page-1134725">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 332)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>332</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees _ March 7, 1864 _'> Trustees _ <date when='1864-03-07'>March 7, 1864</date> _</span></p>
<p>was called to Errors in the accounts so large and<span class='line-break'> </span>apparently of so grave a character, that they reported the<span class='line-break'> </span>facts to the Trustees for their action in the premises. _</p>
<p>In consequence of this a Committee consisting of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee on Regulations and Records of Interments<span class='line-break'> </span>and the Finance Committee was appointed to Examine<span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent's books and vouchers and to report<span class='line-break'> </span>at a subsequent meeting.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Comee on Mann suit _ continued _'>Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Mann suit _ continued _</span></p>
<p>At a meeting on the <date when='1863-04-05'>fifth of April</date> this Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>reported that charges had been made against <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'><!--Mann-->the Super<span class='line-break'></span>intendent</a>, (which appeared to be corroborated by Entries<span class='line-break'> </span>in the books,) of direct violation of a well known<span class='line-break'> </span>By-law of the Corporation, and involving the integrity<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>, and they recommended that a meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees should be held at an early day, and<span class='line-break'> </span>that <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> should be notified of the charges<span class='line-break'> </span>made, and be requested to appear before the Board at<span class='line-break'> </span>such meeting.</p>
<p>At the same meeting it was stated that <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Mann</a> had proposed to deposit in the hands of <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the<span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer</a> one thousand dollars ($1000.) to meet<span class='line-break'> </span>any deficiences or inaccuracies which on a further<span class='line-break'> </span>and full investigation of his accounts might be proved;<span class='line-break'> </span>and it was voted that the Treasurer be authorized<span class='line-break'> </span>to receive of him the said sum as proposed, and to<span class='line-break'> </span>give a receipt therefor. _ In persuance of this vote,<span class='line-break'> </span>the sum of one thousand dollars ($1000.) was deposited<span class='line-break'> </span>in the hands of the Treasurer by <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>, and a<span class='line-break'> </span>receipt given therefor, a <u>copy</u> of which is hereto annexed.</p>
<p>(See page 337.)</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134726">
<h3><a name="page-1134726">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 333)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>333</p>
<p>Your Committee deem it unnecessary to state in<span class='line-break'> </span>detail the doings of many subsequent meetings of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Board called to consider the charges made against<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>, and the affairs of the Cemetery, at some<span class='line-break'> </span>of which <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> was present, though he after<span class='line-break'></span>wards, by the advice of counsel, declined attending<span class='line-break'> </span>and at which partial reports were made by the Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee on the investigation of his accounts; suffice it<span class='line-break'> </span>to say that at a meeting on the <date when='1863-09-03'>second of September</date>,<span class='line-break'> </span>after a most laborious, patient and careful Exam<span class='line-break'></span>ination of the books of the Superintendent and of bills<span class='line-break'> </span>receipted by <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>, procured from Proprietors, the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee by Mr <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Cha<sup>s</sup> G. Nazro</a> then Chairman,<span class='line-break'> </span>reported that there appeared a large deficit in the<span class='line-break'> </span>accounts of <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>, amounting to about Eighteen<span class='line-break'> </span>thousand dollars ($18,233.92) as far as ascer<span class='line-break'></span>tained, and that a fuller examinaton might<span class='line-break'> </span>reveal a still further deficit.</p>
<p>At their meeting a committee was appointed to<span class='line-break'> </span>commence a suit against <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>, and to pros<span class='line-break'></span>ecute the claim against him. _ Under the direction<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Committee a suit was immediately commenced,<span class='line-break'> </span>and soon after the Entry of the action, under an<span class='line-break'> </span>order of Court, the accounds were referred to an Au<span class='line-break'></span>ditor, who in <date when='1862-08'>August 1862</date> reported that after a<span class='line-break'> </span>very protracted hearing and a thorough investigation<span class='line-break'> </span>of the cases, and after arguments by counsel on both<span class='line-break'> </span>sides, and an adjustment of a large number of the items<span class='line-break'> </span>in controversy, there appeared to be due from the<span class='line-break'> </span>defendant; <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>, the sum of two thousand</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134727">
<h3><a name="page-1134727">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 334)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>334</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees March 7, 1864 _'> Trustees <date when='1864-03-07'>March 7, 1864</date> _</span></p>
<p>three hundred fifty Eight dollars, sixty three cents,<span class='line-break'> </span>($2,358.63) after allowing him the said sum of<span class='line-break'> </span>one thousand dollars ($1000) paid by him to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation in <date when='1861-04'>April 1861</date>, and two hundred thirty five<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars ($235) due him for salary _ while he<span class='line-break'> </span>at the same time took occasion to say that the<span class='line-break'> </span>result of this protracted hearing had left upon his<span class='line-break'> </span>mind no impressions unfavorable to the honesty<span class='line-break'> </span>and integrity of <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Comee on Mann suit _ continued _'>Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Mann suit _ continued _</span></p>
<p>At a meeting of the Trustees in <date when='1862-08'>August 1862</date>, <span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee were instructed not to appeal from<span class='line-break'> </span>the Auditor's award. _</p>
<p>At a meeting of the Trustees, <date when='1862-09-08'>September 8, 1862</date>,<span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee on the prosecution of the claim against<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> reported that they had been notified<span class='line-break'> </span>that the Defendant would appeal from the said<span class='line-break'> </span>award; and the case was accordingly set down for<span class='line-break'> </span>trial</p>
<p>For the further history of the case and the proceeding<span class='line-break'> </span>in Court, your Committee beg leave to refer to the report of<span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee on the prosecution of the suit made <date when='1864-01-05'>Jan<span class='line-break'></span>uary 25, 1864</date>, and the statement of the counsel for the<span class='line-break'> </span>Corporation appended thereto, a copy of which is hereby<span class='line-break'> </span>annexed. _ [see note p. 313 _ also same in print on file.]</p>
<p>Such being the state of the case at the annual meeting<span class='line-break'> </span>to the Proprietors on <date when='1864-02-01'>the first of February 1864</date>, a vote<span class='line-break'> </span>was passed requesting the incoming Board of<span class='line-break'> </span>Trustees to discontinue the suit against <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Mann</a>, and to return to him the one thousand dollars<span class='line-break'> </span>deposited by him with interest.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134728">
<h3><a name="page-1134728">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 335)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>335</p>
<p>This brief statement of the whole case from<span class='line-break'> </span>the beginning, which your Committee has considered<span class='line-break'> </span>it expedient to give must, they think, satisfy every<span class='line-break'> </span>candid mind that the action of the Trustees in the<span class='line-break'> </span>case has been a simple performance of their duty<span class='line-break'> </span>as the body entrusted with the "superintence and care<span class='line-break'> </span>of the property, expenditures, business, and prudential<span class='line-break'> </span>concerns of the Corporation"; and it is difficult to<span class='line-break'> </span>perceive how they could have done less, or at what<span class='line-break'> </span>stage of the proceedings they could have stopped. _</p>
<p>When a Committee appointed for the purpose<span class='line-break'> </span>and aided by competent accountants, after a careful<span class='line-break'> </span>Examination reported that there was an apparent<span class='line-break'> </span>balance of eighteen thousand dollars due from<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a>: when <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> himself deposited<span class='line-break'> </span>with <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> of the Corporation a sum of money &amp;<span class='line-break'> </span>meet any deficiences which might appear in<span class='line-break'> </span>his accounts, would not the Trustees have been<span class='line-break'> </span>liable to very grave and merited censure,<span class='line-break'> </span>had they neglected to take measures for the re<span class='line-break'></span>covery of the debt?</p>
<p>When the Auditor reported that there was due from<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> the sum of twenty three hundred fifty eight<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars ($2358) over and above the amount deposited by<span class='line-break'> </span>him as security and the salary and other moneys due<span class='line-break'> </span>him, and <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> refused to pay the same and<span class='line-break'> </span>claimed a trial by jury, would the Trustees have been<span class='line-break'> </span>justified in discontinuing the suit? And when, after<span class='line-break'> </span>a jury trial and a verdict for the defendant, that ver<span class='line-break'></span>dict was upon motion of the counsel for</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134729">
<h3><a name="page-1134729">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 336)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>336</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees _ March 7, 1864 _ Report of Comee on Mann suit _ continued _'> Trustees _ <date when='1864-03-07'>March 7, 1864</date> _ Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Mann suit _ continued _</span></p>
<p>the Corporation set aside as against the laws and<span class='line-break'> </span>the evidence, was there any reason for abandoning<span class='line-break'> </span>the claim?</p>
<p>Your Committee cannot therefore but feel that<span class='line-break'> </span>the action of the Proprietors has been such as is calcu<span class='line-break'></span>lated to do injustice towards the Trustees, and could<span class='line-break'> </span>only have resulted from a mistaken view of the real<span class='line-break'> </span>state of the case. _</p>
<p>At the same time your Committee, which<span class='line-break'> </span>they cannot admit the right of the Proprietors to direct<span class='line-break'> </span>or instruct the Trustees, consider the vote of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors as a sufficient authority to do that,<span class='line-break'> </span>which otherwise in the performance of their duty,<span class='line-break'> </span>and with a just regard to the rights and interests<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Corporation, they might hesitate to do, and<span class='line-break'> </span>they therefore recommend that the request of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Proprietors in their vote of <date when='1864-02-01'>the first of February</date><span class='line-break'> </span>be complied with, and that the suit against<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> be discontinued.</p>
<p>Your Committee are also of opinion that as<span class='line-break'> </span>the money deposited by <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> with <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasu<span class='line-break'></span>rer</a> was as security for any amount which might<span class='line-break'> </span>be found due from him, and not in payment of<span class='line-break'> </span>an admitted indebtedness, upon the discontinance of<span class='line-break'> </span>of the suit, <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> will be entitled to a return<span class='line-break'> </span>of the money, but they cannot recognize any claim<span class='line-break'> </span>for interest thereon. _</p>
<p>The voluntary deposit of the money in this case was<span class='line-break'> </span>similar to an attachment of property in a suit,<span class='line-break'> </span>which, though it may deprive the defendant</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134730">
<h3><a name="page-1134730">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 337)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>337</p>
<p>of the use of the property, does not, upon the<span class='line-break'> </span>discontinuance of the suit, or a verdict in his<span class='line-break'> </span>favor, entitle him to damages for such loss<span class='line-break'> </span>or deprivation.</p>
<p>They therefore recommend that  upon a<span class='line-break'> </span>discontinuance of the suit, the money now held<span class='line-break'> </span>by <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> on deposit from <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a><span class='line-break'> </span>be returned to him without interest.</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1864-03-07'>March 7, 1864</date></th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Edw<sup>d</sup> S. Rand</a></th> <th>}<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Edward Austin</a></td> <td>} Committee</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>James Cheever</a></td> <td>}</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>Copy of Receipt referred from page 332.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1861-04-05'>April 5, 1861</date>, Received from Mr <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Jon<sup>a</sup> Mann</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Superintendent of Mount Auburn Cemetery one thousand<span class='line-break'> </span>dollars deposited by him to meet any deficiencies or<span class='line-break'> </span>inaccuracies that on Examination of my (his) accounts<span class='line-break'> </span>with said Corporation may prove to Exist, which depos<span class='line-break'></span>it is in accordance with a vote of the Trustees passed<span class='line-break'> </span>this day.</p>
<p>$1000 (signed) <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'>Geo. W<sup>m</sup> Bond</a>, Treas<sup>r</sup></p>
<p>--------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Acceptance of Report _ Divison of Question _ yeas &amp; nays ordered _'>Acceptance of Report _ Divison of Question _ yeas &amp; nays ordered _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a> moved the acceptance of the report<span class='line-break'> </span>and that the same be recorded. _</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that when the question is taken it be by yeas and<span class='line-break'> </span>nays, _ and that the question of acceptance and adoption<span class='line-break'> </span>be divided.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134731">
<h3><a name="page-1134731">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 338)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>338</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ March 7. 1864 _ Motions adopted to discontinue Suit vs J. Mann _ and Refund $1000.'>Trustees _ <date when='1864-03-07'>March 7. 1864</date> _ Motions adopted to discontinue Suit vs <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>J. Mann</a> _ and Refund $1000.</span></p>
<p>After some discussion the question was first<span class='line-break'> </span>taken upon the acceptance of the report. _</p>
<p>The yeas and nays were called, and the vote upon the<span class='line-break'> </span>acceptance appeared to be unanimous. _</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> then moved the adoption of <span class='line-break'> </span>the following votes, as recommended in the report:</p>
<p>That the Committee on the prosecution of the claim <span class='line-break'> </span>against <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> be instructed to discontinue<span class='line-break'> </span>the suit against him: _</p>
<p>That <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> be directed to refund <span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/59191' title='Mann, Jonathan'>Mr Mann</a> the sum of ($1000) one thousand <span class='line-break'> </span>dollars deposited in his hands without interest.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Yeas &amp; Nays on same _'>Yeas &amp; Nays on same _</span></p>
<p>Upon these motions, the yeas and nays being <span class='line-break'> </span>called,</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a></th> <th>___</th> <th>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a><span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a></td> <td>and</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>Messrs</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a></td> <td>Messrs</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/65964' title='Livermore, George'>Livermore</a></td> <td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Norcross</a></td> <td>voted <u>nay</u>:</td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a></td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td>{ <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a></td> <td>voted <u>yea</u>.</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>And the motions were declared to be adopted.</p>
<p>Adjourned</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134732">
<h3><a name="page-1134732">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 339)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>339</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ April 4. 1863'>Trustees _ <date when='1863-04-04'>April 4. 1863</date></span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held on <date when='1864-04-04T10:00:00'>Monday, April 4, 1864, at 10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present, Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65964' title='Livermore, George'>Livermore</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Norcross</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>. _</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt.s suggestion for increase of Fees for Intermt referred to Com. on Intermts'><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->Supt.<sup>s</sup></a> suggestion for increase of Fees for Interm<sup>t</sup> referred to Com. on Interm<sup>ts</sup></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> read a note from <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'>Capt. Winsor</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>the Superintendent, suggesting that, as the price of <span class='line-break'> </span>labor and materials had considerably advanced, <span class='line-break'> </span>the fees for interment should be increased. _</p>
<p>Voted that the subject be referred to the Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee on Interments with full power. ~</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resignation of C. P. Curtis _ as Trustee _ placed on file _'>Resignation of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>C. P. Curtis</a> _ as Trustee _ placed on file _</span></p>
<p>A communication received from <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Charles P. Curtis Esq.</a><span class='line-break'> </span>resigning his seat at the board, which he has held <span class='line-break'> </span>for more than thirty years, was read. _</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a> moved that this communication be <span class='line-break'> </span>placed on file. _</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a> moved to amend <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read's</a> motion <span class='line-break'> </span>by substituting the word "record" instead of "file;"<span class='line-break'> </span>but the amendment was not adopted.</p>
<p>The original motion was adopted. _</p>
<p>The meeting was adjourned _</p>
<p>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134733">
<h3><a name="page-1134733">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 340)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>340</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ May 2. 1864.'>Trustees _ <date when='1864-05-02'>May 2. 1864</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held on <date when='1864-05-02T10:00:00'>Monday, May 2, 1864, at 10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65964' title='Livermore, George'>Livermore</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Norcross</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Team Gate to be opened near Engine House. '><a href='/pages/subjects/58792' title='East Gate'>Team Gate</a> to be opened near <a href='/pages/subjects/102074' title='Engine house'>Engine House</a>. </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> for the Committee on Grounds, in compliance<span class='line-break'> </span>with an application of <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superintendent</a> reported that the <span class='line-break'> </span>Committee would recommend that <a href='/pages/subjects/58792' title='East Gate'>a gate for teams</a> be <span class='line-break'> </span>opened on the easterly side of the Cemetery, opposite or near<span class='line-break'> </span>to the <a href='/pages/subjects/102074' title='Engine house'>Engine House</a>.</p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the question be referred to the Committee <span class='line-break'> </span>on Grounds with full power. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Superintendent&apos;s application for increase of Salary referred to Special Comee'><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->Superintendent's</a> application for increase of Salary referred to Special Com<sup>ee</sup></span></p>
<p>A written communication from <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superintendent</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>asking, in consequence of the increased price of living, an <span class='line-break'> </span>increase of his salary, was laid before the Board. _</p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that a Committee of three be appointed to investi<span class='line-break'></span>gate the subject of the Superintendent's communication, <span class='line-break'> </span>and report to this Board at the next meeting.</p>
<p>Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/65964' title='Livermore, George'>Livermore</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>were so appointed. _</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> for the Committee on Grounds stated that <span class='line-break'> </span>the granite facade for the intended <a href='/pages/subjects/66005' title='Catacomb Tombs'>catacombs</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/59984' title='Rosebay Avenue'>Rosebay Avenue</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>for which a contract had been made with the Granite</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134734">
<h3><a name="page-1134734">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 341)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>341</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Final Settlement of claim of Granite Railway Co. referred to '>Final Settlement of claim of <a href='/pages/subjects/66004' title='Granite Railway Company'>Granite Railway Co.</a> referred to </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/66004' title='Granite Railway Company'><!--granite-->Railway Company</a> had proved a failure _ that the<span class='line-break'> </span>stains appeared to be inerradicable <small>[sic - ineradicable]</small> _ that the contract <span class='line-break'> </span>had not been performed, although ample opportunity <span class='line-break'> </span>had been given them for experiments to remove the stains _<span class='line-break'> </span>and the Committee would recommend that the <span class='line-break'> </span>subject should be finally disposed of without further <span class='line-break'> </span>delay. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Special Comee with authority to remove façade of Catacombs-'>Special Com<sup>ee</sup> with authority to remove façade of <a href='/pages/subjects/66005' title='Catacomb Tombs'>Catacombs</a>-</span></p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>, it was</p>
<p>Voted, that the façade of the <a href='/pages/subjects/66005' title='Catacomb Tombs'>catacombs</a> furnished <span class='line-break'> </span>by the <a href='/pages/subjects/66004' title='Granite Railway Company'>Granite Railway Company</a> not being <span class='line-break'> </span>conformable to the contract,</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> with Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Norcross</a> <span class='line-break'> </span>be a Committee with full powers to remove the <span class='line-break'> </span>same, and to make such settlement with the con<span class='line-break'></span>tractors as in their judgment may seem just. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resolution adopted requesting Mr Curtis to withdraw resignation as Trustee _'>Resolution adopted requesting <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> to withdraw resignation as Trustee _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a> said that among the matters <span class='line-break'> </span>brought before the Board at its last meeting (at<span class='line-break'> </span>which he was unable to be present,) was one which <span class='line-break'> </span>he sincerely regretted _ the resignation tendered <span class='line-break'> </span>by <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> as a member of this Board _<span class='line-break'> </span>He had hoped that his long and valuable services<span class='line-break'> </span>would be given to the Corporation still longer; and <span class='line-break'> </span>that he would be induced to withdraw his resignation.</p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>, it was</p>
<p>Voted <u>unanimously</u>, that <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a> be <span class='line-break'> </span>requested to withdraw his letter of resignation, and con<span class='line-break'></span>tinue to serve at this Board. ~</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134735">
<h3><a name="page-1134735">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 342)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>342</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Recommendn of Com. on Intermts to increase fees for Interments &amp;c adopted _'>Recommend<sup>n</sup> of Com. on Interm<sup>ts</sup> to increase fees for Interments &amp;c adopted _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a> for the Committee on Interments <span class='line-break'> </span>reported upon the subject referred to that Com<span class='line-break'></span>mittee at the last meeting, as follows: _</p>
<p>"The Committee on Regulations and Records of Inter<span class='line-break'></span>ments, to which was referred at the last meeting the question <span class='line-break'> </span>of expediency of increasing the charges for interment at <span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery, would report _ recommending the following <span class='line-break'> </span>rates:</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>For opening grave and recording</th> <th>___</th> <th>5.00 _<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>" [For opening] " [grave and] " [recording] child under 10  years</td> <td>___</td> <td>3.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [For] " [opening]  and closing tomb, at discretion of Sup<sup>n</sup></td> <td>3.00</td> <td>- 5.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [For] deposit in <a href='/pages/subjects/57656' title='Receiving Tomb'>Receiving Tomb</a> $14 of which will be refunded upon removal of the body to any part of the Cemetery within four months.</td> <td>___</td> <td>20.00</td> </tr> <tr><td>" [For] building a brick grave</td> <td>___</td> <td>20.00</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>For the Committee</th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Uriel Crocker</a>, Chairman</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>Voted that the report be accepted and adopted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Secretary authorized to notify certain proprietors of condition of ^their neglected lots _'>Secretary authorized to notify certain proprietors of condition of ^<sup>their</sup> neglected lots _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> stated that he had received from <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superintendent</a>, in compliance with the vote of last Novem<span class='line-break'></span>ber a list of lots which appear to have been neglected <span class='line-break'> </span>by the Proprietors, and which need repairs.</p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Mr Norcross</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> be authorized to notify said <span class='line-break'> </span>proprietors of the condition of these lots, and request them <span class='line-break'> </span>to cause them to be put in a proper state of repair. _<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />

Stiles</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/53203' title='Cambridge, MA'>Cambridge</a>, father in law of <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/103401' title='Thompson, Levi P.'>Levi P.
