<p>-------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ June 6. 1864'>Trustees _ <date when='1864-06-06'>June 6. 1864</date></span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>was held on <date when='1864-06-06T10:00:00'>Monday June 6<sup>th</sup> 1864, at 10<span class='line-break'> </span>o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65964' title='Livermore, George'>Livermore</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Norcross</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>. _</p>
<p>The records of the last meeting were read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sec.y. under direction of Comee to notify Granite R. Co to remove the stones of the façade _'><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->Sec.y</a>. under direction of Com<sup>ee</sup> to notify<a href='/pages/subjects/66004' title='Granite Railway Company'> Granite R. Co</a> to remove the stones of the façade _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Mr Rand</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> be instructed, under the <span class='line-break'> </span>direction of the Committee appointed at the last meeting <span class='line-break'> </span>in relation to the removal of the façade of the <a href='/pages/subjects/66005' title='Catacomb Tombs'>Catacombs</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>to notify <a href='/pages/subjects/60720' title='Hollis, Thomas'>Thomas Hollis</a>, President of the <a href='/pages/subjects/66004' title='Granite Railway Company'>Granite Railway <span class='line-break'> </span>Company</a>, to remove the stones of the façade, the same <span class='line-break'> </span>not being conformable to the contract. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='[Increase in price of lots _]'>[Increase in price of lots _]</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Dr. Bigelow</a> suggested that the universal increase <span class='line-break'> </span>of prices including the cost of labor and materials <span class='line-break'> </span>appeared to him to require an increase of the price <span class='line-break'> </span>of land. _</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134739">
<h3><a name="page-1134739">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 346)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>346</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Increase in price of lots _'>Increase in price of lots _</span></p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>, it was</p>
<p>Voted that, until otherwise ordered, no upland <span class='line-break'> </span>between <a href='/pages/subjects/58084' title='Yew Avenue'>Yew<!--Ave--></a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/58791' title='Central Avenue'>Central Avenues</a> be sold for less<span class='line-break'> </span>than two dollars ($2) per square foot; and no upland <span class='line-break'> </span>in other parts of the Old Cemetery be sold for less than <span class='line-break'> </span>one dollar ($1) per square foot, except by approval of <span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee on Lots.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Communications from Mr C P Curtis respecting his resignation to be laid before next Annual Meeting of Proprs _'>Communications from <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr C P Curtis</a> respecting his resignation to be laid before next Annual Meeting of Prop<sup>rs</sup> _</span></p>
<p>A written communication from <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr C. P. Curtis</a> in<span class='line-break'> </span>reply to the request contained in the vote adopted at<span class='line-break'> </span>the last meeting that he would withdraw his resignation<span class='line-break'> </span>as a member of this Board, was read.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>'s communication of the <span class='line-break'> </span><date when='1864-06-04'>4<sup>th</sup> of June</date> be placed on file and that this ^<sup>&amp;</sup> and his preceding <span class='line-break'> </span>communication of <date when='1864-04-04'>April 4<sup>th</sup></date>, on the same subject, be laid<span class='line-break'> </span>before the Proprietors at their next annual meeting.</p>
<p>The meeting was then adjourned.</p>
<p>Attest  <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J Coolidge</a>, Secy.</p>
<p>----------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title=' Trustees _ July 4 1864 _ no Meeting.'> Trustees _ <date when='1864-07-04'>July 4 1864</date> _ no Meeting.</span></p>
<p><date when='1864-07-04'>Monday, July 4, 1864</date></p>
<p>The regular meeting, by the advice of <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span>was omitted this day on account of the National <span class='line-break'> </span>Holiday.</p>
<p>Attest  <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Sec.y.</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134740">
<h3><a name="page-1134740">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 347)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>347</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ August, 1st 1864 _'>Trustees _ <date when='1864-08-01'>August, 1<sup>st</sup> 1864</date> _</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees <span class='line-break'> </span>was held on <date when='1864-08-01T10:00:00'>Monday August 1<sup>st</sup> 1864 at <span class='line-break'> </span>10 o'clock a.m. </date>_</p>
<p>There were present Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Jacob-->Bigelow</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>. _</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read and <span class='line-break'> </span>approved. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Settlt with the Granite Railway Co., Report of Progress _'>Settl<sup>t</sup> with the <a href='/pages/subjects/66004' title='Granite Railway Company'>Granite Railway Co.</a>, Report of Progress _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> informally stated that the Com<sup>ee</sup><span class='line-break'> </span>to settle with the <a href='/pages/subjects/66004' title='Granite Railway Company'>Granite Railway Company</a> had <span class='line-break'> </span>engaged the services of three competent experts to <span class='line-break'> </span>examine the façade of the <a href='/pages/subjects/66005' title='Catacomb Tombs'>Catacomb tomb</a> and <span class='line-break'> </span>report thereon. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Comee in favor of in-crease of salary of Supt rejected _'>Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> in favor of in-crease of salary of Sup<sup>t</sup> rejected _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a> for the Committee to whom was referred<span class='line-break'> </span>the application of <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superintendent</a> for an increase <span class='line-break'> </span>of his salary, reported recommending that his salary be <span class='line-break'> </span>increased to <u>eighteen hundred dollars</u> per annum,<span class='line-break'> </span>with the same perquisites he now has, to commence<span class='line-break'> </span>at the beginning of the present quarter.</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a> moved the adoption of the Report: but the <span class='line-break'> </span>motion failed, only four votes being cast in its favor.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Gate-Keeper&apos;s Application for increase of salary _ referred to Comee'>Gate-Keeper's Application for increase of salary _ referred to Com<sup>ee</sup></span></p>
<p>A memorial was received from <a href='/pages/subjects/63799' title='Derby, James, Jr.'>James Derby</a>, Gate<span class='line-break'></span>Keeper, asking for an increase in his salary: and his <span class='line-break'> </span>application was referred to the same Committee _ Messrs<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/65964' title='Livermore, George'>Livermore</a>. _</p>
<p>Adjourned.  Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134741">
<h3><a name="page-1134741">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 348)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>348</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees ~ Sept. 5. 1864.'>Trustees ~ <date when='1864-09-05'>Sept. 5. 1864</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held on <date when='1864-09-05T10:00:00'>Monday, September 5, 1864, at 10<span class='line-break'> </span>o'clock a.m.</date> _</p>
<p>There were present, <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> and Messrs<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65964' title='Livermore, George'>Livermore</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Norcross</a>. ~ 8</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Grant of $200, in addn to salary of Supt for this year _'>Grant of $200, in add<sup>n</sup> to salary of Sup<sup>t</sup> for this year _</span></p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Mr Crocker</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that a grant of two hundred dollars ($200)<span class='line-break'> </span>be made in addition to the regular salary of <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Super<span class='line-break'></span>intendent</a> for the present year. ~</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Grant of $50. in addn to Gatekeeper&apos;s salary for this year _'>Grant of $50. in add<sup>n</sup> to Gatekeeper's salary for this year _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>, for the Committee to which the request of <a href='/pages/subjects/63799' title='Derby, James, Jr.'><!--Derby-->the<span class='line-break'> </span>Gatekeeper</a> for increase of salary was referred, reported<span class='line-break'> </span>verbally recommending that his salary for the present<span class='line-break'> </span>year be increased to six hundred dollars ($600.) _</p>
<p>Without action upon the report,</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Mr Norcross</a>,</p>
<p>Voted, that a grant of fifty dollars be made<span class='line-break'> </span>in addition to the Gatekeeper's salary for the present year. ~</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Fee for making and recording deeds &amp; transfers increased to $2.'>Fee for making and recording deeds &amp; transfers increased to $2.</span></p>
<p>A written application by <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> for an increase of<span class='line-break'> </span>the fees for making and recording deeds and transfers was presented.</p>
<p>Upon motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Mr Norcross</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the fee for making and recording deeds or trans<span class='line-break'></span>fers be two dollars each, instead of one dollar heretofore<span class='line-break'> </span>charged. _</p>
<p>Adjourned, Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> Secretary.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134742">
<h3><a name="page-1134742">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 349)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>349</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Octo. 3. 1864.'>Trustees _ <date when='1864-10-03'>Octo. 3. 1864</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held on <date when='1864-10-03T10:00:00'>Monday, October 3. 1864, at 10 o'clock AM</date>.</p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, and Messrs<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65964' title='Livermore, George'>Livermore</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, and<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Norcross</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representation of Lots'>Representation of Lots</span></p>
<p>In the following cases applications were received<span class='line-break'> </span>for the representation of lots of deceased proprietors,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the persons nominated were severally designa<span class='line-break'></span>ted to represent the lots: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='27'><a href='/pages/subjects/103405' title='Lot 27'><!--Lot-->27</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/103406' title='Holmes, Oliver Wendell'>Oliver Wendell Holmes</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, son of <a href='/pages/subjects/103407' title='Holmes, Sarah'>Sarah<span class='line-break'> </span>Holmes</a>, deceased, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/103405' title='Lot 27'>lot numbered 27</a>, to represent<span class='line-break'> </span>said lot: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='106'><a href='/pages/subjects/103408' title='Lot 106'><!--Lot-->106</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/103409' title='Allen, Jeremiah'>Jeremiah Allen</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/62295' title='Newton, MA'>Newton</a>, son of <a href='/pages/subjects/58478' title='Allen, Andrew J.'>Andrew J. Allen</a>, deceased,<span class='line-break'> </span>late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/103408' title='Lot 106'>lot numbered 106</a>, to represent said lot:</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='392'><a href='/pages/subjects/103410' title='Lot 392'><!--Lot-->392</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/103411' title='Scudder, Samuel H.'>Samuel H. Scudder</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, a son of <a href='/pages/subjects/58353' title='Scudder, Charles'>Charles Scudder</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/103410' title='Lot 392'>lot numbered 392</a>, to represent<span class='line-break'> </span>said lot: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='547'><a href='/pages/subjects/103412' title='Lot 547'><!--Lot-->547</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/103413' title='Rogers, Sarah C. H.'>Mrs Sarah C. H. Rogers</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, widow of <a href='/pages/subjects/103414' title='Rogers, George'>George Rogers</a><span class='line-break'> </span>deceased, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/103412' title='Lot 547'>lot numbered 547</a> to represent said lot: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='659'><a href='/pages/subjects/71333' title='Lot 659'><!--Lot-->659</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/81732' title='Fairbanks, Nancy'>Nancy Fairbanks</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, widow of <a href='/pages/subjects/71334' title='Fairbanks, Otis'>Otis Fairbanks</a>, deceased,<span class='line-break'> </span>late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/71333' title='Lot 659'>lot numbered 659</a>, to represent said lot: _</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134743">
<h3><a name="page-1134743">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 350)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>350</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Octo. 3. 1864. continued _'>Trustees <date when='1864-10-03'>Octo. 3. 1864</date>. continued _</span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1089'><a href='/pages/subjects/103418' title='Lot 1089'><!--Lot-->1089</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/103419' title='Dodd, Ann'>Mrs Ann Dodd</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, widow of <a href='/pages/subjects/103420' title='Dodd, James'>James Dodd</a>, de<span class='line-break'></span>ceased, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/103418' title='Lot 1089'>lot numbered 1089</a>, to represent<span class='line-break'> </span>said lot: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1448'><a href='/pages/subjects/103421' title='Lot 1448'><!--Lot-->1448</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/103422' title='Snow, Charlotte W.'>Mrs Charlotte W. Snow</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, widow of <a href='/pages/subjects/103423' title='Snow, Daniel F.'>Daniel<span class='line-break'> </span>F. Snow</a>, deceased, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/103421' title='Lot 1448'>lot numbered 1448</a>, to<span class='line-break'> </span>represent said lot: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2369'><a href='/pages/subjects/103424' title='Lot 2369'><!--Lot-->2369</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/103425' title='Davenport, Mary S.'>Mrs Mary S. Davenport</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/62295' title='Newton, MA'>Newton</a>, widow of <a href='/pages/subjects/103426' title='Davenport, Samuel D.'>Sam<sup>l</sup> D. Dav<span class='line-break'></span>enport</a>, deceased, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/103424' title='Lot 2369'>lot numbered 2369</a>, to repre<span class='line-break'></span>sent said lot: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='2401'><a href='/pages/subjects/103427' title='Lot 2401'><!--Lot-->2401</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/103428' title='Smith, Samuel'>Samuel Smith</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, son in law of <a href='/pages/subjects/103429' title='Aspinwall, Samuel'>Samuel Aspin<span class='line-break'></span>wall</a>, deceased, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/103427' title='Lot 2401'>lot numbered 2401</a>, to<span class='line-break'> </span>represent said lot: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='3412'><a href='/pages/subjects/103430' title='Lot 3412'><!--Lot-->3412</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/107891' title='Baxter, Ann Maria'>Ann Maria Baxter</a>, of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, daughter of <a href='/pages/subjects/107328' title='Baxter, Nancy'>Nancy Baxter</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>deceased late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/103430' title='Lot 3412'>lot numbered 3412</a>, to repre<span class='line-break'></span>sent said lot.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Petition for compensation for Derrick _'>Petition for compensation for Derrick _</span></p>
<p>A petition was presented from <a href='/pages/subjects/54384' title='Bayley, Thomas J.'>Thomas J. Bay<span class='line-break'></span>ley</a> asking payment for a derrick which had been<span class='line-break'> </span>left in Mount Auburn several years since, and<span class='line-break'> </span>which he claimed had been used and worn<span class='line-break'> </span>out in the service of the Corporation, _</p>
<p>And the same was referred to<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Mr Cheever</a> to inquire and report thereon.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Question [whether sale should be completed]'>Question [whether sale should be completed]</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> stated that a deed had been ordered<span class='line-break'> </span>by <a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->the Treasurer</a> for lot numbered <a href='/pages/subjects/67170' title='Lot 3484'>3484</a> on <a href='/pages/subjects/59222' title='Larch Avenue'>Larch Avenue</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134744">
<h3><a name="page-1134744">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 351)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>351</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='[Question] whether sale should be completed'>[Question] whether sale should be completed</span></p>
<p>containing 1046 square feet, to <a href='/pages/subjects/103497' title='Prescott, William A.'>W<sup>m</sup> A. Prescott</a>, of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, which was reported on the _____ of ____<span class='line-break'> </span>last with the approval of the Committee on Lots to be sold<span class='line-break'> </span>to said Prescott at sixty-seven cents per foot _<span class='line-break'> </span>that said Prescott did not comply with the rule<span class='line-break'> </span>requiring payment within five days, and neglected<span class='line-break'> </span>to pay for said lot until the <date when='1864-09-23'>23<sup>d</sup> day of September</date>,<span class='line-break'> </span>previous to which time the price of land in the<span class='line-break'> </span>vicinity was increased by vote of their Board<span class='line-break'> </span>to ($1.25) one dollar and twenty five cents per square<span class='line-break'> </span>foot: ~</p>
<p>And he raised the question whether said Pres<span class='line-break'></span>cott was entitled to a deed at the price reported.</p>
<p>Voted that the question be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots with full power.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Paper on subject of perpetual repair of lots referred to Com. on Lots _'>Paper on subject of perpetual repair of lots referred to Com. on Lots _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Mr Norcross</a> stated that he had received<span class='line-break'> </span>from <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> a paper in the form of a<span class='line-break'> </span>proposed address to proprietors on the subject of the<span class='line-break'> </span>perpetual repair of their lots and matters inci<span class='line-break'></span>dentally connected therewith: _ and he proposed<span class='line-break'> </span>its reference to the Committee on Lots.</p>
<p>Voted that the subject and the com<span class='line-break'></span>munication be referred to the Committe on<span class='line-break'> </span>Lots, to report thereon. _</p>
<p>Adjourned<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134745">
<h3><a name="page-1134745">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 352)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>352</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Nov. 7. 1864'>Trustees _ <date when='1864-11-07'>Nov. 7. 1864</date></span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees<span class='line-break'> </span>was held on <date when='1864-11-07T10:00:00'>Monday November 7<sup>th</sup> 1864<span class='line-break'> </span>at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> ~</p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65964' title='Livermore, George'>Livermore</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Norcross</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>. _</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Mr Norcross</a> for the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots stated that<span class='line-break'> </span>the Committee were not ready to report on the matters<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to them last month.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Claim of Thos. J. Bayley.'>Claim of <a href='/pages/subjects/54384' title='Bayley, Thomas J.'>Thos. J. Bayley</a>.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Mr Cheever</a> to whom the claim of <a href='/pages/subjects/54384' title='Bayley, Thomas J.'>Tho<sup>s</sup> J. Bayley</a><span class='line-break'> </span>was referred at the last meeting reported in part, that<span class='line-break'> </span>he could not find, from inquiry at the Cemetery, that<span class='line-break'> </span>Mr Bayley had any valid claim for damages.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Applicn for land at reduced rate _ referred to Com. on Lots _'>Applic<sup>n</sup> for land at reduced rate _ referred to Com. on Lots _</span></p>
<p>An application was presented from <a href='/pages/subjects/107311' title='Cullis, Charles'>Dr. Charles Cullis</a><span class='line-break'> </span>for a suitable lot of land in the Cemetery, at a reduced<span class='line-break'> </span>price, for the use of the "Home for Indigent and Incurable<span class='line-break'> </span>Consumptions." _</p>
<p>Voted that the same be referred to the Com<span class='line-break'></span>mitee on Lots to report thereon.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt. authorized to employ laborers in cutting trees during winter _'>Supt. authorized to employ laborers in cutting trees during winter _</span></p>
<p>On motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superintendent</a> be instructed to engage from<span class='line-break'> </span>six to twelve suitable laborers, to be employed through the winter, if<span class='line-break'> </span>necessary, in removing superfluous trees from the Cemetery, _<span class='line-break'> </span>the work to be done with such caution as not to occasion<span class='line-break'> </span>damage to or in proprietors' lots, and under the dir-</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134746">
<h3><a name="page-1134746">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 353)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>353</p>
<p>ection of the Committee on Grounds, as to the par<span class='line-break'></span>ticular trees to be removed. _</p>
<p>Adjourned, <span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y</p>
<p>------------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees - Decr 5. 1864.'>Trustees - <date when='1864-12-05'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 5. 1864</date>.</span></p>
<p>The regular monthy meeting of the Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held on <date when='1864-12-05T10:00:00'>Monday December 5<sup>th</sup> 1864, 10 O'clock a.m. </date></p>
<p>There wre present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> and Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/65964' title='Livermore, George'>Livermore</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Norcross</a>, and <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report upon cutting of trees _'>Report upon cutting of trees _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> for the Committee on Grounds<span class='line-break'> </span>submitted a Report of which the following is a copy: _</p>
<p>"That by statements of <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Super<span class='line-break'></span>intendent</a> has been furnished with a copy of the <span class='line-break'> </span>vote passed relative to removing trees in the Ceme<span class='line-break'></span>tery, and also that the Committee have furnished<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superintendent</a> with written instructions as <span class='line-break'> </span>to the mode of performing this duty."</p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'>Jacob Bigelow</a>, Chairman</p>
<p>The report was accepted. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Application for land at reduced price rejected _'>Application for land at reduced price rejected _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Mr Norcross</a> for the Committee on Lots, to whom <span class='line-break'> </span>was referred the application of <a href='/pages/subjects/107311' title='Cullis, Charles'>Dr Cha<sup>s</sup> Cullis</a>, for a suitable <span class='line-break'> </span>lot of land in the Cemetery, at a reduced price for <span class='line-break'> </span>the use of the "Home for Indigent and Incurable Consumptives"</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134747">
<h3><a name="page-1134747">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 354)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>354</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees Decr 5, 1864.'>Trustees <date when='1864-12-05'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 5, 1864</date>.</span></p>
<p>reported: _</p>
<p>"That" for reasons left for late in their report,<span class='line-break'> </span>"the Committee would recommend that the applicant<span class='line-break'> </span>have leave to withold." _</p>
<p>The report was to be accepted.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Comee on Lots on the Repair Fund _'>Report of Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots on the Repair Fund _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Mr Norcross</a> for the Committee on Lots further sub<span class='line-break'></span>mitted the following report: _</p>
<p>"The Committee on Lots to whom was referred<span class='line-break'> </span>the communication of <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a>, respecting the Repair,<span class='line-break'> </span>Guarantee and proposed Indigent Fund, ask leave to<span class='line-break'> </span>Report that from the small number of proprietors who<span class='line-break'> </span>have thus far avoided themselves of the opportunity to provide<span class='line-break'> </span>for the perpetual repair of their lots, your Committee are<span class='line-break'> </span>of opinion that the Proprietors generally are not aware<span class='line-break'> </span>of the provision in the ByLaws relating to the Guarantee<span class='line-break'> </span>Fund, and would therefore suggest to the Trustees that<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> be authorized, by printed notice – to call<span class='line-break'> </span>their attention to it.</p>
<p>As regards the proposed Indigent Fund your<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee are of opinon that it is inexpedient for<span class='line-break'> </span>the Trustees to move in the matter at this time." _</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th>Resp.y</th> <th>} Committee<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Edward Austin</a></td> <td>} on </td> </tr> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Otis Norcross</a></td> <td>} Lots "</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a> <date when='1864-11-30'>Nov 30, 1864</date></p>
<p>The report was accepted. _</p>
<p>The following vote was then recommended by the Committee,<span class='line-break'> </span>and was adopted. ~~</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134748">
<h3><a name="page-1134748">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 355)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>355</p>
<p><b>Sec.y, under the direction of the Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots authorized to send circular to Propr<sup>s</sup> on subj. "Repair Fund" _</b></p>
<p>"That <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a>, under the direction of the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots, be authorized to send a<span class='line-break'> </span>printed circular to every proprietor of a lot in<span class='line-break'> </span>the Cemetery, in accordance with the previous vote."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt instructed to place numbers &amp; bounds to lots without them _'>Sup<sup>t</sup> instructed to place numbers &amp; bounds to lots without them _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Mr Norcross</a> also submitted a list of<span class='line-break'> </span>lots without proper boundary posts, furnished by<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superintendent</a> at the request of the Committee<span class='line-break'> </span>on Lots; upon which it was</p>
<p>"Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superintendent</a> be instruc<span class='line-break'></span>ted to place the numbers and bounds to such<span class='line-break'> </span>lots as have been neglected, at the expense of<span class='line-break'> </span>the proprietors, notice having previously been<span class='line-break'> </span>given in accordance with the rules of this Board."</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Supt directed before 1st Monday in April each year to report to Trustees a list of all lots out of repair _'>Sup<sup>t</sup> directed before 1<sup>st</sup> Monday in April each year to report to Trustees a list of all lots out of repair _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Mr Norcross</a> also submitted a list of<span class='line-break'> </span>lots out of repair, furnished by <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superintendent</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>at the request of the Committee on Lots:</p>
<p>Upon which it was</p>
<p>"Voted that the Superintendent be required on<span class='line-break'> </span>or before the first Monday in April, Each year,<span class='line-break'> </span>to report to the Trustees a list of all lots which<span class='line-break'> </span>may be so much out of repair as to detract from<span class='line-break'> </span>the general good appearance of the Cemetery, upon<span class='line-break'> </span>which the proprietors of said lots, or other persons<span class='line-break'> </span>interested therein, shall be notified by the Secretary<span class='line-break'> </span>of their condition, and be earnestly requested to put<span class='line-break'> </span>them in repair."</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134749">
<h3><a name="page-1134749">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 356)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>356</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Decr 5, 1864'>Trustees _ <date when='1864-12-05'>Dec<sup>r</sup> 5, 1864</date></span></p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Reconveyance of Lots 903, 904 &amp; 1309 to Corpn and new deeds to the Messrs Lawrence authorized _'>Reconveyance of <a href='/pages/subjects/72273' title='Lot 903'>Lots 903</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62301' title='Lot 904'><!--Lot-->904</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/62683' title='Lot 1309'><!--Lot-->1309</a> to Corp<sup>n</sup> and new deeds to the Messrs Lawrence authorized _</span></p>
<p>An application from <a href='/pages/subjects/104060' title='Lawrence, William R. (1812-1885)'>Dr. W<sup>m</sup> R Lawrence</a> received<span class='line-break'> </span>by the Committee on Lots, for a relocating by the Corporation<span class='line-break'> </span>of <a href='/pages/subjects/72273' title='Lot 903'>lot numbered 903</a>, containing 600 square feet, belonging<span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/64302' title='Lawrence, James'>Mr James Lawrence</a>, situated in the northeasterly corner<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Lawrence enclosure on <a href='/pages/subjects/61148' title='Chapel Avenue'>Chapel Avenue</a>, and of <a href='/pages/subjects/62301' title='Lot 904'>lots num<span class='line-break'></span>bered 904</a> belonging to <a href='/pages/subjects/60399' title='Lawrence, Amos Adams'>Mr Amos A. Lawrence</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/62683' title='Lot 1309'><!--Lot-->1309</a><span class='line-break'> </span>belonging to <a href='/pages/subjects/104060' title='Lawrence, William R. (1812-1885)'>Dr Lawrence</a>, each containing 300 square feet,<span class='line-break'> </span>and situated in the northwesterly corner of said enclosure,<span class='line-break'> </span>so that said not <a href='/pages/subjects/72273' title='Lot 903'>No. 903</a> may be located in the northwest<span class='line-break'> </span>erly corner, and <a href='/pages/subjects/62301' title='Lot 904'>lots numbered 904</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/62683' title='Lot 1309'><!--Lot-->1309</a> in the north<span class='line-break'></span>easterly corner of said enclosures - was read and<span class='line-break'> </span>referred to the Committee on Lots with full power. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Application of Wm H. Ladd for reconveyce of lot 2090 and two new lots from the land refused _'>Application of <a href='/pages/subjects/107320' title='Ladd, William H.'>W<sup>m</sup> H. Ladd</a> for reconvey<sup>ce</sup> of <a href='/pages/subjects/107321' title='Lot 2090'>lot 2090</a> and two new lots from the land refused _</span></p>
<p>An application was received from <a href='/pages/subjects/107320' title='Ladd, William H.'>William H. Ladd</a><span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/107321' title='Lot 2090'>lot numbered 2090</a>, containing 300 square<span class='line-break'> </span>feet, one half of which is in fact owned by <a href='/pages/subjects/107322' title='Pearson, Martha J. M.'>Mrs Martha<span class='line-break'> </span>J.M. Pearson</a>, for leave to reconvey the same to the Cor<span class='line-break'></span>poration in order that two deeds of land containing<span class='line-break'> </span>150 feet each might be conveyed to said Ladd<span class='line-break'> </span>and Mrs Pearson to hold in severally _<span class='line-break'> </span>was received and considered, and it was</p>
<p>Voted that the petitioners have leave to with<span class='line-break'></span>draw.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Sec.y directed to notify Supt of the rule requiring $17 for a Grave in Public Lots.'>Sec.y directed to notify Sup<sup>t</sup> of the rule requiring $17 for a Grave in <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>Public Lots</a>.</span></p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> be directed to give notice<span class='line-break'> </span>to <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superintendent</a> that, the fee for interments having<span class='line-break'> </span>been increased from three to five dollars, the<span class='line-break'> </span>charge for a grave in either of the <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>Public Lots</a>, as<span class='line-break'> </span>required by the By law, Art. 18, is seventeen dollars<span class='line-break'> </span>for the body of any person Except a child under ten</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134750">
<h3><a name="page-1134750">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 357)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>357</p>
<p>years of age, for which the charge is fifteen dollars,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that he be authorized to have the blanks<span class='line-break'> </span>corrected in accordance with these rates.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Respecting the exclusion of dilinqent [sic] Undertakers _'>Respecting the exclusion of dilinqent [sic] Undertakers _</span></p>
<p>Voted _ that <a href='/pages/subjects/55278' title='Winsor, Daniel L., Capt.'><!--Winsor-->the Superintendent</a>, under the direc<span class='line-break'></span>tion of the Committee on Interments be directed<span class='line-break'> </span>to exclude from the privileges of the Cemetery any<span class='line-break'> </span>Undertaker, in his official capacity; who shall<span class='line-break'> </span>have been reported as dilinquent in complying with<span class='line-break'> </span>the regulations relating to interments.</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Expediency of having printed certif. of Graves in Public Lots referred to Comee on Lots _'>Expediency of having printed certif. of Graves in <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>Public Lots</a> referred to Com<sup>ee</sup> on Lots _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->The Secretary</a> suggested to the Board the<span class='line-break'> </span>expediency of a having a certificate prepared in<span class='line-break'> </span>due form to be given to every purchaser of a<span class='line-break'> </span>grave in either of the <a href='/pages/subjects/61319' title='Public Lot'>Public Lots</a>, and sub<span class='line-break'></span>mitted a form which he had prepared for that<span class='line-break'> </span>purpose; _ upon which it was</p>
<p>Voted that the same be referred to the<span class='line-break'> </span>Committee on Lots, with full power. ~</p>
<p>Adjourned<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a><span class='line-break'> </span>Secretary</p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134751">
<h3><a name="page-1134751">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 358)</a></h3>

<p>358</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Jan.y 9. 1865'>Trustees _<date when='1865-01-09'> Jan.y 9. 1865</date></span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees was <span class='line-break'> </span>held on <date when='1865-01-09T10:00:00'>Monday, January 9<sup>th</sup> 1865, at 10 o'clock<span class='line-break'> </span>a.m.</date> (having been postponed from the 2<sup>d</sup> inst. by <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the<span class='line-break'> </span>President</a>, at the request of a majority of the Trustees.)</p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a> and Messrs<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65964' title='Livermore, George'>Livermore</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Norcross</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>. ~</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting was read. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representation of Lots of Decd Propers'>Representation of Lots of Dec<sup>d</sup> Prop<sup>ers</sup></span></p>
<p>In the following cases applications were received <span class='line-break'> </span>for the representation of lots of deceased proprietors,<span class='line-break'> </span>and the persons nominated were severally designated<span class='line-break'> </span>to represent the lots. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='231'><a href='/pages/subjects/107332' title='Lot 231'><!--Lot-->231</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/107333' title='Avery, John'>John Avery</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/71564' title='Lowell, MA'>Lowell</a>, only son of <a href='/pages/subjects/107333' title='Avery, John'>John Avery</a>, late<span class='line-break'> </span>proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/107332' title='Lot 231'>lot numbered 231</a> to represent said lot: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='302'><a href='/pages/subjects/107334' title='Lot 302'><!--Lot-->302</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/107335' title='Kendall, Elizabeth B.'>Elizabeth B. Kendall</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/54284' title='Charlestown, MA'>Charlestown</a>, widow and guardian of<span class='line-break'> </span>the minor children of <a href='/pages/subjects/107336' title='Kendall, Isaac'>Isaac Kendall</a> late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/107334' title='Lot 302'>lot<span class='line-break'> </span>numbered 302</a> to represent said lot: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1056'><a href='/pages/subjects/107337' title='Lot 1056'><!--Lot-->1056</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/67129' title='Savell, Charles E.'>Charles E. Savell</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/54347' title='Roxbury, MA'>Roxbury</a>, son of <a href='/pages/subjects/107338' title='Savell, John A.'>John A. Savell</a><span class='line-break'> </span>late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/107337' title='Lot 1056'>lot numbered 1056</a> to represent said lot: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1536'><a href='/pages/subjects/107339' title='Lot 1536'><!--Lot-->1536</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/107340' title='Farmer, Jesse'>Jesse Farmer</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, oldest son of <a href='/pages/subjects/107341' title='Farmer, Margaret'>Margaret Farmer</a><span class='line-break'> </span>late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/107339' title='Lot 1536'>lot numbered 1536</a> to represent said lot: _</p>

<p>359</p>

<p><a href='/pages/subjects/107346' title='Gould, Lucy S.'>Lucy S. Gould</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, widow of <a href='/pages/subjects/107347' title='Gould, Jacob S.'>Jacob<span class='line-break'> </span>S. Gould</a> late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/97359' title='Lot 1769'>lot numbered 1769</a> to represent<span class='line-break'> </span>said lot: _</p>

<p><a href='/pages/subjects/107349' title='Bradshaw, Ellen A.'>Ellen A. Bradshaw</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/55343' title='Somerville, MA'>Somerville</a>, widow and guardian<span class='line-break'> </span>of the minor children of <a href='/pages/subjects/107350' title='Bradshaw, Henry H.'>Henry H. Bradshaw</a>, late proprietor of<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/107348' title='Lot 2547'>lot numbered 2547</a> to represent said lot: _</p>

Lawrence</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/72695' title='East Cambridge, MA'>East Cambridge</a>, widow of <a href='/pages/subjects/60029' title='Lawrence, James K.'>James<span class='line-break'> </span>K. Lawrence</a> late proprietor of  <a href='/pages/subjects/60031' title='Lot 2807'>lot number2807</a> to represent said<span class='line-break'> </span>lot. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Time of Adjd meeting _'>Time of Adj<sup>d</sup> meeting _</span></p>
<p>Voted that when this meeting adjourn, it <span class='line-break'> </span>be to <date when='1865-01-30'>Monday January 30<sup>th</sup> at 10 o'clock a.m.</date></p>
<p>Adjourned<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest  <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a>, Sec.y</p>
<p>-----------------------------</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Jan.y. 30, 1865.'>Trustees _ <date when='1865-01-30'>Jan.y. 30, 1865</date>.</span></p>
<p>An Adjourned Meeting of the Trustees was held<span class='line-break'> </span>on <date when='1865-01-30T10:00:00'>Monday, January 30<sup>th</sup> 1865 at 10 o'clock a.m.</date> _</p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, Messrs <a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Austin</a><span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Curtis</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54774' title='Little, Charles C.'><!--Charles-->Little</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65964' title='Livermore, George'>Livermore</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Nazro</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Norcross</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/63802' title='Rand, Edward S.'>Rand</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a>. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Com. on Lots _ of Semi-Annual Examn_'>Report of Com. on Lots _ of Semi-Annual Exam<sup>n</sup>_</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Mr Austin</a> for the Committee on Lots submitted<span class='line-break'> </span>a report of the result of the semi-annual examina<span class='line-break'></span>tions by the Committee for the past year of lots cared for under<span class='line-break'> </span>the Repair Fund _ &amp; the report was accepted.<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134753">
<h3><a name="page-1134753">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 360)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>360</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees ~ Adjd Meeting Jany. 30, 1865.'>Trustees ~ Adj<sup>d</sup> Meeting <date when='1865-01-30'>Jany. 30, 1865</date>.</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Mr Austin</a> for the Committee on Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>also submitted a report as follows: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Report of Com. on Lots on Lots recently accepted for Perpetual Repair _'>Report of Com. on Lots on Lots recently accepted for Perpetual Repair _</span></p>
<p>"The Committee on Lots<span class='line-break'> </span>Report,<span class='line-break'> </span>That they have<span class='line-break'> </span>contracted for the Perpetual repair of Lots not<span class='line-break'> </span>heretofore reported as follows: _</p>
<p><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th><a href='/pages/subjects/59940' title='Lot 1030'>Lot No. 1030</a></th> <th>_ of the late <a href='/pages/subjects/60690' title='Warren, Pelham W.'>Pelham W. Warren</a> for</th> <th>three hundred dollars _</th> <th>300.<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/101235' title='Lot 1790'><!--Lot-->1790</a></td> <td>_ <a href='/pages/subjects/107352' title='Hatfield, Ann L.'>Ann L. Hatfield</a> _</td> <td>three hundred dollars</td> <td>300.</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/65202' title='Lot 801'><!--Lot-->801</a></td> <td>_ <a href='/pages/subjects/65201' title='Willard, Susan L.'>Susan L. Powars</a> _</td> <td>two hundred dollars</td> <td>200.</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/67074' title='Lot 1250'><!--Lot-->1250</a></td> <td>late <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a></td> <td>}</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/67075' title='Lot 1315'>1315</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/107353' title='Parker, Mary I.'>Mary I. Parker</a>^<sup>said Parker Ex<sup>or</sup></sup></td> <td>} One thousand dollars</td> <td>1000.</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/67076' title='Lot 1333'>1333</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/107354' title='Parker, Franny Cushing'>Franny Cushing Parker</a></td> <td>}</td> </tr> <tr><td><a href='/pages/subjects/65988' title='Lot 3324'>3324</a></td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/107355' title='Sears, William C.'>W<sup>m</sup> C. Sears</a>, Ex<sup>or</sup> of <a href='/pages/subjects/65987' title='Spring, Sarah'>Sarah Spring</a></td> <td>six hundred &amp; fifty dollars</td> <td>650.</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span>And they submit the same for concurrence of<span class='line-break'> </span>this Board, <span class='line-break'> </span><table class='tabular'><thead><span class='line-break'> </span><tr><th>___</th> <th><a href='/pages/subjects/54832' title='Austin, Edward'>Edward Austin</a></th> <th>} Committee on<span class='line-break'> </span></th></tr></thead> <tbody> <tr><td>___</td> <td><a href='/pages/subjects/56312' title='Norcross, Otis'>Otis Norcross</a></td> <td>} Lots _ </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, <date when='1864-12-31'>Dec. 31, 1864</date>.</p>
<p>Voted that this Board concur in the foregoing<span class='line-break'> </span>contracts.</p>
</div>

<div id="page-1134754">
<h3><a name="page-1134754">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 361)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>361</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Repairs needed upon Lots 1 &amp; 1556 &amp; 1809, 1810 _'>Repairs needed upon <a href='/pages/subjects/64179' title='Lot 1'>Lots 1</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/60755' title='Lot 1556'>1556</a> &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/67214' title='Lot 1809'><!--Lot-->1809</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/64044' title='Lot 1810'><!--Lot-->1810</a> _</span></p>
<p>Voted that <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'><!--Coolidge-->the Secretary</a> be directed to<span class='line-break'> </span>notify the representations of <a href='/pages/subjects/67214' title='Lot 1809'>Lots 1809</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/64044' title='Lot 1810'><!--Lot-->1810</a><span class='line-break'> </span>now held by this Corporation in trust for <a href='/pages/subjects/62002' title='Dowse, Thomas'>Thomas<span class='line-break'> </span>Dowse</a>, also of <a href='/pages/subjects/64179' title='Lot 1'>Nos. 1</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/60755' title='Lot 1556'>1556</a> _ <a href='/pages/subjects/53606' title='Fuller, Henry H.'>Henry H.<span class='line-break'> </span>Fuller</a>, &amp; <a href='/pages/subjects/60695' title='Brigham, William'>W<sup>m</sup> Brigham</a>, Trustee, that the lots<span class='line-break'> </span>are out of repair; that the funds provided<span class='line-break'> </span>are insufficient to keep said lot in repair,<span class='line-break'> </span>and that he request them to give early<span class='line-break'> </span>attention to the subject. ~</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Annl Rept of Trustees _ '>Ann<sup>l</sup> Rep<sup>t</sup> of Trustees _ </span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->The President</a> read the Annual report<span class='line-break'> </span>of the Trustees, which on motion of <a href='/pages/subjects/54820' title='Nazro, Charles G.'>Mr Nazro</a>,<span class='line-break'> </span>was accepted. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Treasr &amp; supt'>Treas<sup>r</sup> &amp; sup<sup>t</sup></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/54274' title='Bond, George William'><!--Bond-->The Treasurer</a> also read an abstract of<span class='line-break'> </span>his report. _ which was accepted. _</p>
<p>On motion by <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'>Mr Read</a>,</p>
<p>Voted that the several reports of the Trustees,<span class='line-break'> </span>Treasurer and Superintendent be printed<span class='line-break'> </span>ready for distribution at the Annual Meeting.</p>
<p>Adjourned<span class='line-break'> </span>Attest <a href='/pages/subjects/53157' title='Coolidge, Austin J.'>Austin J. Coolidge</a> Sec.y<span class='line-break'> </span></p>
</div>
</div>
<br />
<div id="page-1134755">
<h3><a name="page-1134755">Trustees Records, Vol. 3, 1859 (page 362)</a></h3>
<div class="page-content">
<p>362</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Trustees _ Feby. 6. 1865  _'>Trustees _ <date when='1865-02-06'>Feby. 6. 1865</date>  _</span></p>
<p>The regular monthly meeting of the Trustees was<span class='line-break'> </span>held on <date when='1865-02-06T10:00:00'>Monday, February 6<sup>th</sup> 1865, at 10 o'clock am.</date></p>
<p>There were present <a href='/pages/subjects/52529' title='Bigelow, Jacob'><!--Bigelow-->the President</a>, and Messrs<span class='line-break'> </span><a href='/pages/subjects/62841' title='Cheever, James'>Cheever</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/62842' title='Crocker, Uriel'>Crocker</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/65964' title='Livermore, George'>Livermore</a>, <a href='/pages/subjects/54770' title='Read, James'><!--James-->Read</a> and <a href='/pages/subjects/65944' title='Sleeper, Jacob'>Sleeper</a>.</p>
<p>The record of the last meeting and the adjourn<span class='line-break'></span>ment thereof was read. ~</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Resolution referring resignation of Mr C.P. Curtis to next annual meeting reconsidered _'>Resolution referring resignation of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr C.P. Curtis</a> to next annual meeting reconsidered _</span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/65964' title='Livermore, George'>Mr Livermore</a> offered the following vote: _</p>
<p>"Whereas by the decease of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr Curtis</a>, there is<span class='line-break'> </span>no further occasion for the reference to the next annual<span class='line-break'> </span>meeting of the Proprietors the communications of <a href='/pages/subjects/54773' title='Curtis, Charles P.'>Mr<span class='line-break'> </span>Curtis</a> tendering his resignation as a member of this Board,<span class='line-break'> </span>under date of <date when='1864-04-04'>April 4<sup>th</sup></date> and <date when='1864-06-04'>June 4<sup>th</sup> 1864</date>.</p>
<p>Voted that the vote of the Trustees on the <date when='1864-06-04'>6<sup>th</sup> of June<span class='line-break'> </span>last</date> ordering such reference be hereby reconsidered.</p>
<p>and the motion was unanimously adopted. _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='Representation of Lots _'>Representation of Lots _</span></p>
<p>In the following cases applications were received<span class='line-break'> </span>for the representation of lots of deceased proprietors, and the<span class='line-break'> </span>persons nominated were severally designated to represent<span class='line-break'> </span>the lots: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='933'><a href='/pages/subjects/107356' title='Lot 933'><!--Lot-->933</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/107607' title='Fessenden, Thomas F.'>Thomas F. Fessenden</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/54378' title='Providence, RI'>Providence R.I.</a> eldest child of <a href='/pages/subjects/107608' title='Fessenden, William B.'>William B.<span class='line-break'> </span>Fessenden</a>, late proprietor of <a href='/pages/subjects/107356' title='Lot 933'>lot numbered 933</a> to represent said lot: _</p>
<p><span class='depth3' depth='3' title='1250'><a href='/pages/subjects/67074' title='Lot 1250'><!--Lot-->1250</a></span></p>
<p><a href='/pages/subjects/107357' title='Parker, Francis J. '>Francis J. Parker</a> of <a href='/pages/subjects/52559' title='Boston, MA'>Boston</a>, son of <a href='/pages/subjects/54923' title='Parker, Isaac (1788-1858)'>Isaac Parker</a>, late propri<span class='line-break'></span>etor of <a href='/pages/subjects/67074' title='Lot 1250'>lot numbered 1250</a> to represent said lot: _</p>
</div>
